834<!><!><!>BUFFALO WINGS<!><!><!>Cut wing tips off at joint and discard; cut each wing in half at joint.  On rack in broiler pan, arrange wings.  Broil 6 inches from heat, 25 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear, turning occasionally.  Transfer to serving platter.  Meanwhile, in 1 qt. saucepan, over medium heat, heat hot pepper sauce and margarine until margarine is melted, stirring often.  Drizzle over wings.  Serve with celery stick and dressing for dipping.<!><!><!>none
835<!><!><!>BUFFALO WINGS<!><!><!>Split wings at each joint and discard tips.  Broil 3 to 5 inches from heat until brown, turning as you need to.  Preheat oven to 350°.  Place wings in baking pan. 837<!><!><!>BUFFALO WINGS<!><!><!>Melt the butter in a large frying pan.  Add the Tabasco and vinegar.  Roll the chicken wings around in the mixture to coat them.  Serve with Blue cheese dip and celery sticks.<!><!><!>none
838<!><!><!>ANGEL WINGS<!><!><!>Beat egg yolks in bowl until thick.  Add and blend sugar, salt and brandy.  Add flour alternately with sour cream until all blended.  Turn dough on floured board.  Cover and let rise for 10 minutes.  Knead dough until it blisters.  Roll very thin.  Cut into strips 1-inch wide and 4-inches long.  Cut gash in center and pull one end of strip through.  Fry in deep fat at 370° until light brown; turn over.  Cool and dust with powdered sugar.<!><!><!>none

841<!><!><!>BUFFALO WINGS<!><!><!>Spread chicken wings on baking pan.  Bake in 450° oven for 35 minutes if frozen or 25 minutes if thawed.  Combine ingredients to make sauce.  Cover cooked wings with sauce and bake in 350° oven for 10 minutes.  I put my sauce in a large Tupperware bowl and add cooked wings and shake vigorously to coat wings.<!><!><!>none

847<!><!><!>BUFFALO CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Split wings at each joint and discard tips.  Wash well and pat dry.  Deep fry at 400° for 12 minutes or until completely cooked and crispy.  Drain. 850<!><!><!>ANGEL WINGS<!><!><!>Add salt to egg yolks, then beat egg yolks and eggs until thick and lemon colored. Add sugar, butter and rum.  Beat until well mixed. Fold in flour and knead until the dough blisters. Transfer to a well floured board.  Cut in half.  Roll each half until it is very thin.  Cut into 4-inch long by 2-inch wide strips.  Slit each strip in the center and pull one end through the slit.  Drop into hot oil and fry until lightly browned. Drain on paper towel. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.<!><!><!>none
851<!><!><!>BROILED PARTY WINGS<!><!><!>In large container, mix all ingredients except honey and ketchup.  Cut wings in half at joints and add them to marinade and stir well.  Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.  Foil line broiler pan and arrange wings in a single layer.  Mix honey and ketchup with 6 tablespoons of marinade.  Blend well and brush one side of wings.  Broil 12 minutes.  Turn wings and brush again. Broil 12 minutes more or until cooked through.<!><!><!>none

860<!><!><!>BUFFALO WINGS<!><!><!>Heat oil approximately 15 to 20 minutes.  Cut wings apart and throw away tips. Fry wings 20 minutes for frozen and 12 minutes for thawed. 861<!><!><!>DIG DEEP SALAD<!><!><!>Note:  This layered salad is very versatile.  A clear big bowl (you can purchase a dish for layered salads) makes a good dish to serve in and pretty to look at too!<!><!><!>none
862<!><!><!>DIG DEEP SALAD<!><!><!>Layer lettuce on bottom.  Layer other desired vegetables as you wish.  Peas (thawed) top the salad. 873<!><!><!>BARBECUE CHICKEN WINGS IN A CROCK-POT<!><!><!>Rinse chicken wing drummettes and pat dry. Sprinkle wings with salt and pepper and place on a broiler pan. Combine barbecue sauce, honey, mustard, Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco sauce in a mixing bowl. Pour over wings. Cover and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours or on high for 2 to 2 1/2 hours. 916<!><!><!>AUTHENTIC BUFFALO STYLE CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>If you really want to "spice up your life," you can add some dashes of Tabasco sauce to your chicken wing sauce.  In Buffalo we have 5 versions:  mild, medium, hot, extra hot and screamers.  Even Wilkins TWP #4 will have a hard time putting you out once you've had a plate of screamers!<!><!><!>none
917<!><!><!>BUFFALO CHICKEN WINGS WITH BLUE CHEESE DIPPING SAUCE<!><!><!>Melt the butter or margarine in a small saucepan.  Add hot sauce and remove from heat.  In a large pan or deep-fat fryer, heat 1 inch of oil to 375°.  Fry wings in batch without crowding until golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes.  Drain on paper towels. Brush wings with spicy butter and serve warm, with Blue Cheese Dipping Sauce.<!><!><!>none
918<!><!><!>BUFFALO CHICKEN WINGS WITH BLUE CHEESE DIPPING SAUCE<!><!><!>Blue Cheese Dipping Sauce:<!><!><!>none
919<!><!><!>BUFFALO CHICKEN WINGS WITH BLUE CHEESE DIPPING SAUCE<!><!><!>In a small bowl, mash the Blue cheese, leaving some small lumps.  Whisk in the mayonnaise until blended.  Add the remaining ingredients and whisk to blend well.  Cover and refrigerate until serving time.<!><!><!>none
920<!><!><!>BUFFALO WINGS<!><!><!>Sprinkle wing pieces with salt and pepper.  Cook in hot oil for  10  minutes or until golden brown.  Drain well.  Melt butter and add  hot sauce to taste; add vinegar.  Put wings on platter and pour butter mixture over them.<!><!><!>none
921<!><!><!>"HOT" BARBECUE CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Cut wings in half.  Dust in mixture of flour and chili powder. Fry in hot oil 8 to 10 minutes on each side until brown.  Drain on paper towels.  Heat together barbecue sauce and hot pepper sauce.  Add chicken wings and simmer a few minutes.  Makes 24 "hot" wings.<!><!><!>none
922<!><!><!>BARBECUED CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Rinse wings; pat dry with paper towels.  Sprinkle with salt and pepper.  Place in shallow pan.  Mix together remaining ingredients and pour over wings.  Cover dish tightly with foil and bake 1 1/2 hours in a 350° oven.  Remove from oven; pour all but about 1/4 of sauce into a bowl and reserve.  Baste wings with sauce in dish and broil 3 to 5 minutes or until wings are glazed a deep dark red.  Skim fat off reserved sauce and serve sauce with wings.<!><!><!>none
923<!><!><!>BARBECUE STYLE CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Rinse chicken; pat dry.  Cut off and discard wing tips.  Cut each wing at joint to make 2 sections.  Place the wing pieces in a single layer in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan.  Bake in a 375° oven for 20 minutes.  Drain fat from baking pan.<!><!><!>none
924<!><!><!>BARBECUE STYLE CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>For sauce, combine remaining ingredients. Brush wings with sauce. Bake 10 minutes. Turn wings over; brush again with sauce. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes or until chicken is tender.<!><!><!>none
925<!><!><!>BUFFALO CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Serve with French fries and celery sticks with Blue cheese dressing.<!><!><!>none
926<!><!><!>BUFFALO SWINGERS WINGS<!><!><!>Fry unbreaded Wingflingers according to directions.  Melt margarine and stir in remaining ingredients.  Coat cooked Wingflingers with sauce and bake 10 minutes in oven at 350°. Serve with Blue cheese dressing, celery sticks and carrot sticks.<!><!><!>none
927<!><!><!>BROWN GLAZED CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Wash and pat dry chicken wings.  Cut into 2 parts at the joint.  Place wings in large, shallow baking pan.  In a small saucepan, put soy sauce, vinegar, honey, sugar, garlic and ginger. Stir until blended.  Heat until sugar and honey dissolve.  Pour this on the wings.  Marinate for 2 hours or overnight in refrigerator.  Turn and baste occasionally.<!><!><!>none
928<!><!><!>BROWN GLAZED CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 400°.  Place foil covered wings in oven and bake for 15 minutes.  Reduce heat to 350° and bake for 1/2 hour. Uncover; baste and turn partially cooked wings.  Continue baking until all liquid evaporates.  Chicken should look a beautiful brown glazed color.  This freezes well.<!><!><!>none
929<!><!><!>BROWN GLAZED CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Personal Note:  When I took Chinese cooking classes, this was one of my favorite recipes that I learned to do.<!><!><!>none
930<!><!><!>BARBECUED CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients; pour over chicken wings.  Bake at 350° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.<!><!><!>none
931<!><!><!>CHICKEN FLAUTAS WITH SALSA<!><!><!>Sauté onion and garlic until tender.  Stir in cornstarch, salt and pepper.  Mix well.  Stir in broth, chicken and chilies.  Cook, stirring constantly, until very thick and bubbly.  Dip tortillas in 1/4-inch hot oil to soften.  Spoon a heaping tablespoon of filling in each tortilla and roll up.  Sauté flautas, a few at a time, in hot oil, turning often until crisp, about 2 minutes.  Keep warm. Serve with Salsa.  Garnish with lettuce.<!><!><!>none
932<!><!><!>CHICKEN FLAUTAS WITH SALSA<!><!><!>Salsa:<!><!><!>none
933<!><!><!>CHICKEN FLAUTAS WITH SALSA<!><!><!>Combine ingredients.  Refrigerate 1 hour.<!><!><!>none
934<!><!><!>CHICKEN-AVOCADO TORTILLA SOUP<!><!><!>In a 5 to 6-quart nonstick pan over medium heat, stir onion, garlic, cumin, oregano, chili powder and pepper until spices are fragrant, about 1 minute.  Add broth, tomatoes (including juice) and green chilies. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat.<!><!><!>none
935<!><!><!>CHICKEN-AVOCADO TORTILLA SOUP<!><!><!>Meanwhile, stack tortillas and cut into 1/8-inch wide strips. Add to boiling broth. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.<!><!><!>none
936<!><!><!>CHICKEN-AVOCADO TORTILLA SOUP<!><!><!>Rinse chicken and cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Peel the avocado, pit and thinly slice. Add chicken to broth and return to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat, cover and simmer until chicken is white in center (cut to test), about 5 minutes.  Stir in cilantro and salt to taste. Ladle into soup bowls, garnish with avocado and add cheese to taste.  Makes 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
937<!><!><!>CHICKEN-AVOCADO TORTILLA SOUP<!><!><!>The thinly sliced corn tortillas thicken the soup as they dissolve.<!><!><!>none
938<!><!><!>CURRIED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients in bowl.  Chill for at least 1 hour and serve.<!><!><!>none
939<!><!><!>HOT CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients except potato chips and cheese. Turn into 11 x 7 x 1-inch baking dish. Top with potato chips and cheese that have been combined. Bake at 450° for 10 minutes. Serve immediately. Serves 8 to 10.<!><!><!>none
940<!><!><!>SOUTHWESTERN CHICKEN SOUP<!><!><!>In a large skillet, sauté the chicken in oil until lightly browned. Transfer to a 5 quart slow cooker with a slotted spoon. Stir in the remaining ingredients.  Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours.  Stir before serving.<!><!><!>none
941<!><!><!>CHICKEN SOUP<!><!><!>Cook chicken in water until easily removed from bones.  Debone and chop meat.  You will need at least 2 cups of poultry.  Pour water and all remaining ingredients into large Dutch oven or pan. Bring to boil, then simmer until all vegetables are cooked.<!><!><!>none
942<!><!><!>STEAK OR CHICKEN SHISH KABOBS<!><!><!>Slice meat into 4 x 1/4-inch strips and set aside.  Combine remaining ingredients in a shallow dish.  Add steak, coating well. Cover and let sit in refrigerator overnight.  Remove steak from refrigerator and place on skewers.  Add fresh vegetables if you like.  Grill 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until desired level of doneness is reached.  Baste frequently with marinade.<!><!><!>none
943<!><!><!>WEIGHT CONTROL CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Mince zucchini and mushrooms.  Stir in chicken, mayonnaise and seasoning.  Fill pita pockets.  Serves 2.<!><!><!>none
944<!><!><!>CHICKEN-RICE-VEGETABLE SOUP-STEW<!><!><!>Cook first 4 ingredients together; simmer until tender, about 30 minutes. Remove chicken from broth. Strain broth and return to clean kettle. Add to boiling broth the next 8 ingredients. Cook 20 minutes or so. Add chopped chicken. Add frozen green peas. Cook until done, at least 10 more minutes. Add milk; add thickening, if desired, and adjust seasoning. If canned vegetables are used, add with chopped chicken. Serves 10.<!><!><!>none
945<!><!><!>CHICKEN FAJITA<!><!><!>Cut chicken into bite size pieces.  Mix lemon juice, oil, seasoning, oregano and peppers and marinate chicken for several hours.  Stir-fry chicken until cooked.  Add cut up pepper, onion, mushrooms and tomatoes and stir-fry for 2 minutes.  Serve with hot tortillas and Spanish rice.  Grate cheese and lettuce for garnish.<!><!><!>none
946<!><!><!>PENNSYLVANIA DUTCH STYLE CHICKEN AND CORN SOUP<!><!><!>Cook chicken in water slowly until it is tender, adding salt 30 minutes before it is done.  Remove chicken and strain broth through a fine sieve.  Take meat from bones and cut in bite size pieces. Set aside.  Add corn to broth.  Add onion, chopped celery and seasoning; cook 5 minutes.  Five minutes before serving, add chicken, diced eggs and rivels.<!><!><!>none
947<!><!><!>PENNSYLVANIA DUTCH STYLE CHICKEN AND CORN SOUP<!><!><!>Rivels:<!><!><!>none
948<!><!><!>PENNSYLVANIA DUTCH STYLE CHICKEN AND CORN SOUP<!><!><!>Rub rivel mixture together with 2 forks until the size of peas and drop into boiling soup.  Cover and cook gently for 5 minutes. Delicious!!<!><!><!>none
949<!><!><!>CHINESE CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Mix chicken, onions and lettuce. Add sesame seeds, almonds and noodles.<!><!><!>none
950<!><!><!>CHINESE CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Dressing:<!><!><!>none
951<!><!><!>CHINESE CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Mix together. Pour over salad.<!><!><!>none
952<!><!><!>CHICKEN SLICES "POLLO EN RAJAS"<!><!><!>Cut chicken into long strips and season with salt and pepper on both sides.  Sauté until golden; set aside.  In 2 teaspoons olive oil, sauté onions.  Add chicken strips; cover and turn heat to low. In a baking dish (sprayed with Pam), layer beginning with green chilies, jalapeno pepper, onions and top with chicken.  Begin layering again.  Top with Cheddar cheese.<!><!><!>none
953<!><!><!>CHICKEN SLICES "POLLO EN RAJAS"<!><!><!>When using optional ingredients, blend milk, jalapeno and sour cream in a blender.  Layer as before.  Bake at 375° for 20 minutes. Serve with black beans and rice.  Makes a great Spanish dish!<!><!><!>none
954<!><!><!>CHICKEN CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Boil  rice until done.  Add chicken, soup, lemon juice, butter,  grated  cheese,  mayonnaise  and  chicken broth.  Mix together and bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.<!><!><!>none
955<!><!><!>SAVORY ROULADES OR CHICKEN ROLL-UPS<!><!><!>Heat 4 tablespoons oil; add onion, celery and bread crumbs. Cook until celery is glazed and crumbs brown.  Add seasonings; remove from heat.  Add egg.  Place 2 tablespoons of filling on flattened chicken.  Roll up from wide end, folding in to hold filling.  Put in greased pan; add wine.  Use 2 tablespoons oil with wine to bake.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 45 to 60 minutes.<!><!><!>none
956<!><!><!>HOT CHICKEN DIP<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients in large saucepan and heat until cheese is melted.  Add chicken and pour in Pyrex dish.  Bake at 350° for approximately 25-30 minutes.  Serve hot with scoop Fritos.<!><!><!>none
957<!><!><!>CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP<!><!><!>Boil chicken until done.  Debone it and put in diced potatoes and corn.  Cook until potatoes are done.  Put in 2 tablespoons crushed rosemary, salt and pepper.  Put in bow tie noodles and cook until tender.<!><!><!>none
958<!><!><!>LEMON LIME CHICKEN<!><!><!>Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper, garlic and basil. Combine remaining ingredients except lemon and lime slices.  Pour over chicken.  Bake uncovered 30 minutes.  Turn and baste.  Bake 30 to 40 minutes more.  Garnish with fruit slices.  Bake at 400°. Calories:  235.<!><!><!>none
959<!><!><!>HOMEMADE CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP<!><!><!>Boil chicken for an hour.  Drain water, but save.  Let chicken cool.  Add all other ingredients except noodles to chicken broth and boil again.  Remove chicken from bones and add meat to soup. Boil at least 1 hour; add noodles and serve.<!><!><!>none
960<!><!><!>HAM OR CHICKEN PUFFS<!><!><!>Bring water and margarine to boil.  Add flour, and stir.  It will have the consistency of Play Dough.  Stir about 1 minute. Take off stove.  Stir in eggs, one at a time.  Drop by spoonfuls on cookie sheet.  (You may need to add a little flour to make it a good drop consistency.)   Bake at 400° for 30 minutes.  Cut each roll in two pieces; stuff with ham salad or chicken salad.<!><!><!>none
961<!><!><!>HAM OR CHICKEN PUFFS<!><!><!>Note: The rolls will be hollow inside, making them easy to stuff.<!><!><!>none
962<!><!><!>SOUTHWESTERN CHICKEN-CORN CHOWDER<!><!><!>Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat; add chicken, onion, garlic, and sauté 10 minutes.  Stir in 2 cups half-and-half and next 6 ingredients; cook over low heat, stirring often, 15-20 minutes.  Stir in 2 tablespoons cilantro. Serve immediately.  Makes 2 quarts.<!><!><!>none
963<!><!><!>CHICKEN CRESCENTS<!><!><!>Boil chicken for about 30 to 45 minutes; drain and cool.  Tear chicken into thin pieces.  Add cream cheese.  Sprinkle salt over entire chicken.  Add about 1 tablespoon pepper.  Add almonds.  Cut up onion and add.  Stir in milk.  Melt butter in microwave.  Open crescent rolls and add mixture, everything except butter, onto crescent rolls, usually a teaspoon.  Close rolls and put on baking pan.  Pour melted butter over rolls and bake at 350° for about 10 minutes or until brown.<!><!><!>none
964<!><!><!>CHICKEN FINGER SNACKS<!><!><!>Make 1 to 2 days ahead of time the honey mustard dip so it has time to let the flavors blend.  You do this by mixing honey and mustard together well and store in airtight container. Refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
965<!><!><!>CHICKEN FINGER SNACKS<!><!><!>Cut chicken into 1/2 x 2-inch strips.  Set aside.  Mix flour, salt and pepper in shallow bowl.  Dip chicken in milk.  Roll in flour mixture to coat well.  Place breaded chicken on wax paper. Heat 1/4-inch of oil in large heavy skillet.  Heat to about 350°. You can tell it's hot enough by dropping a cube of bread in and it browns in 1 minute.  Add chicken to oil; fry, turning 1 time, about 3 minutes each side.  Drain and serve with sauce.<!><!><!>none
966<!><!><!>CHICKEN MEXICALI (HOT)<!><!><!>Sauté onions in butter until tender.  Blend in flour.  Add broth, milk, sauce and seasonings.  Cook until smooth and creamy. Stir in other ingredients except cheese and spoon into 2-quart casserole.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
967<!><!><!>CHICKEN MEXICALI (HOT)<!><!><!>For very hot Chicken Mexicali, add jalapenos.<!><!><!>none
968<!><!><!>LOW CALORIE BEEF/CHICKEN GRAVY<!><!><!>Add onion flakes to bouillon.  Bring to a boil.  Dissolve cornstarch in cold water.  Add cornstarch mixture to boiling bouillon.  Simmer until gravy thickens, stirring constantly, about 2 minutes.  Yields 1 cup.  Calories:  Negligible.  For diabetics: Exchanges:  Free.<!><!><!>none
969<!><!><!>CASHEW CHICKEN BAKE<!><!><!>On the day before the casserole is to be served, mix all items together except the cashews.  Place in a 9 x 13-inch casserole and refrigerate.  Before baking, cover top with cashews.  Bake 45 minutes at 350°.<!><!><!>none
970<!><!><!>FRUITY CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Stir together the cream cheese, milk, lemon juice, salt and pepper.  Stir in chicken, apple, celery and green onion. Makes about 2 1/2 cups or enough for 30 small cream puffs or about 18 heart-shaped biscuits.<!><!><!>none
971<!><!><!>CHICKEN TORTILLA SOUP<!><!><!>Place all ingredients into pot or crock-pot. Stir well and heat thoroughly. Serve with tortilla chips on top and shredded Cheddar cheese.<!><!><!>none

973<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD LETTUCE WRAPS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°. Bake almonds for 5 to 7 minutes or until toasted. In a small bowl, stir chicken salad, cranberries and almonds together. If necessary, cut the bottom of each butterhead leaf, making leaves about 6-inches long. Discard bottom of leaves. Spread about 3 tablespoons of mixture lengthwise down one edge of each butterhead leaf. Roll up and secure each with 3 wooden cocktail picks, completely enclosing salad in lettuce. Use a gentle sawing motion to cut each lettuce roll between the picks, making 3 pieces.<!><!><!>none

976<!><!><!>AMISH CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP<!><!><!>Place chicken in a kettle with 2 qts. of water, cover until tender (about 2 1/2 hrs). Remove chicken from the kettle and strain the broth.  Debone the chicken and return to the kettle with the strained broth.  Add chicken stock, celery, carrots, apple, onions and pepper and cook until vegetables are tender. Add noodles and cook another 8-10 minutes.<!><!><!>none

978<!><!><!>QUICK AND EASY CHICKEN WRAPS<!><!><!>In medium mixing bowl, combine yogurt, garlic and herb. Stir until blended. Salt and pepper to taste. Add chicken breast and stir until well coated. 979<!><!><!>QUICK AND EASY CHICKEN WRAPS<!><!><!>Calories: 250, 4gm fat, 34gm protein, 19gm carbohydrate.<!><!><!>none
980<!><!><!>WALNUT CHICKEN<!><!><!>Skin, halve and bone chicken breasts.  Cut chicken into 1 inch pieces.  In a small bowl stir soy sauce into cornstarch; stir in chicken broth, ginger root, sugar, salt and red pepper.  Set aside. Preheat a wok over high heat; add cooking oil.  Stir-fry green peppers and green onions in hot oil for 2 minutes or until crisp-tender.  Remove from wok.  Add walnuts to wok; stir-fry 1 to 2 minutes or until just golden.  Remove from wok.  Add half of the chicken to the hot wok; stir-fry 2 minutes.  Remove from wok. Stir-fry remaining chicken 2 minutes.  Return all chicken to wok. Stir soy mixture into chicken.  Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.  Stir in vegetables and walnuts; cover and cook 1 minute more.  Serve chicken and vegetables at once with hot cooked rice. Garnish with whole red peppers and fresh cilantro, if desired.<!><!><!>none
981<!><!><!>CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP<!><!><!>In stockpot, combine all ingredients, except noodles.  Mix well.  Cook over medium heat for 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.  Add noodles.  Simmer an additional 15 minutes or until desired doneness.<!><!><!>none
982<!><!><!>SOUTHWESTERN SHREDDED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Trim chicken breasts of visible fat. In a shallow saucepan, bring broth and cumin to a boil. Add chicken breasts and reduce heat to low. Simmer gently until chicken is done, about 10 minutes. Do not allow to boil. Remove chicken from broth and allow to cool slightly. When chicken is cool enough to handle, use 2 forks and pull with the tines of each fork in the opposite direction, shredding the chicken. Set aside.<!><!><!>none
983<!><!><!>SOUTHWESTERN SHREDDED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Bring the broth to a boil and reduce until it measures 1 cup, about 5 to 7 minutes. Allow to cool. Stir in mayonnaise and lime juice to taste. Toss the chicken with a small amount of the dressing and reserve the rest of the dressing for the salad.<!><!><!>none
984<!><!><!>SOUTHWESTERN SHREDDED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Arrange the salad by spreading the chopped lettuce on a 10-inch serving platter. Starting from the outside of the platter and working in, make a ring of kidney beans, a ring of tomatoes, a ring of corn and a ring of green chiles. Pile the chicken in the center. Sprinkle the entire salad with cilantro. Drizzle the salad with remaining dressing and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with lime wedges. Makes 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
985<!><!><!>FRUITED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Put chicken, pineapple, celery, oranges, olives, peppers and onion in bowl.  Stir together mayonnaise and mustard and pour over all other ingredients and carefully fold until well blended. Cover and chill for several hours.  Just before serving, add the chow mein noodles.<!><!><!>none
986<!><!><!>BROCCOLI-CHICKEN-CHEESE CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Cook broccoli about 10 minutes, until almost tender.  Drain and arrange in 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish.  Sprinkle with chicken; set aside.<!><!><!>none
987<!><!><!>BROCCOLI-CHICKEN-CHEESE CASSEROLE<!><!><!>In saucepan melt margarine; blend in flour and salt until smooth and bubbly.  Gradually stir in bouillon until smooth.  Stir over low heat until thickened.  Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup of cheese and the Worcestershire until cheese melts.  Pour over chicken and broccoli.  Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Bake in 400° oven 20 to 25 minutes, until hot.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
988<!><!><!>OLD FASHION CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP<!><!><!>Boil chicken until done.  Take chicken apart; cut fine pieces. Take the rest of the ingredients into pan.  Cook until carrots are done.  Cover and simmer for at least 2 hours.<!><!><!>none
989<!><!><!>MEXICAN CHICKEN AND CHEESE SOUP<!><!><!>Brush both sides of chicken with lime juice. Sprinkle chili powder and cumin evenly over both sides; let stand 10 minutes. Grill or broil chicken until cooked through. Cool; cut into 1/2-inch pieces.<!><!><!>none
990<!><!><!>MEXICAN CHICKEN AND CHEESE SOUP<!><!><!>Meanwhile, bring broth to a boil in a large saucepan. Add tortilla chips; turn off heat, cover and let stand 10 minutes. Puree mixture in batches in food processor or blender; return to saucepan. Stir 1 1/2 cups cheese into broth mixture. Cook over medium heat until melted, stirring frequently. Stir in salsa and chicken to heat through. Ladle into bowls; top with sour cream or tomatoes, if desired. Add cilantro and remaining cheese. Makes 6 serving.<!><!><!>none
991<!><!><!>CHICKEN SOUP CHINESE STYLE<!><!><!>Finely slice white part of onions.  Reserve green parts for garnish.  Heat stock until boiling.  Add mushrooms and onions. Cook 2 to 3 minutes.  Add chicken.  Beat eggs with a little salt and pepper until frothy.  Stir soup well.  Pour eggs steadily into soup, stirring constantly, so that it remains in shreds.  Let cook a minute or two to set eggs.  Add soy sauce to taste.  Serve in soup bowls.  Sprinkle with finely chopped green parts of onions. Yields 4 to 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
992<!><!><!>CHICKEN AND ORANGE SALAD<!><!><!>Cook rice in boiling salted water until tender.  Drain and while still hot, mix with onion and seasonings; cool.  Add chicken, celery, olives and mayonnaise.  Toss lightly.  Peel oranges and split them into sections.  Cut 1/2 of the sections into small pieces.  Add to mixture.<!><!><!>none
993<!><!><!>CHICKEN AND ORANGE SALAD<!><!><!>To Serve:  Place salad on bed of lettuce.  Garnish with remaining orange sections.<!><!><!>none
994<!><!><!>CHICKEN BREAST IN WINE<!><!><!>Brown chicken in butter.  Put in large baking dish.  Sprinkle with paprika and salt.  Add mushrooms, water, soup and wine to butter left in skillet.  Cook about 5 minutes.  Pour over chicken in baking dish.  Bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours.<!><!><!>none
995<!><!><!>BEST EVER GRILLED CHICKEN<!><!><!>Place fryer into a bowl with a tight fitting lid.  Combine all other ingredients and pour over chicken early in the day.  Place in the refrigerator.  Shake the bowl several times that day.  Cook on an outdoor barbecue grill as you would any other chicken.  Use the sauce to baste the chicken while cooking.  The whole family should go for this one.  Serves 4.<!><!><!>none
996<!><!><!>CHICKEN STEW<!><!><!>Cook, debone and chop chicken.  Place in 5-quart cooker or crock-pot the chicken, tomatoes, potatoes, onion and okra; cook for 8 hours.  Add corn, ketchup and barbecue sauce.  Cook 10 more minutes.  This makes the stew.  If you want soup, add the 3 cups chicken stock.<!><!><!>none
997<!><!><!>CELESTIAL CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Combine chicken, celery, mushrooms, pecans and crumbled bacon in larger bowl. Blend mayonnaise, lemon juice and sour cream. Add chicken to mixture, tossing lightly. Chill thoroughly. Serve in crisp lettuce cups. Serves 6 to 8.<!><!><!>none
998<!><!><!>BLACK BEAN AND CHICKEN SOUP<!><!><!>Rinse beans.  Put them into a large bowl and cover completely with cold water.  Let stand overnight!  Drain beans.  Transfer to a medium pan.  Add 2 cups water and bay leaf.  Bring to a boil over medium heat.  Cook 15 minutes.  Reduce heat.  Simmer for 20 minutes, until beans are tender.  Drain and discard the bay leaf.<!><!><!>none
999<!><!><!>BLACK BEAN AND CHICKEN SOUP<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 400°.  Place a heavy pot over medium heat for 1 minute.  Put olive oil and add the stems, carrots, celery and onions.  Cover and reduce heat to low.  Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Add thyme, basil and wine.  Simmer for 15 minutes.  Coat chicken with barbecue sauce and bake 10 minutes on top oven rack.  Remove from oven and cube chicken.  Add chicken stock, chicken and beans to stockpot.  Cook over low heat for 3 minutes, until thoroughly heated.  Stir in skim milk and broccoli florets.  Cook 5 minutes.  Do not boil.  Add cornstarch mixture and cook a few minutes longer.  Add liquid smoke, Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco sauce.  Garnish with cilantro.<!><!><!>none
1000<!><!><!>EASY CHICKEN DIVAN<!><!><!>Cook broccoli until tender; drain.  Arrange stalks in greased 12 x 7 1/2 x 2-inch baking dish.  Lay chicken on top.  Combine next 3 ingredients and pour over chicken.  Sprinkle with cheese. Combine crumbs and butter; sprinkle over all.  Bake at 350° about 35 minutes until heated.  Serves about 6 to 8.<!><!><!>none
1001<!><!><!>BUFFALO CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Cut wings at joints. Discard tips. Wash and pat dry wings. Arrange wings in a foil-lined pan in a single layer. Bake in oven at 375° for 20 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1002<!><!><!>BUFFALO CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Meanwhile, in a saucepan, melt margarine and stir in hot sauce. When wings are done, drain off fat and brush with hot sauce mix. Bake for 10 more minutes. Turn wings over and brush with hot sauce mix again. Bake wings 5 to 10 more minutes. Serve with Blue cheese dressing and celery sticks. Makes 24 wings.<!><!><!>none
1003<!><!><!>BUFFALO CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>You may substitute your favorite hot sauce instead of Texas Pete.<!><!><!>none
1004<!><!><!>CHICKEN BALL<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients except pecans. Form into a ball. Refrigerate to chill. Roll in chopped pecans. Serve with crackers.<!><!><!>none
1005<!><!><!>FRUITED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Line serving bowl with lettuce leaves.	Chill mixture for several hours before adding chow mein noodles.  Pour onto lettuce leaves and serve.<!><!><!>none
1006<!><!><!>CHICKEN CHIMICHANGA<!><!><!>Combine chicken, taco sauce, onion, cumin, oregano and salt in medium frypan.  Simmer 5 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1007<!><!><!>CHICKEN CHIMICHANGA<!><!><!>Brush one side of tortillas with butter.  Spoon 1/8 cup meat mixture onto center of unbuttered side; top with 2 tablespoons cheese.  Roll shell, place seam down, in greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake in 475° oven about 10 to 13 minutes; top with guacamole and additional taco sauce.<!><!><!>none
1008<!><!><!>HONEY-MUSTARD CHICKEN<!><!><!>Combine wine and oil in large bowl.  Season to taste with salt, pepper and thyme.  Place chicken in mixture for at least one hour. Remove chicken from marinade, reserving marinade.  Broil chicken on both sides in oven or on barbecue grill for 35 to 40 minutes. Meanwhile, combine 2 tablespoons of reserved marinade, dry mustard and honey.  When chicken is just done, brush with honey-mustard sauce and serve.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
1009<!><!><!>BAKED CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Defrost chicken wings and rinse in cold water; pat dry. Combine all ingredients and marinate for 24 hours. Discard marinade and bake wings in single layer at 350° for about 1 hour. Serve with duck sauce, if desired.<!><!><!>none
1010<!><!><!>BAKED CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Marinade may also be used for chicken kebabs on the grill.<!><!><!>none
1011<!><!><!>VIDALIA CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Combine chicken meat, onion, grapes, and almonds in a large mixing bowl.  In a small bowl mix together mayonnaise, dry mustard, and curry powder.  Toss with chicken mixture to coat thoroughly.  Chill at least 1 hour to blend flavors.<!><!><!>none
1012<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD WITH FRUIT<!><!><!>In a large bowl, combine all ingredients, except dressing. Mix thoroughly. Add enough of the Miracle Whip or mayonnaise to properly moisten salad. May need more or less than 1 cup.<!><!><!>none
1013<!><!><!>HOT CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients and spread into a casserole dish.<!><!><!>none
1014<!><!><!>HOT CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Topping:<!><!><!>none
1015<!><!><!>HOT CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Sprinkle crushed potato chips over top.  Melt butter and pour over chips.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1016<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>In a large bowl with fork, combine mayonnaise, mustard and pepper. Add remaining ingredients except lettuce. Toss well. Cover and refrigerate 2 hours. Serve over lettuce. Makes 4 servings, 1/2 cup each.<!><!><!>none
1017<!><!><!>CREAM OF CHICKEN SOUP<!><!><!>Melt butter in saucepan.  Blend in flour.  Dissolve bouillon cubes in boiling water.  Add with milk to saucepan.  Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and boils.  Cook and stir for 2 minutes.  Reduce heat and stir in chicken and pepper.  Return to boiling.  Serve immediately.  Makes 4 or 5 servings.<!><!><!>none
1018<!><!><!>CHICKEN GUMBO SOUP<!><!><!>Cook  or roast chicken until tender, roasting or baking gives richer flavor.  Remove meat from bones.  Chop and add to remaining ingredients.  Heat together, then  ladle  into jars. Process 60 minutes at 10 pounds pressure, or serve.<!><!><!>none
1019<!><!><!>CHICKEN GUMBO SOUP<!><!><!>Note:  Some add 1 or 2 cups cooked, brown rice.<!><!><!>none
1020<!><!><!>SNAPPY CHICKEN FINGERS<!><!><!>Combine cheese, pesto and pimento.  Add chicken. Toss gently to mix.  Place roll halves on cookie sheet.  Top each roll half with chicken mixture.  Broil 5-inches from heat for 2 minutes or until cheese melts.  Cut each roll half into 4 slices.  Makes 16 appetizers.<!><!><!>none
1021<!><!><!>LEMON CHICKEN<!><!><!>Combine lemon juice, butter or margarine, thyme and pepper seasoning in small bowl.  Sprinkle the chickens with salt and pepper.  Place chickens, bone side down, on the grill over hot coals.  Brush with the basting sauce.  Grill for 40 minutes, turning over once.  Baste frequently with the sauce.  Serve with the remaining basting sauce poured over the chickens.<!><!><!>none
1022<!><!><!>LEMON CHICKEN<!><!><!>Note:  Adjust the heat if chicken is cooking too fast.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
1023<!><!><!>CHICKEN PINEAPPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Combine 2 tablespoons juice from pineapple with mayonnaise, mustard, curry powder and salt.  Set aside.  Cut chicken into small pieces and mix with celery, green onion, almonds and raisins.  Add mayonnaise mixture and blend well.  Refrigerate 1 hour.  Serve with lettuce and pineapple.<!><!><!>none
1024<!><!><!>SOUTHWESTERN CHICKEN SALAD WRAPS<!><!><!>Drain roasted peppers well, pressing between layers of paper towels; chop.  Stir together roasted peppers, chicken, and next 7 ingredients.  Cover and chill at least 2 hours.  Stir pine nuts, if desired, in chicken mixture.  Spoon evenly over tortillas, and roll up.  These can be eaten as sandwiches, or each roll can be cut into 5 slices and served as appetizers.<!><!><!>none
1025<!><!><!>CHICKEN JUBILEE<!><!><!>Wash chicken; pat dry and season with salt and pepper.  Place chicken in large baking pan so pieces do not overlap.  Pour melted margarine or butter over chicken.  Place under broiler until brown. Watch carefully that chicken does not burn.  Remove chicken from broiler.  Combine fruit, onions, chicken broth and chili sauce. Spoon mixture over chicken.  Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour or until chicken is tender in 325° or 350° oven.  Just before serving, heat Worcestershire sauce and brandy in small saucepan and pour over chicken.  Yields 6 to 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
1026<!><!><!>CLASSIC CHICKEN DIVAN<!><!><!>Cook broccoli in boiling salted water; drain.  Melt butter; blend in flour.  Add chicken broth, stirring until thick.  Stir in cream, sherry, salt and pepper.  Place broccoli crosswise in 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.  Pour 1/2 the sauce over broccoli; top with chicken slices.  Add Parmesan cheese to remaining sauce; pour over chicken.  Sprinkle with additional Parmesan cheese.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until heated through.  Broil until sauce is golden.<!><!><!>none
1027<!><!><!>CLASSIC CHICKEN DIVAN<!><!><!>Can be frozen in freezer-to-oven type baking dish.  It can also be made and stored in refrigerator the day before it is to be baked.  Serves 8.<!><!><!>none
1028<!><!><!>CHICKEN CORN CHOWDER<!><!><!>Sauté celery and onions in butter until tender.  Add milk, soup, corn and seasonings.  Heat, stirring occasionally, until chowder is hot, but not boiling.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
1029<!><!><!>BUTTERMILK FRIED CHICKEN<!><!><!>Combine buttermilk, Old Bay, Tabasco sauce, onion, garlic, salt and pepper.  Pour over chicken breasts and allow to marinate for 3 to 4 hours.  Pour flour onto large plate.  Remove chicken breasts from marinade and coat with flour.  Place floured chicken on wax paper and refrigerate for 1 hour.  Remove chicken from refrigerator and allow to warm to room temperature (about 15 minutes).  In a large frying pan or skillet, heat oil to 370°.  Cook chicken breasts one at a time for about 7 to 10 minutes each side until brown and cooked through.  Drain chicken breasts on paper towels.<!><!><!>none
1030<!><!><!>CHICKEN PUFFS<!><!><!>Fry chicken breasts in pan.  Season with salt, oregano and a little pepper.  When done, remove from pan and cool.  Take meat off bones.  Roll out patty shells (tart side up) and fill each with chicken and 1 slice Mozzarella cheese.  Put on ungreased pan and bake at 350° for about 15 minutes or until golden.<!><!><!>none
1031<!><!><!>ORIENTAL CHICKEN CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Make cream sauce with margarine, flour and milk.  Add cheese, soy sauce, salt and pepper; stir until cheese melts.  Combine rice, chicken, water chestnuts, mushrooms and celery.  Place alternate layers of chicken-rice mixture and sauce mixture in 1 1/2-quart casserole.  Arrange noodles around edge of casserole and bake in 350° oven for 25 to 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1032<!><!><!>MOLDED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>*If you use Dream Whip, reduce sugar to 1 1/2 teaspoons.<!><!><!>none
1033<!><!><!>MOLDED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Drain crushed pineapple.  Add enough water to juice to make 1 1/2 cups.  Heat to boiling.  Stir in jello.  Refrigerate.  When jelled, whip.  Blend in cream cheese, Miracle Whip and sugar.  Fold in chicken, carrots, celery and drained pineapple with whipped cream or Dream Whip.  Put in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
1034<!><!><!>CHICKEN CHALUPA<!><!><!>Grate Jack and Cheddar cheese together.  Combine soup, chilies, grated onion, 1/2 of green onion tops, sour cream, olives and 2/3 of grated cheese.  Set aside 1 1/2 cups of this mixture.  Add chicken to remaining mixture.  Place 3 heaping tablespoons of chicken mix on each tortilla.  Roll up and place in shallow pan. Spread remaining mixture (1 1/2 cups) on top.  Sprinkle the 1/3 cheese and onion tops and paprika over top.  Refrigerate overnight. Bake at 375° for 45 minutes.  Makes 12 servings.<!><!><!>none
1035<!><!><!>CHICKEN PRIMAVERA<!><!><!>Cook pasta according to package directions.  In a large skillet, heat olive oil and margarine.  Add onion and garlic and cook 2 to 3 minutes.  Add mushrooms, broccoli, zucchini and carrot and cook 3 more minutes.  Add wine, basil, parsley, salt and pepper.  Simmer 5 minutes until vegetables are tender.  Toss pasta and chicken with vegetables.  Top with Parmesan cheese.  Serves 6 to 8.<!><!><!>none
1036<!><!><!>HERBED CHICKEN BITES<!><!><!>Mix together ingredients except chicken and margarine. Melt margarine. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. Dip in melted margarine. Roll in crumb mixture. Place on baking pan. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until nicely browned.<!><!><!>none

Return mixture to saucepan; gradually stir in milk and yogurt. Heat and stir occasionally.  Garnish with sliced apple.  Makes about 3 cups or 4 servings.<!><!><!>none
1038<!><!><!>BARBECUE SAUCE FOR CHICKEN<!><!><!>Combine all the ingredients in a saucepan and heat until blended and smooth.  Pour on chicken and baste.<!><!><!>none
1039<!><!><!>CURRIED CHICKEN BALLS<!><!><!>Mix first 5 ingredients.  Add mayonnaise to moisten.  Form small balls and roll in chopped nuts.  Chill overnight.  Makes 50.<!><!><!>none
1040<!><!><!>CHICKEN JERUSALEM<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients in roasting pan.  (You can mix all the liquid ingredients and spices and then pour over chicken, mushrooms, artichoke hearts and onion.) 1041<!><!><!>CHICKEN TACO SOUP<!><!><!>Boil chicken until done. After it cools, shred with fork. In large saucepan, combine olive oil, taco seasoning, onion, garlic and chicken. Cook until onions are clear. Combine all ingredients and cook until thoroughly heated. Serve in individual bowls with corn chips and top with shredded cheese.<!><!><!>none
1042<!><!><!>CHICKEN DELIGHT<!><!><!>Remove fat or gristle from chicken.  Split each piece into 2 thin layers, then cut layers into strips about 2-inches long, 1/4-inch wide.  Cook rice according to package directions (omit margarine).  Heat oil in skillet or wok, add chicken.  Stir constantly until chicken turns white and is slightly brown (approximately 2 minutes).  Turn heat to medium and add peppers, celery, onion, bouillon cube, water chestnuts, salt, ginger and water.  Make a smooth paste of arrowroot and soy sauce and stir in chicken mixture until smooth.  Cook gently 6 to 7 minutes, tightly covered.  Add bean sprouts to cooked vegetables; cover and cook gently another 2 minutes.  Each serving consists of 1/2 cup cooked rice with 1 cup chicken mixture.<!><!><!>none
1043<!><!><!>CHICKEN DELIGHT<!><!><!>Exchanges per serving - 1 serving = 1 bread, 1 1/2 fat, 3 meat, 1 "A" 1 "B" vegetable.  Yields 5 servings, 398 calories per serving.<!><!><!>none
1044<!><!><!>CHICKEN ENCHILADA SOUP<!><!><!>Combine cornstarch and water in small bowl.  Stir together all remaining ingredients, except cilantro, in saucepan.  Add the cornstarch water mixture; bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Add cilantro.  Garnish with tortilla chips and shredded Cheddar cheese.<!><!><!>none
1045<!><!><!>CHICKEN TORTILLA SOUP<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients together and simmer.  Serve with grated cheese and tortilla chips.  Can be done in crock-pot also.  Canned mixed vegetables can be added.<!><!><!>none
1046<!><!><!>CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Combine in saucepan the soy sauce, brown sugar, water, garlic powder, ginger and vinegar.  Heat through to melt brown sugar.  Do not boil.<!><!><!>none
1047<!><!><!>CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Place chicken wings in large pan.  Pour sauce over wings and marinate in refrigerator for 2 days.  Each day, stir the wings to make sure they get coated very well.  Place on sprayed cookie sheet in single layers.  Bake, uncovered, at 325° to 350° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.<!><!><!>none
1048<!><!><!>CHICKEN ALMOND SPREAD<!><!><!>Several hours or the day before serving, mix softened cream cheese, celery salt, onion salt, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco sauce, parsley and sour cream.  Stir in chicken, mushrooms and almonds, all finely chopped.  Place in a dish that will mold the spread.  Refrigerate until chilled.  This allows all flavors to blend.  Unmold spread and sprinkle with paprika.  Serve with assorted crackers.<!><!><!>none
1049<!><!><!>CHICKEN-VEGETABLE SOUP<!><!><!>Bring first 8 ingredients to a boil in a Dutch oven; cover, reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Stir in chicken and next 5 ingredients. Stir together flour and 1/4 cup water until smooth. Stir into chicken mixture and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat and simmer, stirring often, 6 to 8 minutes or until thickened. Yield: 12 cups.<!><!><!>none

1061<!><!><!>CHICKEN CORDON BLEU<!><!><!>Place 1 slice of ham and 1 slice of cheese in the center of each chicken piece.  Sprinkle evenly with parsley and pepper. 1067<!><!><!>CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP<!><!><!>Place chicken in Dutch oven or deep kettle.  Add water, onion, parsley, salt and whole black peppercorns.  Cover and simmer for 1 hour. Add chicken and heat.  Makes 2 1/2-quarts.<!><!><!>none

1073<!><!><!>SWEET AND SOUR CHICKEN<!><!><!>In bowl, combine all ingredients except chicken; add chicken and toss to coat.  Cover bowl and refrigerate for at least 8 hours, occasionally tossing chicken in marinade.  Remove chicken from marinade; remove and discard garlic and ginger.  In blender container pureed marinade.  Arrange chicken parts in disposable aluminum roasting pan; grill over hot coals until tender, basting occasionally with pureed marinade.  Transfer chicken and pan juices to serving platter.  In small saucepan bring remaining marinade to a boil; serve with chicken.  May also substitute turkey for chicken.<!><!><!>none
1074<!><!><!>CHICKEN PASTA SALAD<!><!><!>Remove pea pods from package; place in a bowl of cool water until thawed. Drain. Cook macaroni as directed on package except add pea pods about 2 minutes before macaroni is done; drain. Rinse macaroni and pea pods with cold water; drain. 1075<!><!><!>BARBECUED CHICKEN WITH HONEY-MUSTARD GLAZE<!><!><!>In a large screw-top jar, combine all ingredients, except chicken and glaze.  Cover and shake vigorously to blend. Grill chicken over medium flame for 45 to 50 minutes, brushing with marinade and turning frequently.  Just before serving, brush with Honey-Mustard Glaze.<!><!><!>none

1078<!><!><!>SOUTH OF THE BORDER CHICKEN CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Cut chicken into bite size pieces.  Cut tortillas into 1-inch strips.  Mix soups, milk, onion and chilies. 1079<!><!><!>COUNTRY CHICKEN CAMP STEW<!><!><!>Boil onion and chicken until chicken comes off the bones.  Pick off the bones and cut up chicken.  Discard bones. 1080<!><!><!>STIR-FRIED CHICKEN AND CASHEWS<!><!><!>In medium bowl, combine chicken, soy sauce and sherry; set aside.  In a 12-inch skillet or wok, stir-fry cashews in hot oil over high heat for 1 to 2 minutes or until browned.  Lift out with a slotted spoon and set aside.  Add the chicken mixture to the skillet.  Stir-fry over high heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until just done.  Stir in hoisin sauce and cashews.  If desired, sprinkle with sliced green onion.  Serve at once with hot cooked rice.  Makes 4 or 5 servings.<!><!><!>none
1081<!><!><!>MEXICAN CHICKEN/BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Cook chicken in 1 1/2 gallons water.  When chicken is half cooked, add potatoes and carrots.  When potatoes and carrots are cooked, add rest of ingredients with salt.  Soup should be cooked at least 1 hour and 30 minutes on medium flame.  When serving, squeeze lime into soup in bowl.<!><!><!>none
1082<!><!><!>MAMAW'S CHICKEN PIE<!><!><!>Boil chicken in large deep pot in salted water until tender. Remove bones and skin; cut into bite sized pieces and place in a well-greased 3-quart casserole (Pyrex 9 x 13-inch dish is ideal).<!><!><!>none
1083<!><!><!>MAMAW'S CHICKEN PIE<!><!><!>Sauce:<!><!><!>none
1084<!><!><!>MAMAW'S CHICKEN PIE<!><!><!>Make sauce by blending flour into melted butter and adding milk, chicken broth, lemon juice and minced onion.  Cook over medium heat until slightly thick.  Pour over chicken.  Top with Pinwheel Crust.<!><!><!>none
1085<!><!><!>MAMAW'S CHICKEN PIE<!><!><!>Pinwheel Crust:<!><!><!>none
1086<!><!><!>MAMAW'S CHICKEN PIE<!><!><!>Will need 32 pinwheels to cover pie.<!><!><!>none
1087<!><!><!>MAMAW'S CHICKEN PIE<!><!><!>Sift dry ingredients together.  Cut in shortening and add all of milk at once.  Stir just enough to mix.  Roll out to 1/4-inch thickness on floured board.  Spread chopped pimientos and cheese over pastry.  Roll in jelly roll fashion and slice into pieces about 3/4-inch thick.  Place rounds on top of chicken and sauce. Bake at 350° for about 30 minutes or until brown and bubbly. Serves 8 to 12.  Freezes well.<!><!><!>none
1088<!><!><!>CHICKEN, ARTICHOKE AND RICE SALAD<!><!><!>Cook rice according to directions, omitting butter, and allow to cool.  Drain artichokes, saving juice for dressing.  Cut artichokes in halves or slice and add to rice with remaining ingredients.<!><!><!>none
1089<!><!><!>CHICKEN, ARTICHOKE AND RICE SALAD<!><!><!>Dressing:<!><!><!>none

1091<!><!><!>ASPARAGUS AND CHICKEN SOUP<!><!><!>Heat stock.  Cut chicken into small pieces.  After asparagus is cooked, cut into small pieces.  Save 1 cup of water to add to chicken stock.  Add chicken and boil.  Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.  Mix cornstarch with cold water and add to soup, stirring constantly.  Add sherry.  Slowly add beaten eggs and asparagus.  Heat through.<!><!><!>none
1092<!><!><!>CHICKEN TETRAZZINI<!><!><!>Heat oven to 375°.  Generously grease a shallow 2 quart baking dish.  Mix undiluted soup and milk in a large bowl until well blended.  Add remaining ingredients except cheese and toss gently to mix.  Turn into prepared dish.  Sprinkle cheese evenly over top.  Bake 15 minutes or until hot and bubbly.  Makes 4 servings.<!><!><!>none

1100<!><!><!>CHICKEN KIEV<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°.  In a 2 quart saucepan melt butter.  On a piece of wax paper combine bread crumbs, cheese, basil and garlic salt.  Dip chicken breasts in melted butter, then roll in bread crumbs to coat.  Place skin side up in ungreased 9-inch square baking dish.  Bake in oven at 375° for 50 to 60 minutes.  While chicken is baking, add apple juice, onion and parsley to remaining melted butter.  When chicken is golden brown, pour butter sauce over and around.  Return to oven for 3 to 5 minutes more or just until sauce is hot.  Serve with sauce spooned over.  Good with wild rice as an accompaniment.<!><!><!>none
1101<!><!><!>CHICKEN SOUP<!><!><!>Boil (slowly) chicken in the water for 40 to 45 minutes. Remove chicken from water.  Set aside on platter to cool.  Skim top of the water and discard skimmings.  Add vegetables to water (can be cut first if you wish) and bouillon cube.  When the chicken has cooled, remove meat from bone and put back in water to simmer for 2 more hours.<!><!><!>none
1102<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Simmer whole fryer. Cook minced onion. Combine chicken, onion and chicken stock. Add cheese, egg and pimientos. Sprinkle with garlic powder and pepper, if desired. Add mayonnaise and mix carefully.<!><!><!>none
1103<!><!><!>THREE CHEESE CHICKEN LASAGNA<!><!><!>Cook noodles and drain.  Cook onion and green pepper in butter until tender.  Stir in soup, mushrooms, pimento, milk and basil. Lay 1/2 the noodles in a 13 x 9-inch pan.  Top with half each the sauce, cottage cheese, chicken and American and Parmesan cheeses. Repeat layers except for the last 2 cheeses.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  Top with remaining cheeses.  Bake a few minutes more.  Makes 8 to 10 servings.<!><!><!>none
1104<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Place cleaned fryer hen in Dutch oven with water and poultry seasoning (generous amount); salt and pepper if your diet allows. 1105<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Note:  The recipe is for a diet for 3 meats, 2 fats, 2 fruit exchanges; however, you may design your own recipe to fit your diet by using the base amounts listed as follows:<!><!><!>none
1106<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Sample Recipe:<!><!><!>none
1107<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>**Fruit amounts equal 2 fruits.<!><!><!>none
1108<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Use 4 to 6 small Tupperware bowls and line them up on the counter, assembly-line style.  In this manner, add the amount of the ingredients in each bowl so that when completed, you have 4 to 6 exact meals ready to put into lunch boxes or serve at the table. Complete meal is served with 2 slices of bread.<!><!><!>none
1109<!><!><!>TURKEY OR CHICKEN CRESCENTS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°.  Blend cream cheese and 2 tablespoons margarine or butter until smooth.  Add turkey, salt, pepper, milk and chives.  Mix well.  Separate rolls into 4 rectangles.  Firmly press rolls to seal.  Spoon 1/2 cup meat mixture onto center of each square.  Pull 4 corners of dough to top center.  Twist slightly and seal edges.  Brush top with reserved butter.  Dip in crouton crumbs.  Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown.<!><!><!>none
1110<!><!><!>CANNELLONI AND CHICKEN WITH HAM<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°.  In a frying pan, melt 4 tablespoons of butter.  Add chicken breasts and fry for 5 minutes, until lightly browned on both sides.  Transfer to bowl.  Add chicken livers to the frypan and cook 2 minutes on each side.  Transfer to bowl with chicken breasts.  Mince the chicken breasts, livers and ham together.  Add 1/4 cup Parmesan to the ground meat and mix well with a fork.  In a medium saucepan, melt another 4 tablespoons butter.  With a wooden spoon, stir the flour into the butter and cook for 2 minutes.  Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the milk slowly.  Return to heat and cook until sauce thickens.  Remove and add cream, salt and pepper.  Add 1/4 of the sauce to the meat and cheese mixture in the bowl and mix well.  Set aside.  Bring 2 1/2 quarts of water to a boil.  Drop into the boiling water and cook for 6 to 15 minutes, depending on the thickness.  With a slotted spoon, remove the pasta from the pan and place on dampened cloth to drain.  Using 1 tablespoon of butter, grease a large baking dish and spread 2 tablespoons of meat and cheese mixture on each pasta square.  Fold over and make a roll.  Place the cannelloni in either one or two layers, placing the joined side down in the baking dish.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese and cover with reserved sauce.  Dot the top of the dish with small pieces of butter and place in oven.  Bake for 30 minutes until lightly browned.<!><!><!>none
1111<!><!><!>CANNELLONI AND CHICKEN WITH HAM<!><!><!>Cannelloni:<!><!><!>none
1112<!><!><!>CANNELLONI AND CHICKEN WITH HAM<!><!><!>Sift flour and salt into a mixing bowl.  Add eggs.  Use hands to mix the flour and eggs together and form a ball.  Place ball of dough on floured board and knead for 10 minutes, until smooth but stiff.  If necessary, add more flour.  Divide the dough into 4 pieces and roll out into thin sheet.  Cover with cloth and leave for 30 minutes.  Cut into 4 x 3-inch rectangles.<!><!><!>none
1113<!><!><!>CHICKEN BREASTS WITH ADOBADO SAUCE<!><!><!>Remove the seeds from the chilies and lightly roast to develop the full flavor.  Soak in the vinegar (add enough water to cover) for 15 minutes, then puree.  Brown the onions, then add the garlic puree and cumin.  Add the chili puree and stock.  Let cook for about 20 minutes or until the flavors have all merged.<!><!><!>none
1114<!><!><!>CHICKEN BREASTS WITH ADOBADO SAUCE<!><!><!>Make a paste of the brown sugar, orange juice, lemon or lime juice and tomato puree.  Whip into the sauce and continue cooking another 15 minutes.  Taste and adjust seasoning.  Marinate the chicken breasts in the sauce 2 to 3 hours.  Grill over charcoal or bake in 400° oven for 20 to 25 minutes.  To broil, allow about 8 minutes a side.  This sauce is also an excellent marinade for pork chops or ribs.  Serves 6. Contains 275 calories per serving.<!><!><!>none

1122<!><!><!>SINGAPORE CHICKEN SATAY<!><!><!>In a small pan, combine water, peanut butter and garlic.  Cook over medium heat, stirring, until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat and stir in other ingredients.  Let cool to room temperature before serving.  Makes 1 cup.<!><!><!>none
1123<!><!><!>EASY CHICKEN ENCHILADA SOUP<!><!><!>Mix and warm to boil.<!><!><!>none
1124<!><!><!>PARMESAN FRIED CHICKEN<!><!><!>Remove skin from chicken pieces.  Lightly salt chicken. Preheat oven to 400°.  In oven, melt 2 tablespoons butter and shortening in a 15 1/2 x 10 1/2-inch jelly roll pan.  In 2-quart plastic bag, combine flour, salt, pepper and paprika.  Shake chicken pieces to coat them well.  In medium bowl, beat together eggs with milk.  Dip flour coated chicken in egg mixture.  In another 2-quart plastic bag, combine cheese and bread crumbs. Shake chicken pieces in cheese mixture to coat well.  Place chicken bone side down in melted butter and shortening in jelly roll pan. Drizzle 1/4 cup butter over chicken pieces and bake in preheated oven at 400° for 1 hour.  Serve hot or cold.  Serves 8 to 10.<!><!><!>none

1126<!><!><!>WILTED LETTUCE WITH CHICKEN<!><!><!>In a large mixing bowl, combine romaine, red leaf lettuce, mushrooms and onion.  Toss lightly to mix.  Set aside.  In a 12-inch skillet, heat one tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add chicken and mustard seed.  Cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes or until chicken is tender.  Reduce heat to medium.  Stir in 3 tablespoons of olive oil and the vinegar.  Add apples and cook for 30 seconds.  Remove skillet from heat and immediately add lettuce mixture.  Carefully toss for about one minute or until lettuce begins to wilt.  Spoon lettuce mixture into 4 salad plates. Garnish with egg wedges.  Makes 4 servings.<!><!><!>none

1128<!><!><!>CHICKEN ACAPULCO<!><!><!>Sauté onion in butter in a large saucepan until tender. 1132<!><!><!>CHICKEN TERIYAKI<!><!><!>Cut the chicken breasts into bite-size pieces.  Place the pieces in a shallow bowl. 1135<!><!><!>CHICKEN CORN CHOWDER<!><!><!>Combine flour and 2 tablespoons fajita seasoning in a heavy-duty zip-top plastic bag. Add chicken; seal and shake to coat. Stir in remaining fajita seasoning, corn, next 5 ingredients, and if desired, olives. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer 5 minutes. 1152<!><!><!>CHICKEN WITH GINGER AND GARBANZO BEANS<!><!><!>Do not skimp on the ginger.  Serve with a starch such as bulgur or brown rice.<!><!><!>none
1153<!><!><!>CHICKEN WITH GINGER AND GARBANZO BEANS<!><!><!>Place chicken in a large bowl.  Cover with water.  Add lemon juice.  Let marinate for 20 minutes.  Drain chicken.  Pat dry, then season with salt and pepper.  In a 4-quart pot, heat oil.  Brown chicken in oil on all sides.  Remove from pot.  Cook the onions in the same pot until soft.  Add more oil, if needed.  To the onions, add ginger, cumin, cardamom and coriander.  Cook for a few more minutes.  To the pot, add the chicken, garbanzo beans and broth. Bring to a boil on high heat.  Reduce heat.  Let cook, covered, for 30 minutes or until chicken is tender.  Serve with cooked bulgur, brown rice and/or pita bread.<!><!><!>none

1156<!><!><!>CHICKEN PARMIGIANA<!><!><!>With meat mallet or dull edge of French knife, pound each chicken breast half to 1/4-inch thickness.  Place bread crumbs in pie plate. 1170<!><!><!>SWISS CHICKEN<!><!><!>Place 4 chicken breasts (halved and boned, 8 fillets) in mayonnaise coated casserole.  Cover with slices of Swiss cheese. 1173<!><!><!>CHICKEN NUGGETS<!><!><!>Cut chicken into 1-inch pieces.  Heat 3-inches of oil in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat until it reaches 375°, adjust heat to maintain temperature.  Meanwhile beat egg and water in large bowl until well mixed.  Add flour, salt, and pepper, stirring to form smooth batter.  Dip chicken pieces into batter, draining off excess.  Fry chicken, a few pieces at a time, in hot oil about 4 minutes or until golden brown.  Drain on paper towels. Serve with sauces.<!><!><!>none
1174<!><!><!>CHICKEN NUGGETS<!><!><!>Apricot Sauce:<!><!><!>none
1175<!><!><!>CHICKEN NUGGETS<!><!><!>In a small bowl blend well.  Microwave at high (100%) 1 to 1 1/2 minutes or until heated through.<!><!><!>none
1176<!><!><!>CHICKEN NUGGETS<!><!><!>Dill Mayonnaise Sauce:<!><!><!>none
1177<!><!><!>CHICKEN NUGGETS<!><!><!>Combine in small bowl, cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.<!><!><!>none
1178<!><!><!>CHICKEN NUGGETS<!><!><!>Cocktail Sauce:<!><!><!>none
1179<!><!><!>CHICKEN NUGGETS<!><!><!>Combine all in small bowl, blend well.<!><!><!>none
1180<!><!><!>CROCK-POT CHICKEN AND RICE CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Mix  in  crock-pot  the 3 cans of soup and rice.  Place the chicken on top of the mixture, then add the diced celery. Cook for 3 hours on high or 4 hours on low.  Makes 4 servings.<!><!><!>none
1181<!><!><!>CROCK-POT CHICKEN AND RICE CASSEROLE<!><!><!>More rice, about 1/2 cup, and 2 additional chicken breasts may be added to make 6 servings.<!><!><!>none

1183<!><!><!>QUICK AND EASY CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Toast almonds on a baking sheet for 6 to 8 minutes at 350°. Remove from oven and let cool. Cut grapes in half. Mix chicken, grapes, almonds and yogurt along with pepper. Chill.<!><!><!>none
1184<!><!><!>CHICKEN ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>Boil chicken.  When done, debone.  Mix chicken with cream of chicken, onions, chili and sour cream.  Add spices to taste. 1185<!><!><!>AMISH CHICKEN CORN SOUP<!><!><!>Simmer chicken in boiling water until tender, remove bones and skin, strain the stock.  Return stock and chicken to the pot, add onions, celery and corn.  Simmer until vegetables are tender.<!><!><!>none
1186<!><!><!>AMISH CHICKEN CORN SOUP<!><!><!>Mix flour with egg and milk.  Rub mixture with a fork till it crumbles, drop crumbs in soup.  Cook 10 more minutes covered. Serves 3 to 4.<!><!><!>none
1187<!><!><!>HONEY CHICKEN & GRAPE SALAD<!><!><!>Mix dressing and orange peel in large bowl.  Add chicken breast strips, grapes and celery.  Toss lightly.  Refrigerate several hours or overnight.  Toss with lettuce and sprinkle with sunflower seeds just before serving.<!><!><!>none
1188<!><!><!>GRILLED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Mix honey and dressing for marinade.  Place chicken breasts, cut in strips, in 1/2 marinade in refrigerator for 3 hours.  Pour out marinade.  Grill chicken until done, basting with remaining marinade that chicken was not in.<!><!><!>none
1189<!><!><!>GRILLED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Mix together eggs and salad greens.  Add others if you wish. Cube chicken over salad.  Pour on favorite dressing.<!><!><!>none
1190<!><!><!>GLAZED CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Mix first 5 ingredients in a bowl, set aside.  Cut chicken at joints; place in a row in roasting pan.  Place the sauce over the wings and bake until golden brown in a 350° oven.<!><!><!>none
1191<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Steam chicken in steamer or simmer in large saucepot until fork-tender; drain and cool.  Discard skin and bones; cut meat into bite-size chunks.  In large bowl, mix chicken and remaining ingredients except chicory and tomatoes.  Chill mixture at least 1 hour to blend flavors.  To serve, line serving platter with chicory.  Spoon chicken salad onto platter and garnish with cherry tomato halves. Makes 4 main-dish servings.<!><!><!>none
1192<!><!><!>QUICK CHICKEN CACCIATORE<!><!><!>Coat chicken with flour.  In large skillet, brown chicken and garlic in 3 tablespoons oil; remove chicken from pan.  Add pasta sauce, then chicken; stir.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover and simmer 20 minutes, adding pepper during last 5 minutes. Uncover; top each chicken breast with half cheese slice.  Toss hot cooked macaroni with remaining 1 tablespoon oil and parsley.  Serve with chicken and sauce.<!><!><!>none
1193<!><!><!>SIMMERING CHICKEN STRAWBERRY KABOBS<!><!><!>In a shallow glass bowl combine lemon juice, juice from pineapple can, salt, pepper and 1 teaspoon cinnamon.  Mix together. Add cubed chicken and marinate for 1 hour in the refrigerator. Preheat grill to medium heat.  In a small bowl combine the melted butter or margarine, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, brown sugar and nutmeg. Lightly oil grate.  Using metal or soaked wooden skewers arrange chicken, pineapple chunks and strawberries on each stick (approximately 4 to 6 pieces of each item per skewer).  Brush kabobs with butter or margarine mixture place on grill and cook, turning on all sides, until chicken is cooked through and strawberries are sizzling, approximately 8 to 10 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1194<!><!><!>SIMMERING CHICKEN STRAWBERRY KABOBS<!><!><!>You may want to spice the chicken up a bit more to add to the contrast between the meat and the fruit. Try adding some crushed chilies to your chicken marinade.<!><!><!>none
1195<!><!><!>CHICKEN CRESCENTS<!><!><!>Separate crescent rolls into 4 rectangles. Place on a cookie sheet. Blend all other ingredients. Spoon 1/2 cup of chicken mixture onto each rectangle. Roll the 4 corners of the crescent dough over chicken mixture to the center. Brush with melted butter or margarine. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1196<!><!><!>CHICKEN FRIED STEAKS AND MILK GRAVY<!><!><!>Season meat with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Mix flour with 1 teaspoon pepper in shallow plate.  Dredge each steak in flour.  Dip in beaten egg, then dredge in flour again. Heat lard or oil in large, heavy skillet until hot.  Fry steak 3 to 4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.  Drain on paper towels. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons of the oil.  Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of the dredging flour into oil.  Cook over medium heat 1 minute, scraping up browned bits from bottom of skillet.  Stir in milk, a little at a time, until gravy is smooth.  Cook, stirring frequently, 3 to 4 minutes, until thickened and bubbly.  Add 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon pepper and 1/4 teaspoon salt; gravy should be quite peppery.  Serve steaks smothered in gravy.<!><!><!>none
1197<!><!><!>CHICKEN SPAGHETTI WITH ROTEL TOMATOES<!><!><!>Melt 1 stick oleo in skillet and sauté medium chopped onion and bell pepper (optional) until tender.  Add the Ro-Tel tomatoes, cream of chicken soup and Cheddar cheese.  Add chopped chicken and drained spaghetti.  Keep heat low until the cheese melts.  Pour in 9 x 13-inch casserole and bake at 350° for approximately 25 to 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1198<!><!><!>QUICK CHICKEN CHOWDER<!><!><!>Cook celery and onion in butter until tender, but not brown. Stir in peas and potatoes, broth, milk, rosemary and dash of pepper.  Cook and stir until mixture boils.  Reduce heat.  Cover and simmer about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Add chicken and heat to boiling.  Serve hot and sprinkle crumbled, crisp-cooked bacon or paprika over the top.  Makes 4 servings.<!><!><!>none
1199<!><!><!>CHICKEN AND ESCAROLE SOUP<!><!><!>Boil 1 chicken or stewing hen.  Squeeze 1/2 lemon into stock. Use 2 or 3 cubes chicken bouillon or 2 tablespoons chicken soup base.  Boil with celery, onion and garlic.  Remove chicken and pick meat off bones.  Return meat to stock.  The fat needs to be skimmed off.  (It's easier to refrigerate and then skim off and re-cook the next day.)  Heat stock.  Add meatballs and cook about 2 hours. Just before serving, add one bunch escarole (spinach), chopped up. Heat and serve.<!><!><!>none
1200<!><!><!>CHICKEN LIVERS<!><!><!>Heat 1/4 cup margarine in heavy saucepan.  Add onion and sauté 2 to 3 minutes.  Add mushrooms and cook 5 minutes.  Add rice and stir until rice just begins to brown.  Stir in boiling broth. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes.  Add a little more broth if mixture is too dry.  Sauté livers in remaining margarine, after dusting them with flour, until done.  Add seasoning.  Stir gently into rice mixture.<!><!><!>none
1201<!><!><!>CHICKEN TACO SOUP<!><!><!>Season chicken to taste and broil in oven until done.  Remove meat; cool and shred with a fork.  (Chicken may be covered with water and boiled on stove until done if preferred.  Remove from water; cool and shred with a fork.)  In a large skillet, combine shredded chicken, olive oil, taco seasoning, onions, and garlic. Cook until onions are clear.  While cooking chicken mixture, combine all the remaining ingredients in a pot and heat.  When skillet mixture is done, add to the pot and heat thoroughly.  Serve soup with cheese and chips or corn bread.<!><!><!>none
1202<!><!><!>CHICKEN CHOW MEIN<!><!><!>Heat oil in deep heavy pot; add celery and onions.  Stir-fry over moderate heat until onions are transparent but not brown.  Add chicken broth; cover and cook 4 to 5 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1203<!><!><!>CHICKEN CHOW MEIN<!><!><!>Meanwhile, mix cornstarch, salt, garlic, ginger, cold water and soy sauce; mix until smooth.  Add slowly to hot mixture, stirring constantly.  Cook until liquid is thick and clear.  Add chicken, green pepper, mushrooms and water chestnuts; mix well.  Cover and cook on low about 5 minutes or until hot.  Turn into 2-quart serving dish.  Mix noodles and candied ginger and scatter on top of chicken mixture.<!><!><!>none
1204<!><!><!>RANCH CHICKEN BALL<!><!><!>Cream together cream cheese, chicken breast chunks and salad dressing mix.  Refrigerate for several hours in a Cool Whip tub which has been lined with Saran Wrap.  After several hours (or overnight), turn out onto a plate and top with almonds.<!><!><!>none
1205<!><!><!>RANCH CHICKEN BALL<!><!><!>Serve with Triscuits or favorite crackers.<!><!><!>none
1206<!><!><!>BAKED ALMOND CHICKEN<!><!><!>Coat chicken pieces with flour.  Blend celery salt, paprika, salt, curry powder, oregano and pepper with butter, coating all sides.  Arrange chicken in single layer in a baking dish (9 x 13-inches).  Sprinkle evenly with almonds.  Pour light cream between pieces.  Bake, uncovered, in a moderate 350° oven for 45 minutes.  Uncover.  Spoon 1/2 cup sauce from pan into sour cream and mix together.  Pour evenly over chicken.  Sprinkle with bread crumbs.  Bake, uncovered, about 15 minutes longer or until chicken is tender.  Makes 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
1207<!><!><!>CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients.  Stir while heating thoroughly on medium heat.<!><!><!>none
1208<!><!><!>CHICKEN-VEGETABLE PACKETS<!><!><!>Prepare outdoor grill.  In large bowl, mix all ingredients except chicken.  On double thickness of heavy-duty foil, place 1/4 of chicken and 1/4 of vegetable mixture.  Wrap chicken and vegetable mixture in foil.  Make certain seam of foil is folded several times to seal in juices.  Repeat to make three more packets.<!><!><!>none

1212<!><!><!>Mock "Fried Chicken"<!><!><!>Make a light paste with all of the ingredients, except tofu and oil.  Marinate tofu for a few minutes, turning occasionally.  Heat skillet with oil until hot.<!><!><!>none
1213<!><!><!>Mock "Fried Chicken"<!><!><!>Dry Mixture:<!><!><!>none
1214<!><!><!>Mock "Fried Chicken"<!><!><!>*Flour ration should be approximately 4 to 1 yeast flakes.<!><!><!>none
1215<!><!><!>Mock "Fried Chicken"<!><!><!>Dredge tofu in flour mixture.  Fry tofu until brown on both sides.  Drain on paper towels.  This mock "fried chicken" can be eaten as "cold chicken" after refrigeration.<!><!><!>none
1216<!><!><!>CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS<!><!><!>Wash chicken and place in a large pot with enough water to cover well.  Add salt, pepper, carrot and celery.  Bring to a boil; lower heat and cook at a gentle boil for about 45 minutes to an hour.  Be sure to add more water if it gets low.<!><!><!>none
1217<!><!><!>CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS<!><!><!>When chicken is very tender, remove chicken, carrot and celery from broth; discard vegetables.  When chicken is cool, remove meat from the bones.  Add meat back to the broth.  If the chicken broth does not have a good amount of fat on top, add a half stick of butter.<!><!><!>none
1218<!><!><!>CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS<!><!><!>Dumplings:<!><!><!>none
1219<!><!><!>CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS<!><!><!>Sift flour and salt into a bowl; cut in shortening.  Stir in enough milk to make a stiff dough.  Turn dough out onto a floured surface.  Knead dough, but don't overwork.  Roll dough thin and cut into strips about an inch or two wide and about three-inches long. Coat the dumplings well with flour and let them air dry for an hour or two.  You can make these as you put the chicken on to cook and let them dry until the chicken and broth are ready.<!><!><!>none
1220<!><!><!>CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS<!><!><!>Bring chicken and broth to a boil.  Drop dumplings into pot, a few at a time, keeping the broth at a gentle boil.  When all dumplings are in, lower heat, cover and simmer for a few minutes. Add more salt and pepper if needed.<!><!><!>none
1221<!><!><!>CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS<!><!><!>An easier way is to thin dough with more milk and spoon dumplings into boiling chicken and broth mixture as directed.  It is faster, but the dumplings will be softer and moister.  You can also add a can of cream of chicken soup to make the dumplings richer.  I don't think Granny would have minded us saving time!<!><!><!>none
1222<!><!><!>GUACAMOLE CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice and salt; blend well.  Stir in chicken, celery, tomato and avocado; chill to blend flavors.  Serve on lettuce leaves.  Makes four servings.<!><!><!>none
1223<!><!><!>CURRIED CHICKEN DIP<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients together. Serve with crackers.<!><!><!>none
1224<!><!><!>OVEN FRIED CHICKEN<!><!><!>Sprinkle chicken with pepper and salt.  Let stand for 30 minutes.  Mix other dry ingredients and put in plastic bag.  Dip chicken in buttermilk.  Place a few pieces at a time in dry mixture and shake.  Place chicken in a baking dish which has been sprayed with a nonstick preparation.  Bake at 350° for about 35 to 40 minutes or until chicken is brown and tender.<!><!><!>none
1225<!><!><!>CHICKEN SAVANNAH<!><!><!>Soak chicken in buttermilk for 1 1/2 hours; remove and drain. Mix flour, salt, pepper and garlic.  Thoroughly coat chicken with mixture and allow to sit for 20 minutes.  Heat vegetable oil to 375° and fry chicken.<!><!><!>none
1226<!><!><!>CHICKEN SAVANNAH<!><!><!>Make glaze by melting butter and adding honey and brown sugar. Bring mixture to a low boil.  Add pecans and simmer for 20 minutes. 1227<!><!><!>STUFFED CHICKEN BREASTS<!><!><!>Place chicken breasts between 2 sheets of waxed paper and pound out.  Blend cheese, crumbs, parsley, onions and 1/4 cup butter. Shape into 6 balls.  Season inside of each chicken breast with salt and pepper.  Place stuffing ball at one end of each breast.  Turn long sides of breast toward center just enough to make a neat fold. Roll up each breast as for a jellyroll.  Secure ends with skewers or toothpicks.  Brush rolls with oil and butter and sprinkle with paprika.  Arrange on medium-hot grill.  Cover and cook 15 minutes. Brush with oil and butter; turn and brush again.  Cover and continue cooking about 10 minutes more or until done.  Brush with oil and butter again just before serving.  Top with packaged mushroom sauce, if desired.<!><!><!>none
1228<!><!><!>CHICKEN STEW<!><!><!>Cook in crock-pot or on stove; simmer for 1 hour.  The last 5 minutes add macaroni or rice to thicken.  You can put anything you like or have leftover in it.  The more veggies, the better.<!><!><!>none
1229<!><!><!>CHICKEN POTATO CORN CHOWDER<!><!><!>In large saucepan, stir all ingredients until well blended. Bring to boil over medium heat.  Stir occasionally.  Makes 4 servings; contains 281 calories per serving.<!><!><!>none
1230<!><!><!>BRAISED HONEY CHICKEN WINGS<!><!><!>Cut each wing at joints, in 3 sections.  Save tips for broth or other use.  In hot oil, in heavy skillet, stir-fry onions and ginger 3 minutes to flavor oil.  Remove with slotted spoon; discard.  Brown chicken; set aside.  Drain skillet.  Add sherry, honey and soy sauce; bring to a boil.  Stir in chicken; reduce heat.  Cover and simmer 15 minutes, or until chicken is tender. Uncover and simmer 5 minutes, turning chicken frequently as sauce thickens.  Serve immediately with any remaining sauce or arrange on platter; cover.  Chill.  Serve cold.  Makes 6 appetizer servings.<!><!><!>none
1231<!><!><!>CHICKEN SQUARES<!><!><!>Mix first 6 ingredients.  Separate an 8 ounce can of rolls into 4 triangles.  Seal perforations. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.<!><!><!>none
1232<!><!><!>CHICKEN BROTH<!><!><!>Wash and cut hen into frying pieces.  Salt and pepper chicken.  Place in large saucepan and cover with water.  Cook on stovetop until meat is done, about 1 hour (45 minutes in pressure cooker).  Remove chicken from pot, discard celery and carrots; strain broth.  Reserve chicken for other uses.<!><!><!>none
1233<!><!><!>CHICKEN BROTH<!><!><!>Yield:  4 to 6 cups broth.  Add water to make 6 cups if desired, especially if broth produces a lot of fat, which will float to the top when cool.<!><!><!>none
1234<!><!><!>CHICKEN QUESADILLAS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 400°.  Chop chicken and jalapeno pepper with Food Chopper; set aside.  Combine chicken, pepper, soup and 1/2 cup cheese in Batter Bowl.  Top half of each tortilla with 1/4 cup soup mixture.  Spread to within 1/2-inch of edge with Super Scraper. Moisten edges of tortillas with water using Pastry Brush.  Fold over and press edges together.  Place tortillas on 15-inch Baking Stone.  Bake 8 minutes or until hot.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese.  Cut into wedges using Pizza Cutter.  Garnish serving plate with tomato, jalapeno pepper slices and cilantro.  Serve with salsa and sour cream.  Serve with Mini-Serving Spatula.  Serves 8 quesadillas or 32 appetizers.<!><!><!>none
1235<!><!><!>CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP<!><!><!>Bring water to a boil.  Add soup mix and chicken.  Bring back to a boil; reduce heat and simmer uncovered 12 - 15 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1236<!><!><!>CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP<!><!><!>Boil all ingredients with 8-10 cups water for 2 hours on low heat.  Strain.  Remove chicken breast and any other edible chicken pieces.  Chop the chicken.  In small saucepan, melt 2 tbsp butter. Add then chopped chicken and add pinch of garlic powder, onion, salt, black pepper, thyme and basil.  Sauté until slightly browned.  Add 2 Tbsp. tomato sauce (and some more butter if needed).  Sauté and add boiled macaroni noodle.  Sauté another minute until macaroni is well coated with butter and tomato mixture.  Add to strained soup and slowly cook for 15 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1237<!><!><!>CRUNCHY CHICKEN BALLS<!><!><!>In a bowl, combine the first 5 ingredients; mix well. Shape into 3/4-inch balls. Roll in parsley. Cover and chill. Yield: 8 servings (2 dozen).<!><!><!>none
1238<!><!><!>CHILI CHICKEN BITES<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 400°F. Melt butter or margarine in a 9 inch square pan in oven. Tip pan to coat with butter or margarine. In a large bowl, beat eggs, stir in flour, baking powder, and salt. Add melted butter or margarine. Set pan aside for later. Stir in chilies, cottage cheese and Jack cheese. Mix until blended. Turn batter into coated pan. Bake 15 minutes. Reduce heat to  350°F. Bake 30 - 35 minutes longer or until lightly browned. Cool slightly and cut into small squares. May be frozen.<!><!><!>none
1239<!><!><!>CHILI CHICKEN BITES<!><!><!>Variations; Recipe may be doubled and baked in  a 13 x 9 inch pan. One (10 oz.) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained well, may be added with chilies.<!><!><!>none
1240<!><!><!>CHICKEN TACOS<!><!><!>In a 9 or 10-inch skillet, heat oil.  Add onion and garlic and sauté until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.  Add tomato, tomato sauce and seasonings. 1241<!><!><!>CHICKEN CRESCENT WREATH<!><!><!>Arrange crescent rolls on a 12 inch pizza pan forming a ring with pointed ends facing the outer edge of pan with wide ends overlapping. Move the rolls in a bit from the edge of the pan so filling does not cook over edge of pan.  Bake 375° for 20 to 25 minutes.<!><!><!>none
1242<!><!><!>CHICKEN PUFFS<!><!><!>Melt margarine in 1 c. boiling water; add flour and a dash of salt; stir vigorously. Cook and stir till mixture forms a ball that doesn't separate; remove from heat and cool slightly. Add eggs and beat until smooth; stir in cheese. Drop dough onto greased baking sheet using 1 level tsp. dough for each puff. Bake at 400° about 20 minutes. Cool and split. Combine remaining ingredients and fill each puff.<!><!><!>none
1243<!><!><!>SPICY CHICKEN CHUNKS (LOW CALORIE)<!><!><!>Put chicken in glass or plastic bowl.  Add hot sauce and stir lightly.  Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
