2069<!><!><!>OLD FASHIONED POTATO SALAD<!><!><!>In large bowl, stir together mayonnaise, onion, vinegar, salt, pepper and eggs.  Add potatoes and celery.  Toss to coat well.  Cover.  Refrigerate for at least 4 hours.  If desired, sprinkle with paprika.  Makes about 8 cups.<!><!><!>none
2070<!><!><!>CHOPPED ITALIAN SALAD<!><!><!>Toss to combine all of the above ingredients.<!><!><!>none
2071<!><!><!>CHOPPED ITALIAN SALAD<!><!><!>Dressing:<!><!><!>none
2072<!><!><!>CHOPPED ITALIAN SALAD<!><!><!>Mix dressing ingredients and toss with salad.<!><!><!>none
2073<!><!><!>TAFFY APPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Cook flour, vinegar, sugar, egg and pineapple juice until thick, stirring constantly. Refrigerate while peeling and dicing apples. Fold all ingredients together and let set for at least 1 day.<!><!><!>none
2074<!><!><!>MARINATED GREEN BEAN SALAD<!><!><!>Mix dry mustard with 1 tablespoon of vinegar until completely dissolved.  Add remaining ingredients except beans and onions; mix well.  Pour over green beans and marinate for at least 2 hours before serving.  Serve cold with finely chopped onions sprinkled over top.<!><!><!>none
2075<!><!><!>MARINATED GREEN BEAN SALAD<!><!><!>Exchange:  One-half cup equals 1 vegetable.<!><!><!>none
2076<!><!><!>FOUR BEAN SALAD<!><!><!>Drain beans and mix together.  Mix ingredients together.  Store in large jar or Tupperware, sealed airtight.  Refrigerate.  Keeps 10 days.  Serve on lettuce leaf or with cooked pasta as a salad.<!><!><!>none
2077<!><!><!>FOUR BEAN SALAD<!><!><!>Optional:  Dice 1 chorizo sausage or finely diced cooked ham.<!><!><!>none
2078<!><!><!>POTATO SALAD<!><!><!>Cook potatoes in their jackets about 25 to 30 minutes, until done.  Remove from heat and drain water.  Let cool before dicing. Sprinkle potatoes with sugar and vinegar.  Add celery, onion, pickles and salt.  Stir gently to combine.  Add mayonnaise by folding into mixture.  Add sliced eggs.  Sprinkle top with paprika.<!><!><!>none
2079<!><!><!>MACARONI SALAD<!><!><!>Cook macaroni according to directions on the box; drain.  Add the cucumber, green pepper, celery, onion and eggs.  Stir.  Make a dressing using the mayonnaise, milk, mustard, vinegar and sugar. Pour over macaroni.  Stir well.  Chill.<!><!><!>none
2080<!><!><!>MARINATED VEGETABLE SALAD<!><!><!>Drain all liquids from your peas, corn, etc.  Combine those ingredients in a large plastic container.  Pour sugar, vinegar and oil into bowl.  Stir until well mixed.  Cover container and store overnight in refrigerator.<!><!><!>none

2084<!><!><!>MY MIRACLE SALAD<!><!><!>Soften Knox gelatine in cold water.  Dissolve the Jell-O in boiling water.  Combine gelatine and Jell-O.  Allow to cool.  Add fruit cocktail.  Soften cheese with Cool Whip.  Add all other ingredients.  Mix well.  Refrigerate to congeal.  Serve on lettuce with mayonnaise.<!><!><!>none
2085<!><!><!>PASTA SALAD<!><!><!>Cook the pasta noodles until almost done (you'll want them a little firm for stirring).  Then use cold water to rinse and let them sit in the refrigerator while doing rest of cutting and chopping of other ingredients.<!><!><!>none

2087<!><!><!>PASTA SALAD<!><!><!>Note: If you use this dish for the next day, add in a little more Italian dressing and Parmesan cheese to give it more zip! Enjoy!<!><!><!>none
2088<!><!><!>COTTAGE CHEESE SALAD<!><!><!>Mix container of cottage cheese with dry jello. Add miniature marshmallows, pineapple and Cool Whip. Mix. Garnish top with sliced or whole strawberries. Serves 12.<!><!><!>none
2089<!><!><!>TURKEY WALDORF SALAD<!><!><!>Chill ingredients.  Sprinkle diced apple with lemon juice.  Add turkey, grapes, celery, walnuts, onion, salad dressing, salt and pepper and toss lightly. 2090<!><!><!>QUICK TACO SALAD<!><!><!>In large skillet, brown ground beef and onion.  Drain. Remove from skillet.  Set aside.  In same skillet, prepare Rice-A-Roni as package directs.  Stir in meat mixture, salsa and chili powder.  Continue cooking over low heat 3 to 4 minutes or until heated through.  Arrange lettuce on serving platter.  Top with rice mixture, tomatoes, cheese and tortilla chips.  Serves 5.<!><!><!>none
2091<!><!><!>LAYERED GARDEN PASTA SALAD<!><!><!>Cook macaroni as per package directions and drain.  Rinse with cold water; drain again.  Stir together macaroni, onions and bacon bits in medium bowl.  Mix mayonnaise, lemon juice, cheese, sugar and garlic powder.  In 3 1/2-quart salad bowl, layer salad greens, macaroni mixture, zucchini and cauliflowerets.  On top of this, layer broccoli and tomatoes.  Pour dressing evenly over top.  Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours.  Sprinkle with bacon bits just before serving.  Refrigerate only remaining salad.  Makes 10 servings.<!><!><!>none
2092<!><!><!>THREE BEAN SALAD<!><!><!>Mix vinegar, oil, sugar, salt, pepper and garlic powder.  Add beans and onions; toss well.  Cover and refrigerate 3 hours or overnight, tossing occasionally.  Serve on lettuce.  Makes 8 or 10 servings.<!><!><!>none
2093<!><!><!>POTATO SALAD<!><!><!>Cook potatoes until tender.  Peel, cube and toss with onions, pimento, pepper and celery seed.<!><!><!>none
2094<!><!><!>POTATO SALAD<!><!><!>Mix mayonnaise, mustard and salt.  Toss in potatoes.  If potatoes are not completely covered, mix up more mayo and mustard. Cover and refrigerate several hours before serving.  May be garnish with cross sections of green pepper.<!><!><!>none
2095<!><!><!>FRUIT SALAD<!><!><!>Pour pineapple juice in measuring cup and add enough water to make 1 1/2 cups. Cook pudding and juice-water on stove until it boils and thickens. Cool. Mix with fruit and chill.<!><!><!>none
2096<!><!><!>EGGPLANT AND PASTA SALAD<!><!><!>Wash eggplant; prick skin in several places with fork.  Bake in 350° oven for 45 minutes or until tender; cool.  Peel eggplant; cut pulp into 1/2-inch diced pieces.  Combine eggplant, onion, tomatoes, garlic, oil, lemon juice, parsley, oregano and salt in large bowl.  Toss and mix well.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Cook pasta in boiling salted water.  Drain and do not rinse.  Add to eggplant mixture.  Toss and mix well.  Serve warm or cold in lettuce-lined bowl garnished with tomato wedges, lemon slices and Greek olives.<!><!><!>none

2103<!><!><!>AUTUMN APPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Combine undrained crushed pineapple and sugar in a large saucepan.  Bring to boil; boil gently for 3 minutes, stirring often.  Add gelatin and stir till dissolved.  Add the cream cheese and stir till mixture is thoroughly combined.  Remove from heat; cool slightly.  Cover and refrigerate salad for 1 hour.  Fold in apples, nuts and celery.  Gently fold in dessert topping.  Pour into a 2-quart square baking dish.  Cover and chill several hours or until firm.  Garnish with apple slices and sprinkle salad with additional chopped nuts.<!><!><!>none

2135<!><!><!>CRANBERRY SALAD<!><!><!>Wash and clean cranberries and place in a large pan.  Add water to cranberries and cook for 5 minutes, then add sugar and continue to cook over a medium heat until all the berries have popped. (Around 1/2 hour).  Remove from heat and add Jello, apples, nuts, oranges and celery, making sure mixture is stirred well.  Pour into pans and place in refrigerator until mixture is jelled, best if it sets for at least 24 hours in the refrigerator. Cut and serve.  Will keep in refrigerator for 2 weeks.<!><!><!>none

2177<!><!><!>RUBY RED RASPBERRY SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve raspberry gelatin in 1 cup boiling water.  Add raspberries and stir until berries are thawed and separated. 2191<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY PRETZEL SALAD<!><!><!>Middle Layer:<!><!><!>none

2193<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY PRETZEL SALAD<!><!><!>Top Layer:<!><!><!>none
2194<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY PRETZEL SALAD<!><!><!>Mix one large box strawberry gelatin in 2 cups boiling water, stir until gelatin is dissolved.  Add frozen strawberries.  Frozen berries will cause the gelatin to set.  Pour over cream cheese layer.  Refrigerate until ready to serve.<!><!><!>none
2195<!><!><!>SUMMER PASTA SALAD<!><!><!>In large salad bowl or deep serving dish, mix well oil, vinegar, salt, oregano and basil.  Add pasta, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, Mozzarella, salami and olives; toss to combine.  Cover; chill several hours or overnight.  Toss; let stand at room temperature 30 minutes before serving.  Makes 4 servings.  Can be made up to a day ahead.<!><!><!>none

2200<!><!><!>FROZEN STRAWBERRY SALAD<!><!><!>Beat cream cheese at medium speed of an electric mixer until creamy.  Gradually add sugar, beating until smooth.  Fold in whipped topping and remaining ingredients.  Spoon mixture into a 13 x 9 x 2-inch dish.  Cover and freeze until firm.<!><!><!>none
2201<!><!><!>ORIENTAL PASTA SALAD<!><!><!>Gradually add pasta bow ties to boiling water so that water continues to boil.  Cook uncovered until tender.  Drain in colander and cool.  Add snow peas, red peppers, scallions, broccoli and diced chicken.  Combine salad dressing, Tabasco, garlic powder and ginger.  Pour over pasta mixture.  Toss lightly.  Chill and enjoy.<!><!><!>none
2202<!><!><!>ONION SALAD<!><!><!>Place onion and soda in lukewarm water and let stand 5 minutes. Drain.  Then crisp onions by allowing them to stand in ice water, changing water several times.  Drain and dry thoroughly.  Add vinegar, sugar and seasoning.  Let stand 10 minutes.  Drain and dry thoroughly.  Serve on crisp lettuce.  Garnish with mayonnaise. Makes 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
2203<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY SALAD<!><!><!>Soften cream cheese.  Blend in a small amount of stiffly beaten cream.  Fold cream cheese into remainder of whipped cream.  Mix other ingredients.  Put into heart shaped mold.  Freeze until firm. Let stand 3 minutes to thaw.  Serve on lettuce.<!><!><!>none

2206<!><!><!>APRICOT SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve jello and water.  Add juice from fruits.  Chill until slightly thickened.  Fold in fruit and marshmallows.  Pour into 9-inch square dish.  Chill until firm.<!><!><!>none

2211<!><!><!>SOUTH OF THE BORDER SALAD<!><!><!>Cook pork or ground beef, onions and garlic until meat is browned and onions tender.  Drain off fat. Top with meat mixture.  Sprinkle with shredded cheese.  Top with cherry tomato halves and green pepper strips.  Peel and slice avocado.  Arrange slices on top of salad.<!><!><!>none

2226<!><!><!>BAKED CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>In large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.  Add celery and onion; cook about 4 minutes.  Remove from heat.  Stir in mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, salt and pepper until well blended.  Add chicken, almonds and mushrooms; toss to coat well. Spoon into 1 1/2-quart casserole.  Sprinkle with potato chips. Bake in 325° oven for 25 to 30 minutes.  Serves 6.<!><!><!>none
2227<!><!><!>WEIGHT CONTROL CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Mince zucchini and mushrooms.  Stir in chicken, mayonnaise and seasoning.  Fill pita pockets.  Serves 2.<!><!><!>none
2228<!><!><!>INDONESIAN FRUIT SALAD<!><!><!>Combine bananas, oranges and dates in a large bowl.  Drain pineapple, reserving 1/2 cup juice.  Add pineapple to fruit. Combine juice with wine vinegar, curry powder, salt and salad oil. Shake well; pour over fruit and marinate about 1/2 hour.  Arrange on platter with crisp greens.  Spoon cottage cheese on top and fruit over all.  Top salad with peanuts and serve.<!><!><!>none
2229<!><!><!>CAESAR SALAD<!><!><!>Clean and tear lettuce. Set aside. Mix together well the garlic, anchovies, oil and vinegar. Season with pepper, Worcestershire, lemon juice and oregano. Add beaten egg. Wait until ready to serve before tossing dressing on lettuce. Add Parmesan cheese and croutons.<!><!><!>none
2230<!><!><!>CAESAR SALAD<!><!><!>Croutons: Cut day old Italian or French bread into 1-inch cubes. Toss in mixture of olive oil, salt, oregano and chopped garlic. Bake on cookie sheet at 275° for about 25 minutes to dry out. Keep in airtight container for up to 2 weeks.<!><!><!>none
2231<!><!><!>GREEN PEA PICNIC SALAD<!><!><!>Place peas in a colander and run cool water over them to thaw.  Set aside to drain well.  Cut the cucumber in half and using a spoon, scrape out the seeds.  Chop the cucumber and place it in a 2-quart or larger bowl.  Peel and finely mince the garlic, adding it to the bowl.  Add basil, red bell pepper and onion.  Add sour cream, mayonnaise, lemon, salt and pepper to the bowl.  Stir well to mix the vegetables.  Add the green peas and toss to coat. Mix well.  Serve at once or cover and chill up to 24 hours.<!><!><!>none
2232<!><!><!>GERMAN POTATO SALAD<!><!><!>Cook bacon until crisp; drain.  Heat drippings; blend in flour, sugar, salt, celery seed and pepper.  Gradually blend in broth and vinegar.  Cook, stirring constantly, until slightly thickened. Combine potatoes and bacon bits.  Pour sauce over; toss gently and put in serving dish.  Put in oven at 325° to reheat for 1/2 hour.<!><!><!>none
2233<!><!><!>GOURMET TOSSED GREEN SALAD<!><!><!>Tear lettuce into bite-size pieces.  Wash cauliflower; remove green stalks and separate into tiny flowerets.  Cut onion in paper-thin rings.  Toss gently with green pepper, pimiento, mushrooms, cheese and garlic.  Chill about 1 hour.  Toss and serve immediately with low calorie French dressing.<!><!><!>none
2234<!><!><!>FROG EYE SALAD<!><!><!>Drain pineapple and reserve juice.  In a medium saucepan combine dry pudding mix and dry milk powder.  Add enough water to reserved pineapple juice to make 1 and 1/2 cups liquid.  Add liquid to dry pudding mixture and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and starts to boil.  Remove from heat.  Stir in vanilla extract and cooked macaroni.  Mix gently to combine.  Cool 10 minutes.  Fold in Mandarin oranges and pineapple.  Pour into medium bowl.  Cover and cool at least 1 hour.  Fold in Cool Whip lite and marshmallows.  Chill until ready to serve.  This makes eight servings. of 2/3 cup.<!><!><!>none
2235<!><!><!>BUTTERMILK SALAD<!><!><!>Heat pineapple to boiling.  Dissolve in this lemon and orange Jell-O.  Let cool thoroughly.  Add buttermilk, cheese and Cool Whip.  Mix all ingredients well.  Pour into a square or long dish. Place in refrigerator to chill well.  Will keep for several days. (Travels well.)<!><!><!>none

2248<!><!><!>TORTELLINI SALAD<!><!><!>Bring large pot of water to boil.  Add 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add tortellini and cook until al dente.  Do not overcook.  Drain and rinse under cold water.  Meanwhile, cook the vegetables according to package directions in boiling water or microwave. When done, rinse under cold water and drain well.  In large serving bowl, stir together the olive oil, garlic salt and oregano.  Add cooked tortellini and vegetables.  Stir gently to coat with dressing.  If salad seems dry, add a little more olive oil.  Chill at least 1 hour.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.<!><!><!>none

2286<!><!><!>LIME JELLO SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water.  Stir in cold water.  Set aside.  In medium bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy.  Stir in cottage cheese. Each Serving:  1/3 cup.<!><!><!>none
2293<!><!><!>SHRIMP SALAD<!><!><!>Exchange:  3 low-fat meat.<!><!><!>none
2294<!><!><!>BROKEN GLASS SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve each package of Jell-O in 1 1/2 cups boiling water. Pour into shallow pans to jell.  Take 1 package Knox gelatine and dissolve in 1/4 cup cold water.  Bring 1 cup of pineapple juice to a boil.  Add 3 tablespoons of sugar and the plain gelatin.  Mix and set aside to cool thoroughly.  Crush 24 graham crackers and mix with 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup soft butter.  Press 1/2 cracker mix in the bottom of an 8 1/2 x 11-inch pan.  Whip 1 pint of whipping cream.  Add 1/2 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon of vanilla. Fold in gelatin pineapple mixture.  Cut the strawberry, orange and lime Jell-O into squares and add to whipped cream mixture. Sprinkle remaining cracker mixture on top.  Chill overnight.<!><!><!>none
2295<!><!><!>SHRIMP SALAD A LA FINLAND<!><!><!>Tear lettuce into bite size chunks.  Add all other ingredients and toss well.  Chill until serving time.  Serve with buttermilk dressing.<!><!><!>none
2296<!><!><!>YVONNE'S SALAD<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients.  Pour dressing over salad mix.  Fresh vegetables can be added.  Makes 10 - 15 servings.<!><!><!>none
2297<!><!><!>SPRING SALAD<!><!><!>Boil the macaroni. Cool completely. In a large bowl, combine salad dressing, sugar, vinegar and milk. Slice in the vegetables, using as many as you want. Add macaroni. Refrigerate overnight.<!><!><!>none
2298<!><!><!>PINEAPPLE AND APRICOT SALAD<!><!><!>Drain the juice from the pineapple and apricots.  Save juices. Dissolve the jello in the hot water.  Add 1/2 of each juice.  When jello thickens, add 3/4 cup mashed apricots and marshmallows. Refrigerate until firm.  When set, spread the top with the following.<!><!><!>none
2299<!><!><!>PINEAPPLE AND APRICOT SALAD<!><!><!>Cook 3/4 cup pineapple and apricot juices, sugar, egg, flour and butter until thick. When cool, fold in the whipped topping and mix well. Spread over entire salad. Sprinkle Cheddar cheese over top of all before serving.<!><!><!>none
2300<!><!><!>FROZEN FRUIT SALAD<!><!><!>Mix some of the juice from Bing cherries with cream cheese until very soft (not runny). Add remaining ingredients. Mix by hand. Be sure to cut cherries and pineapple in halves before mixing. I always double this recipe. Put in molds, clear glass containers, etc. Cover with foil and freeze.<!><!><!>none
2301<!><!><!>ICEBOX MACARONI SALAD<!><!><!>Cook macaroni until tender and then drain it.  Do not chill yet.  While still hot, drizzle with oil and vinegar.  Add onion, seasonings and cheese.  Toss well.  Gently mix in peas and remaining ingredients.  Chill thoroughly.  Serve on lettuce leaves if desired.<!><!><!>none
2302<!><!><!>MARINATED ARTICHOKE AND PASTA SALAD<!><!><!>Cook pasta according to package directions; drain, rinse and set aside.  Cut tomatoes into quarters or eighths; place in large bowl.  Trim off any tough pieces on artichoke hearts; halve and place in bowl.  Add mushrooms and olives (halve or quarter, if needed); toss gently.<!><!><!>none
2303<!><!><!>MARINATED ARTICHOKE AND PASTA SALAD<!><!><!>In a shaker jar, combine remaining ingredients; shake well to mix.  Pour dressing over vegetables; toss.  Add cooked pasta to salad; toss gently, being careful not to break pasta.  Cover with plastic wrap.  Serve salad at room temperature; refrigerate leftovers.  Add shrimp, Italian sausage, pepperoni or salami to make a main dish salad.<!><!><!>none
2304<!><!><!>SAUERKRAUT SALAD<!><!><!>Combine first 5 ingredients in a serving bowl. Heat vinegar and sugar until dissolved. Cool to lukewarm and pour over vegetables. Mix well and refrigerate until serving time.<!><!><!>none
2305<!><!><!>SHRIMP AND PASTA SALAD<!><!><!>The night before, arrange onion, dill pickle, black olives, shrimp and green olives in layers, starting with the diced onion. On the following day, cook macaroni; drain and stir in some pickle juice, tossing several times to allow flavor to blend in.  You should have about 3 cups of the macaroni.  Add remaining ingredients to the macaroni and then combine all with the first mixture, stirring lightly.  Cool several hours or overnight.<!><!><!>none
2306<!><!><!>SHRIMP SALAD<!><!><!>Drain and rinse shrimp.  Combine first 7 ingredients.  Toss to mix.  Serve with dressing.  Yields 4 servings.<!><!><!>none
2307<!><!><!>CHERRY COKE SALAD<!><!><!>Bring water and sugar to a boil; add cherry pie filling. Bring to boil again. Add jello and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat; add pineapple, lemon juice, Coke and nuts. Stir together and refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
2308<!><!><!>ORIENTAL SALAD<!><!><!>Brown and crumble bacon, drain on paper towel.  Toast sesame seeds and almonds at 350° for 5 minutes (watch closely, almonds burn easily).  Break lettuce into bite size pieces, add onions. Top with bacon, seeds, almonds and noodles.<!><!><!>none

2311<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS TREE SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve Jello in 1 cup boiling water.  Let cool.  Add Philadelphia cream cheese, pineapple and Cool Whip.  Mix with beater.  Add nuts.  For tree effect pour salad mixture in coffee cup liners.  Gel.  Dip in hot water to loosen.  Turn upside down on leaf of lettuce.  Top with Cool Whip.  Place a Maraschino cherry on top of tree for effect, or pour into small square pan.<!><!><!>none
2312<!><!><!>MOLDED FRUIT SALAD<!><!><!>Drain pineapple, reserving juice.  Combine reserved pineapple juice, eggs, sugar and flour.  Cook over low heat until thick (about 5 minutes).  Add gelatin.  Stir until dissolved.  Cool before adding orange sections, bananas, pineapple and marshmallows. Chill in refrigerator for several hours before serving.<!><!><!>none
2313<!><!><!>FROZEN FRUIT SALAD<!><!><!>Cream the cheese.  Beat in syrup.  Add lemon juice and bananas.  Stir in pineapple, strawberries, dates and pecans.  Fold in the whipped cream. Line muffin baking pan with paper bake cups. Fill with salad.  Freeze until firm.  Store in plastic bag in freezer.  Take out of freezer 15 minutes before serving.<!><!><!>none
2314<!><!><!>DREAM-UP SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve Jello in boiling water, add 7-UP and rest of ingredients.  Chill until firm.<!><!><!>none
2315<!><!><!>DREAM-UP SALAD<!><!><!>Topping:<!><!><!>none
2316<!><!><!>DREAM-UP SALAD<!><!><!>Mix first four ingredients together and cook over low heat stirring constantly until mixture thickens.  Remove from heat and cool.  Mix topping with prepared Dream Whip.  Cover chilled Jello with topping.  Sprinkle nuts over topping.<!><!><!>none
2317<!><!><!>DUMPY SALAD<!><!><!>Beat cherry pie filling with mixer or blender.  Mix together pie filling, crushed pineapple, Cool Whip, Eagle Brand milk and pecans.  Refrigerate for 2 hours or more.  Serve.<!><!><!>none
2318<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY JELLO SALAD<!><!><!>Mix jello as directed.  Add all ingredients.  Pour 1/2 of the mixture into bowl and sit in freezer until solid, but not frozen. Spread layer of sour cream over jello and then pour rest of jello mixture over the sour cream.  Let sit in freezer until solid, but not frozen.  Remove and keep in refrigerator until ready to serve.<!><!><!>none
2319<!><!><!>CHICKEN SALAD<!><!><!>Boil chicken until cooked.  Remove chicken from bones.  Cut into small pieces.  Add green onions and celery.  In separate container, mix sour cream, mayonnaise and Lawry's salt.  When thoroughly mixed, add to chicken.  Refrigerate until served.<!><!><!>none

2326<!><!><!>MINIATURE CHICKEN SALAD PUFFS<!><!><!>Puff Pastry:<!><!><!>none
2327<!><!><!>MINIATURE CHICKEN SALAD PUFFS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 400°.  Lightly grease 2 or 3 baking sheets. Combine water, butter and salt in saucepan.  Heat to a boil, stirring to combine.  Remove from heat.  Add flour all at once. Stir vigorously with wooden spoon until mixture leaves side of pan and sticks to spoon.  Set aside and cool for 2 to 3 minutes.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.<!><!><!>none
2328<!><!><!>MINIATURE CHICKEN SALAD PUFFS<!><!><!>Drop the mixture by rounded teaspoonfuls onto prepared sheets. Leave 2-inches between puffs.  Bake for 10 minutes.  Reduce heat to 350° and bake for additional 12 to 15 minutes, until golden brown and rigid to touch.  Slit the puffs in the side.  Pull out insides and discard.  Fill with chicken salad and garnish.<!><!><!>none

2356<!><!><!>PRETZEL SALAD<!><!><!>Cream butter and 3 tablespoons sugar.  Blend in pretzels. Press in a 9 x 13-inch pan and bake at 350° for 10 minutes.  Cool. 2372<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>Heat oil in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over high heat. Add beef, stirring to break up pieces; cook 3 minutes or until no longer pink. Add 2 cups hot water, milk, green pepper, soup mix, salt and pepper; stir to mix. Scatter pasta over top; cover and bring to a boil. Boil 2 minutes, stirring 3 to 4 times with a fork to separate strands of pasta. Stir in peas and carrots; cover, reduce heat and simmer 4 minutes or until vegetables and pasta are tender. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup hot water. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.<!><!><!>none
2373<!><!><!>BEEF WITH WHEAT<!><!><!>Wash meat, pat dry.  Cover with water and bring to a boil. Cook 10 mins., discard water.  Add fresh water and boil meat until tender.  Shred meat, put back in water, add beef broth if needed for flavor.  Wash wheat, add to beef  with spices. Stir until wheat is cooked.  1-2 tbsp. of margarine or butter gives extra flavor.<!><!><!>none

2378<!><!><!>ITALIAN BEEF SANDWICHES<!><!><!>Combine beef roast, water, salt and onions in a large roasting pan. Cover and cook at 325° for 2 hours until done. Remove roast and cool (save the juice). Slice, then layer in a covered  dish. Add all spices to the juice you saved from the roast. Bring to a boil and pour over meat. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Serve on French bread.<!><!><!>none

2381<!><!><!>BEEF-NOODLE SOUP<!><!><!>In a Dutch oven, brown beef and onion; drain. Add tomatoes, beef broth, mixed veggies, salt, black pepper, sugar, celery seed and oregano, if using. 2382<!><!><!>ITALIAN BEEF<!><!><!>Cook all ingredients except onions on top of stove for 3 to 4 hours in covered pan.  During last 1/2 hour, remove meat; slice thinly with electric knife. 2383<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF AND OKRA<!><!><!>Season ground meat and place in a cast iron pot; add onions and brown; drain off excess grease. Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, and frozen okra. 2384<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF AND OKRA<!><!><!>Tip: If you do not like for your ground meat to be in large clumps, try putting in on to brown with a small amount of water. Stir as the water cooks out. The meat will resemble a fine crumble. An excellent method for making chili etc.<!><!><!>none
2385<!><!><!>BEEF WITH SOUR CREAM<!><!><!>Remove bone and fat from steak.  Cut meat into thin, narrow strips.  Dredge in flour; using large skillet, quickly brown meat on all sides in hot oil.  Add onions, broth, thyme, mushrooms and liquid from mushrooms.  Cover and cook 5 to 7 minutes.  Stir in sour cream.  Heat through; do not boil.  Serve over hot rice.<!><!><!>none
2386<!><!><!>COKE ROAST BEEF<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 400°.  Place roast in bean pot (or covered roasting pan); cover with Coke and soup.  Bake, covered, for 2 1/2 to 3 hours until internal temperature reaches 170°.<!><!><!>none
2387<!><!><!>COKE ROAST BEEF<!><!><!>Note: Pork, turkey or chicken may be substituted for beef. Carrots, celery and potatoes may be added.<!><!><!>none

2389<!><!><!>FABULOUS BEEF FAJITAS<!><!><!>In a large resealable plastic bag, combine 1/4 cup salad dressing and chili powder; add steak.  Seal and turn to coat; refrigerate for 30 minutes.  In a skillet, sauté peppers and onion in remaining salad dressing until crisp and tender.  Remove and keep warm.	Drain steak, discarding marinade in skillet, sauté steak for 6-10 minutes or until no longer pink.  Return vegetables to pan.  Heat through and spoon meat and vegetables down center of tortillas; fold in sides.  Yield:  4-6 servings.<!><!><!>none
2390<!><!><!>BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>Brown ground meat with chopped onions, chili powder, ground comino and salt.  Drain.  On the side, pour about 1/2 can Wolfe's chili into a bowl or Pyrex pie dish; add small amount of water (make it a little runny); stir and warm in a microwave.  Dip flour or corn tortillas into warm chili; add a couple of spoons of meat, onions and cheese, then roll it up and place into an oblong pan. When all are rolled up, pour any remaining chili on top; add cheese and onions.  Cook at 400° to 425° until cheese melts.<!><!><!>none
2391<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>In large skillet, over medium heat, cook and stir steak, mushrooms, onions in oleo until steak is browned and vegetables are tender.  Reduce heat, add flour. Cook and stir 1 minute.  Add water and boullion.  Cook and stir until thick and bubbly.  Stir in sour cream.  Heat through. DO NOT BOIL.  Serve with hot noodles.<!><!><!>none
2392<!><!><!>BARBECUED BEEF<!><!><!>Boil roast beef until it falls apart. Sauté onions. Combine all ingredients. If too dry, add beef broth. Serve on buns with coleslaw.<!><!><!>none
2393<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>Trim fat from the beef; slice beef into thin strips, about 2-inches long. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet. Add beef and cook over high heat until meat is lightly browned; add onions, garlic and mushrooms. Cook over medium heat until onions are soft. Remove from heat. Stir in flour, parsley, salt and pepper. Gradually add beef broth and tomato paste. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Remove from heat.<!><!><!>none
2394<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of yogurt, then stir in remaining yogurt. Stir yogurt into meat mixture; simmer over low heat 3 to 4 minutes. If mixture is too thick, add additional broth. Makes  6 servings.<!><!><!>none

2397<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>Serve over hot cooked noodles accompanied by asparagus, combination salad and crusty bread.<!><!><!>none

2405<!><!><!>BEEF AND BARLEY SOUP<!><!><!>Fry bacon in Dutch oven over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon and drain on paper towel. 2407<!><!><!>BEEF BARBECUE SANDWICHES<!><!><!>Cook the chuck roast until tender; shred into small pieces. Combine the remaining ingredients. Boil for 10 minutes, stirring constantly. Add beef and simmer for 1/2 hour in covered pan. Serve on buns.<!><!><!>none

2409<!><!><!>BEEF GOULASH<!><!><!>Heat oil in deep saucepan.  Add beef cubes and onions. Sprinkle with flour and cook until lightly browned.  Stir in paprika and cook 3 minutes.  Add tomato puree, water, salt, sugar, pepper, bay leaf and pepper.  Cover and simmer 1 hour or until meat is tender.  Serve over buttered noodles.<!><!><!>none

2413<!><!><!>BEEF FAJITAS<!><!><!>Place meat in shallow pan.  Pour marinade over and refrigerate 3 hours.  Remove meat from marinade and cut into 1/2 x 3-inch strips. Place tomatoes over both meat and vegetables.  Garnish with lemon wedges.  Serves 6.<!><!><!>none

2418<!><!><!>BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Brown meat; cut up into cubes. Cut up potatoes, onions and carrots. Mix with meat in soup pot; add water to cover. Cook approximately 25 minutes, then add vegetables and beef stew seasoning.<!><!><!>none
2419<!><!><!>BEEF ROULADEN<!><!><!>Salt and pepper steak.  Spread with mustard, sliced bacon, onion and dill pickle.  Roll up and fasten with nails or toothpicks.  Then brown in skillet.  Put in roaster and cover with hot water.  Bake at 350° for 2 1/2 to 3 hours.  Thicken gravy with cornstarch.<!><!><!>none
2420<!><!><!>ALL-DAY-LONG CROCKPOT BEEF<!><!><!>Cut beef roast into serving sized portions.  Use more beef if you need more that 6 servings.  Brown beef in a bit of vegetable oil, although you can skip this step if you're rushed for time. Slice onion and separate into rings.  Dice the peeled carrots, dice the celery and slice the peppers into thin strips or circles. Place these into bottom of the Crockpot.  Sprinkle the beef pieces with fresh ground black pepper, minced garlic and the onion soup mix.  Place on top of the vegetables.  Mix the steak sauce and worcestershire sauce in a small bowl with about 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup tomato juice.  Pour this over the meat.  Turn the crockpot to high for 30 minutes, or if you're in a hurry, skip this step. Turn to low cover and let cook for 7 - 9 hours.  Keep the crockpot covered as much as possible through out cooking time.  When ready to serve, dip meat and vegetables out with a slotted spoon, use the liquid in the crockpot as is or turn the crockpot to high and thicken liquid with a little flour or cornstarch.<!><!><!>none
2421<!><!><!>CHIPPED BEEF DIP<!><!><!>Mix ingredients thoroughly in baking dish.  Drizzle butter on top and sprinkle with pecans.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.  Serve with chips or crackers.<!><!><!>none
2422<!><!><!>BEEF STEW DELUXE<!><!><!>IT IS NOT NECESSARY TO BROWN MEAT. Mix all ingredients in a covered casserole dish and bake at 300° for 3 hours. Serve over fluffy rice, noodles or whipped potatoes. Thicken gravy if necessary. Raise temperature of over to 400°.  Remove cover from pan and add 1 can of refrigerated canned biscuits to top of stew. Bake until biscuits are browned. Bake extra biscuits to serve stew over biscuit.<!><!><!>none
2423<!><!><!>CHEESY BEEF TACO DIP<!><!><!>In a large skillet, cook beef, onion and green pepper over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. 2424<!><!><!>MARINADE FOR BEEF<!><!><!>For marinade combine first 9 ingredients.  Pour over beef; cover and refrigerate for several hours or overnight.  Cook beef on a grill, using the marinade as a basting sauce.<!><!><!>none
2425<!><!><!>MARINATED BEEF SLICES<!><!><!>Marinate beef in lemon juice for 10 minutes. While meat is marinating, heat oil in large skillet; add fresh mushrooms, onions and green pepper. Cook until tender. Remove vegetables from skillet and keep warm. Drain meat, reserving lemon juice marinade. Place meat slices in skillet and brown. Return vegetables to skillet. Add reserved lemon juice and pepper. Heat through. Serve over rice. Makes 4 servings.<!><!><!>none

2439<!><!><!>GOLDEN BEEF QUICHE<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°. Spread crust with butter. Cook beef and onion until meat is browned. Spoon into pie crust. 2441<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF AND CABBAGE CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Cook ground beef and onion until browned. Drain and add rest of ingredients. Pour into baking dish and bake at 325 degrees for 35-40 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2442<!><!><!>BEEF BOURGUIGNON<!><!><!>Slowly heat 4-quart Dutch oven with tight fitting lid.  Add 2 tablespoons butter.  Heat, do not burn.  In hot butter over high heat, brown beef cubes well, using a fourth at a time or just enough to cover bottom of Dutch oven.  Lift out beef as it browns. Continue until beef is browned.  Add butter as needed.  Return beef to Dutch oven.  In small saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons brandy just until vapor rises.  Ignite; pour over beef.  As flame dies, remove beef.  Add 2 tablespoons butter to Dutch oven.  Heat slightly.  Add onions.  Cook over low heat, covered, until onions brown slightly. Add mushrooms.  Cook, stirring, 3 minutes.  Remove from heat.  Stir in flour, meat extract paste and tomato paste until well blended. Stir in Burgundy, sherry, Port and broth.  Preheat oven to 350°. Bring wine mixture just to boiling, stirring.  Remove from heat. Add beef, pepper and bay leaf.  Mix well.  Bake, covered, stirring occasionally, 1 1/2 hours or until beef is tender.  Add remaining brandy, little by little.  Serves 6.<!><!><!>none
2443<!><!><!>BEEF AND BACON ROLL-UPS<!><!><!>Wrap a slice of bacon around each sausage and secure with a toothpick.  Layer the wrapped franks and brown sugar half at a time in a slow cooker.  Cook on low for 3 to 4 hours stirring occasionally.<!><!><!>none
2444<!><!><!>COMPANY BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>In a heavy skillet, brown beef in shortening.  Add onions, tomatoes, steak sauce, catsup, green pepper and parsley.  Simmer for 30 minutes.  Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Combine spaghetti and beef mixture in large greased baking dish. Salt and pepper to taste.  Mix in the cream of mushroom soup. Sprinkle cheese over top.  Bake in a 350° oven for 30 minutes, until bubbly and browned.  Serves 8.<!><!><!>none

2469<!><!><!>VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Cook potatoes, celery and onion for 10 minutes in water; add drained corn, green beans, peas and corned beef.  Cook 10 minutes. Drain off excess water.  Add juice to cover vegetables.  Heat just enough to get juice hot.<!><!><!>none
2470<!><!><!>BEEF LOG<!><!><!>Mix  all  ingredients  in  bowl.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Remove  once  a  day for 3 days.  Knead well for 5 minutes.  On 4th day divide into 6 or 7 rolls.  Lay on broiler pan with drip pan under it.  Bake 9 hours at 160°.  Turn over rolls in  4 1/2 hours.  At 9th hour, remove and wrap in paper towel to remove grease.  Roll in handy wrap, freeze or refrigerate.  Will keep in refrigerator 3 weeks.<!><!><!>none
2471<!><!><!>BEEF LOG<!><!><!>Note:  You  can use 1 pound of sausage for hamburger if lean.<!><!><!>none
2472<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF & MACARONI MEDLEY<!><!><!>Crumble beef into a large skillet with butter, over high heat stir until meat is no longer pink, add onion, turn heat to low, add tomatoes with liquid and macaroni. Serve with parmesan cheese to spoon over individual servings.  Good served with a tossed salad and hot bread.<!><!><!>none

2475<!><!><!>EASY CHEESY BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>Brown the beef in a large skillet. Drain the meat. Mix in the taco seasoning. Add the water and simmer over low heat. 2476<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>Combine the 1 tablespoon flour and the salt; coat meat.  Melt 2 tablespoons butter in skillet; add meat and brown quickly on both sides.  Add mushrooms, onion, and garlic; cook till crisp-tender, 3 or 4 minutes.  Remove meat and mushrooms from pan. Add 2 tablespoons butter to pan drippings.  Blend in the 3 tablespoons flour.  Add tomato paste; stir in beef stock.  Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.  Return browned meat and mushrooms to skillet.  Stir in sour cream and wine; cook slowly until hot; do not boil.  Serve over noodles. Serves 4 or 5.<!><!><!>none
2477<!><!><!>SPANISH RICE (BEEF AND RICE CASSEROLE)<!><!><!>In at least a 2 1/2-quart microproof dish with cover, crumble beef and cook on High for 3 minutes.  Stir and cook for 3 more minutes.  Drain if you wish.  Make sure the cooked meat is crumbled well.  Add remaining ingredients and cut up the tomatoes and stir. Microwave on High for 10 minutes.  Stir and cook on 20% for 10 minutes.  Stir and cook on 70% for 5 to 6 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is soft.  Let stand for a few minutes before eating or you might burn the roof of your mouth.<!><!><!>none
2478<!><!><!>DRIED BEEF DIP<!><!><!>Soften cream cheese. Add milk and mix. Add sour cream and mix. Add remaining ingredients and mix. Cook for appropriate time. Bake in oven at 350° for 15 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2479<!><!><!>DRIED BEEF DIP<!><!><!>Microwave:  Cook at High power for 3 minutes.  Stir.  Cook on High power again for 3 minutes.  Continue cooking until it becomes slightly thick.<!><!><!>none
2480<!><!><!>BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Brown meat in oil, in pan you are going to cook stew in. Drain grease and add tomato sauce (plus 1 & 1/2 cans water), carrots, onion, & potatoes that have been cut into cubes. Salt & pepper. Cook with lid at medium temp. until tender.<!><!><!>none
2481<!><!><!>BARBECUE SHREDDED BEEF<!><!><!>Cook meat until very tender in water to which salt has been added.  While meat is cooking, make sauce.  Melt shortening and add onions; cook until tender, but not browned.  Add remaining ingredients and cook over low heat for 20 minutes.  Add shredded meat and liquid to the sauce and mix well.  Cover and cook very slowly for 30 minutes.  If mixture becomes too thick, add a little water.  Serve on hamburger buns.<!><!><!>none
2482<!><!><!>DRIED BEEF CHEESE BALL<!><!><!>Soften cream cheese to room temperature. Combine cream cheese with cottage cheese. Add olives, onions and the sauces; mix well. Add 1/3 of snipped beef. Shape into a large ball. Wrap in foil and refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
2483<!><!><!>DRIED BEEF CHEESE BALL<!><!><!>To serve, roll ball in rest of the beef. Center in serving plate and surround with crisp crackers, celery, tiny tomatoes and stuffed olives. Serves 8.<!><!><!>none
2484<!><!><!>BAKED BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Combine the tomatoes, water, tapioca, sugar, salt and pepper in large bowl.  Add remaining ingredients; mix well.  Pour into greased 13 X 9 inch baking dish.  Cover and bake at 375 degrees for 1 3/4 to 2 hours.<!><!><!>none
2485<!><!><!>BEEF TACO-MAC<!><!><!>Cut beef steaks lengthwise into 1-inch wide strips and then crosswise into 1-inch pieces. In Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat until hot. Add beef and onion. Cook and stir 3 minutes. Season with salt. Stir seasoning mix, tomatoes, pasta and water into beef. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover tightly and simmer 20 minutes or until pasta is tender. Sprinkle cheese before serving.<!><!><!>none
2486<!><!><!>BEEF PIE<!><!><!>Prepare mashed potatoes, except reduce water to 1 cup. Stir in egg; spread on bottom and sides of a well-greased 9-inch pie pan. Bake in 400° oven 15 minutes. Brown beef and celery (some like a little onion, too) in large skillet. Pour off liquid. Stir in water, tomato paste, sugar and salt. Bring to boil. Spoon into potato crust. Sprinkle with topping. Continue baking at 400° for 10 to 15 minutes, until top is brown.<!><!><!>none
2487<!><!><!>BEEF PIE<!><!><!>Crisp Topping:<!><!><!>none
2488<!><!><!>BEEF PIE<!><!><!>Combine butter with potato flakes and cheese.<!><!><!>none
2489<!><!><!>SAVORY ITALIAN BEEF<!><!><!>Brown roast in hot skillet.  Place roast in crock-pot. Sprinkle dressing and soup mixes over meat.  Pour beer or broth over meat.  Cover and cook on low 8 to 10 hours.  Remove meat from cooker and shred.  If thicker gravy is desired, stir cornstarch into water until all lumps are gone.  Return shredded meat to pot. Cover and cook on high another 15 to 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2490<!><!><!>SAVORY ITALIAN BEEF<!><!><!>Note: Sometimes I marinate the roast overnight in Italian dressing as well. Serve on sandwich buns with mild or hot pepperoncini.<!><!><!>none

2498<!><!><!>BARLEY, BEEF AND KALE SOUP<!><!><!>Heat oil in Dutch oven or large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and meat; cook until well browned. Add broth, barley, thyme and salt. Bring to boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer about 1 hour or until barley and meat are almost tender. Add mushrooms and kale or other greens. Cover and cook 5 to 10 minutes more until kale is cooked and meat and barley are tender.<!><!><!>none
2499<!><!><!>BARLEY, BEEF AND KALE SOUP<!><!><!>Note: A like amount of chard, spinach, collards or other greens may be substituted for the kale.<!><!><!>none

Pour in baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes at 350 degrees.  If using biscuits on top, bake until brown.<!><!><!>none
2506<!><!><!>DRIED BEEF LOG<!><!><!>Blend cream cheese, parmesan and horseradish, stir in olives and dried beef. Wrap and chill several hours. Roll in snipped beef if desired.<!><!><!>none
2507<!><!><!>BEEF CREAM CHEESE SPREAD<!><!><!>Chop the chipped beef and mix with all the ingredients. Chill and serve with assorted crackers.<!><!><!>none
2508<!><!><!>VEGETABLE AND DRIED BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Partially cook celery, onion, peas or corn and carrots. Drain.  Put part of each vegetable in casserole, then pour some of your homemade dried beef gravy (or frozen creamed chipped beef, thawed) over it and continue with layers.  Sprinkle Cheddar cheese on top.  Bake for 1/2 hour at 325°.  Serves 4 to 6.<!><!><!>none
2509<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Brown ground beef and drain.  Add tomato sauce and garlic juice.  Simmer for about 25 minutes.  Cook a 5 or 6 oz. package of noodles as directed.  Make a white sauce of sour cream,  cream cheese and chopped green onions (can use white onions).  Put layers of noodles, ground beef, and sauce into a casserole dish. Sprinkle with grated cheddar cheese.  Bake for 25 minutes at 350°.<!><!><!>none
2510<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>This makes a huge casserole.  I usually divide this into two casserole dishes and freeze one.<!><!><!>none
2511<!><!><!>CROCK-POT BEEF AND VEGGIES<!><!><!>Brown the ground beef. Transfer to crock-pot. Add remaining ingredients. Mix to combine. Cover and cook on low 7 to 9 hours (or high for 3 1/2 to 4 1/2 hours). Serve with brown rice. Serves 4 to 6.<!><!><!>none
2512<!><!><!>CROCK-POT BEEF AND VEGGIES<!><!><!>Cal-459, CHO-33, Pro-36, Fat-21.<!><!><!>none
2513<!><!><!>STIR-FRY BEEF WITH BROCCOLI<!><!><!>Cut steak into thin strips; combine with soy sauce, garlic and 2 tablespoons of broth.  Marinate while preparing the vegetables.  Cut and wash broccoli flowerets. I don't use the large stalk part of the broccoli but if you do use them, you need to peel them and cut crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.  Wash, peel and cut carrots into strips or slice thinly crosswise.  Cut onion.<!><!><!>none
2514<!><!><!>STIR-FRY BEEF WITH BROCCOLI<!><!><!>Heat  a little oil in a skillet or wok over medium heat.  Add beef with soy mixture; stir-fry 3 to 5 minutes until beef is almost cooked through.  Remove with slotted spoon to platter, leaving any liquid in the pan.  Add broccoli, carrot and onion. Add remaining broth. Cover; cook about 5 minutes.  Add beef; stir-fry 2 to 3 minutes or until cooked through. Serve. Serves 4.<!><!><!>none
2515<!><!><!>ROAST (PORK OR BEEF)<!><!><!>Add your seasoned roast to pot and brown. It will make water so don't add any now. Once the water cooks out and the roast browns real good on both sides, add onions and smother down (don't worry, they will brown too). Add small amounts of water (about 1 cup) at a time until tender. Cook on medium to low heat until done. Add potatoes when you see the roast is tender and cook until they are done.<!><!><!>none
2516<!><!><!>ROAST (PORK OR BEEF)<!><!><!>If you are cooking a pork roast, don't use onions, but fry down the same way. You can also stuff your roast (pork) with garlic. Just make a hole with a knife and push the garlic in.<!><!><!>none
2517<!><!><!>LITTLE BEEF ROLLS<!><!><!>Trim round steak of all fat. Cut into strips, about 1 1/2 x 3-inches. Salt and pepper meat. Place a sliver of garlic and a very small piece of bacon on meat. Roll up and secure with a toothpick. Roll in flour and brown in melted shortening. After all rolls are browned, drain off all fat from pan. Push meat aside and pour in mushroom soup. Add 1 can of water. Cover and cook over low heat until tender, about 1 hour, scraping bottom of skillet to keep from sticking. Add water when necessary. Very good served with mashed potatoes.<!><!><!>none
2518<!><!><!>ZESTY BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>In a skillet, cook beef until no longer pink; drain.  Stir in 1/2 c. sauce and 1 c. cheese.  Warm tortillas according to package directions.  Spread 1/2 c. sauce in a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish. Spoon about 2 tablespoons meat mixture down the center of each tortilla.  Roll up and place seam-side down in baking dish.  Top with remaining sauce and cheese.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until cheese melts.  Yield: 10-12 enchiladas.<!><!><!>none
2519<!><!><!>ZESTY BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>Variations:<!><!><!>none
2520<!><!><!>ZESTY BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>Beefy Corn and Chile Enchiladas:  Use 1/2 lb. ground beef. After browning ground beef, add 1 cup whole kernel corn and 1/2 c. drained, canned green chilies.  Prepare as above.<!><!><!>none
2521<!><!><!>ZESTY BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>Cheesy Chili Enchiladas:  Omit ground beef and increase cheese to 3 cups.  Mix 2 c. of the cheese and 1 can (4 oz.) drained, chopped green chilies for filling.  Prepare as above.<!><!><!>none
2522<!><!><!>ZESTY BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>Seafood Enchiladas:  Omit ground beef.  Use 2 c. chopped cooked shrimp.  Prepare as above. Garnish with fresh cilantro.<!><!><!>none
2523<!><!><!>ZESTY BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>Beefy Skillet Enchiladas:  Use 8 corn tortillas (6 inches) and cut into 1 inch squares.  After browning ground beef, add enchilada sauce, tortillas and 1 c. cheese. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook over low heat 5 minutes or until hot.  Top with remaining cheese.<!><!><!>none
2524<!><!><!>HUNGRY JACK BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°. Brown beef. Stir in next 5 ingredients and heat until bubbly. Pour in 2-quart casserole. Cut biscuits in half to form 20 half circles. Place cut side down around edge of casserole. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 25 to 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2525<!><!><!>BEEF BURGUNDY<!><!><!>Brown beef and onion. Add beef broth. Bake, covered, 1 1/2 hours at 350°. Add wine and continue baking for 2 hours. Add soup the last  hour of baking. Very good served over noodles or rice.<!><!><!>none
2526<!><!><!>ITALIAN BEEF<!><!><!>Place meat, seasonings, peppers and juice in crock-pot. Cover with water.  Cook for at least 4 hours before you shred meat into small pieces.  Cook for 2 more hours, until tender.  Serve shredded meat on buns with cheese on top.<!><!><!>none
2527<!><!><!>BROCCOLI BEEF SQUARES<!><!><!>Heat oven to 400°.  Grease 13 x 9 x 2 baking dish.  Heat 1-inch salted water to boiling.  Add broccoli.  Cover and cook until almost tender, about 5 minutes.  Drain thoroughly.  Cook and stir beef until brown.  Drain.  Stir in mushrooms, 1 1/2 cups Cheddar cheese and onion.  Mix Bisquick, water and remaining cheese until soft dough forms.  Beat 20 strokes.  Pat dough in dish with floured hands, pressing 1/2-inch up sides.  Spread beef mix over dough.  Sprinkle with broccoli.  Mix remaining ingredients.  Pour over broccoli.  Bake until knife comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2528<!><!><!>BEEF ROLL-UPS<!><!><!>In a saucepan, sauté onions in butter.  Add carrots, potatoes, 1/2 can of soup, parsley and 1/4 teaspoon dill.  Cook until partially tender.  Sprinkle meat with salt and pepper.  If using round steak, cut into 4 or 5 pieces and flatten.  Place stuffing in center of meat.  Roll up, tuck in ends and skewer with toothpicks. Using a skillet, brown roll-ups on all sides in shortening.  Remove excess fat.  Pour in soup, dill, tomatoes and remaining stuffing. Simmer about an hour, but stir frequently.  Add apple juice and simmer for 15 minutes more.<!><!><!>none
2529<!><!><!>KOREAN BARBECUED  BEEF<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients but rump roast to make sauce. Marinate beef for several hours or longer in the sauce. Barbecue or broil in oven and serve immediately.<!><!><!>none

Cover with top to the roaster or heavy-duty aluminum foil.  Bake at 300° for 6 to 7 hours.  Cool.  Slice very thin or shred in food processor for sandwiches.<!><!><!>none

2544<!><!><!>BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Place potatoes, onions and baby carrots in slow-cooker.  Add bell pepper and beef.  In small bowl, combine broth or bouillon, oregano, paprika, parsley, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Pour over meat and vegetables.  Cover and cook on LOW 9-10 hours. Turn pot on HIGH.  In small bowl, dissolve cornstarch in water; stir into cooked stew mixture.  Cover and cook on HIGH 15-20 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally.  Makes 6 or 7 servings.<!><!><!>none
2545<!><!><!>BARBECUED BEEF<!><!><!>Place meat and ginger ale in pan and simmer until liquid is about gone and meat is tender.  Flake meat with fork and add chili sauce and heat through.<!><!><!>none
2546<!><!><!>MACARONI AND BEEF<!><!><!>In skillet, brown beef and onions. Drain off excess fat. Add tomatoes, salt and pepper. Simmer over low heat for 30 minutes. Cook macaroni according to directions; drain. Combine cooked macaroni and beef into large serving bowl.<!><!><!>none
2547<!><!><!>GARLIC BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>In saucepan over medium heat, combine beef, onions and about 1/2 cup water; cook until onions are translucent.  Add flour and seasonings; mix well.  Stir in tomatoes; bring to a boil.  Reduce heat; simmer about 15 minutes, until most of liquid is absorbed. Pour about 1 1/2 cups sauce into an ungreased 9 x 13 inch baking dish.  Spread about 1/4 cup beef mixture down the center of each tortilla shell; top with 1 to 2 Tbsp. cheese.  Roll up tightly; place seam side down over sauce.  Repeat with each tortilla shell. Top with remaining sauce and cheese.  Broil on LOW until cheese is melted and bubbly.  Yield: 4 to 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
2548<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>Salt, pepper, & flour meat.  Brown in small amount of shortening.  Add onions & cook until soft; then add 3 or 4 cups water & cook until tender.  Add soup & cook 5 minutes longer.  Add sour cream.  Cook noodles & drain.  Then pour into meat mixture.<!><!><!>none

2570<!><!><!>CHEESY BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>Brown ground meat and drain well. Stir in half the salsa and 1 cup of the cheese. Spread 1 cup of the salsa in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. 2571<!><!><!>BEEF OR PORK SAUCE<!><!><!>Add all ingredients.  Bring to a boil.  Pour over uncooked meat and let set (as little as 30 minutes or as long as all day). Use remaining sauce with meat after it's cooked!  I recommend using this sauce with pork tenderloin.<!><!><!>none
2572<!><!><!>WHERE'S THE BEEF?<!><!><!>Cut and remove top of bread loaf and hollow out the bread, leaving about 1-inch thick sides, reserving the top to be used as a lid. Mix all other ingredients together, seasoning with Worcestershire, Louisiana hot sauce, Tabasco and cayenne to taste.  Put the filling ingredients inside bread.  Top with the bread lid.  Wrap the loaf in foil and bake at 300° on a cookie sheet for 1 1/2 hours.  Remove from oven.  Remove foil.  Take off top of loaf.  Serve on platter. Surround with Fritos or crackers.  Serves 10 to 12.  Round bread keeps filling warm for quite awhile.<!><!><!>none
2573<!><!><!>TEXAS BEEF FAJITAS<!><!><!>Combine lime juice, garlic and Worcestershire sauce. Marinate steak in this mixture at least 3 hours or overnight. Drain meat well and grill over charcoal until barely medium-rare.<!><!><!>none
2574<!><!><!>TEXAS BEEF FAJITAS<!><!><!>Meanwhile, sauté green peppers and onions in the vegetable oil in a large skillet. Can use an electric skillet which is just put in the middle of the table. Set on "warm, " as a serving dish. Cut the grilled meat into very narrow strips (about 1/4-inch). Add to skillet when peppers and onions are about cooked. Stir and cook a little longer until all is done.<!><!><!>none
2575<!><!><!>TEXAS BEEF FAJITAS<!><!><!>Serve sizzling hot with flour tortillas (also heated), salsa, guacamole and refried beans. The fresh cilantro is optional but makes the fajitas even better.<!><!><!>none
2576<!><!><!>TEXAS BEEF FAJITAS<!><!><!>Everyone makes their own. Just place about 2 tablespoons of meat mixture on a flour tortilla and add salsa and a few leaves of fresh cilantro; roll and eat! Good! Serves 6.<!><!><!>none
2577<!><!><!>TEXAS BEEF FAJITAS<!><!><!>Fresh Tomato Salsa:<!><!><!>none
2578<!><!><!>TEXAS BEEF FAJITAS<!><!><!>Chop tomatoes to fine pieces and add all other ingredients. Let set at least an hour.<!><!><!>none
2579<!><!><!>BEEF NOODLE CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Brown meat in hot fat in Mirro-Matic. Add other ingredients and stir, except for the last 2 ingredients. Cover; set control at 15 and cook for 5 minutes after control jiggles. Reduce pressure instantly. For a heavier consistency, this mixture may be thickened by cooking, uncovered, with mixture of flour and water, stirring constantly. Quantity of ingredients: 2 1/2 to 4 quarts. Serves 4.<!><!><!>none
2580<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF WITH MACARONI<!><!><!>Cook the pasta as per package instructions.  Cut the onion and fry it with 2-3 tsp. oil.  Add all-spice and the beef.  Braise until meat turns brown.  Then add water and tomato sauce and salt. Cook meat for 10 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2581<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF WITH MACARONI<!><!><!>Mix the flour and the milk in a blender.  Cook over medium heat, while continuously stirring, until it becomes thick like Tahina sauce. Mix the pasta with 2-3 Tbsp. of this white sauce.<!><!><!>none
2582<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF WITH MACARONI<!><!><!>Grease a baking tray and layer 1/2 of the pasta.  Add the meat and top with the remaining pasta.  Pour the remaining white sauce over the pasta.  Evenly pour the beaten egg over the top.  Bake in 350°F oven for 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2583<!><!><!>BEEF BARLEY SOUP<!><!><!>Cook meat, onion, broth and seasonings in slow cooker on 250 degrees for 8 hours until meat is tender.<!><!><!>none
2584<!><!><!>BEEF BARLEY SOUP<!><!><!>Add vegetables, more seasonings if needed, and water depending on how thick you want the soup.  Cook for another 4 hours.  Add dry barley and liquid (water or broth).  Cook until barley is tender and fluffy.  Season again and eat.<!><!><!>none
2585<!><!><!>BEEF ROLL-UP<!><!><!>Spread a thin layer of garlic paste on meat.  Season with salt, pepper, parsley and grated cheese.  Add bread crumbs.  Roll up meat jelly roll style and secure with toothpicks.  Brown in oil and transfer to casserole dish sprayed with Pam.  Add beef broth and wine to drippings.  Strain and pour over rolls.  Bake covered at 350° for 1 - 1 1/2 hr., depending on cut of meat.<!><!><!>none
2586<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Brown onions and ground beef in hot fat in a skillet. Mix tomato sauce, mixed vegetables, salt and pepper in casserole dish. Add browned onions and beef. Cook in 350° oven for about 1 hour.<!><!><!>none
2587<!><!><!>HEARTY BEEF 'N CHEESE CRESCENT PIE<!><!><!>Heat oven to 375°.  In large skillet, brown ground beef with onion and green pepper.  Drain.  Stir cumin seed, garlic salt, salt, tomato sauce, and green beans.  Simmer uncovered while preparing crust.  Separate dough into 8 triangles.  Place in ungreased 9 inch pie pan.  Press firmly over bottom and up sides to form crust.  Seal perforations.  In small bowl, combine egg and cheese.  Spread over bottom of crust.  Spoon hot meat mixture over cheese mixture.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese and paprika.  Bake at 375° for 20-25 minutes or until crust is golden brown.  Let stand 5 minutes before serving.<!><!><!>none
2588<!><!><!>HEARTY BEEF 'N CHEESE CRESCENT PIE<!><!><!>Makes 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
2589<!><!><!>BEEF VEGETABLE SOUP<!><!><!>Brown beef, onion and garlic. Add rest of ingredients. Bring to boil. Turn heat to simmer and cook until all vegetables are done. Use a 4-quart cooking pot.<!><!><!>none
2590<!><!><!>JUMBO STUFFED SHELLS (BEEF)<!><!><!>Break ground beef into small particles and sauté in butter or olive oil.	Mix thoroughly meat, egg, Mozzarella, milk, bread, chopped parsley, salt and pepper.  Fill cooked shells.  Cover bottom of baking dish with pasta sauce.  Arrange filled shells side by side in single layer in baking pan.  Pour remaining sauce over filled shells and bake at 350° for about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with grated cheese and serve.<!><!><!>none
2591<!><!><!>CHIPPED BEEF DIP<!><!><!>Place cream cheese in bowl. Microwave 1 minute. Stir in milk, sour cream, onion, garlic powder, pepper, green peppers and beef. Mix well. Melt butter. Stir in pecans and Texas Pete. Mix well and serve on crackers as dip.<!><!><!>none
2592<!><!><!>BROTHER JOHN'S BEEF STEW<!><!><!>In a 5-quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat, in 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, cook onions, stirring often, until lightly browned, about 10 minutes; with slotted spoon remove to bowl.  In a large bowl, toss beef with flour, salt, and pepper. In the same Dutch oven, over high heat in 2 tablespoons hot oil, cook beef, half at a time, until well browned on all sides.  With slotted spoon, remove beef to another bowl as it browns.<!><!><!>none
2593<!><!><!>BROTHER JOHN'S BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Return beef to Dutch oven; add beef-flavor bouillon and 4 cups water.  Over high heat, heat to boiling.  Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 1 1/2 hours or until beef is almost fork-tender. Add onions, carrots, and potatoes to Dutch oven; over high heat, heat to boiling.  Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 1 hour longer until beef and vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.  Stir in peas; heat through.  Makes about 8 servings.  Serve with freshly baked corn bread.<!><!><!>none
2594<!><!><!>CORNED BEEF CRACKER SPREAD<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients until well mixed.  Let sit for several hours or overnight.  Serve with a variety of crackers.  Keep well for several days.<!><!><!>none
2595<!><!><!>SAUCY BEEF OVER RICE<!><!><!>You will need 1 Reynolds oven bag.<!><!><!>none
2596<!><!><!>SAUCY BEEF OVER RICE<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°.  Shake flour in bag.  Place in 9 x 13 baking pan.  Add undrained tomatoes, soup mix, water and pepper. Squeeze bag to mix.  Add beef strips.  Turn bag to coat meat. Arrange in an even layer.  Close bag with bag tie.  Cut 6 (1/2-inch) slits on top.  Bake until beef is tender, 40 to 45 minutes.  Serve over hot rice.<!><!><!>none
2597<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF II<!><!><!>Brown beef in skillet.	Do not drain.  Place beef and all ingredients in 13 x 9-inch baking pan.  Mix together thoroughly. Cover and bake at 350° for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.<!><!><!>none
2598<!><!><!>BEEF TACO BAKE<!><!><!>In skillet over medium-high heat, cook beef until browned, stirring to separate meat.  Pour off fat.  Add soup, salsa, milk, tortillas and half the cheese.  Spoon into 2-quart shallow baking dish.  Cover.  Bake at 400° for 30 minutes or until hot.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese.  Serves 4.<!><!><!>none
2599<!><!><!>ONE POT BEEF ROAST AND GRAVY<!><!><!>Place roast in a large baking dish with a cover. Sprinkle roast with dry onion soup mix. In a small bowl, add 1/2 cup of water to soup and pour over roast. Cover and bake roast at a low temperature of 200° or 250° for 3 to 4 hours. Roast will be exceptionally tender. Take roast out of pot and place baking dish on top of stove. Heat the liquid mixture from roast until bubbly.<!><!><!>none
2600<!><!><!>ONE POT BEEF ROAST AND GRAVY<!><!><!>Meanwhile, mix the milk, cornstarch and Gravy Master in a small bowl until smooth. Add this mixture to the bubbling liquid and stir until gravy has thickened.<!><!><!>none
2601<!><!><!>GROUND BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Brown beef.  Add next five ingredients and simmer for 15 minutes.  Cook noodles in boiling water.  While noodles are cooking, mix the cream cheese, sour cream, and chopped onions. After meat cooks and noodles are done, mix all the ingredients together, except the grated cheese.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Top with grated cheese.  Put back in oven for a few seconds to let the cheese melt.<!><!><!>none

2617<!><!><!>HEARTY BEEF AND VEGETABLE CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Boil  potatoes and carrots in salted  water  15  to  20 minutes.   Combine  soup,  milk and  catsup.  Brown  meat  and onion.   (With  canned  hamburger, heat  hamburger,  cook  the onions with potatoes.) In 2 1/2 quart dish alternate layers of vegetables, soup mixture and meat,  ending  with soup mixture. 2618<!><!><!>SPICY BEEF AND CABBAGE<!><!><!>In a large Dutch oven, brown sausage, beef and onion; drain well. Add the remaining ingredients, except cabbage; mix well. Stir in the cabbage and simmer 20 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Serves 4.<!><!><!>none
2619<!><!><!>MIXED BARBECUE BEEF AND PORK<!><!><!>Put in Dutch oven and bake at 350° for about 3 hours.  Mash and serve on hamburger buns.<!><!><!>none
2620<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>Trim excess fat from steak.  Partially freeze steak.  Slice across grain into thin strips.  Combine flour and pepper, mixing well.  Dredge meat in flour mixture; set aside.  Coat a small Dutch oven with cooking spray.  Add oil and place over medium heat until hot.  Add mushrooms and onions to Dutch oven.  Cover and cook 5 minutes or until onion is tender, stirring frequently.  Remove vegetables from Dutch oven and set aside.  Add meat to Dutch oven. Increase heat to medium-high and cook until browned.  Stir in mushrooms, onion and remaining ingredients, except yogurt and noodles.  Bring to a boil.  Cover.  Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes.  Uncover and simmer an additional 15 minutes.  Remove from heat and stir in yogurt.  Cook meat and sauce until thoroughly heated (do not boil).  Serve over noodles.<!><!><!>none
2621<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>Yield:  6 servings (about 162 calories per serving plus 100 calories per 1/2 cup cooked noodles).<!><!><!>none
2622<!><!><!>JUNE'S BEEF BRISKET<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 425°.  Slice onion and place in the bottom of a Dutch oven or heavy pan.  Wipe beef brisket with a damp cloth and season with pepper and paprika to taste.  Place beef in pan on top of onions.  Bake in open pan for 45 minutes.  Remove from oven and decrease heat to 325°.  Pour can of Coke over beef and seal pan with heavy aluminum foil.  Return to oven.  Cook for 3 1/2 hours.  Remove beef from pan.  Wrap in foil to let cool.  Pour juice from pan into bowl and place in refrigerator.  When cool and fat has formed on top, remove fat and reserve   juice for serving with meat.  When ready to serve, trim fat from meat and slice across the grain. A sauce of mayo and horseradish to taste may be served on the side.<!><!><!>none
2623<!><!><!>BEEF RAGOUT<!><!><!>Put all ingredients, except cornstarch and water, into slow cooker (crock-pot) for six hours or so.  (I cook mine during work hours.)  Bring to a boil just before serving.  Mix cornstarch and water and add to meat mixture.  Boil until thickened.  Delicious served over rice or noodles.<!><!><!>none
2624<!><!><!>TENNESSEE BEEF SKILLET<!><!><!>In a skillet, fry ground beef and onions.  Drain.  Stir in remaining ingredients except cheese and corn chips.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Serve over corn chips, then top with cheese.<!><!><!>none
2625<!><!><!>ITALIAN BEEF IN THE CROCK-POT<!><!><!>Place roast, bouillon cubes, garlic salt and Italian dressing in crock-pot.  Add enough water to cover beef.  Cook on low for 8 hours.  Heat up garlic bread or spread garlic spread on French bread.  Wrap in foil and heat in oven for about 10 minutes.  Shred beef with fork and knife; serve with gravy on garlic bread.  Add a salad and a vegetable to this "delicious" sandwich.<!><!><!>none
2626<!><!><!>BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Put in crock-pot and simmer approximately 8 hours.<!><!><!>none
2627<!><!><!>BAR-B-Q BEEF<!><!><!>Sear roast at 400° 1/2 hour to brown.  Mix all remaining ingredients and cook 45 minutes.  Pour over seared roast. Serve in hamburger buns.<!><!><!>none
2628<!><!><!>BEEF-CHICKEN MAGNIFICENT<!><!><!>Spread beef in greased baking dish.  Wrap each chicken breast in slice of bacon.  Place on top of beef.  Combine cheese, soup, and water; pour over chicken.  Cover & bake 1 1/2 hours at 325°. Uncover and bake 1 hour.<!><!><!>none
2629<!><!><!>BEEF HASH<!><!><!>Stir together hot water and beef bouillon cube until cube dissolves. Saut potatoes, onion and garlic in hot oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat 10 minutes. Add beef; cover, reduce heat and cook, stirring occasionally, 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in bouillon mixture, salt, pepper, and if desired, parsley. Cover and simmer 5 minutes. Yield: 4 servings.<!><!><!>none
2630<!><!><!>BEEF HASH<!><!><!>Prep: 10 minutes. Cook: 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2631<!><!><!>HEARTY VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Brown meat with onion in a large pot. Cook until onion is tender and drain. Stir in remaining ingredients. Salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Yield: 6 to 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
2632<!><!><!>CORNED BEEF HASH<!><!><!>(Note:	Amount of potatoes, carrots and onions will depend on amount of meat).<!><!><!>none
2633<!><!><!>CORNED BEEF HASH<!><!><!>Cut up corned beef, potatoes and carrots into pieces.  Put all through meat grinder.  Melt butter; add chopped onions.  Brown and add beef, potato and carrot mixture.  Cook and stir until hot enough to serve; season with salt and pepper to taste.  Maybe served with poached egg and ketchup.  Any leftover meats may be used instead of corned beef.<!><!><!>none
2634<!><!><!>HOT MADRAS BEEF CURRY<!><!><!>Heat the butter in large saucepan and fry the onions until golden brown.  Next add green chilies, turmeric, chili powder, cumin, garlic, coriander, curry and tomato paste.  Fry for 10 minutes, stirring constantly, making sure the masala does not stick to the bottom of the pan.  Add lemon, salt and pepper.  In large pan, brown the round steak in butter.  Add water and bouillon cubes.  Let simmer for 20 to 30 minutes.  Mix in the masala sauce.  Simmer for 2 or more hours, adding water as needed. Serve over rice or noodles.  This is a very spicy dish.  You can use more or less chilies to suit your personal taste.<!><!><!>none
2635<!><!><!>BEEF AND RICE FIESTA<!><!><!>Brown ground beef in a skillet; leave meat in chunks. Add onion slices and cook until tender. Add water, mushroom soup, whole kernel corn, salt and chili powder. Bring to a boil. Stir in Minute rice. Add tomato and green pepper. Cover and simmer 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Makes about 6 cups or 5 servings.<!><!><!>none
2636<!><!><!>BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Bake at 250 for 5 hours.<!><!><!>none
2637<!><!><!>POT ROAST OF BEEF<!><!><!>Put vegetables in bottom of crock-pot. Salt and pepper meat, then put in pot. Add liquid. Cover and cook on low for 10 to 12 hours (on high for 5 to 6 hours). Makes 12 to 14 servings.<!><!><!>none

2640<!><!><!>CHEESY BEEF ENCHILADAS<!><!><!>Prepare hamburger with taco seasoning according to package directions.  Heat refried beans.  Mix together cottage cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, chopped chiles, egg and seasonings. Microwave tortillas on HIGH for 30 to 45 seconds or until pliable. Place refried beans evenly on each tortilla; next place hamburger mixture on each tortilla, then Monterey Jack cheese filling on each tortilla.  Roll the tortillas up in jellyroll fashion; place seam side down in an 11 3/4 x 7 1/2 x 1 3/4 inch baking dish. Cover with enchilada sauce.  Microwave on HIGH for 10 to 12 minutes or until hot and bubbly.  Sprinkle with cheddar cheese; microwave for an additional 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted.  Garnish with sour cream and green onions.<!><!><!>none
2641<!><!><!>BEEF BARLEY SOUP<!><!><!>Brown meat in large saucepan; drain. Stir in water, tomatoes, carrots, mushrooms, barley, garlic and oregano. Bring to a boil; reduce heat. 2666<!><!><!>BEEF ENCHILADA CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Sauce for Enchiladas:<!><!><!>none

2668<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF III<!><!><!>Wash and cut mushrooms.  Season meat and brown in butter. Transfer to casserole.  Brown mushrooms in same pan and put them in casserole.  Put flour into remaining juices in pan and add sour cream.  Cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly.  Pour sauce over meat.	This can be prepared the day before.  Casserole should be heated in a very low oven (250° to 300°) for 1 hour.  Serves 8.  Serve with rice or English muffins.<!><!><!>none
2669<!><!><!>BEEF-BARLEY SOUP<!><!><!>Brown ground beef.  Put all ingredients in a large cooking pot.  Boil.  Turn down heat and let simmer 1 hour.<!><!><!>none

Shape into a ball and roll in remaining dried beef. Refrigerate at least 20 minutes before serving.  Makes a 4-inch ball.<!><!><!>none
2671<!><!><!>BEEF BRISKET ANNA<!><!><!>Dust beef with flour; season with salt and pepper. In large skillet, sear beef on all sides in olive oil. Add onions and sauté until they begin to color.<!><!><!>none
2672<!><!><!>BEEF BRISKET ANNA<!><!><!>In blender, puree tomatoes. Combine with raisins, sugar and lemon, peeled, seeded and quartered, and 1 clove garlic, pressed. Pour sauce over meat and simmer, covered, 2 to 2 1/2 hours. Slice diagonally and serve with noodles. Serves 6 to 8.<!><!><!>none
2673<!><!><!>GRAMA JULIA'S BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Wash meat and bones.  Place in large pot.  Add water.  Let it come to a boil; skim off fat.  Prepare vegetables by washing and paring as necessary.  Add seasoning and vegetables except potatoes.  Simmer for 2 1/2 hours.  Add whole potatoes; simmer for another 1/2 hour.  When done, strain soup.  Serve as consomme or with Crum Noodles.<!><!><!>none

2678<!><!><!>SLOW-COOKED CHUNKY BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Preheat the oven to 250°. Combine all ingredients except tomato juice and peas in a large roaster or Dutch oven. Stir well. Pour tomato juice over mixture. Cover and bake at 250° for 5 hours. Stir in peas and return to oven for 10 more minutes. Makes 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
2679<!><!><!>DRIP BEEF ON BUNS<!><!><!>Remove excess fat; the leaner, the better. Place in Dutch oven or crock-pot. Put in seasonings; barely cover with water and simmer 8 to 10 hours covered in slow oven. When done, lift meat to platter; shred with fork and return to pot. Serve on warm buns. Serves 12.<!><!><!>none
2680<!><!><!>GAIL'S ITALIAN BEEF<!><!><!>Place roast in covered baking dish.  Add beef broth, seasoning mix, water, oregano and pepperoncini.  Cover and bake at 275° for 5 hours until tender. 2682<!><!><!>LAYERED BEEF VEGETABLE CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°. Sauté ground beef, onions and green pepper until beef is browned. Drain fat. Add salt and mix well. 2683<!><!><!>CHICKEN BREAST AND DRIED BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Pound chicken breasts to flatten them. In a 2-quart casserole dish, line bottom with dried beef. Place chicken breasts on top of dried beef. Place layer of dried beef on top of chicken breasts. Mix together sour cream and cream of chicken soup. Spread over all ingredients. 2684<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>Brown ground beef and onion; drain off excess fat. Stir in flour, salt and pepper. Stir in cream of mushroom soup and sour cream. Add mushrooms and let simmer for a few minutes.<!><!><!>none

2686<!><!><!>BARBECUE BEEF BRISKET<!><!><!>Brush brisket with hickory smoke on both sides.  Rub well with the 3 salts.  Marinate overnight.  Cover tightly in refrigerator. Bake, covered, at 250° for 3 hours.  Pour off half the juice and turn and bake 1 hour longer.  Pour barbecue sauce over and bake 1 hour longer.  Let cool and slice thinly.  Put in shallow baking dish covered with foil and freeze.  Reheat to serve.  This is so good to prepare and put into as many servings as you need for company later and freeze.<!><!><!>none
2687<!><!><!>BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Steam ground beef, garlic and onion together. Drain and put in a large soup pot. Add juice, sugar, bay leaf and cream of celery soup. Microwave carrots and celery until tender. Add to soup mixture. Simmer for 1/2 hour. Add salt and pepper. Serves 6 to 8.<!><!><!>none

2691<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF SANDWICH<!><!><!>In a skillet, brown ground beef and onion; drain. Add salt, garlic powder and pepper. Cut bread lengthwise in half; butter both halves and place on baking sheets. Remove meat mixture from the heat; stir in sour cream. Spoon onto the bread. Sprinkle with tomatoes, green pepper and cheese. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. (Bake longer for crispier bread.) Yield: 8 to 10 servings.<!><!><!>none
2692<!><!><!>PERUVIAN GROUND BEEF (CAPOS)<!><!><!>Boil cabbage about 30 minutes.	Take cabbage and start peeling the leaves.  Cook ground beef until brown.	Cook rice. 2693<!><!><!>BEEF ROAST<!><!><!>Butter bottom and 1/2 way up sides of pan.  Sprinkle onion soup in bottom of pan.  Lay roast on top of soup.  Put potatoes and carrots around roast. 2694<!><!><!>ROAST BEEF ROLL UPS<!><!><!>Determine how many sandwiches you will need, and buy beef and tortillas accordingly.  These are made with the 10-inch fajita tortilla and can be cut in half if you want.  Spread each of the tortillas liberally with the horseradish sauce.  If you have folks that don't care for horseradish, I have used plain mayonnaise.  It just doesn't have the same zip!  Place one slice of roast beef in the center of the tortilla and top with a large leaf of lettuce. Roll up and place face down in a 9 x 13 pan to keep from unrolling.  Repeat with the remainder of tortillas and beef. Cover with Saran Wrap and refrigerate.  These are actually better if you can make them a day ahead.  Slice in half if you want before serving.<!><!><!>none

Remove from oven and sprinkle cheese on top. Place back in oven for 5 minutes. Remove and garnish with lettuce and tomatoes.<!><!><!>none

2700<!><!><!>BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>In large pan, cook beef with onions until tender.  Add broth, mushroom soup and water.  Cover and heat to boiling (stir often). Reduce heat to low.  Add noodles and sour cream.  Simmer about 10 to 15 minutes until noodles are tender.<!><!><!>none
2701<!><!><!>SPICY BEEF SALAD<!><!><!>Partially freeze beef. Slice across the grain into thin strips; set aside. For dressing, combine lime juice, sugar, soy sauce, basil and mint; set aside. In a medium nonstick skillet that has been coated with nonstick cooking spray, sauté jalapeno, garlic and ginger for 30 seconds. Add beef; stir fry until cooked as desired. Remove beef from pan; gently toss with red pepper and cucumber. Place greens in a large bowl or divide among individual bowls or plates; top with beef mixture. Add dressing to pan and bring to a boil; remove from heat and drizzle over salad. Serve immediately. This has 11 grams carbohydrate.<!><!><!>none
2702<!><!><!>TEXAS BEEF SKILLET<!><!><!>In a skillet, cook ground beef and onion until meat is browned and onion is tender. Drain off fat. Stir in the undrained tomatoes, undrained beans, uncooked rice, green pepper, chili powder, garlic salt, 1/2 cup water and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Top with cheese. Cover and heat about 3 minutes or until cheese melts. Sprinkle corn chips around the edge. Serves 6.<!><!><!>none
2703<!><!><!>THE BEST BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Add to meat mixture and cook until vegetables are tender.<!><!><!>none
2704<!><!><!>ITALIAN BEEF SANDWICHES<!><!><!>In skillet, bring broth, garlic, oregano and pepper to a boil.  Add green pepper.  Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered until tender, about 5 minutes.  Remove green pepper with slotted spoon; keep warm.  Return broth to boil; add beef and cover and remove from heat.  Let stand for 2 minutes or until heated through. Place beef and green pepper on buns.  Serve with broth for dipping.<!><!><!>none

2711<!><!><!>BEEF GOULASH<!><!><!>Brown meat in skillet, making sure to brown on all sides and not to crowd pan. Meat should not touch other meat. Place in slow cooker. Place onion in skillet and cook until translucent. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Place in slow cooker. Add stock to skillet and scrape up brown pieces. Take 2 3/4 cups of the stock and put in slow cooker. Add flour to remaining stock and whisk until thickened. Add to slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients, except for sour cream and parsley leaves, and stir. Set slow cooker for desired time. Serve with buttered egg noodles, preferably wide. Garnish with sour cream and parsley.<!><!><!>none
2712<!><!><!>BEEF AND VEGETABLE STIR-FRY<!><!><!>In a small bowl, mix beef broth with cornstarch and teriyaki sauce.  In a large skillet or wok, heat 1 tablespoon oil over high heat; add asparagus, pepper and onions; stir-fry until tender-crisp.  Remove to bowl.  Add remaining oil and beef; stir-fry until cooked.  Add beef broth mixture and cook, stirring constantly until thickened; add vegetables and toss.  Serve in warm pastry shells.<!><!><!>none
2713<!><!><!>BEEF AND BEAN BURRITO<!><!><!>Brown ground beef; drain fat.  Drain salsa; reserve liquid. Add seasoning mix, beans, chilies and liquid from salsa.  Simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes. 2714<!><!><!>BEEF AND DRESSING CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Put dressing in a bowl with 1 cup hot water.  Cover and let stand (set aside).  Brown hamburger with chopped celery and onion - no salt.  Add cream of chicken soup and put in bottom of a casserole.  Spread dressing on top of meat.  Add 1/2 cup water to cream of celery soup and pour over all.  May add mushrooms to this if desired.
