2715<!><!><!>CRUSTY BEEF, CHEESE AND NOODLE CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 325°.  Heat oil. Brown meat and onions. Add mushroom sauce, salt and pepper. Heat thoroughly.  Arrange in a casserole dish a layer of noodles, sauce and cheese. Repeat layers. Bake for 1 hour. Serves 8 to 10.<!><!><!>none
2716<!><!><!>FLEMISH BEEF-AND-BEER STEW<!><!><!>Cut beef into 1/2-inch slices; cut slices into 2-inch strips. (For ease in cutting, partially freeze beef about 1 1/2 hours.) Cut bacon into 1/4-inch pieces; fry in Dutch oven until crisp. Remove bacon with slotted spoon; drain on paper towels.  Pour off fat and reserve.  Cook and stir onions and garlic in 2 tablespoons of the reserved bacon fat until tender, about 10 minutes.  Remove onions.  Cook and stir beef in remaining bacon fat until brown, about 15 minutes.  Stir in flour to coat beef; gradually stir in water.  Add onions, beer, bay leaf, brown sugar, salt, thyme and pepper.  Add just enough water to cover beef if necessary.  Heat to boiling; reduce heat.  Cover and simmer until beef is tender, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.  Remove bay leaf.  Stir in vinegar; sprinkle with bacon and parsley.  Serve with noodles.  Yield:  6 servings.<!><!><!>none
2717<!><!><!>BEEF OR CHICKEN GRAVY<!><!><!>Bring the broth to a boil in a medium saucepan.  Boil until reduced by one third volume or approximately for 10 minutes.  In a small bowl combine cornstarch and water.  Gradually add to the hot broth, stirring constantly.  Cook over low heat, stir constantly for 5 minutes or until thickened.  Add the thyme or pepper.  Stir to mix.<!><!><!>none

2740<!><!><!>SOFT BEEF TACOS<!><!><!>Wrap tortillas securely in aluminum foil. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until thoroughly heated. 2742<!><!><!>MARIE CHOPLIN'S CORNED BEEF MOLD<!><!><!>Stir lemon Jell-O into 1 cup of boiling water until dissolved. Remove from stove and let mixture cool. Mix with the remaining ingredients and pour into a mold. Refrigerate overnight.<!><!><!>none
2743<!><!><!>HOMEMADE VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Clean and cut carrots crosswise in 2 inch pieces;  place in 5 quart cooking pan.  Wash roast, cut up in large pieces, season with salt, ground black pepper and garlic salt.  Transfer meat to 5 quart pan with carrots; add water to top of meat.  Cook covered for 2 hours or longer until very tender.  OR, cook in pressurized cooker (i.e., Presto cooker) with water up to top of meat for 40 minutes.  Remove meat to large bowl or rectangular pan, reserving broth.  Discard suet.  Trim fat from meat and cut into small pieces.  Remove carrots to a small bowl.  Set meat and carrots aside.  Strain beef broth into separate bowl, add water, if necessary, to make 2 cups; set broth aside.<!><!><!>none
2744<!><!><!>HOMEMADE VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>While beef is cooking, cook vegetables (except corn) separately on cook top, each with a ham hock, as directed on package if frozen (season with salt).  OR, when meat is done, cook each vegetable (except corn) with a ham hock and salt in Presto cooker for 12 minutes each.  Transfer each vegetable to a separate small bowl.  Separate meat from ham hocks and place in a small bowl; discard bones and fat and skin.  Season corn with butter and salt; cook in microwave or stovetop per package directions...fresh corn is great.<!><!><!>none
2745<!><!><!>HOMEMADE VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Pour cubed raw potatoes in a 3 quart pan; add water to top of potatoes and cook until done.  Set aside.<!><!><!>none
2746<!><!><!>HOMEMADE VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Fry okra in vegetable oil until light tan.  Pour into small bowl and set aside.<!><!><!>none
2747<!><!><!>HOMEMADE VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Coarsely chop tomatoes and pour into a 5 quart stockpot; add chopped onions,  garlic and okra.  Cook on medium heat, for about 1 1/2 hours.  Stir in broth, add vegetables to measure 1 cup each (add corn last, as it sticks easily), add 2 1/2 cups potatoes, beef and ham hock meats.<!><!><!>none
2748<!><!><!>HOMEMADE VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Slice carrots into soup mixture.  Add salt and pepper; adjust seasoning to taste.  Cook for about 30 minutes;  stir in 1 cup corn.   Reserve leftover vegetables for another use.<!><!><!>none
2749<!><!><!>EL DORADO BEEF-CHEESE CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Place beef in cold skillet and brown. Add onion, garlic salt and tomato sauce. Combine sour cream and cottage cheese with green chilies. Crush tortilla chips in bottom of well-buttered 2 1/2-quart casserole. Add half the meat mixture; cover with half the sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with half the grated cheese. Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, in 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes. Garnish with reserved tortilla chips.<!><!><!>none
2750<!><!><!>CORNED BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Boil noodles. Mix meat, soup, milk and 1 cup cheese. Pour over noodles. Dice and crumble bread on top and sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2751<!><!><!>EASY BEEF STROGANOFF<!><!><!>Brown beef and drain. Season with salt and pepper. Add onions and mushrooms and cook until tender. Mix milk and flour. Add to meat mixture. Cook until thick. Serve over buttered noodles.<!><!><!>none
2752<!><!><!>NO FUSS BEEF LASAGNA<!><!><!>Brown meat (8 to 10 minutes).  Mix spaghetti sauce, tomatoes, salt and pepper.  In medium bowl, beat egg.  Add Ricotta and Parmesan cheeses.  Spread 2 cups of meat and sauce on 13 x 9-inch pan.  Arrange 5 noodles one at a time, pressing into meat mixture. Spread cheese mixture on noodles.  Sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese and top with 1 1/2 cups meat sauce.  Arrange another layer of noodles, pressing into meat.  Sprinkle Mozzarella cheese on top. Tent foil lightly.  Bake 45 minutes at approximately 350°. Remove from oven and let sit 15 minutes.  Cut into 3-inch squares. Serve.<!><!><!>none
2753<!><!><!>CHIPPED BEEF DIP<!><!><!>Chop beef. Add all ingredients and heat on low until cream cheese is smooth. Serve with crackers.<!><!><!>none
2754<!><!><!>TEXAS BEEF SKILLET<!><!><!>Cook ground beef and onions until ground beef is brown and onions tender.  Drain fat.  Stir in undrained tomato, beans, rice, water, green pepper, chili powder, salt and garlic salt.  Bring to boil.  Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Top meat mixture with shredded cheese.  Cover and heat about 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.  Sprinkle corn chips around edges.  Makes 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
2755<!><!><!>HOMEMADE BEEF SOUP<!><!><!>Cover beef with  water;  add  salt  and slice of onion. Cook under pressure slowly 1 hour.  Debone and chip lean meat. Skim off fat and  add  other  ingredients.  Bring  to boil and cook slowly about  30  minutes,  until  celery and carrots are done.  (If soup is  too watery, add another can of potato soup to thicken.)<!><!><!>none
2756<!><!><!>COMPANY BEEF<!><!><!>Brown meat and onions; drain. Boil 5 ounces of macaroni; drain. Mix all together with everything except cheese. Sprinkle cheese on top. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2757<!><!><!>BEEF TACO BAKE<!><!><!>In skillet over medium heat, cook beef until browned, stirring to separate meat. Pour off fat. Add soup, salsa, milk, tortillas and 1/2 the cheese. Spoon into 2-quart shallow baking dish. COVER. Bake at 400° for 30 minutes or until hot. Sprinkle remaining cheese. Serves 4.<!><!><!>none
2758<!><!><!>PARTY BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>In a large resealable plastic bag, combine flour, salt and pepper; add beef cubes and shake to coat. In a skillet over medium heat, brown beef in oil. Place beef and drippings in a greased, shallow 2 1/2-quart baking dish.<!><!><!>none
2759<!><!><!>PARTY BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>To skillet, add water, broth, garlic, onion, thyme and rosemary; bring to a boil. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Stir in mushrooms. Pour over meat; mix well. Cover and bake at 350° for 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 hours or until beef is tender. Sprinkle peas over meat. Spread potatoes evenly over top. Brush with butter. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake 15 to 20 minutes more. Yield: 6 to 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
2760<!><!><!>BEEF GOULASH<!><!><!>Cook pasta according to directions on pkg.  Then drain. Brown ground beef along with onion, green pepper, garlic, salt and pepper.  Drain off as much fat as possible from cooked meat mixture.  Add the cooked meat mixture to cooked pasta.  Add the tomato soup and both cans of chopped tomatoes. (Do not drain the chopped tomatoes.)	Mix all ingredients together.  Heat on low on top of stove until good and hot.  Before serving, you may sprinkle on cheese.	Makes 4 generous servings.  Goes well with a salad and hot corn bread.<!><!><!>none
2761<!><!><!>CORN BEEF BALL<!><!><!>Mix well and shape into a ball.  Serve with crackers of your choice.<!><!><!>none
2762<!><!><!>SPINACH BEEF BISCUIT BAKE<!><!><!>Press and flatten biscuits onto bottom and sides of a greased 11 x 7 x 2-inch baking dish; set aside.  In a skillet over medium heat, cook beef and onion until meat is no longer pink; drain.  In a bowl, beat eggs.  Add spinach and mushrooms; mix well.  Stir in cheese, garlic powder, salt, pepper and beef mixture; mix well. Spoon into prepared crust.  Drizzle with butter.  Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 25 to 30 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. Yield:  6 servings.<!><!><!>none
2763<!><!><!>BEEF ROLL-UPS<!><!><!>Make stuffing according to directions on box.  Cut steak into thin pieces, about 4 1/2 x 2-inches; score.  Sprinkle with salt and pepper.  Spread some dressing on each piece of meat.  Roll up and fasten with skewer or toothpicks.  Roll in flour and brown in butter.  Add 2 cups water (meat stock is better) and simmer for 1 1/2 hours until tender.  Remove toothpicks.  Pour gravy over meat. Garnish with chopped parsley.  Serve with mashed potatoes.<!><!><!>none
2764<!><!><!>BEEF BOURGUIGNON<!><!><!>Cut beef into bite-sized cubes.  In a large skillet heat half of the butter.  Add the mushrooms and brown very lightly.  Remove and set aside.  Add the remaining butter to the pan and brown the onions.  Remove and set aside.  Add the beef cubes to the pan in batches, browning on all sides.  Remove cubes as done, and continue until all beef has been browned.  Remove all beef cubes and set aside.  To the remaining fat in the pan stir the flour, then add the bouillon, wine, and tomato paste.  Bring to a boil and stir until thickened.  Add garlic, salt, thyme, bay leaf and pepper.<!><!><!>none
2765<!><!><!>BEEF BOURGUIGNON<!><!><!>Mix sauce and meat cubes together in a large casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350° for about 2 hours, until the meat is very tender.  Add the onions for the last half hour or cooking time, and the mushrooms for the last 15 minutes.  Remove from oven and discard bay leaf.  Makes 6-8 servings.<!><!><!>none
2766<!><!><!>BEEF ENCHILADAS WITH CHEESE<!><!><!>In a 1 1/2-quart casserole, crumble meat.  Cook by microwave 4 minutes, stirring twice.  Drain fat.  Add 1 cup cheese and olives to meat.  In a 2 1/2-quart casserole, blend tomato paste with enchilada sauce mix.  Stir in water.  Cover and cook by microwave for 8 minutes.  Pour 1 cup prepared enchilada sauce in 7 1/2 x 12-inch baking dish.  Dip each tortilla into remaining heated sauce.  Spoon beef mixture in center of each tortilla.  Fold sides of tortilla over filling and place in baking dish, seam side down. Pour remaining sauce over the top.  Then top with 1 1/2 cups cheese; cover with plastic wrap.  Heat by microwave for 3 minutes. Makes 8 enchiladas.<!><!><!>none
2767<!><!><!>BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Cut meat up into small pieces.  Heat shortening in a large pot on the stove.  Add meat, turning often till brown.  Add sliced onion to the last 5 minutes of browning.  When brown, sprinkle with 1 tsp. salt and pepper.  Add water, cover and heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer until meat is done, about 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Add more water if needed.<!><!><!>none
2768<!><!><!>BEEF STEW<!><!><!>Slice carrots and potatoes and add to meat.  Pour in enough water to cover vegetables.  Add rest of salt and cook until vegetables are done.  Then stir together flour and 1/3 cup water to make a thickening.  Pour into stew and cook about 2 to 3 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2769<!><!><!>NO PEEP BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients and put in covered casserole. Bake at 300° for 3 hours. Do not peep until 3 hours have passed. Serve over rice or noodles. Meat will be very tender.<!><!><!>none
2770<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS ROCKS<!><!><!>Chop cherries, pineapple and pecans.  Pour orange juice over fruit and let stand 1 hour.  Sprinkle 1 1/2 c. flour over fruit & nut mixture.  Mix eggs, butter, sugar, 1 1/2 c. flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves.  Add fruit mixture and mix well.  Spoon onto cookie sheet.  Bake at 350 degrees until edges are brown.  Cookies will be soft.<!><!><!>none
2771<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FUN FOR THE KIDS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°.  Blend all ingredients until well mixed. You may have to add more flour if too wet or more water if too dry. Flour working area and roll dough out until 1/4 inch thick.  Dip cookie cutter in the flour and cut out ornaments.  Place on lightly greased cookie sheet.  Use the end of the paint brush to punch a hole in the top to hang by.  Decorate with paints, glitter and ribbon.<!><!><!>none

I do this the day before and store in refrigerator.  Combine remaining ingredients and pour into cooked hash brown crust.  Bake until eggs are set, about 20 minutes, in 375 degree oven.<!><!><!>none

2774<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAKFAST PIE<!><!><!>Cook sausage, drain, add cheese, mix well.  Sprinkle  mixture in pie shell.  Beat eggs, add onions, peppers, and cream.  Pour in pie shell bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes.  Cool 10 minutes. Serve. Garnish with red and bell peppers. Can be refrigerated overnight and baked the next morning. This is great for a quick breakfast on Christmas morning.<!><!><!>none

2785<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS GOLD FRUIT CAKE<!><!><!>Beat butter until light and creamy.  Gradually add the sugar, beating until smooth.  Beat egg yolks together lightly and add to mixture.  Combine milk, brandy and vanilla.  Mix flour and salt together.  Alternately add milk mix and flour mix to butter mix. Fold in fruits and nuts.  Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff, but not dry.  Fold whites into batter gently, but thoroughly.  Pour mixture into two buttered and floured six-cup molds.  Bake at 275° for 2 1/2 hours or until they test done.  Cool and unmold.<!><!><!>none
2786<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS RIBBON SALAD<!><!><!>Drain cherries, reserving 1 cup juice.  Chop cherries.  Stir together gelatins and 2 cups boiling water until completely dissolved.  Stir in reserved cherry juice, sugar, port, and lemon juice.  Stir in cherries.  Lightly spray a 10-cup ring mold or Bundt cake pan with vegetable cooking spray, and pour half of gelatin mixture into mold.  Chill 2 hours or until almost set. Stir together remaining gelatin mixture, cream cheese, and pecans, blending well.  Pour over slightly set gelatin mixture in mold. Chill 6 hours or until firm.  Garnish, if desired.<!><!><!>none

2792<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Beat butter until creamy. Gradually add sugar; beat until fluffy. Add egg; beat until light and fluffy. Blend in vanilla. Cut into desired shapes with floured cookie cutters. Place on buttered cookie sheets. Bake in preheated moderate oven (350°) 8 to 10 minutes. 2793<!><!><!>WHITE CHRISTMAS CHIFFON PIE<!><!><!>Soften gelatin in cold water.  Mix together in a saucepan the milk, flour and sugar; cook to slightly thicken and dissolve the gelatin in that.  Cool.  Then whip the cream.  Beat the egg whites until stiff and add the cream of tartar.  To the gelatin mixture, fold in the whipped cream and the egg whites.  Add the vanilla and almond extract.  Then fold in the coconut.  Spoon into the pie shells and chill in the refrigerator.<!><!><!>none

2801<!><!><!>SEVEN LAYER CHRISTMAS RIBBON CAKE<!><!><!>Mix as directed on box. Add different cake coloring to each layer. 2804<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FRUIT CAKE<!><!><!>Crush graham crackers to a powder. Chop cherries, leaving 5 or 6 for decoration. Melt marshmallows in milk. Mix all ingredients, a little at a time, into hot marshmallows. When mixture becomes cool, you can begin mixing with your hands. You will need to add cherry juice as you mix to keep ingredients moist. Place a drinking glass on cake plate and pat the cake mixture around glass until you "make a cake" around it. Set in the refrigerator until firm. Remove glass.<!><!><!>none

2810<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS<!><!><!>In mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and dressing mix until smooth.  Add red pepper, celery, onions and olives:  mix well. 2811<!><!><!>WHITE CHRISTMAS FUDGE<!><!><!>Combine sugar, sour cream, milk, butter, corn syrup and salt in heavy 2-quart saucepan.  Stir over moderate heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture reaches a boil.  Boil over moderate heat 9 to 10 minutes to 238°, soft-ball stage.  Remove from heat and allow to stand until lukewarm (110°), about an hour.  Add vanilla and beat until mixture just begins to lose its gloss and hold its shape. Quickly stir in walnuts and turn into oiled pan.  Let stand until firm before cutting.  Makes 1 1/2 pounds.<!><!><!>none

2821<!><!><!>Christmas Toffee<!><!><!>1. Preheat oven to 325°. Spread out almonds on a baking sheet and bake, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, 5-7 minutes.  Let cool.<!><!><!>none
2822<!><!><!>Christmas Toffee<!><!><!>2. Coarsely chop chocolate chips in a food processor, pulsing on and off.  Transfer to a medium bowl.  In same processor bowl, coarsely chop almonds, pulsing on and off. Add to chocolate chips, tossing to combine  Spread half of mixture evenly over bottom of a well-greased baking sheet.<!><!><!>none
2823<!><!><!>Christmas Toffee<!><!><!>3. In a heavy saucepan, bring butter and brown sugar to a boil, stirring constantly, over medium heat.  Cook 5-7 minutes or until syrup is golden brown and just reaches the hard crack stage (300° on a candy thermometer).  At that point, a bit of syrup, when dropped into a bowl of ice water, should separate into threads that are hard and brittle.<!><!><!>none
2824<!><!><!>Christmas Toffee<!><!><!>4. Pour hot syrup evenly over nut mixture.  Top with remaining nut mixture, smoothing and pressing down gently with a spatula. Refrigerate until toffee is set and chocolate is firm, about 1 1/2 hours.  Cut into irregular pieces with tip of a sharp knife. Store in tightly covered container in refrigerator up to 2 weeks.<!><!><!>none
2825<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CUSTARD<!><!><!>Mix pudding with pint of  milk and beat with mixer 5 minutes. Add cream (unwhipped) and beat 3 minutes. Add other ingredients and mix well while scraping side of the bowl. Refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
2826<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS MORNING STRATA<!><!><!>Night before serving, grease 13 x 9 glass baking dish.  Cook sausage meat, using slotted spoon remove sausage to paper towel to drain.  Cut bread into 1/2 inch cubes.  Drain and chop mushrooms. In baking dish combine meat, bread and mushrooms.  In large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk and seasonings.  Pour egg mixture over sausage mixture.  Cover baking dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.<!><!><!>none
2827<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS MORNING STRATA<!><!><!>About 1 1/2 hours before serving preheat oven to 350°.  Bake uncovered 1 hour.   Remove from oven and sprinkle evenly with cheese.  Bake 15 minutes longer or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.  Remove from oven and let stand 10 minutes before serving.  Serves 8.<!><!><!>none
2828<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS ANISE DROPS<!><!><!>Generously grease cookie sheets.<!><!><!>none

2830<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS ANISE DROPS<!><!><!>Beat until very thick and piled softly.  Fold in the dry ingredients, sifting in about 1/4 at a time. Use a pastry bag or drop by teaspoonfuls onto the cookie sheets, about 2-inches apart. Set cookie sheets aside in a cool place (not in refrigerator) 8 to 10 hours or overnight.  Do not cover cookies and do not disturb!<!><!><!>none

2833<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS M&M'S COOKIES<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°. Beat together butter, brown sugar and white sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Blend in eggs and vanilla. Combine flour, salt and baking soda in a small bowl. Add to butter mixture. Mix well. Add M&M's. Drop by teaspoons and bake for 10 to 12 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2834<!><!><!>WHITE CHRISTMAS CAKE<!><!><!>Combine candied fruits, coconut, raisins, almonds and orange rind in a large bowl.  Sift flour, baking powder and salt over fruit.  Mix well.  Cream margarine with sugar in medium bowl.  Beat in eggs; stir in apple and orange juice.  Pour over fruit mixture; fold and mix thoroughly.  Spoon batter into a greased and floured 8-inch pan.  Bake at 375° for 3 hours.  Cool completely in pan.  On serving day, put on an Orange Glaze.  Makes an 8-inch round cake.<!><!><!>none
2835<!><!><!>WHITE CHRISTMAS CAKE<!><!><!>Orange Glaze:<!><!><!>none
2836<!><!><!>WHITE CHRISTMAS CAKE<!><!><!>Beat all until smooth and creamy.  Makes about 3/4 cup.<!><!><!>none
2837<!><!><!>FRESH CHRISTMAS EGGNOG<!><!><!>Beat egg yolks in bowl until smooth.  Combine egg yolks and sugar in top of double boiler over hot water.  Stir in milk gradually.  Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture coats spoon. Remove from heat.  Refrigerate until chilled.  Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.  Fold egg whites and whipping cream into chilled egg yolk mixture.  Stir in rum flavoring.  Chill for several hours to blend flavors.  Stir in vanilla just before serving; sprinkle with nutmeg.  Yield:  24 (1/2 cup) servings.<!><!><!>none
2838<!><!><!>ROLLED CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Mix ingredients in order.  Cream together first four ingredients. Mix together the dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture.<!><!><!>none
2839<!><!><!>ROLLED CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Chill; roll; cut out shapes.<!><!><!>none
2840<!><!><!>ROLLED CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Bake at 375 degrees for 5 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2841<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix ingredients. Add 2 qt chilled ginger ale before serving. Top with pineapple sherbet.<!><!><!>none
2842<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Combine juices and water in bottom part of percolator. Place all other ingredients in basket of percolator. Perk 5 to 10 minutes. This makes a delicious drink for a party or just to serve on cold days at home.<!><!><!>none
2843<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SCENT<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients in tea kettle or saucepan and bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer as long as desired. Check often and add additional water, if needed. Mixture may be stored in refrigerator for several days and reused. Yield: 4 cups.<!><!><!>none
2844<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FRUIT COOKIES<!><!><!>Mix fruit, nuts, flour, sugars and salt.  Add beaten egg whites and vanilla.  Mix well.  Add melted margarine and mix again.  Grease and flour cookie sheets.  Drop mixture by scant teaspoonful on cookie sheets.  Bake at 325° for 15 minutes until golden brown.  Store baked cookies in airtight container.  Yield: 4 dozen.<!><!><!>none
2845<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS RAMEKIN<!><!><!>Cut bread down the middle and slice into strips. Drizzle with butter (and garlic if you desire) and bake at 350° for 8-10 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2846<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS RAMEKIN<!><!><!>Meanwhile, saut garlic in oil. In bowl mix artichokes, red pepper, hot jalapeno pepper, cheese, and garlic.  Add enough mayonnaise so it all holds together.  Add the lemon juice. Bake at 350 uncovered for 30-35 minutes until it bubbles and the top is golden.<!><!><!>none
2847<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS RAMEKIN<!><!><!>Serve with the French bread immediately.<!><!><!>none
2848<!><!><!>FUDGY CHRISTMAS WREATH<!><!><!>In a sauce pan over low heat cook and stir milk and chocolate chips until chocolate melts and mixture is slightly thickened (about 6 minutes).  Remove from heat and stir in nuts and vanilla. Cool until it starts to set, about 15 minutes.  Line a baking sheet with wax paper.  Spoon mixture by 2 tablespoons full into small mounds to form a wreath.  Decorate with cherries.  You can just pour it out on  wax paper and then cut into pieces when firm. Chill until firm.  This makes a soft fudge.  Keep refrigerated.<!><!><!>none
2849<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Toss lettuce, avocado, red onion, cranberries and mandarin oranges together. Mix cranberry juice concentrate, rice wine vinegar, mustard, pepper and oil. Pour over salad and toss.<!><!><!>none
2850<!><!><!>OLD FASHIONED CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE<!><!><!>Mix & cook sugar, butter, milk, and cocoa for 20 min., stirring occasionally.  Add vanilla, peanuts (crushed), and flour.<!><!><!>none
2851<!><!><!>OLD FASHIONED CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE<!><!><!>Mix well & pour into a greased cookie sheet.  When almost cold, cut into your size squares.<!><!><!>none
2852<!><!><!>PECAN CHRISTMAS CAKE<!><!><!>Cream butter and sugar.  Beat in eggs, one at a time.  Add vanilla.  Mix raisins, nuts and 1/4 cup flour.  Sift remaining dry ingredients.  Alternately fold in raisins, pecan mixture and dry ingredients into creamed mixture.  Spoon into greased and paper lined pan.  Bake at 300° for 1 hour and 50 minutes in 10-inch tube pan.  Cool and remove from pan.<!><!><!>none
2853<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FRUIT SALAD<!><!><!>In large saucepan, combine egg yolks, water, vinegar and salt.  Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and reaches 160°.  Remove from heat.  Fold in whipped cream.  In large bowl, combine remaining ingredients.  Add dressing and toss to coat.  Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Makes 12 to 14 servings.<!><!><!>none
2854<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BONBONS<!><!><!>Combine milk, powdered sugar and oleo.  Mix until smooth and creamy.  Add coconut, walnuts and cherries; mix thoroughly.  Chill 1 hour.  Form into small balls.  Chill another 2 hours.  Melt chocolate.  Dip individually into chocolate.  Place on waxed paper to cool.  Chill in refrigerator.  Makes about 150 pieces.<!><!><!>none
2855<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BONBONS<!><!><!>Can use any dipping chocolate.<!><!><!>none
2856<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CRUNCH CANDY<!><!><!>Melt chocolate chips over simmering water in top of double boiler.  Let cool.  Stir in salted peanuts, raisins and marshmallows.  Line cookie sheet with wax paper.  Drop by teaspoonfuls on paper.  Refrigerate overnight.<!><!><!>none
2857<!><!><!>AROMA OF CHRISTMAS<!><!><!>Combine spices and fruit with water in sauce pan or crockpot. Bring to a boil and simmer.  Check hourly; add water as needed.<!><!><!>none
2858<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS RASPBERRY CAROUSEL<!><!><!>You will also need 1 Jell-O mold.<!><!><!>none
2859<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS RASPBERRY CAROUSEL<!><!><!>Dissolve raspberry Jell-O in 1 cup of boiling water. Add cranberry juice and chill until slightly thickened (about 1 hour). Fold in apple, celery and nuts and put in ring mold to set.<!><!><!>none
2860<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS RASPBERRY CAROUSEL<!><!><!>Dissolve lemon or lime Jell-O in cup of boiling water and chill until slightly thickened. Combine Cool Whip with mayonnaise and fold into lemon or lime Jell-O and spoon into center of mold. Chill until firm. Remove from mold and garnish with salad greens and sliced apples.<!><!><!>none
2861<!><!><!>SPICY CHRISTMAS PICKLES<!><!><!>Drain juice from pickles and discard. Slice pickles into spears and put in jar. Add hot sauce, garlic and 1/3 of sugar. Screw on lid tightly. Gently mix pickles with sugar and spices by tipping jar back and forth. Leave on counter at room temperature for 1 week. As sugar dissolves, add more sugar until all sugar is used. Mix pickles daily. Pickles will be dark green when all sugar is absorbed.<!><!><!>none
2862<!><!><!>CORN FLAKE CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES<!><!><!>Melt butter over medium heat. Stir in marshmallows until melted. Add green food coloring. Turn off heat and add corn flakes. Fold into mixture with a spoon. Run hands under cold water and form wreaths on wax paper. Place red hots on top to look like berries and let stand until firm.<!><!><!>none
2863<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Prepare jello with boiling water and cold water.  Add pineapple.  Pour into 9 x 12 dish and refrigerate until set.  To the cream cheese (room temperature), add milk and mix until like soft butter.  Spread over lime jello and chill thoroughly.<!><!><!>none
2864<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Meanwhile, make cherry jello; cool until syrupy. Pour over layer of cheese. Chill. Cut into squares to serve.<!><!><!>none
2865<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Change color of jello for other holidays.<!><!><!>none
2866<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST<!><!><!>Trim crusts from bread. Crumble bread. Mix bread and cheese and spread in bottom of greased 7 1/2 x 12-inch flat baking dish. Beat eggs and milk together and stir in salt, pepper and mustard. Pour over bread and cheese. Lay bacon on top. Refrigerate overnight. Next morning, bake uncovered, at 350° for 50 to 55 minutes. Serves 6. Make this the day before.<!><!><!>none
2867<!><!><!>OLD TIME CHRISTMAS SALAD (SLAW)<!><!><!>Grate cabbage on coarse side of grater.  Drain peas and beans thoroughly.  Mix cabbage, peas and beans together and add 7 tablespoons of horseradish (or more to taste) and mayonnaise. Store in refrigerator until ready to serve.  Will keep for several days.  Garnish with olives or sliced pimentos.<!><!><!>none
2868<!><!><!>White Christmas Salad<!><!><!>Dissolve jell-o in hot water, adding pineapple juice. When it begins to congeal, fold in whipped cream and remaining ingredients. Chill until firm. Serves 10.<!><!><!>none
2869<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS EGG CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Sauté the sausage, drain all the grease and set aside. Beat the eggs, add milk, salt and mustard, stir. Layer the bread cubes on the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Then layer the sausage, followed by cheese. Pour the egg mixture over the top, cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.<!><!><!>none
2870<!><!><!>RUBY CHRISTMAS SLUSH<!><!><!>Combine thawed orange juice concentrate and water, mixing well. Stir in fruit punch, pineapple juice and cranapple juice.  Freeze in a large container stirring occasionally.  Remove from freezer 3-4 hours before serving, stirring occasionally as mixture thaws. Stir in ginger ale just before serving.  Yield:  about 2 1/4 gallons.<!><!><!>none
2871<!><!><!>PRETTY PEARS FOR CHRISTMAS<!><!><!>Divide juice 1/2 and 1/2 in bowls. Add green coloring to one; add red coloring to other. Darken to your liking. Add pears and refrigerate overnight.<!><!><!>none
2872<!><!><!>PRETTY PEARS FOR CHRISTMAS<!><!><!>Filling:<!><!><!>none
2873<!><!><!>PRETTY PEARS FOR CHRISTMAS<!><!><!>Mix together and scoop into colored pear halves, about 1 teaspoon each. Serve on a bed of lettuce.<!><!><!>none
2874<!><!><!>HAZEL'S CHRISTMAS PICKLES<!><!><!>Fill a one gallon glass jar with small to medium cucumbers which have been thoroughly washed.  Add all the preceding ingredients and finish filling the jar with water.  Put lid on and shake well, let stand in cool place till December, (standing longer will not affect quality).  Open jar; drain and wash pickles.  Cut into bite size chunks and put back into jar.  Dissolve 7 cups of sugar in a quart of water and pour over cucumbers.  If necessary, add more water to cover pickles; let stand for 2 weeks in the refrigerator.<!><!><!>none
2875<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WREATHS<!><!><!>Melt margarine with marshmallows and add vanilla and food coloring.  Pour over corn flakes and mix.  Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper.  Put red hots or cherry halves in middle to form wreaths.  Chill 40 minutes.  Makes 2 dozen.<!><!><!>none
2876<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FANTASY FUDGE<!><!><!>You will also need 1 candy thermometer.<!><!><!>none
2877<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FANTASY FUDGE<!><!><!>Using a heavy pot, mix sugar, butter and milk; bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 5 minutes over medium heat or until candy thermometer reaches 238°. Stir constantly; mixture scorches easily. Remove from heat. Stir in chocolate pieces until melted, then add marshmallow, nuts and vanilla; beat well. Pour in greased 9 x 3 pan. Cool and cut into small squares. "Mark off" while still warm.<!><!><!>none
2878<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Chop pecans, pineapple and cherries.  Use 1 cup flour to coat them.  Mix in order given; drop on greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 300° about 25 to 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2879<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WHITE CAKE<!><!><!>Combine Brazil, walnuts, dates and cherries.  Sprinkle with flour.  Take juice from cherries and mix flour, sugar, eggs and butter.  Combine all ingredients and bake at 270 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.<!><!><!>none
2880<!><!><!>RETHA'S CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY<!><!><!>Add drops of food coloring while cooking.<!><!><!>none
2881<!><!><!>RETHA'S CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients and cook to 300°. Stir in small bottle of flavored oil to coordinate with the color of candy.<!><!><!>none
2882<!><!><!>RETHA'S CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY<!><!><!>Pour out onto a cookie sheet dusted with powdered sugar.<!><!><!>none
2883<!><!><!>RETHA'S CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY<!><!><!>Cut into strips and then pieces when cool enough to handle.<!><!><!>none
2884<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES<!><!><!>Beat butter at medium speed of mixer until creamy.  Add sugar gradually.  Mix well.  Add flour and orange juice alternately.<!><!><!>none
2885<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES<!><!><!>Use cookie gun fitted with proper dish to shape wreaths. Place on ungreased cookie sheet.   Bake at 375° for 8 minutes or until edges just begin to turn brown.  Remove to wire rack.  Cool completely.<!><!><!>none
2886<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES<!><!><!>Using decorator frosting, shape leaves at one point of wreath cookie.  Embed cinnamon candies for berries.<!><!><!>none
2887<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS REINDEER COOKIES<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients except flour.  Slowly add flour until makes a ball.  For best results, chill half hour or more.  Roll out on floured surface.  Use any type cookie cutter (we prefer reindeer in our family).  Place on cookie sheets sprayed with Pam.  Bake at 350° until edges are brown.  Cool on rack for frosting.<!><!><!>none
2888<!><!><!>WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE<!><!><!>Dissolve gelatin in water and let stand. Combine sugar, flour and milk in a small saucepan. Over medium heat let boil and thicken while constantly stirring. Remove from heat, stir in gelatin and let cool. Add whip cream, vanilla and almond extract. Mix well and pour into a graham cracker crust. Refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
2889<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WREATHS<!><!><!>In 5 qt.  Dutch oven melt margarine and marshmallows.  Mix in vanilla and food color.  Stir in frosted flakes until well coated. Spoon onto greased pan and decorate with 3 cinnamon candies.  May also make 1 large wreath.<!><!><!>none
2890<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CRUNCH SALAD<!><!><!>Mix with Dressing.<!><!><!>none

2893<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS ROCKS<!><!><!>Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs, vanilla and dry ingredients, mixing well. Add fruit and nuts; mix well. Spoon onto cookie sheet covered with parchment paper. Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2894<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients (except ginger ale). The ginger ale should be added just prior to serving. If more color is desired, add a few drops of food coloring. This mixture may be made ahead of time and frozen. Serves 35 to 40.<!><!><!>none
2895<!><!><!>RED CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Chill fruit juice and 7-Up.  Prepare 7-Up ice cubes by pouring  7-Up into 2 ice trays.  Freeze.  At serving time, combine cranberry and apple juice in a punch bowl.  Slowly pour in 7-Up. Add "ice cubes".  Serve.  Makes 35 punch cup servings.<!><!><!>none
2896<!><!><!>CRANBERRY CHRISTMAS MOLD<!><!><!>Drain pineapple juice into measuring cup; reserve pineapple.  Add water to juice to make 1 cup.  Bring to a boil in saucepan over moderate heat.  When boiling, remove from heat, stir in gelatin and stir until dissolved.  Add cold water; chill until mixture is consistency of unbeaten egg whites.  In medium bowl combine drained pineapple and cranberry sauce; when well mixed stir into gelatin mixture.  Pour into 9 inch square pan.  Cover and chill until firm. Meanwhile, heat oven to 350°.  Place pecans and butter in a shallow pan and bake about 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pecans are toasted.  Cool nuts.  When gelatin mixture is firm, spread Creamy Cheese Topping over the top.  Sprinkle pecans over frosting.  Chill 3 to 4 hours until frosting is firm.  Using wet knife, cut salad into 9 squares.  With small pancake turner lift squares onto a serving plate.  Chill until serving time.  Decorate with salad greens if desired.  Makes 9 servings.<!><!><!>none
2897<!><!><!>CRANBERRY CHRISTMAS MOLD<!><!><!>Creamy Cheese Topping:<!><!><!>none
2898<!><!><!>CRANBERRY CHRISTMAS MOLD<!><!><!>Place the whipped dessert mix in small bowl of electric mixer. Prepare according to package directions but substitute 1/2 cup heavy cream for the milk and 1/2 cup milk for the water.  When mixed add the cream cheese and blend well.  Use to frost Cranberry Christmas Salad.<!><!><!>none
2899<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS A.M. CASSEROLE<!><!><!>First Layer:  6 pieces bread, 1/2 cup cooked sausage, 1/2 egg, milk mixture and 1/2 of cheese; repeat layer.<!><!><!>none
2900<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS A.M. CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Beat milk, eggs, salt and pepper together. Brown sausage and drain. Bake at 350°  covered for 25 minutes uncovered 25 minutes. Make day before. Then pop into oven.<!><!><!>none
2901<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WREATHS<!><!><!>Melt oleo and marshmallows.  Add food coloring and pour over corn flakes.  Stir until flakes are coated. 2902<!><!><!>OMA'S CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Cream butter and sugar together.  Add nuts and flour.  Make little balls and bake at 350° until done.  Roll them in the powdered sugar after they have cooled.<!><!><!>none
2903<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WREATHS<!><!><!>Melt butter and marshmallows.  Add salt, vanilla and coloring. Pour over corn flakes.  Drop by spoon onto waxed paper.  Decorate with red candies.  Let set 24 hours.<!><!><!>none
2904<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS DATE SQUARES<!><!><!>Combine dates, sugar and water; cook all together until thick and put aside. Combine remaining ingredients thoroughly to make oat mixture. Put 1/2 of oat mixture into a pan and pat down. Layer the date mixture on top. Pour remainder of oat mixture on top. Bake in moderate oven until light brown.<!><!><!>none
2905<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS EGGNOG<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients together in a bowl or blender. Mix until smooth. Store in refrig. until time to serve. Pour into punch bowl and sprinkle with nutmeg.<!><!><!>none
2906<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients and fold into  Cool Whip. Let set and chill 4 to 5 hours or overnight.<!><!><!>none
2907<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUDDING CAKE<!><!><!>Grind the entire orange and the raisins (use the orange peel too).  Mix the ground mixture with the sugar, butter, egg, flour, soda, salt, and milk.<!><!><!>none

2909<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUDDING CAKE<!><!><!>Mix 1/2 cup orange juice and 1/2 cup sugar.  Pour over the cake while still warm.<!><!><!>none
2910<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CHEESE BALL<!><!><!>Mix equal amounts of cream cheese and Cheddar cheese. Roll into log or ball. Place line of chili powder on wax paper and roll. Sprinkle top with chives, paprika and pepper.<!><!><!>none
2911<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAD<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 325°. Butter large bowl; set aside. Butter an 8-inch round cake pan. Line inside of pan with double layer of heavy-duty foil so that foil extends 2-inches above top edge. Secure ends with paper clips. Butter inside of foil.<!><!><!>none
2912<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAD<!><!><!>In large bowl, combine 2 1/2 cups flour, sugar, yeast, salt and cinnamon. In a pot, heat butter, milk, 1/2 cup water and vanilla over low heat until warm (120° to 130°). Add butter mixture to flour mixture. At medium-high speed, beat until combined. Beat in eggs and 2 yolks, one at a time. Stir in candied fruit, raisins and zest. Beat in remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, until soft, wet dough forms. Transfer to buttered bowl; cover and let rest 10 minutes. Transfer dough to pan. Cover and let rise in warm place until dough has doubled, about 1 hour.<!><!><!>none
2913<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAD<!><!><!>Beat remaining yolk with 1 teaspoon water; brush over dough. Cut 1/2-inch deep X across center. Bake 55 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool on rack 10 minutes. Remove from pan; cool completely on rack.<!><!><!>none
2914<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAD<!><!><!>Dissolve yeast in water.  Add evaporated milk, sugar, shortening, salt and 2 cups flour.  Beat until smooth.  Stir in fruit and enough remaining flour to form a soft dough.  Do not knead.  Place in greased bowl, turning once to grease top.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 1/4 hours.  Punch down.  Turn onto a floured surface; knead 3 to 4 minutes.  Pat evenly into a greased 10-inch tube pan.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until nearly double in size, about 45 minutes.  Bake at 375° for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pan to cool on a wire rack.  Combine confectioners sugar,  milk and vanilla; drizzle over bread.  Garnish with candied fruit, if desired.  Servings: 1.<!><!><!>none
2915<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Make lemonade and Kool-Aid as directed. Add in strawberries. Add ginger ale just before serving. Serves 35 to 40.<!><!><!>none
2916<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Preparation time: 5 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2917<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BRAID<!><!><!>Thaw frozen dough; roll to 12-inch square.  Cut in 3 strips. Spread butter or margarine down lengthwise center of each strip. Combine brown sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over butter.  Top with chopped pecans.  Bring dough up around filling, sealing edges to form 3 ropes.  Place on greased baking sheet and loosely braid. Let rise until double (about 30 minutes).  Bake at 375° for 30 to 35 minutes.  Combine confectioners sugar and enough milk to make a thin glaze.  Drizzle over braid while it is still warm. Sprinkle top with red sugar and trim with pecan halves.<!><!><!>none
2918<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SIX LAYER COOKIES<!><!><!>You will also need a glass pan with greased sides.<!><!><!>none
2919<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SIX LAYER COOKIES<!><!><!>Melt butter and mix with graham cracker crumbs to make bottom crust. Layer chocolate, nuts, butterscotch and coconut. Pour milk over all and bake 30 to 35 minutes at 350°.<!><!><!>none
2920<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Blend juices and water; chill.  Add ginger ale just before serving.  Float a half gallon of lime sherbet on top of punch mixture.<!><!><!>none
2921<!><!><!>CROCK POT CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>In a crockpot, combine juices, red-hot candies and cinnamon stick. Cook on low for 2-5 hours. Remove cinnamon stick(s) before serving. Yields 2 quarts.<!><!><!>none
2922<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS<!><!><!>Place rolls in greased tube pan.  Sprinkle dry pudding over rolls.  Cook butter, brown sugar and cinnamon until it bubbles and sugar dissolves.  Pour over rolls.  Cover tightly with foil and let sit on counter overnight, or 6 - 8 hours.  Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Invert onto serving plate.<!><!><!>none
2923<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Mix in order listed. This dessert freezes well.<!><!><!>none
2924<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Mix lime jello, boiling water and pineapple.  Allow to congeal.  Meanwhile, soften cream cheese.  Spread cream cheese, salad dressing and pecans over lime mixture and allow to cool. Mix jello and boiling water.  Add cold water.  After mixture is cool, pour over the layer of cream cheese.  This salad is pretty and colorful as well as delicious.<!><!><!>none
2925<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CAKE<!><!><!>Cream butter, add sugar gradually, beating well after each addition.  Add eggs one at a time.  Add flavorings.  Add flour and mix.  Add pineapple preserves, cherries and nuts last.  Bake 250° until done. At least 2 hours.<!><!><!>none
2926<!><!><!>FAVORITE CHRISTMAS OR EASTER CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Brown and drain sausage.  Cut in large pieces.  Cut eggs and cheese in large pieces.  Season white sauce with marjoram, pepper, few drops of Worcestershire.<!><!><!>none
2927<!><!><!>FAVORITE CHRISTMAS OR EASTER CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Put sausage, egg, cheese and mushrooms into sauce.  Put in casserole and top with bread crumbs.  Cook on high in microwave 10 to 12 minutes.  Serve on toast or English muffins.  Make day before and refrigerate.  Serves 8 to 12 people.<!><!><!>none
2928<!><!><!>FAVORITE CHRISTMAS OR EASTER CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Variations: Add curry, onions, bell pepper, sherry, ham or chicken.<!><!><!>none
2929<!><!><!>CHOCOLATE COVERED CHRISTMAS BALLS<!><!><!>Combine milk, sugar and oleo.  Add grated coconut and chopped pecans.  Roll into small balls and freeze hard.  Melt chocolate and wax in a double boiler.  Dip frozen balls into chocolate.  Let cool on waxed paper.  (Stick toothpick in ball to dip in chocolate and wax mixture.)  Let cool on waxed paper.<!><!><!>none
2930<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE<!><!><!>Rinse raisins and drain on towel.  Pour boiling water over prunes.  Let stand 10 minutes.  DRAIN DRY, use scissors and cut up.  Combine nuts, rind, all fruits.  Pour juice over and let stand.<!><!><!>none
2931<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE<!><!><!>*Mix separate.  Sift flour, salt and baking powder together. Cream shortening, sugars and eggs and spices.  Mix well and add flour mixture and vanilla.  Stir well and add to fruit.  Mix well until all fruit is evenly distributed.  Pour into loaf pans that are well lined with well greased brown paper.   Bake at 275° from 3 3/4 to 4 hours.  Makes 10 pounds.  Wrap in juice (wring out) soaked gauze (cheesecloth).  Place in foil and cool place to ripen.<!><!><!>none
2932<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS<!><!><!>In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and dressing; mix until smooth.  Add red peppers, celery, onion, olives, mix well.  Spread about 3/4 c on each tortilla.  Roll up tightly wrap in plastic wrap.  Refrigerate 2 hours; slice 1/2 inch pieces.<!><!><!>none
2933<!><!><!>BISCUIT CHRISTMAS TREE<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 450°.  Separate biscuits from two cans of biscuits.  At center top of ungreased baking sheet, place a biscuit, then make two rows of 2 below, then two rows of 3 and two rows of 4 biscuits, making "tree" shape as you go along.  Final biscuit is made into oval and placed at center bottom of base. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.  Frost while hot with light green powdered sugar glaze.  Put large whole maraschino or candied cherries in hollows where biscuits come together and cherry halve on edges and at peak of tree.  Sprinkle with green colored sugar.<!><!><!>none
2934<!><!><!>BISCUIT CHRISTMAS TREE<!><!><!>Recipe can be cut in half for a smaller tree.<!><!><!>none
2935<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER<!><!><!>In large saucepan, cook cauliflower in a small amount of water 6 to 7 minutes until crisp-tender; drain well. In medium saucepan, sauté green pepper and mushrooms in butter 2 minutes. Add flour. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Add pimientos and salt. Place half of cauliflower in a greased 2-quart baking dish. Top  with half of sauce. Repeat layers. Bake at 325° for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika.<!><!><!>none
2936<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAD<!><!><!>Grease bundt pan.  Place frozen bread rolls, 18 small squares into pan evenly.  Shake 1 small dry pudding mix over bread.  Melt butter and mix with brown sugar.  Put mixture over bread.  Shake cinnamon and pecans over rolls.  Place towel over bundt pan and set it out overnight.  In the morning, preheat oven, bake for 30 minutes in a 350° oven.  Cool for 10 minutes; turn out onto serving dish and serve.<!><!><!>none
2937<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CIDER<!><!><!>Heat to boiling point. Add remaining ingredients and simmer about 15 minutes. Strain and serve warm.<!><!><!>none
2938<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FUDGE<!><!><!>Mix sugar,  milk  and butter.  Bring to a boil.  Cook 8 minutes.  Pour  mixture  over  marshmallow  cream  and kisses. Stir  until kisses melt.  Stir in nuts.  Makes approximately 5 pounds of candy.  Great for gifts.<!><!><!>none
2939<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST<!><!><!>Spread croutons in a lightly greased 13 x 9 pan. Cook sausage well until brown, stirring to crumble. Drain well. Sprinkle sausage over croutons. Combine eggs, milk, soup, mushrooms and mustard; mix well and pour over sausage. Cover and refrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator and let stand 30 minutes. Bake uncovered at 325° for 50 to 55 minutes. Sprinkle cheese over top and bake an additional 5 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2940<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BIRD SEED<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients well. Store in airtight container.<!><!><!>none
2941<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SPREAD<!><!><!>Put beef through grinder. Place in double boiler with egg, cheese and tomato paste. Cook until mixed. Chill spread. When ready to serve, spread on crackers.<!><!><!>none
2942<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Bring 1 c. water to a boil.  Add cranberry sauce and heat until it melts.  Add jello and stir.  Add 1 c. cold water.  Chill until mixture is syrupy.  Add orange sections to jello.  Pour into ring mold.  Chill until firm.  Unmold on lettuce leaves and fill center with creamed cottage cheese.  One c. canned mandarin oranges can be used.<!><!><!>none
2943<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PICKLES<!><!><!>Wash whole cucumbers and pack tightly in wide-mouth gallon jar (glass).  Combine vinegar, alum, salt and pickling spice.  Pour this solution over cucumbers in jar.  Put lid on tight and set in a cool place for 2 weeks or more or can leave until a few weeks before Christmas.<!><!><!>none
2944<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PICKLES<!><!><!>Turn jar upside-down every few days so brine will cover pickles. When ready to use, pour off brine.  Take out cucumbers and rinse off.  Rinse out jar.  Now slice or cube the cucumbers and put back into jar.  Add 6 cups sugar.  Mix by turning or shaking the jar, so sugar will dissolve.  Put lid on tight.  Let set overnight. Can be used as soon as you desire.  Use right from the jar, no canning to do.  Can let set on counter or cabinet top or put in the refrigerator for cooler, crisp pickle taste.  Yummy!<!><!><!>none
2945<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Boil applesauce in saucepan. Stir in small jello. Mix well. Add crushed pineapple and chopped nuts. Mix well. Pour in jello mold. Chill.<!><!><!>none
2946<!><!><!>MOM'S CHRISTMAS PIE<!><!><!>Scald milk. Melt butter and blend in cornstarch, sugar and salt. Gradually add milk to melted butter mixture. Cook mixture until fairly thickened. Remove from fire; add gradually to beaten egg whites. Stir in vanilla. Pour into baked 9-inch pie shell and bake in 350° oven for 5 minutes. When cool, top with whipped cream. Garnish with chopped nuts.<!><!><!>none
2947<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Mix butter, shortening, sugar, eggs and vanilla thoroughly. Add dry ingredients, mix until the dough  is firm enough to handle. This can be used in a cookie press or rolled out and cut with cookie cutters. Decorate with powdered sugar frosting.<!><!><!>none
2948<!><!><!>BEST CHRISTMAS DRESSING<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients with plenty of broth.  Pour in large casserole dish.  Cover and bake in 350 degree oven for 1 hour.<!><!><!>none
2949<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE<!><!><!>Make batter mixing all ingredients but fruit and nuts. Stir in fruit and nuts last. Pour into lightly greased pans and bake at 300° for following time: two 9 x 5-inch loaf pans, bake for 1 hour and 45 minutes; eight 4 x 2-inch pans, bake for 55 minutes and for 48 tart size pans, bake for 20 to 25 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2950<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES AND ICING<!><!><!>Beat eggs. Add butter, sugar, milk and mix.  Mix soda and a little water (enough to stir) and add to mixture.  Sift flour and baking powder together and blend gradually into cookie mixture. Grease and flour cookie sheets.  Roll dough into 1/4 inch thickness and cut with Christmas cookie cutters and place on cookie sheets.  Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes.<!><!><!>none
2951<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES AND ICING<!><!><!>Icing:<!><!><!>none
2952<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES AND ICING<!><!><!>Sift powdered sugar and stir in milk until mixture reaches icing consistency.  Add vanilla extract for flavor and stir. Divide icing into containers and add food coloring to each container to obtain desired colors.  Ice cookies after they have cooled.  Allow icing to dry before moving cookies.<!><!><!>none
2953<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Cream sugar, shortening, eggs until fluffy. In another bowl, add nutmeg, salt, flour; stir baking soda and vinegar into milk. Then add to dry ingredients with creamed mixture, stirring briskly until well mixed, add vanilla. Drop by teaspoonful on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375°  for 10 minutes. Sprinkle top with red or green colored sugar to decorate.<!><!><!>none
2954<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Very festive during the Holiday Season.<!><!><!>none
2955<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PIE<!><!><!>Beat eggs until foamy.  Stir in hash browns, cheese, milk, onions and seasoning.  Pour into 9 inch pie tin.  Cook bacon until crisp.  Save 1 Tbsp. of fat.   Crumble bacon over egg mixture. Combine cornflakes and bacon fat.  Sprinkle over egg mixture. Cover and refrigerate over night.  Bake uncovered at 325 degrees for 50 minutes or until golden brown.<!><!><!>none
2956<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Mix sugar and oleo, then add eggs.  Dredge chopped fruit with flour. Put soda in buttermilk and mix all together.  Bake on ungreased cookie sheet at 350° for 10 to 15 minutes until slightly brown.<!><!><!>none
2957<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Mix together and drop from teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 275° until light brown. Makes about 200 cookies.<!><!><!>none
2958<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE<!><!><!>Cream butter and sugar until fluffy.  Sift dry ingredients together 3 times and mix with fruit.  Add eggs to creamed mixture. Add flour-fruit mixture alternately with next 5 ingredients and beat thoroughly.  Pour into pans lined with greased paper. Sprinkle almonds on top.  Cover cakes with greased paper.  Steam for 2 hours, then bake in slow oven 300° 1 1/2 to 2 hours, removing paper last 1/2 hour to dry surface.<!><!><!>none
2959<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Cream together butter, sugar and eggs. In separate bowl, combine flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Add flour mixture gradually to butter mixture. Mix well. Add vanilla and almond extracts.<!><!><!>none

2964<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>You may halve cookie dough and add red food coloring and 1 tablespoon milk to one half of dough and green food coloring and 1 tablespoon milk to the other half. Roll out each half to equal lengths. Braid together and cut to desired size.<!><!><!>none
2965<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Bake at 350° until done.<!><!><!>none
2966<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST<!><!><!>Brown sausage and layer sausage, bread and cheese in 9 x 13 pan. Mix together mushroom soup, eggs, mustard and milk.  Pour over other ingredients and bake for 350° for 1 hour. Top will be raised and slightly brown.  Best if fixed night before and baked in the morning.<!><!><!>none
2967<!><!><!>GRAM CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Premix Kool-Aid according to directions on pack.  Makes 1 gallon.  Pour 1/2 Kool-Aid in punch bowl.  Add 1/2 ginger ale and 1/2 sherbet.  This will make 2 punch bowls full.<!><!><!>none
2968<!><!><!>WHITE CHRISTMAS FUDGE<!><!><!>Line 8-inch square pan with foil, then grease foil. Mix sugar and milk in 3-quart saucepan. Over medium heat, add butter and bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil for another 5 minutes without stirring. On low heat, add chocolate and almond extract. Stir, then whisk until chocolate melts and mixture is smooth. Stir in dried cherries (or cranberries or apricots) and toasted almonds. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Refrigerate 2 hours until firm. Invert pan; peel off foil and cut into 1-inch squares. Garnish as desired.<!><!><!>none
2969<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Prepare 24 hours ahead of time.<!><!><!>none
2970<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Put thawed frozen hash browns in bottom of greased pan.  Beat eggs until well blended.  Add other ingredients and mix by hand well.  Pour over hash browns.  Cover and put in refrigerator.<!><!><!>none
2971<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Next morning, bake at 350° for an hour or until eggs are set.<!><!><!>none
2972<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS DANISH PUFF PASTRY<!><!><!>In a bowl, cut 1/2 cup butter into 1 cup flour.  Sprinkle the cold water over the mixture.  Stir until blended.  Shape into a ball and divide in two.  Roll each piece into a 3 x 12-inch oblong.  Place them on a baking sheet.  Spread with your favorite jam and refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
2973<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS DANISH PUFF PASTRY<!><!><!>In a saucepan, bring 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water to a rolling boil until the butter is melted.  Stir in all the flour at once.  Beat vigorously over low heat until mixture leaves the pan and forms a ball.  Remove from heat.  Beat in the eggs, one at a time.  Mixture should be smooth and satiny.  Spread over the pastries (seal the edges so that the jam will not seep out).  Bake in a 425° oven until puffed and golden (about 30 minutes).  Remove to a rack and cool.<!><!><!>none
2974<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS DANISH PUFF PASTRY<!><!><!>Icing:<!><!><!>none
2975<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS DANISH PUFF PASTRY<!><!><!>Mix these ingredients together.  Spread over pastry just before serving.<!><!><!>none
2976<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Prepare lemonade as directed, add thawed strawberries and ice cubes. Add ginger ale just before serving. Makes 1 1/2 gallons of punch.<!><!><!>none
2977<!><!><!>DICKENS CHRISTMAS GREAT CAKE<!><!><!>Sift flour with baking powder, salt, nutmeg and cinnamon. Cream butter; gradually add sifted confectioners sugar and cream until light and fluffy.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition.  Then add flour mixture alternately with extra strength coffee, beginning and ending with flour and beating after each addition until smooth (batter will look curdled).  Fold in white raisins, seedless raisins, currants, mixed candied fruit and slivered almonds.  Spread in well-greased 9-inch tube pan.  Bake in moderate 350° oven 30 minutes.  Then sprinkle almonds on top of cake.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes longer.  Simmer corn syrup and water for 1 minute and brush over top of cake to hold almonds in place and to give a gloss.  Cool cake 15 minutes in pan, then turn out on rack to finish cooling.  Cake will slice best when chilled.  Eat at room temperature.<!><!><!>none
2978<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD<!><!><!>Cook the cranberries in 3/4 cup water a few minutes, until tender.  While still hot, dissolve the gelatin and sugar in this mixture.  Let cool to lukewarm.  Add the grapes, celery, undrained crushed pineapple and nuts.  Chill in a 1 1/2 qt. ring mold. Serve with Snowy Dressing.<!><!><!>none
2979<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD<!><!><!>Snowy Dressing:<!><!><!>none
2980<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD<!><!><!>Whip the cream and whip in the softened cream cheese.  Fold in the marshmallows.<!><!><!>none
2981<!><!><!>MIMI'S CHRISTMAS WREATHS<!><!><!>Melt margarine with marshmallows. Add vanilla and food coloring. Pour over corn flakes and mix. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper. Put "red hots" or cherry halves in middle to form wreath. Chill about 40 minutes. Makes 2 dozen.<!><!><!>none
2982<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Mix shortening, brown sugar and eggs.  Add flour, soda and salt.  Then add fruits: cherries and dates, then pecans.  Chill at least one hour.  Drop by teaspoon 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheet.  Bake in 400° oven until lightly browned.<!><!><!>none
2983<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COKE-CHERRY SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve jello in juice heated from cherries and pineapple. This is all the liquid.  Add coke, cherries (or grapes), pineapple and nuts.  Grate frozen cream cheese on top.  Place in refrigerator.  Serve cold.<!><!><!>none
2984<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CRUNCHERS<!><!><!>Line baking sheets with waxed paper, coat with cooking spray. In large mixing bowl, combine pretzels, noodles and peanuts; set aside. In pot over medium heat, melt marshmallows with butter; cook, stirring until smooth. Pour over reserved pretzel mixture; stir until well coated. Coat hands with cooking spray, shape mixture into 1 1/2 in. mounds, place on baking sheets. Using fork drizzle stacks with melted candy melts.<!><!><!>none
2985<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIE CANES<!><!><!>With electric mixer, cream together butter, salt, vanilla and powdered sugar until light and fluffy. At low speed, add flour and oats until just mixed. Form dough into large or small canes. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Place cherry halves on canes and bake in a preheated 325° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly golden brown.<!><!><!>none
2986<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS OPEN HOUSE PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve water and sugar, add Kool-Aid and pineapple juice. When ready to serve, add the ginger ale.<!><!><!>none
2987<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COOKIES-SINGLE BATCH<!><!><!>Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees in a 9 x 13 pan.  Test for doneness with a toothpick.<!><!><!>none
2988<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST<!><!><!>Butter the bread and cut into cubes.  Put in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.  Brown the sausage.  Drain and crumble over the bread.  Put cheese over the sausage and bread.  Mix together eggs, half & half, salt and dry mustard.  Pour over the cheese. Cover and refrigerate overnight (8 hours).  Heat oven to 350°. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until lightly browned.  Serve with biscuits and fresh fruit.<!><!><!>none

2992<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PICKLES<!><!><!>DAY 1 - Step 1:  Slice, peel, and cut cucumbers into rings, taking out seeds.  Mix ingredients - covering rings and simmer 2 hours.  DO NOT BOIL.  Drain.<!><!><!>none

3003<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS (OR ANYTIME) COOKIES<!><!><!>In a mixing bowl, combine softened butter with sugar and cream. Add milk and flavoring. Stir in flour, candied cherries and pecans. Form in 2 rolls. Roll in coconut; wrap in wax paper and chill overnight.<!><!><!>none
3004<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS (OR ANYTIME) COOKIES<!><!><!>Slice 1/4-inch thickness; place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake in 375° oven for 12 minutes, until edges begin to brown.<!><!><!>none
3005<!><!><!>MEDITERRANEAN  CHRISTMAS BREAD<!><!><!>Dissolve yeast, 1/3 of sugar, in small bowl with warm water. In a large bowl, mix rest of sugar with cardamom, salt, egg whites, milk, and oil. Add yeast and rest of ingredients. Mix well to blend. Knead on floured board 5 minutes until smooth, elastic. Shape into ball, place in sprayed 8 inch round cake pan. Cover with damp cloth, let dough rise to double. Bake 350° 35-40 minutes until golden brown.<!><!><!>none
3006<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients in a gallon jug.  Fill remainder of jug with water.<!><!><!>none
3007<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CHILI ROLL<!><!><!>Thoroughly mix cheese with ground cheese.  Add all other ingredients and mix well.  Shape into 4 rolls.  Put chili powder on wax paper.  Wrap rolls in aluminum foil and refrigerate until used. Slice before serving or cheese can be made into balls and at room temperature can be used as spread.  Sharp cheddar cheese can be substituted instead of longhorn.<!><!><!>none
3008<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS TEA<!><!><!>Syrup:  Combine 1 quart water, sugar, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves and allspice.  Boil rapidly for at least 10 minutes.<!><!><!>none
3009<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS TEA<!><!><!>Meanwhile, steep tea bags in 6 cups water until very strong. Remove spices from syrup except for a couple cinnamon sticks.  Pour juices in with syrup in very large pan.  Use only 1/2 can of grapefruit juice.  Add tea and 1/2 teaspoon salt.  Then add apricot brandy, if desired.  Makes about 2 gallons.<!><!><!>none
3010<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Place the spices in a bag of fine cheesecloth.	Peel & cut into thin slices the lemons and oranges, mixing with the apple cider and pineapple juice.  To this add the bag of spices and bring to a very low simmering boil.  Stir as it simmers for approximately 15 minutes, then add salt and stir vigorously.  Just prior to serving, add as much rum as preferred.<!><!><!>none
3011<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS RAINBOW POKE CAKE<!><!><!>Prepare cake mix as directed on package. Pour into two 8 or 9-inch round pans. Bake as directed. Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans. Cool completely. Place cake layers, top side up, back in cleaned pans. Prick each with a utility fork at about 1/2-inch intervals. Pour 1 cup of the boiling water over the raspberry gelatin; stir until dissolved. Spoon over one layer. Repeat with lime gelatin over other layer. Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours. Dip one layer in pan of hot water for 10 seconds; invert on serving plate. Spread with 1 cup Cool Whip. Repeat with remaining layer, inverting it onto the Cool Whip. Frost with remaining Cool Whip. Refrigerate. Garnish with flattened gumdrops out to resemble holly, if desired.<!><!><!>none
3012<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY<!><!><!>In a large heavy saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup and water. Cook on medium heat until candy thermometer reads 300° (hard-crack stage), stirring occasionally.  Remove from heat.  Stir in oil and food coloring.  Pour onto a greased cookie sheet.  Cool.  Break into pieces.<!><!><!>none
3013<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY<!><!><!>Peppermint oil is available in cake decorating and candy supply stores.<!><!><!>none
3014<!><!><!>WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE<!><!><!>In saucepan, combine 1/2 cup sugar, flour and salt. Gradually stir in milk. Cook over low heat until boils 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in gelatine. Beat until smooth. Cool. Blend in flavors. Fold in whipped cream (already whipped) and carefully fold in meringue, then coconut. Put in baked pastry shell and sprinkle top with coconut. Garnish with maraschino cherries, if desired.<!><!><!>none
3015<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER<!><!><!>In a large saucepan cook cauliflower in a a small amount of water for 6 to 7 minutes until crisp and tender. Drain well. In a medium saucepan sauté bell peppers and mushrooms in butter for 2 minutes. Add flour and gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in cheese until melted. Add pimentos and salt. Place half of the cauliflower in a greased 2 quart  baking dish. Top with half of sauce. Repeat layers. Bake uncovered at 325 degrees for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with paprika if desired.<!><!><!>none
3016<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER<!><!><!>Yields 8 to 10 servings.<!><!><!>none
3017<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix equal parts pineapple juice, cranberry juice, and Sprite in a large punch bowl.<!><!><!>none
3018<!><!><!>WHITE CHRISTMAS CANDY<!><!><!>Melt candy coating over medium low heat, stirring until smooth.  Stir in peppermint candy.  Spread on waxed paper lined baking sheets; refrigerate for 8 to 10 minutes.  Break into small pieces; store in an airtight container.<!><!><!>none
3019<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS RIBBON SALAD<!><!><!>Drain cherries, reserving 1 cup juice. Chop cherries. Stir together gelatins and 2 cups boiling water until dissolved. Stir in reserved cherry juice, sugar, wine and lemon juice. Stir in cherries. Pour half of the mixture into a lightly greased 10-cup ring mold or Bundt pan. Chill 2 hours or until almost set.<!><!><!>none
3020<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS RIBBON SALAD<!><!><!>Stir together remaining Jell-O mixture, softened cream cheese and pecans. Blend well. This is the tricky part. Make sure the cream cheese is really soft and blend the Jell-O into the cream cheese a little at a time. Pour over slightly set Jell-O mixture in mold. Cover and chill 6 hours or overnight. Unmold before serving and garnish with whipped cream and/or cranberries if desired.<!><!><!>none
3021<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS<!><!><!>In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and dressing mix until smooth.  Add red pepper, celery, green onions and olives; mix well. Spread about 3/4 cup on each tortilla.  Roll up tightly; wrap in plastic wrap.  Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.  Slice into 1/2 inch pieces.<!><!><!>none
3022<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CASSEROLE COOKIES<!><!><!>Beat eggs well and gradually add sugar. Beat until fluffy. Stir in remaining ingredients. Place in a 2-quart casserole. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. While hot, stir well with a wooden spoon. Cool and form into small balls; roll in granulated sugar.<!><!><!>none
3023<!><!><!>YUGOSLAVIAN CHRISTMAS COOKIES<!><!><!>Cream butter with 1/2 cup sugar; add egg yolk and salt. Stir in flour. Pat mixture into 10 x 15 inch pan. Stir jelly over dough. Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry.  Add remaining cup of sugar, beating slowly. Fold in most of nut and the lemon extract. Spread meringue over jelly. Top with the rest of the nuts.<!><!><!>none
3024<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SCONES<!><!><!>Combine flour sugar, orange peel and baking soda. Cut in butter until resembles crumbs. Add cranberries. Add buttermilk and vanilla. Form dough into 2 equal balls. On floured surface work ball into 6 inch circle 1/2 inch thick. Cut circle into 6 wedges. Place on nonstick baking sheet, leaving 1 inch between each one. Repeat using remaining dough. Bake until lightly brown, about 10-15 minutes. Serve with whipped cream and orange marmalade. Makes 12 servings<!><!><!>none
3025<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WREATHS<!><!><!>In a 2 quart saucepan melt butter and marshmallows over moderately low heat, stirring constantly. When melted, remove from heat and stir in 1 tsp. of the food color and the vanilla. Add more food color if desired. Stir in corn flakes. Drop mixture onto waxed paper, 1 Tbsp. at a time. Decorate with red cinnamon candies. Let stand 30 minutes until cool. Makes 40 wreaths.<!><!><!>none
3026<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAD WREATH<!><!><!>Place defrosted bread in oiled bowl and cover with tea towel. Let rise in warm place 3 to 4 hours.  Punch down (do not knead). Stretch onto an oiled cookie sheet to approximately 8 1/2 x 12-inch rectangle.  Spread with soft butter or oleo.  Sprinkle with brown sugar, white sugar, cinnamon, raisins, ground nuts and candied fruits.  Roll like a jelly roll.  Wet hands and pinch ends together securely, making a large ring.  Cut with scissors every 1/2-inch around the ring.  Using hands, twist each section to lay flatter and hide the cookie sheet.  Let rise until almost double in warm place.  Bake 1/2 hour at 350° until lightly browned.<!><!><!>none
3027<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAD WREATH<!><!><!>Immediately frost with the powdered sugar, almond flavoring and small amount of milk. Decorate the top with nut halves and candied cherries. Put a large candle in the middle. Light candle and serve on large round platter.<!><!><!>none
3028<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS COFFEE CAKE<!><!><!>Dissolve yeast in water.  Cream butter and sugar.  Slowly add egg yolks and beat well.  Add yeast mixture to batter.  Combine flour and salt.  Beat slowly into the batter, alternating with the scalded milk.  Coat raisins in flour to prevent "sinking" in batter.  Add raisins and almonds to batter.  Divide into three 1 1/2-quart tube pans.  Each pan should be 1/2 full.  To rise, cover and let sit in a warm place for 3 hours.  Batter will almost double in size.  Bake at 325° for 35 minutes.  Cool 10 minutes. Remove cakes from the pans and sprinkle with confectioners sugar. Yield:  3 pans.<!><!><!>none
3029<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Cook sausage and bacon.  Mix eggs, milk, crumbled bread and cheese in a large bowl.  Add crumbled sausage and bacon.  Place in 9x13 greased dish.  Place in refrigerator overnight.  Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour.<!><!><!>none
3030<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS ROCKS<!><!><!>Mix all dried fruit and nuts in flour.  Then mix together with eggs, sugar, cinnamon and margarine.  Add drained cherries and soda.  Add some juice of red cherries, this adds taste and color.  Bake 350° for 12-15 minutes.  Let cool.<!><!><!>none
3031<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Combine apples, drained pineapple and marshmallows. Set aside. Cook the remaining ingredients, include the reserved pineapple juice, until thick. Allow the mixture to cool and pour over fruit. Do not mix. Top with coconut.<!><!><!>none
3032<!><!><!>FUDGY CHRISTMAS WREATH<!><!><!>In a saucepan over low heat, cook and stir milk and chocolate chips until chocolate melts and mixture is slightly thickened, about 6 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in nuts and vanilla. Cool until it starts to set, about 15 minutes. Line a baking sheet with waxed paper. Spoon chocolate mixture by 2 tablespoonfuls into small mounds to form a wreath. Decorate with cherries. Chill until firm. Serve chilled. Yield: about 24 servings.<!><!><!>none
3033<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WREATHS<!><!><!>Melt butter in saucepan over low heat.  Add marshmallows. cook until marshmallows melt and mixture is syrupy, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.<!><!><!>none
3034<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS WREATHS<!><!><!>Add food coloring.  Blend well.  Add cornflakes.  Stir until coated.  Divide into 1/4  c. portions on wax paper.  Shape into wreaths with buttered fingers.  Decorate with red candies.  Let stand until cool.  (May press entire warm mixture into an 8 cup buttered ring mold to make a large wreath.)<!><!><!>none
3035<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS<!><!><!>Arrange rolls in greased, fluted tube pan.  Sprinkle dry pudding mix over rolls.  Cook butter and remaining ingredients over low heat until mixture bubbles; pour over rolls.<!><!><!>none
3036<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS<!><!><!>Cover tightly with foil and let stand on countertop overnight. Next morning, bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Let stand 5 minutes, then invert carefully onto serving dish.<!><!><!>none
3037<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CHERRY TARTS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°. Grease two 1 3/4-inch tartlet or small cupcake pans. Combine graham cracker crumbs with butter or margarine; press a rounded teaspoonful of crumb mixture into each cupcake pan. Beat cream cheese, vanilla, egg and sugar until well blended. Fill each cupcake pan. Bake 10 minutes. Chill thoroughly. When ready to serve, run a thin knife around each tart and lift out of pan. Top with a pie cherry. Makes 24.<!><!><!>none
3038<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CHERRY TARTS<!><!><!>To store: Refrigerate in airtight covered container up to 1 week. Or omit cherry; wrap well, label and date. Freeze up to 3 months. To serve, thaw; top with cherry.<!><!><!>none
3039<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CRUNCH<!><!><!>Mix together all of the ingredients and spread mixture out on waxed paper. Melt almond bark in microwave and pour over mixture. Let cool and crumble up. Store in covered container.<!><!><!>none
3040<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS SALAD<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients together. Chill overnight.<!><!><!>none

3043<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS MIX<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients except chocolate. Melt white chocolate and pour over mixed ingredients. Mix all together, then spread on wax paper or cookie sheet. Once completely cooled, break into little clusters.<!><!><!>none
3044<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH<!><!><!>For carbonated punch, use Sprite or ginger ale or 7-Up in place of water.  For really sweet punch, use white grape juice in place of water.<!><!><!>none
3045<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD<!><!><!>Blend cranberries well in blender. In a mixing bowl, combine cranberries, marshmallows and sugar. Refrigerate overnight. Add apples, grapes and pecans to cranberry mixture. Mix well. Fold in whipped cream. Serve immediately. This salad looks pretty served in a glass bowl.<!><!><!>none
3046<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS NIBBLINGS<!><!><!>Melt grease and oleo and add seasonings.  Pour over other ingredients and mix well.  Mix often while baking in slow oven for 1 1/2 hours at 200°.<!><!><!>none
3047<!><!><!>BUCHE DE NOEL (CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE ROLL)<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°. Butter a 10 x 15-inch jelly roll pan. Line it with waxed paper, extending 4-inches beyond the ends of the pan. Butter the waxed paper and set it aside. Wet a towel and squeeze it until it is damp-dry.<!><!><!>none
3048<!><!><!>BUCHE DE NOEL (CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE ROLL)<!><!><!>In a large mixing bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Continue beating and adding 1/2 cup sugar slowly, until whites are stiff and glossy.<!><!><!>none
3049<!><!><!>BUCHE DE NOEL (CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE ROLL)<!><!><!>Beat yolks with 1/2 cup sugar until mixture is very thick. Beat in the walnuts, cocoa and baking powder until blended. Fold in beaten egg whites.<!><!><!>none
3050<!><!><!>BUCHE DE NOEL (CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE ROLL)<!><!><!>Pour batter into prepared pan and spread evenly. Bake at 350° for about 25 minutes, or until top is golden and a cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Immediately cover cake with slightly dampened towel. Allow cake to cool and then refrigerate. Leave towel on cake. This can be done 2 days ahead.<!><!><!>none
3051<!><!><!>BUCHE DE NOEL (CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE ROLL)<!><!><!>The day before serving, turn cake out on 2 overlapping strips of waxed paper. Remove the baking paper and trim edges of cake. Spread Chocolate Whipped Cream mixture over the cake. Using the waxed paper to help you, roll cake up from long end, ending seam side down. Sprinkle top with sifted powdered sugar to resemble snow. Serve 10-12.<!><!><!>none
