3912<!><!><!>HAMBURG-PEA SOUP<!><!><!>Put 2-inches of water in pan.  Break up hamburg.  Put into water.  Chop onion very fine.  Dice potatoes.  When hamburg is done, add juice off peas.  Add potatoes and onion.  When done, add peas.<!><!><!>none
3913<!><!><!>SOUTHWEST SOUP<!><!><!>Sauté onions; brown meat and drain. Add all the other ingredients. Season to taste with salt, pepper and garlic. Simmer for 45 minutes.<!><!><!>none
3914<!><!><!>SOUTHWEST SOUP<!><!><!>I usually put this in a crock-pot when I get up and it is ready when I come in. You may add mixed vegetables (Veg-All) and some pasta, noodles, macaroni, etc. Serve with grated cheese and corn bread. Makes 6 to 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
3915<!><!><!>POTATO-LEEK SOUP<!><!><!>Melt margarine. Sauté leeks and celery. Pour in chicken broth and water. Add potatoes and parsley. Simmer 1 hour. Add milk and simmer 15 minutes. Blend flour into 1/4 cup water and stir into soup. Simmer another 15 minutes, stirring frequently.<!><!><!>none
3916<!><!><!>POTATO-LEEK SOUP<!><!><!>Notice that I never put a high heat under this.  It takes longer to cook, but it does not stick on the bottom.<!><!><!>none
3917<!><!><!>SLOW COOKER TACO SOUP<!><!><!>Brown ground beef and drain. Combine all ingredients in a slow cooker and cook on low setting for 8 hours.<!><!><!>none
3918<!><!><!>POTATO SOUP<!><!><!>Cut potatoes in small cubes.  Pour in water and cook until tender on low heat.  Put milk, salt, pepper, chives and butter in and bring to a slow boil.  Cook for approximately 3 minutes.  Good plain or garnished with grated cheese.<!><!><!>none
3919<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY SOUP<!><!><!>Blend all ingredients well and serve cold.<!><!><!>none
3920<!><!><!>PASTA SOUP<!><!><!>Sauté onion in a little oil.  Add carrots and squash.  Cook 5 minutes.  Add garlic and dried seasonings.  Add all cans; simmer 30 minutes.  Add pasta and fresh basil; cook 15 minutes.  Sprinkle with fresh Parmesan/Romano cheese.<!><!><!>none
3921<!><!><!>HEARTY SPANISH SOUP<!><!><!>Start the meat in cold water.  Make a rich broth by cooking it slowly with garlic, onion, pepper and salt.  When the meat is tender, strain off broth.  Add the vegetables (corn last) and cook slowly until done.  Add the meat, cut in cubes, to the soup.  If extra piquancy is desired, you may serve this with jalapeno sauce. Pick the corn up with fingers.<!><!><!>none
3922<!><!><!>SHRIMP SOUP<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients and heat thoroughly.  Garnish with chives or parsley.  Serves a large group.<!><!><!>none
3923<!><!><!>MOCK DUCK SOUP<!><!><!>Cook spareribs covered with water until it boils.  Spill this water out; rinse ribs and start again the same way, adding the onion, prunes and rest of ingredients except flour and vinegar. Cook until meat is tender.  Strain soup.  Put broth aside.  Put all except meat through a sieve.  Put pulp back in broth.  Mix flour, sour cream and vinegar in blender, then add to broth (while cooking).  Cook to near boil.  Serve with noodles.<!><!><!>none
3924<!><!><!>SWEET POTATO SOUP<!><!><!>Place potatoes, leeks or onions, carrots, celery and water in large kettle.  Add salt and pepper.  Bring to boil and simmer for 40 minutes.  With slotted spoon remove half of the carrots and celery and some of the firmer potato pieces and reserve.  Puree the remainder of soup until smooth.  Return to kettle and add reserved vegetables, margarine, milk, seed and tarragon.  Reheat and check seasonings.<!><!><!>none
3925<!><!><!>SANTA FE SOUP<!><!><!>You will need a crock-pot. (I cook in larger pan and then transfer to crock-pot; faster.)<!><!><!>none
3926<!><!><!>SANTA FE SOUP<!><!><!>Cook hamburger and onions. Add all ingredients except cheese (do not drain vegetables; use juice). Heat meat and vegetables until ingredients are hot. Cut up cheese in smaller squares and add after the rest is hot. Stir frequently until melted.<!><!><!>none
3927<!><!><!>SANTA FE SOUP<!><!><!>I serve with saltine crackers; could use corn chips or Doritos.<!><!><!>none
3928<!><!><!>SENATE BEAN SOUP<!><!><!>Wash and drain beans.  Put in large kettle with 6 cups water. Bring to a boil and boil 2 minutes.  Remove from heat, cover and let stand for 1 hour.  Add 2 1/2 quarts water, bring to a boil, cover and simmer 2 hours or until beans are mushy.  Add margarine, potatoes, celery, onion, garlic and 3 teaspoons salt.  Cover and simmer about 1 hour, stirring occasionally.  Add more water if necessary to make a thick soup, then add pepper and more salt if necessary.  Sprinkle parsley over each serving of soup when ready to serve.  Yields 4 1/2 quarts.<!><!><!>none
3929<!><!><!>BLUEBERRY SOUP<!><!><!>Rinse the blueberries and remove any stems, leaves or green berries.  Put the berries in a kettle and add the water, cloves and cinnamon stick.  Set over moderate heat and bring to a boil.  Stir in honey; reduce heat and simmer, partially covered, until berries are very tender, about 5 minutes.  Remove from heat and cool to room temperature.  Force the soup through a strainer or through the medium blade of a food mill.  Stir in lemon juice, creme de cassis and vinegar.  Cover and refrigerate for at least 6 hours.  Serve in chilled bowls, garnished with a few whole blueberries, a dollop of plain yogurt and a sprinkle of grated orange rind.  Serves 6.<!><!><!>none
3930<!><!><!>BROCCOLI SOUP<!><!><!>Add all ingredients to large saucepan and cook over medium heat until creamy.<!><!><!>none
3931<!><!><!>EASY BROCCOLI SOUP<!><!><!>Precook broccoli according to pkg. directions. Sauté onion in butter; add cheese and let melt. Add soups and milk (use soup can to measure milk). Keep stirring to prevent sticking. Add cooked broccoli. Serve with crackers.<!><!><!>none
3932<!><!><!>LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP<!><!><!>In stockpot, add first 9 ingredients.  Cook and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes.  Combine flour and milk. Stir until smooth.  Add to soup and bring to a boil, stirring often.  Remove pot from heat and add cheese.  Place lid on pot and let sit for 3 or 4 minutes.  Stir until cheese is melted completely.  Add sour cream and stir together until completely blended.<!><!><!>none
3933<!><!><!>BLACK BEAN AND VEGETABLE SOUP<!><!><!>In large saucepan or Dutch oven, cook onion in oil until tender.  Add tomatoes, picante sauce and seasonings.  Stir in beans, peppers, and squash; cover and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes.  Makes about 8 (1 cup) servings.<!><!><!>none
3934<!><!><!>BLACK BEAN AND VEGETABLE SOUP<!><!><!>Suggested toppings: Steamed rice, sour cream, chopped cilantro or parsley, shredded cheese.<!><!><!>none
3935<!><!><!>LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP<!><!><!>Dice unpeeled red potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes.  Place in a large dutch oven, cover with water and bring to a boil.  Boil for 10 min. or until 3/4 cooked.  In a separate large dutch oven, combine melted margarine and flour, mixing until smooth.  Place over low heat and gradually add Half and Half, stirring constantly. Continue to stir until smooth and liquid begins to thicken.<!><!><!>none
3936<!><!><!>LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP<!><!><!>Add melted Velveeta.  Stir well.  Drain potatoes and add to cream mixture.  Stir in pepper, garlic powder, and tabasco.  Cover and cook over low heat for 30 min., stirring occasionally.<!><!><!>none
3937<!><!><!>LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP<!><!><!>Place soup into serving bowls and top with crumbled bacon, shredded cheese, chives and parsley.<!><!><!>none
3938<!><!><!>TACO SOUP<!><!><!>Brown meat and onions. Add all other ingredients and bring to a boil for 4 to 5 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Serve with Cheddar cheese, chopped green onions and crushed tortilla chips on top. Freezes well.<!><!><!>none
3939<!><!><!>CHILI CHEESE SOUP<!><!><!>This is the quickest, easiest soup to make and it is wonderful, thick and hearty.<!><!><!>none
3940<!><!><!>CHILI CHEESE SOUP<!><!><!>Bring water to a boil and add the potatoes from the au gratin box.  Cook until tender.   Add the package of cheese mix, stir well to blend - making sure all of the powder is dissolved.  Add the cheddar cheese soup, margarine, milk and the chili.  Stir well, let simmer for about 10 minutes.  Add salt and pepper to taste.<!><!><!>none
3941<!><!><!>CHILI CHEESE SOUP<!><!><!>Takes about 30 minutes to prepare, makes about 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
3942<!><!><!>SWEDISH BEAN AND BACON SOUP<!><!><!>Cook bacon in a 5-quart pot over medium heat 5 minutes or until crisp.  Drain on paper towels.  Pour off all but 1 tablespoon fat.  Sauté onion in fat 4 minutes or until soft.  Add broth plus 1 extra cup water, the carrots, bacon, marjoram, allspice and bay leaf.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover and simmer 10 minutes.  Add remaining ingredients and boil gently 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender.  Discard bay leaf.  Top servings with sour cream.<!><!><!>none
3943<!><!><!>CREAMY PUMPKIN SOUP<!><!><!>Cook bacon until crisp; crumble and set aside.  In a saucepan, sauté onion and garlic in 1 tablespoon bacon drippings until tender.  In blender or food processor, puree pumpkin, flour, 1/3 cup milk and onion mixture; add to pan.  Add broth, spices, and remaining milk. Bring to boil over medium heat.  Boil for 2 minutes.  Top servings with dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with bacon.  Serve with rolls, fruit, and cheese.  Serves 6-8.<!><!><!>none
3944<!><!><!>FRENCH ONION SOUP<!><!><!>Brown onions in butter. Add consomme, pepper, thyme, salt and water. Simmer for 1 hour.<!><!><!>none
3945<!><!><!>FRENCH ONION SOUP<!><!><!>Pinch tops and sides of bread and line each individual bowl with 5 to 6 pieces of the bread. Fill bowls with soup, then place a slice of Swiss cheese on each. Sprinkle with Parmesan and paprika just before baking. Bake at 400° until brown, usually at least 15 to 20 minutes.<!><!><!>none
3946<!><!><!>SOUTHERN CORN SOUP<!><!><!>Melt butter and stir in flour.  Add milk, bouillon or soup stock and corn.  Season with salt and pepper.  Boil 5 minutes and serve in bouillon cups with popcorn floating on top.  Croutons can be used in place of popcorn.  Serves 4.<!><!><!>none
3947<!><!><!>HOMEMADE VEGETABLE SOUP<!><!><!>Cook stew beef 1 hour.  Add remaining ingredients with the exception of cream-style yellow corn. Cook 1 additional hour.  Add cream-style yellow corn and cook extra 15 minutes.  Stir almost constantly to keep cream-style corn from settling to the bottom and scorching.<!><!><!>none
3948<!><!><!>SWEET AND SOUR CABBAGE SOUP<!><!><!>Put the soup bones in a heavy saucepan.  Add the shredded cabbage and water.  Add the tomatoes, onions, apple and raisins. Add the lemon juice, brown sugar, salt and pepper.  Stir.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer for 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.  Makes 6 to 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
3949<!><!><!>BARLEY SOUP<!><!><!>In large pan, melt butter or margarine.  Add celery, onion and barley; sauté for 5 minutes.  Turn down heat and quickly stir in flour.  Add chicken broth.  Bring to boil.  Lower heat; cover and simmer for 1 hour, until barley is tender.  Just before serving, add chopped parsley, thyme and sour cream or evaporated milk.<!><!><!>none
3950<!><!><!>YELLOW ONION SOUP<!><!><!>Sauté the onions in the butter for a moment.  Sprinkle them with the flour and as soon as they start to brown, stir in the stock.  Add salt and pepper to taste and cook for about 20 minutes.<!><!><!>none
3951<!><!><!>YELLOW ONION SOUP<!><!><!>Put grated cheese in bottom of serving bowls and serve.<!><!><!>none
3952<!><!><!>WILD RICE SOUP<!><!><!>Combine soup and cheese; heat over low heat until cheese is melted. Cook bacon and onions together. Drain on paper towels. Break bacon into small pieces. Add to soup mixture. Add half and half; simmer over low heat for 1/2 hour.<!><!><!>none
3953<!><!><!>WILD RICE SOUP<!><!><!>Note: Can also be made in a crock-pot.<!><!><!>none
3954<!><!><!>FRENCH ONION SOUP<!><!><!>Slice onions.  Melt butter in a 4-quart Dutch oven.  Slowly cook onions in butter until lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Add bouillon cubes, water and wine to onions.  Cover and simmer 2 hours, stirring occasionally.  Add Worcestershire sauce, salt and white and black peppers to soup.  Stir.  Shred cheese.<!><!><!>none
3955<!><!><!>FRENCH ONION SOUP<!><!><!>To serve soup, place a thin slice of French bread into the bottom of each individual ovenware serving bowl.  Ladle soup into bowls.  Top with layer of shredded cheese.  Place under broiler until cheese melts.  Serve at once.<!><!><!>none
3956<!><!><!>FRENCH ONION SOUP<!><!><!>Slice onions.  Melt butter in a 4-quart Dutch oven.  Slowly cook onions in butter until lightly browned, about 20 minutes.  Add bouillon cubes, water and chicken broth to onions.  Cover and simmer 2 hours, stirring occasionally.  Add Worcestershire sauce, salt and white and black peppers to soup.  Stir.  Shred cheese.<!><!><!>none
3957<!><!><!>FRENCH ONION SOUP<!><!><!>To  serve soup, place a thin slice of French bread into the bottom  of  each individual ovenware serving bowl.  Ladle soup into  bowls.  Top  with layer of shredded cheese.  Place under broiler until cheese melts.  Serve at once.<!><!><!>none
3958<!><!><!>BROCCOLI AND CHEESE SOUP<!><!><!>Heat water and bouillon cube to boiling. Add broccoli and carrot and cook according to directions on broccoli box. Remove from heat. Don't drain. In pan that you are going to make soup in, make white sauce by melting margarine and slowly stirring in flour. Continue stirring while slowly adding milk. Continue stirring until lumps are gone. Stir soup in bowl until smooth. Add to milk. Stir. Add cheese, onion, Worcestershire, salt and pepper. Cook on medium-low. Stir often until cheese is melted. Add broccoli and carrot mixture to this. Cook over low heat until thickens. Be careful or it will stick to pan. Serve with crackers or cornbread.<!><!><!>none
3959<!><!><!>FRENCH MARKET SOUP MIX<!><!><!>Combine all beans.  Divide into 14 (2 cup) packages for gift giving.<!><!><!>none
3960<!><!><!>FRENCH MARKET SOUP<!><!><!>Sort and wash bean mix; place in Dutch oven.  Cover with water 2 inches above beans; soak overnight.  Drain beans; add 2 quarts water, ham hock, salt and pepper.  Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 1/2 hours until beans are tender.  Add remaining ingredients; simmer 30 minutes.  Stir occasionally. Remove ham hock, take meat from bone, chop and return to soup. Yields 2 1/2 quarts.<!><!><!>none
3961<!><!><!>CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP<!><!><!>Sauté onion in margarine.  Add chicken broth and bring to boil.  Add noodles and cook for 5 minutes.  Add milk and broccoli and cheese, simmer for 8 minutes.  Add pepper and garlic powder to taste.<!><!><!>none
3962<!><!><!>SLICED PANCAKE SOUP<!><!><!>Make a smooth paste of the cold milk and flour.  Stir in the egg and salt.  Heat enough fat in an omelette pan to cover the bottom of the pan; spoon into the pan enough batter to cover the bottom thinly and evenly.  Fry until crisp on both sides.  Add more fat before frying each pancake.  When cold, the pancakes are rolled up individually and cut into thin strips.  Add to hot beef broth.<!><!><!>none
3963<!><!><!>LENTIL AND FRANKFURTER SOUP<!><!><!>About 2 hours before serving, in 5-quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat in hot salad oil, cook frankfurters until lightly browned on all sides, stirring frequently.  With slotted spoon, remove frankfurters to bowl; cover and refrigerate.  In drippings remaining in Dutch oven over medium heat, cook celery, red pepper, carrot, onion and garlic until tender, about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Meanwhile, rinse lentils in running cold water and discard any stones or shriveled lentils.  Add lentils, pepper, bouillon, 11 cups water and 1 teaspoon salt to vegetable mixture in Dutch oven.  Over high heat, heat to boiling.  Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 1 hour or until lentils are very tender and soup has thickened.  Return frankfurters to Dutch oven and cook until done.<!><!><!>none
3964<!><!><!>SENATE BEAN SOUP<!><!><!>Clean and soak beans overnight.  Drain.  Add water, ham bone, ground ham, celery salt, and onion.  Cook beans until very soft. Remove bone.  Press remaining meat from bone and add to soup.  Add mustard and onion.  Simmer until the desired tenderness to beans is reached.  Serves: 8 to 10.<!><!><!>none
3965<!><!><!>MEXICAN TAMALE SOUP<!><!><!>Brown meat, onion and pepper. To this, add beef broth, tomatoes, corn, beans and seasonings. Simmer 1/2 hour; just before serving, put in cornstarch. Also, just before serving, cut tamales in 1-inch pieces. Heat and serve.<!><!><!>none
3966<!><!><!>CREAM OF ROASTED GARLIC SOUP<!><!><!>Place garlic heads on cookie sheet, sprinkle with olive oil and bake in 350° oven about 1 hour.  Let cool.  Cut off end of each clove and squeeze out contents; set aside.  Sauté onion and leeks in the butter until tender and translucent. Stir flour into onion mixture until all butter is absorbed and continue to cook the mixture over low heat for 4-5 minutes, stirring constantly. Slowly add chicken stock, stirring with wire whisk until smooth, and bring mixture to a simmer. Process potatoes in a blender or food processor.  Add to soup, mixing thoroughly.  Finish the soup by adding the cognac and the cream, and seasoning to taste with salt and white pepper.  Heat thoroughly. Serve immediately garnished with croutons.  Yield:  2 quarts.<!><!><!>none
3967<!><!><!>CRAWFISH SOUP<!><!><!>Wash crawfish; pat dry and sprinkle with Tony's seasoning. Sauté vegetables in 1 stick of oleo. Add crawfish and cook. Add soup and corn; cook about 10 minutes. Add milk, salt and pepper to taste; simmer 10 minutes. Serve over rice with crackers.<!><!><!>none
3968<!><!><!>CRAWFISH SOUP<!><!><!>Tip: Soup is better if made early so that seasonings can blend.<!><!><!>none
3969<!><!><!>SPICY POTATO SOUP<!><!><!>In a Dutch oven or large pot, brown ground beef and onion; drain. Add potatoes and tomato sauce. Stir in water, salt, pepper and hot pepper sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour or until potatoes are tender and the soup has thickened.<!><!><!>none
3970<!><!><!>CORN, CRAWFISH AND POTATO SOUP<!><!><!>Saut butter and onions until tender. Add cream of potato soup and creamed corn; mix well. Cook for about 5 to 10 minutes over medium heat. Add crawfish, half and half and all spices, stirring until well blended. Cook 20 to 30 minutes over medium to low heat, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.<!><!><!>none
3971<!><!><!>KIELBASA SOUP<!><!><!>Add all ingredients except potatoes to the boiling water. When water boils again, reduce to medium heat and simmer for 1-1/2 hours. When carrots are tender, add potatoes. Cook until potatoes are tender.<!><!><!>none
3972<!><!><!>KIELBASA SOUP<!><!><!>Serve with a crusty bread and butter.<!><!><!>none
3973<!><!><!>FRUIT PUNCH SLUSH<!><!><!>Combine bananas and frozen fruit juices in blender; blend until smooth.  Combine banana mixture, pineapple juice, water and sugar in large mixing bowl; mix well.  Pour into plastic freezer containers or molds and freeze.  To serve, thaw until mushy and add carbonated beverage.  Garnish with orange slices.  Yields 6 quarts.<!><!><!>none
3974<!><!><!>RUSSIAN TEA (NON-ALCOHOLIC DRINK)<!><!><!>Mix thoroughly and store in airtight container.  (Will keep indefinitely.)  Use 2 teaspoons Russian tea to 1 cup boiling water.  May be served hot or chilled.<!><!><!>none
3975<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Heat first 3 ingredients until Jell-O and sugar are dissolved. Then add remaining ingredients.  Freeze in small portions.  When ready to use, scrape into a slush.  Add 4 or 5 quarts ginger ale or 7-Up.  Use flavor of Jell-O for color desired.<!><!><!>none
3976<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Heat sugar and water until dissolves, then add remaining ingredients.  Combine all and freeze.  Serve (melt until slushy). Add equal amount of 7-Up or ginger ale and slush.<!><!><!>none
3977<!><!><!>AFRICAN SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Boil sugar and 6 cups  of water in a large saucepan for 3 minutes; let cool.	Mash  bananas  in blender and combine in large container with fruit  juices and 6 ounces of water.  Add sugar mixture and blend  well.  Freeze  for at least 24 hours. Remove from freezer 1  hour  before  serving.  Mash to a pulp. Add ginger ale; mix and serve.  Serves 8 to 10 people.<!><!><!>none
3978<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix jello according to directions.  To this add sugar, lemon juice and pineapple juice.  Put into containers such as margarine tubs and freeze.  Put in the punch bowl.  Add ginger ale or 7-Up. We prefer strawberry over cherry jello.<!><!><!>none
3979<!><!><!>BANANA SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Blend pineapple and bananas until smooth.  Add water, sugar, lemonade and orange juice.  Freeze.  Remove 30 minutes before serving.  Then add cold ginger ale.<!><!><!>none
3980<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix Jell-O with sugar; dissolve with water.   Add lemonade (with water added as directed on can).   Add pineapple juice. Freeze in Ziploc bags.   Thaw about 4 hours before serving.  Mix ginger ale with slushy mixture when ready to serve.<!><!><!>none
3981<!><!><!>YUMMY SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Bring the water and sugar to a full boil. Stir in the Koolaid. In a blender, mix together the bananas and pineapple to a smooth consistency. Add to first mixture, then add in pineapple juice. Freeze. To serve mix with 7-Up or Sprite. Makes 6-7 quarts.<!><!><!>none
3982<!><!><!>YUMMY SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>NOTE: You can also freeze the mixture in ice cube trays for individual servings. Just put a couple in each glass then add soda pop.<!><!><!>none
3983<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Boil sugar in water for 3 minutes.  Add jello and dissolve. Add juices and stir well.  Pour into milk cartons and freeze. Remove from freezer 2 hours before serving.  When ready to serve, add 1 quart of ginger ale to 1/2 gallon of punch.  Mix to slush.<!><!><!>none
3984<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Boil sugar and water.  Stir in orange juice, pineapple juice and bananas.  Freeze in milk cartons until ready to serve.  Tear open cartons.  Pour frozen mixture in punch bowl.  Add 2 liters (or more) 7-Up.<!><!><!>none
3985<!><!><!>SPICED ORANGE TEA DRINK<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients.  Makes nice gifts in decorated canisters.<!><!><!>none
3986<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Simmer sugar and 1 cup water until sugar is dissolved.  Add all the juices and freeze.  Take out 2 hours before serving.  Mix 1 quart sour or Squirt with 1 pint of the slush mixture.<!><!><!>none
3987<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Boil 2 cups boiling water and sugar for 3 minutes and set aside. Let cool. Mix Jell-O and water well until dissolved. Set aside and let cool. Mix pineapple juice, lemonade and 3 cans cold water well. After everything is cooled, mix all ingredients together and freeze. Let stand out 2 to 3 hours before using and then mix with Sprite.<!><!><!>none
3988<!><!><!>FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Put bananas, lemon juice and strawberries in blender. Blend until smooth. Add to thawed grape juice and pineapple juice in a large bowl. Heat sugar and 6 cups water until sugar dissolves (do not boil). Add to fruit mixture. Mix well and freeze.<!><!><!>none
3989<!><!><!>FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>To Serve: Thaw slightly and pour Sprite or ginger ale over this. Don't use too much liquid. Punch should be thick and slushy. Make at least 3 or 4 days before serving. Can be refrozen. Will make 40 to 50 punch cups. Will keep in freezer 2 or 3 months.<!><!><!>none
3990<!><!><!>ORANGE SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve jello and sugar in boiling water.  Add 4 cups cold water and 2 cans pineapple juice.<!><!><!>none

3998<!><!><!>FRUIT TEA PUNCH<!><!><!>Make a syrup of sugar and water in a large saucepan.  Add tea, fruit juice and water (enough to make 1 1/2 gallons).  Add ginger ale just before serving.  May freeze all ingredients, except ginger ale.  Serves 50.<!><!><!>none
3999<!><!><!>CRAN-GRAPE-TEA PUNCH<!><!><!>Pour boiling water over tea bags and spices; cover and let stand for 5 minutes.  Remove tea bags, squeezing gently.  Remove and discard spices.  Add fruit juices and sugar; stir mixture until sugar dissolves.  Serve hot or cold.  Yield: 5 cups.<!><!><!>none
4000<!><!><!>BREAKFAST SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Boil sugar and water.  Add pineapple, orange and lemon juices. Freeze in containers.  Set out about 1 hour before time to use. Place in punch bowl; pour chilled ginger ale over punch.  Small slices of lime and lemon can be frozen in mixture.  Accent with mint.<!><!><!>none
4001<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve Jell-O in hot water.  Add remaining ingredients, mixing well.  Freeze until firm overnight or all day.  Serves 50.<!><!><!>none
4002<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Combine sugar and water in a saucepan; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until sugar dissolves.  Combine sugar mixture, pineapple juice and next 2 ingredients in a large container; freeze.  Remove from freezer 1 hour before serving.  Place in a punch bowl and break into chunks; add ginger ale.  Stir until slushy.  Yields 5 1/2 quarts.<!><!><!>none
4003<!><!><!>COLD TEA PUNCH<!><!><!>Steep tea.  Mix other ingredients.  Put in gallon container and finish filling with cold water.<!><!><!>none
4004<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve jello in hot water and add sugar. Stir in lemonade and cold water.  Add pineapple juice.  Pour into container and freeze.  Thaw 2 hours before needed.  Add ginger ale and mix in punch bowl.  Makes 4 quarts or 64 cups.<!><!><!>none
4005<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Bring sugar and 2 cups water to boil.  Add jello and allow to cool.  Add the rest of the water, almond extract and pineapple juice.  Mix well and freeze.  Remove from the freezer 4 hours before serving.  The mixture will become slushy.  Do not thaw too much.  Add ginger ale and serve.<!><!><!>none
4006<!><!><!>FRIENDSHIP TEA OR SPICED TEA<!><!><!>Mix all together.  Use 2 teaspoons to a cup of boiling water.<!><!><!>none
4007<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Heat sugar and water until dissolved.  Cool.  Blend bananas in blender.  Add dissolved sugar water, blended bananas, mixed orange juice, lemon juice or ReaLemon, pineapple juice and water.  Mix and freeze, stirring when about half frozen.  Take from freezer; let set out short while.  Then mix half and half with 7-Up in your blender.  Serve.<!><!><!>none
4008<!><!><!>50TH ANNIVERSARY PUNCH SLUSH<!><!><!>Freeze pineapple juice and set out about an hour before serving.  Add all the ingredients together to make mixture (should be slush).  Serves about 150.<!><!><!>none
4009<!><!><!>BANANA SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Heat sugar and water until sugar melts.  Mix together all ingredients.  Freezes 8 hours.  Thaw 2 hours before serving.  Add 2 quarts of ginger ale.  (I have kept frozen longer.)<!><!><!>none
4010<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve jello as directed on package.  Add frozen limeade diluted to make 1 quart.  Do the lemonade also the same way.  Put in freezer and freeze.  Just before serving add the ginger ale. May add ice cubes if you like.<!><!><!>none
4011<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Steep tea bags in 2 cups boiling water. Boil sugar in 6 cups of water and cool. Combine tea, sugar water, lemonade, and orange juice. Add bourbon. Mix and freeze 24 hours or serve with ice.<!><!><!>none
4012<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix together sugar, Jell-O and water, stir until dissolved, and add pineapple juice.  Pour into containers and freeze for at least 24 hr.  (Plastic milk jugs work well).  Take out of freezer at least 1 hr. before using.  Empty container into a large punch bowl; break mixture into chunks with a wooden spoon.  Add sprite or ginger ale; mix to a slushy consistency.  Makes a wonderful punch. Can add crushed pineapple or frozen strawberries when pouring in the pineapple juice.<!><!><!>none
4013<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve jello in hot water. Add Kool-Aid, sugar, lemon juice, pineapple juice and water. Freeze. Remove from freezer 2 or 3 hours before serving and flake with a fork until slushy.<!><!><!>none
4014<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix all but pop.  Freeze thoroughly in large Tupperware container.  Remove from freezer 1/2 hour before serving.  Scoop or scrape into punch bowl as much as desired.  Pour pop over and slightly mash with potato masher.  Serve thick or thin.  Add pop and scoop mixture as needed.  Keeps in freezer for a few months. Just use leftovers as desired.<!><!><!>none
4015<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Use 1/2 water to melt lemonade. With other 1/2 water add to sugar in saucepan and heat to dissolve. Add to lemonade, then add juice. Put in large mouth container. Freeze to a slush. Add ginger ale when you start to serve.<!><!><!>none

4019<!><!><!>PARTY PUNCH (SLUSH)<!><!><!>Mix box of jello with hot water.  Add cold water and pineapple juice.  Freeze.  Take out 1 hour before party.  Add 1 liter ginger ale when thawed enough to stir.  Stir again 15 minutes before served.  Makes a slush.<!><!><!>none

Place in freezer bags and store in freezer until ready to use. Makes 2 gallons.<!><!><!>none

4102<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve all ingredients in hot  water;  add to 1 large unsweetened pineapple juice in a gallon container; finish with water.  Freeze to slush and serve with vanilla ice milk.<!><!><!>none
4103<!><!><!>FROZEN SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix Jell-O (flavor of Jell-O for color of punch) with boiling water in large container.  Cool.  Bring 4 cups of water and 4 cups of sugar to a boil in a saucepan.  Cool and add to Jell-O mixture. Pour in pineapple juice and lemon juice and stir well.  Pour into 2 gallon plastic milk containers and freeze.  Thaw for 4 hours. Cut top off plastic milk containers and pour into large punch bowl.  Slush and add 2 bottles of ginger ale to each gallon of punch.<!><!><!>none
4104<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix all and freeze.  Take out of freezer 2 hours before serving at room temperature.  Add 2 quarts of ginger ale slowly just before serving.  Should be slushy.<!><!><!>none
4105<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix the first 5 ingredients and freeze.  When ready to serve, put in punch bowl and add the 7-Up.  This recipe makes 75 servings.<!><!><!>none
4106<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve jello in 2 cups boiling water.  Add sugar, cold water and pineapple juice.  Freeze in gallon size Ziploc freezer bags. Thaw 1 hour before serving.  Add 7-Up and more pineapple juice, if desired.  Makes 30 (1/2 cup) servings.<!><!><!>none
4107<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve Jell-O in 4 cups boiling water.  Add sugar with 8 cups water and boil 3 minutes.  Add pineapple and orange juice. Freeze.  Thaw 2 1/2 hours before serving.  Add 2 quarts of ginger ale to each gallon.  (Add 2 packages of Kool-Aid, same flavor as Jell-O used, to make a richer and deeper color, if desired.)<!><!><!>none
4108<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix,  serve  over  ice  or  freeze  to  make slush.  If frozen, add chilled Sprite when ready to serve.<!><!><!>none
4109<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve Jell-O in hot water, then add other ingredients, stirring as you add them.  Set in freezer for approximately 8 to 9 hours.  Stir hourly after the first 4 hours.  This recipe makes 1 gallon and 8 gallons serves 150 people.<!><!><!>none
4110<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Bring to boil water and sugar to make a simple syrup.  Cool. Mix all ingredients except ginger ale and freeze in 3 half gallon milk cartons.  When ready to serve, mix with ginger ale in punch bowl (1 milk carton of punch mixture to 2 or 3 tall bottles ginger ale).  Can be made ahead and used as needed.<!><!><!>none
4111<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix Jell-O and water.  Add sugar and stir well.  Add juice and enough water to equal one gallon.  Freeze to make slush. Shake occasionally to make a slush.<!><!><!>none
4112<!><!><!>GALA SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>In a blender or food processor, place half of the cut up grapefruit. Cover and process until nearly smooth; strain into a large bowl. Repeat with remaining grapefruit. Add half of the carbonated beverage (about 4 cups) to the grapefruit juice. Stir in the sugar until dissolved. Pour into a 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Cover and freeze 4 to 5 hours or until nearly firm, stirring 3 times during the freezing time.<!><!><!>none
4113<!><!><!>GALA SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>To serve, spoon sherbet and grapefruit mixture into a punch bowl. Pour in remaining carbonated beverage. Serve immediately. Makes 16 (1-cup) servings.<!><!><!>none

4118<!><!><!>GINGER TEA PUNCH<!><!><!>Place tea bags and ginger in a tea pot. Add 4 1/2 cups boiling water. Cover; let steep 3 to 5 minutes or until desired strength. Remove tea bags. Stir in sugar. Cool at room temperature 2 hours. Cover and chill until ready to serve.<!><!><!>none

4140<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix and dissolve jello, sugar and hot water.  Add pineapple juice, lemon and cold water.  Mix well.  Freeze in 3 portions in plastic containers. 4152<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Let frozen strawberries thaw and mix strawberries, orange juice and pineapple juice together.  Re-freeze mixture. Add ginger ale or 7-Up until punch is desired consistency.  Serve immediately.  Makes 1 gallon.<!><!><!>none

4196<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>May use any flavor gelatin.  Dissolve jello in 5 cups boiling water.  Add all other ingredients.  Freeze.  Keeps well. Makes at least 150 punch cups.<!><!><!>none
4197<!><!><!>FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>In a blender mix bananas, orange juice and lemonade.  In a gallon container mix water, sugar and pineapple juice.  Stir in banana mixture.  Freeze mixture.  About 3 hours before serving, take out of freezer to thaw.  Add Sprite immediately before serving.  Serves 25 to 30 people.<!><!><!>none
4198<!><!><!>CARDINAL PUNCH (NON-ALCOHOLIC DRINK)<!><!><!>Combine juices with ice and chill.  Pour into punch bowl over block of ice; add ginger ale.  Garnish glasses with mint sprig. (May add orange sherbet scoops.)<!><!><!>none
4199<!><!><!>TEA DRINK<!><!><!>Soak tea bags overnight.  Add sugar, lemon juice extract and ginger ale.  Add enough water to make a gallon (about 2 quarts plus 1 cup water).<!><!><!>none
4200<!><!><!>WATERMELON SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Boil sugar and water until clear and sugar is dissolved; set aside.  In blender, blend watermelon, salt, lemon juice, food coloring and lime juice.  Add sugar syrup.  Freeze at least 24 hours.  Break into chunks and place in glasses.  Pour 7-Up over chunks, blending in slush.<!><!><!>none
4201<!><!><!>BANANA SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>In a blender, dissolve 4 cups sugar in 6 cups hot water (add food coloring, if desired).  Add juices directly from the cans; add cut up bananas and pineapple.  Freeze.  To serve, put the frozen mixture into a punch bowl.  Pour ginger ale over it and mix slowly so mixture becomes slushy.  Yield:  60 servings.<!><!><!>none

4207<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Freeze for 16 to 20 hours. If using soon, stir every few hours or freeze and when ready to use, thaw out overnight.  Keep stirred to give it the slush texture.  Will keep frozen for several months.<!><!><!>none
4208<!><!><!>FRUIT SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve Jell-O and sugar in boiling water.  Add lemonade, water, pineapple juice plus water.  Freeze solid.  Remove 3 hours before serving.  Crush as you can.  Add 2 liter bottles 7-Up.<!><!><!>none
4209<!><!><!>BEST EVER SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients in an empty ice cream pail.  Mix well and freeze.  Take out of freezer 4 to 5 hours ahead to thaw a little. Chop with a knife to make slush.  Put into punch bowl and add ginger ale just before serving; will be slushy.  Makes 50 (5 ounce) servings.  (You can make this several days ahead of time and keep frozen until ready to use.  Take out a few hours ahead of time.)<!><!><!>none
4210<!><!><!>CHRISTMAS PUNCH OR HOT RUSSIAN TEA<!><!><!>Simmer tea, cinnamon and cloves in 4 cups water for 30 minutes.  Dissolve Jell-O in 2 cups boiling water.  Pour Jell-O mixture into large container.  Then add 6 cups cold water.  Now add sugar and pineapple juice.  Squeeze and strain lemons and add to Jell-O mixture.  Strain tea mixture and combine with Jell-O mixture.  Makes more than one gallon.  Serve cold for punch and hot for tea.<!><!><!>none
4211<!><!><!>GAY'S PINEAPPLE BANANA SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Dissolve sugar in water to make a light syrup.  Mix syrup with next three ingredients and pour into small containers to freeze solid.  Approximately 1 hour before serving, remove containers from freezer and place in punch bowl.  Pour ginger ale over frozen ingredients.  As mixture thaws, rake a fork over ice mixture to make slushy.<!><!><!>none

4214<!><!><!>SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>You can change the color of punch by changing the Kool-Aid. Example:  For red punch, use 2 cherry and 2 strawberry.  For yellow punch, use 4 lemonade.  For purple punch, use 4 grape.  For pink punch, use 3 pink lemonade and 1 cherry.  For green punch, use 4 lime.  Punch can be frozen if ginger ale is not added.<!><!><!>none

4216<!><!><!>AGGIE SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mix juices with sugar and freeze.  Two hours before the punch is to be served, remove from freezer and let thaw.  Right before serving, scoop thawed juice into punch bowl and pour ginger ale into the bowl.  The ginger ale will cause the frozen juice to melt even quicker.  Stir thoroughly and break up large chunks of ice. Punch will be mushy.<!><!><!>none

4231<!><!><!>BANANA PUNCH (SLUSH)<!><!><!>Mix sugar with 3 cups water and boil for ten minutes.  Let cool.  In another container, put bananas, lemon juice, pineapple juice and orange juice. 4233<!><!><!>BANANA SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Mash bananas thoroughly and add the slightly thawed orange juice and lemonade.  Sprinkle sugar over mixture.  Add the pineapple juice, stirring well to dissolve the sugar.  Put mixture into a gallon milk container and fill with water; do not fill to the top of container.  Allow space for expansion during freezing. Freeze to a slush.  At serving time, cut off top of milk container to remove slush.  Place mixture in a 2-gallon punch bowl and add the ginger ale.<!><!><!>none

4240<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY SLUSH PUNCH<!><!><!>Combine the sugar and water in a medium size saucepan.  Bring to a boil.  Remove from heat and stir in the gelatin, stirring until completely dissolved.  Add remaining ingredients (except 7-Up or Sprite) and stir to mix well.  Pour into two 1-gallon plastic containers and freeze.  Remove from freezer 1 to 2 hours before you plan to serve it so that it will begin to thaw.  Break up the punch a little before pouring it into the punch bowl.  Pour in the 7-Up or Sprite and gently slush the mixture using a dull knife.  You will probably want to divide this punch into portions when serving, especially if you don't have a large punch bowl.<!><!><!>none

Add lemon and pineapple juice to jello mixture.  Mix well.  Put in 2 large containers.  Freeze. When ready to use, remove from freezer 4 to 5 hours ahead of time so it may thaw.  When it gets slushy, pour 7-Up over it and enjoy. Makes 2 large punch bowls.<!><!><!>none
4292<!><!><!>ALMOND TEA PUNCH<!><!><!>Make a simple syrup of sugar and water.  Mix all ingredients together. Chill.  Add chilled ginger ale just before serving. Makes 1 gallon.<!><!><!>none

4391<!><!><!>CAROLYN'S STRAWBERRY CRUNCH DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix the first 4 dry ingredients; stir into melted butter until well blended.  Bake on large cookie sheet set at 350° for 20 minutes. 4392<!><!><!>CAROLYN'S STRAWBERRY CRUNCH DESSERT<!><!><!>In a large mixing bowl, beat the egg whites until foaming. Gradually add sugar, beating until very thick.  Add strawberries and lemon juice.  Beat until very light and fluffy. Add Cool Whip. In a 9 x 13-inch baking dish, place one half of the crumb mixture, then the strawberry mixture and then the other half of the crumbs; scatter evenly over the top.  Freeze 8 hours or more. It keeps very well.  Have FUN!!!<!><!><!>none
4393<!><!><!>BLUEBERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Grease 9 X 13 pan.  Layer as listed.  After all layers have finished, bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes.<!><!><!>none
4394<!><!><!>FLUFFY PECAN DESSERT<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°. Beat whites until soft peaks form. Add sugar, baking powder and salt. Beat until sugar is dissolved and meringue is stiff. Stir in vanilla, pecans and cereal crumbs. Spread filling evenly on greased 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with additional chopped pecans.<!><!><!>none
4395<!><!><!>TREASURE CHEST DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix together Rice Krispies, nuts and coconut and brown in oven. Stir in sugar and butter. Put half in 9 x 9-inch square pan. Spoon ice cream and put remaining crumbs on top.<!><!><!>none
4396<!><!><!>FROSTED MANDARIN DESSERT<!><!><!>Drain oranges, reserving syrup.  Add water to syrup to make 1 cup.  Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water.  Add measured liquid.  Add sherbet by spoonfuls, stirring until melted.  Chill until slightly thickened.  Stir in oranges.  Chill until set, about 1 hour.  Makes about 5 cups (8 servings).<!><!><!>none
4397<!><!><!>ORANGE DESSERT<!><!><!>Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water; add sherbet and mix well until sherbet dissolves. Place in fridge until partially set (about 10 minutes). Fold in oranges and whipped cream. Chill.<!><!><!>none
4398<!><!><!>CHERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix first 4 ingredients.  Melt butter; pour over mixture and mix well.  Reserve some crumbs for topping.  Press into bottom and sides of jelly roll pan.  Cover with cherry pie filling.  Sprinkle with crumbs.  Bake at 350° for 1/2 hour, then at 300° for 15 minutes.  Serves about 20.<!><!><!>none
4399<!><!><!>BROKEN GLASS DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix together graham crackers, sugar and margarine to make crust. Reserve half of crust mixture and place remainder in bottom of 9 x 13 pan.  Dissolve each package of gelatin (lemon, lime and strawberry) separately in 1 1/2 cups boiling water.  Chill each until firm, then cut into squares.  Dissolve unflavored gelatin in cold water.  Heat pineapple juice and sugar together; cool and add to unflavored gelatin.  Add the whipped cream.  Add cut up gelatin squares and mix.  Pour gelatin mixture into pan on top of graham cracker crust and top with remaining graham cracker crust mixture. Chill until serving time.<!><!><!>none
4400<!><!><!>CATHY'S CHOCOLATE DELIGHT DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix butter, flour and 1/2 cup of the walnuts. Press into the bottom of the pan and bake at 350° for 15 minutes or until light brown. Mix Cool Whip, cream cheese and powdered sugar until blended. Spread on top of cooled crust. Mix chocolate pudding mix with milk. Spread on top of Cool Whip/cream cheese layer. Spread another container of Cool Whip on top. Sprinkle remainder of walnuts and flakes of Hershey bar on top.<!><!><!>none
4401<!><!><!>GOLOSH DESSERT<!><!><!>Stir together all ingredients and mix well.<!><!><!>none
4402<!><!><!>CHERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar and melted butter. Spread in 13 x 9 oblong pan and bake in 350° oven for 8 minutes. Cream Philadelphia cream cheese and add powdered sugar.  Add Cool Whip and spread over cooled graham cracker crust.  Spread cherry filling over cream cheese mixture.<!><!><!>none
4403<!><!><!>BROWNIE TRIFLE DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix a box of brownie mix with walnuts and bake according to directions on box.  Cool.  Break into small pieces.  Mix pudding according to directions on the box.  Use a glass trifle bowl and layer chocolate pudding, brownies and Cool Whip.  Repeat one time. sprinkle brownie crumbs on top.  May garnish each layer with maraschino cherries, if desired.<!><!><!>none

4421<!><!><!>PRETZEL DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix butter, 3 tbsp. sugar and pretzels into a 9 x 13 inch pan; bake 10 minutes at 350°F. Let cool. 4435<!><!><!>PEACHES AND CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Dice peaches, reserving several slices for garnish. Mix peaches and 2 tablespoons of the sugar in large serving bowl. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup granola. Garnish with additional whipped topping, reserved peach slices and cinnamon sticks. Makes 6 to 8 servings.<!><!><!>none

4489<!><!><!>LEMON PUDDING DESSERT<!><!><!>In a bowl, cut butter into the flour until crumbly. Press into an ungreased 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking pan. Bake at 350° for 18 to 22 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack. In mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Fold in 1 cup whipped topping. Spread over pie crust. In a mixing bowl, beat milk and pudding mix on low speed for 2 minutes. Carefully spread over the cream cheese layer. Top with the remaining whipped topping. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Yield: 12 to 16 servings.<!><!><!>none

4493<!><!><!>PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix the pumpkin, Milnot, sugar, pumpkin pie spice (I use 1 teaspoon vanilla also) and eggs together and pour into an 11 x 13 pan. 4494<!><!><!>CHERRY MERINGUE DESSERT<!><!><!>Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Blend shortening with sugar, creaming well. Blend in egg yolks and milk; beat well. Add the dry ingredients all at once; stir until mixture forms a dough.  Press into bottom of well-greased 9-inch round layer pan.  Chop pecans; reserve 2 Tbsp. for Meringue. Sprinkle remainder over dough. Bake at 375° for 12 to 15 minutes.  Cool. Heat pie filling and add almond extract. Cool. Transfer the cookie circle to baking sheet. Beat egg whites until soft mounds form. Add 1/4 c. sugar gradually, beating well after each addition. Beat until meringue stands in stiff straight peaks.  Drop meringue by tablespoonfuls around edge on top of circle. Sprinkle with reserved pecans.  Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes. Fill center with cherry filling.<!><!><!>none
4495<!><!><!>CHERRY MERINGUE DESSERT<!><!><!>Cherry Filling:<!><!><!>none
4496<!><!><!>CHERRY MERINGUE DESSERT<!><!><!>Drain cherries, reserving 3/4 c. juice. Blend cornstarch with sugar in saucepan. Blend in the reserved cherry juice, stir until sugar dissolves. Cook, stirring constantly, until thick and clear. Add almond extract and the cherries.<!><!><!>none
4497<!><!><!>TOFFEE DESSERT<!><!><!>Combine cracker crumbs and oleo.  Mix well.  Place 2/3 crumb mixture in 9x13 pan.<!><!><!>none
4498<!><!><!>TOFFEE DESSERT<!><!><!>Prepare pudding with milk and add ice milk.  Blend until smooth.  Pour over crumbs. Refrigerator until firm. Spread Cool Whip over pudding mixture.  Add candy bars to remaining crumb mixture and sprinkle over top.  May refrigerator several hours. DO NOT FREEZE!<!><!><!>none
4499<!><!><!>RHUBARB DESSERT<!><!><!>Make crumbs of top 3 ingredients.  Put in 11 x 5 x 1 in. pan. Bake for 10 min.  Mix the rest together, cook and pour on crust. Bake for 25 min.  Beat 6 egg whites.  While beating, add 1-2 Tbsp. sugar and 1 tsp. vanilla, beat till stiff.  Pour on cake and bake till golden.  Very good!<!><!><!>none
4500<!><!><!>CHERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients, except cherries; mix thoroughly. Place in large, buttered pan, reserving one-fourth mixture for topping.  Add cherries.  Cover with topping.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.<!><!><!>none
4501<!><!><!>NO-BAKE STRAWBERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Arrange cake cubes in a single layer in a 13 x 9-inch dish. In a bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water; stir in strawberries. Pour over cake and gently press cake down. Refrigerate until set, about 1 hour. In a bowl, whisk milk and pudding mix for 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Spoon over gelatin layer. Spread with whipped topping. Refrigerate until serving. Yields 20 servings.<!><!><!>none
4502<!><!><!>WALNUT APPLE DESSERT<!><!><!>Place apples in a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup brown sugar and cinnamon.  In a mixing bowl, cream butter and remaining brown sugar.  Add eggs.  Stir in flour and 1/2 cup walnuts.  Spread over apples.  Sprinkle with remaining walnuts.  Bake at 350° for 45 to 55 minutes or until the apples are tender.  Serve warm with ice cream if desired.  Yield:  12 to 16 servings.<!><!><!>none
4503<!><!><!>OREO DESSERT<!><!><!>You will need 3 bowls.<!><!><!>none
4504<!><!><!>OREO DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix milk with pudding. Crumble Oreos and set aside.<!><!><!>none
4505<!><!><!>OREO DESSERT<!><!><!>Cream butter and cream cheese together, then add powdered sugar. Mix well and set aside.<!><!><!>none
4506<!><!><!>OREO DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix pudding and Cool Whip together. Mix all ingredients together except the Oreo cookies.<!><!><!>none
4507<!><!><!>OREO DESSERT<!><!><!>In a 13 x 9 dish, layer 1/2 of the Oreos, cream cheese mixture and the other 1/2 of the cookies in that order. Refrigerate until ready to serve.<!><!><!>none
4508<!><!><!>PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix crackers, margarine and 1/2 c. sugar together and press into 9 X 13 pan. Beat eggs, 3/4 cup sugar, and cream cheese together and pour over graham cracker crust. Bake 20 minutes at 350°. Cool.<!><!><!>none
4509<!><!><!>PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>Filling:<!><!><!>none
4510<!><!><!>PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>Combine pumpkin, 1/2 cup sugar, milk, egg yolks, salt and cinnamon in a saucepan.  Cook until thick, stirring constantly. Dissolve Knox gelatine in water and add to pumpkin mixture.  Cool. Beat egg whites and remaining sugar.  Fold into cool pumpkin mixture.  Fold in Cool Whip.  Add pumpkin mixture to rest of dessert in pan.  Refrigerate and cut into squares.  Top with Cool Whip.<!><!><!>none
4511<!><!><!>CREAMSICLE DESSERT<!><!><!>Break cake into small pieces. Fill buttered 9 X 13 pan with cake pieces. Dissolve jello in hot water, add sherbet and stir. Allow to thicken slightly. Fold in whipped cream. Pour over cake pieces and refrigerate. Top with additional whipped cream and mandarin oranges slices if desired.<!><!><!>none
4512<!><!><!>LEMON DESSERT<!><!><!>First Layer:  Mix together butter, flour and chopped pecans. Place in 9 x 13 pan. Bake 20 minutes at 350° and cool.<!><!><!>none
4513<!><!><!>LEMON DESSERT<!><!><!>Second Layer:  Mix together Cool Whip, cream cheese and sugar; spread over cooled crust. Chill 1 hour.<!><!><!>none
4514<!><!><!>LEMON DESSERT<!><!><!>Third Layer:  Beat the pudding and milk in mixer until quite thick; spread over second layer.  Refrigerate overnight. Top with sweetened whipped cream when served.<!><!><!>none
4515<!><!><!>CREAM PUFF DESSERT<!><!><!>Bring water and margarine to rolling boil. Remove from heat and add flour, stirring vigorously, until it forms a ball. Add eggs, one at a time, beating vigorously until smooth. Spread on a 15 x 11-inch jelly roll pan (greased on bottom only). Bake 30 minutes at 400°. Cool.<!><!><!>none

4519<!><!><!>CRESCENT ROLL DESSERT<!><!><!>Put 1 can of rolls in bottom of 9 x 13 inch dish or pan.  Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla.  Pour over rolls. Bake 30 minutes at 325°.<!><!><!>none
4520<!><!><!>CHOCOLATE PIE DESSERT<!><!><!>Crush graham crackers and mix well with melted butter and sugar; press mixture into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Cook chocolate pudding as directed. When pudding comes to a full boil, add 2 candy bars to mixture. Stir until melted; pour into pan. Cool. When completely cooled, put Cool Whip on top of pudding mixture. Put grated candy bar on top.<!><!><!>none
4521<!><!><!>LEMON PUDDING DESSERT<!><!><!>In bowl, cut margarine into the flour until crumbly.  Press into ungreased 9 x 13 pan.  Bake at 350° for 18 to 22 minutes. Cool.  In mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar till smooth. Fold in 1 cup Cool Whip.  Spread over crust.  In small mixer bowl, beat pudding and milk on low speed 2 minutes.  Carefully spread over the cream cheese layer.  Top with remaining whipped topping. Refrigerate at least 1 hour.  Yield 12 to 16 servings.<!><!><!>none
4522<!><!><!>PUMPKIN PIE DESSERT<!><!><!>In a bowl, combine the cracker crumbs, sugar and butter. Press into a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch dish.  Set aside.  In a bowl, whisk milk and pudding; mix for 2 minutes.  Stir in pumpkin and spices.  Spread over the crust.  Refrigerate for 3 hours or until set.  Garnish with whipped topping and nuts.  Yields 12 to 15 servings.<!><!><!>none

4528<!><!><!>OREO ICE CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Take 3/4 package of Oreos and spread in the bottom of 9 x 13 pan. Slice ice cream. Lay on top of Oreos. Slightly warm sauce and pour over ice cream. 4529<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY-PRETZEL DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix pretzels, melted butter and 2 teaspoons sugar.  Pat into 9 x 13-inch baking dish.  Bake at 400° for exactly 8 minutes.  Set aside.  Beat sugar into cream cheese and stir in Cool Whip. Spread on cooled pretzel mix.  Dissolve strawberry Jello in boiling water.  Add strawberries and mix.  Let stand until beginning to gel.  Pour over cream mixture and refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
4530<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Stir  first  2 ingredients well.  Add Cool Whip and mix well, then fold in berries.  (May  use  blueberries,  peaches, blackberries, etc.) Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Chill.<!><!><!>none

4606<!><!><!>CHOCOLATE CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Prepare brownie mix as directed on package. Let brownies cool completely. Beat the powdered sugar, butter and water until smooth. Spread evenly on top of cooled brownie. Cover and refrigerate until set. Place chocolate chips and remaining 6 tablespoons butter in microwave-safe bowl and microwave on high for approx. one minute or until mixture is smooth when stirred. Pour over the chilled dessert. Cover and refrigerate at least one hour before serving. Cover and refrigerate any leftover dessert.<!><!><!>none
4607<!><!><!>PEACH DESSERT<!><!><!>Place peaches in large dish. Put dry cake mix on top of peaches. Sprinkle brown sugar on top of cake mix. Pour melted butter evenly on top of brown sugar. Bake at 325° for 50 to 60 minutes or until brown.<!><!><!>none

4610<!><!><!>RHUBARB DESSERT<!><!><!>Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes.<!><!><!>none
4611<!><!><!>APPLE NUT DESSERT<!><!><!>Beat egg. Add sugar and vanilla. Separately mix flour, baking powder and salt. Add flour mixture to egg mixture. Stir in apples and nuts. Bake in a greased 7 X 9 inch pan at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes. Quick, easy, delightful.<!><!><!>none
4612<!><!><!>WALNUT APPLE DESSERT<!><!><!>Place apples in a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup brown sugar and cinnamon. In a mixing bowl, cream butter and remaining brown sugar. Add eggs. Stir in flour and 1/2 cup walnuts. Spread over apples. Sprinkle with remaining walnuts. Bake at 350° for 45 to 55 minutes or until the apples are tender. Serve warm with ice cream, if desired. Yield: 12 to 16 servings.<!><!><!>none

4618<!><!><!>BANANA SPLIT DESSERT<!><!><!>Whip cream and pour over the chocolate mixture.  Store in freezer.  Remove 10 minutes before serving.  This keeps several weeks.  Approximately 25 servings.<!><!><!>none
4619<!><!><!>RHUBARB MERINGUE DESSERT<!><!><!>In a bowl, combine the flour and sugar; cut in butter until crumbly.  Press into a greased 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.  Cool on a wire rack.<!><!><!>none
4620<!><!><!>RHUBARB MERINGUE DESSERT<!><!><!>Filling:<!><!><!>none

4622<!><!><!>RHUBARB MERINGUE DESSERT<!><!><!>Meringue:<!><!><!>none
4623<!><!><!>RHUBARB MERINGUE DESSERT<!><!><!>In a mixing bowl, beat egg whites and cream of tartar on medium speed until soft peaks form.  Gradually beat in sugar, a tablespoon at a time, until stiff peaks form.  Beat in vanilla. Spread over hot filling.  Bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.  Cool on a wire rack.  Refrigerate for 1-2 hours before serving.  Refrigerate leftovers.  Yield: 12-15 servings.<!><!><!>none

4642<!><!><!>SPRING GREEN DESSERT<!><!><!>Second layer: Cream powdered sugar and cream cheese together and fold in 1 cup of whipped topping.  Spread over cooled crust.<!><!><!>none
4643<!><!><!>SPRING GREEN DESSERT<!><!><!>Third layer: Beat together pudding mix and milk for 2 to 3 minutes.  Spread over the second layer.  Refrigerate 2 - 3 hours or overnight.  Before serving, spread the other cup of whipped topping over all.<!><!><!>none

4648<!><!><!>ICE CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Line bottom of 8 1/2 x 11-inch casserole dish with ice cream sandwiches. (Should take about 9 1/2 sandwiches.) Sprinkle 1/3 of the Heath Bar pieces on top of the sandwiches. Add a second layer of ice cream sandwiches. Poke holes in the sandwiches with a fork. Drizzle the Kahlua over the sandwiches. Sprinkle more of the Heath Bar pieces, saving a few for the top. Spread whipped topping on top and garnish with the remaining Heath Bar pieces. Keep frozen until serving. It is easiest to serve when frozen overnight. Serve on a dessert plate and drizzle with caramel sauce.<!><!><!>none
4649<!><!><!>STRAWBERRIES N CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Place cake slices in bottom of pan (cutting to fit). Reserve remaining for second layer. Brush top of cake slices with half of orange juice. Repeat layers with remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
4650<!><!><!>PEANUT BUTTER APPLE DESSERT<!><!><!>In a bowl, combine crumbs, brown sugar, 1/2 cup peanut butter, and butter; spoon half into a 3 qt. bowl.  In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth; fold in whipped topping.  Spread half over crumb mixture in the bowl.  Top with one can of pie filling.  Combine powdered sugar, cinnamon, and remaining peanut butter until crumbly; sprinkle half over pie filling.  Repeat layers.  Refrigerate until time to serve.<!><!><!>none
4651<!><!><!>PEANUT BUTTER APPLE DESSERT<!><!><!>Yield: about 20 servings in a glass bowl or 9 x 13-inch pan.<!><!><!>none

4653<!><!><!>BUSTER BAR DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix crushed Oreos and melted margarine. Spread in a 9 x 13 pan. Place in refrigerator to set. Then spread peanuts over crust. Spread ice cream over crust and peanuts. Cover with cooled topping mix and freeze.<!><!><!>none
4654<!><!><!>PINEAPPLE DESSERT<!><!><!>Make and chill a graham cracker crust. Drain pineapple chunks. Reserve the syrup. Chill the pineapple. Add water to pineapple syrup to make 1 cup. Bring to a boil, then stir into lemon gelatin until completely dissolved. Gradually blend half of hot gelatin into cream cheese warmed to room temperature. When smooth, pour into chilled crust. Chill until set. Arrange pineapple on top and spoon remainder of gelatin over all. Chill.<!><!><!>none

4667<!><!><!>SOUR CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Dissolve Jell-O, sugar and salt in boiling water.  Stir in cream and vanilla (mixture will look curdled, but will become smooth).  Stir in sour cream.  Chill until slightly thickened. Beat until smooth.  Pour into 3 or 4-cup ring mold.  Chill until firm.  Unmold.  Serve with fruit if desired.  Makes 6 servings.<!><!><!>none

4673<!><!><!>TRIPLE CHOCOLATE DESSERT<!><!><!>In a mixing bowl, combine the first six ingredients.  Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.  Stir in chocolate chips.  Pour into a 5 quart slow cooker that has been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Cover and cook on low for 6-7 hours or until a toothpick inserted near center comes out with moist crumbs.  Serve in bowls with ice cream.  Or may cook on high for 3-4 hours.<!><!><!>none
4674<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Crush pretzels (not too fine).  Press into 9 x 13 pan.  Bake at 400° for 8 minutes.  Let cool.  Mix together cream cheese, sugar and Cool Whip. Reduce heat, cover and cook for 6 - 8 minutes or until zucchini is crisp-tender.  Stir in sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg, cover and simmer for 5 minutes.  (Mixture will be thin.) 4704<!><!><!>CHOCOLATE DESSERT WRAPS<!><!><!>Spread 2 tablespoons of peanut butter on each tortilla. Sprinkle 1/4 cup marshmallows and 2 tablespoons chocolate chips on half of each tortilla. Roll up, beginning with the topping side. Wrap each tortilla in heavy-duty foil; seal tightly. Grill, covered, over low heat for 5 to 10 minutes or until heated through. Unwrap tortillas and place on dessert plates. Serve with ice cream, if desired. YIELD: 4 servings.<!><!><!>none
4705<!><!><!>BANANA SPLIT DESSERT<!><!><!>Let margarine stand at room temperature until softened. Mix 1 stick of margarine with the graham cracker crumbs to form a crust; press into a 9 x 13 inch pan. 4708<!><!><!>APPLE PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>Heat oven to 400°. Spoon apple filling into 8 to 10 custard cups.<!><!><!>none
4709<!><!><!>APPLE PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>In large mixer bowl, beat pumpkin, sweetened condensed milk, eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt. Spoon over apple filling. Combine crumbs and butter. Makes 8 to 10 servings.<!><!><!>none
4710<!><!><!>BANANA PINEAPPLE DESSERT<!><!><!>Make crust with graham cracker crumbs, sugar and oleo.  Press into bottom of baking pan.  Arrange banana slices on crust. Spread Cool Whip over pineapple.  Refrigerate about 3 hours.<!><!><!>none
4711<!><!><!>JELLO DESSERT I<!><!><!>Mix well the first 4 ingredients. In a separate bowl, mix Knox gelatine and water until well dissolved. Add to other ingredients. Refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
4712<!><!><!>JELLO DESSERT I<!><!><!>Jell-O:<!><!><!>none
4713<!><!><!>JELLO DESSERT I<!><!><!>To each box of Jell-O, mix hot water and cold water. Pour into a 7 x 12 x 2-inch dish. Put in the refrigerator and let jell. Top with White Layer. Mix next Jell-O and repeat, alternating Jell-O  and White Layer.<!><!><!>none
4714<!><!><!>JELLO DESSERT I<!><!><!>I start 2 days in advance of when I need the dessert. Use colors depending on occasion.<!><!><!>none
4715<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Pour 2 cups boiling water over Jello.  Add 1/2 cup cold water and 1/2 cup juice from strawberries.  Mix and let gel set till soft.  After set, beat with electric mixer till very fluffy, about 3 minutes.  Add strawberries and beat some more.  Fold in Cool Whip.   Using a loaf pan, layer, starting with Jello mix, then cake, and repeat ending up with Jello mix.  Chill overnight or 24 hours.  Enough Jello may be put in bottom of pan chilled stiffly for a nicer look when serving (about 3/4 c.).  You may add 1/2 c. chopped maraschino cherries on top.<!><!><!>none
4716<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>I Layer:  Break angel food cake in small pieces.<!><!><!>none
4717<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>II Layer:  Cream cheese, 1/2 c. sugar, Dream whip (prepare per package directions).  Fold dream whip into whipped cream cheese and sugar.<!><!><!>none
4718<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>III Layer:  Prepare salada as directed.  Cool.  Fold into strawberries.  Add 1/2 c. sugar to berries if fresh.  May substitute strawberry pie filling for salada.<!><!><!>none
4719<!><!><!>PEANUT BUTTER ROCKY ROAD DESSERT<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Refrigerate candies to make cutting easier.  Mix butter and graham cracker crumbs well.  Press into bottom of a 9 inch square pan.  Bake 8 minutes.  Cool completely.<!><!><!>none
4720<!><!><!>PEANUT BUTTER ROCKY ROAD DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix puddings, milk, and peanut butter until it begins to thicken.  Fold in whipped topping.  Spread evenly over crust.<!><!><!>none
4721<!><!><!>PEANUT BUTTER ROCKY ROAD DESSERT<!><!><!>Cut peanut butter candies into eighths.  Sprinkle candies, marshmallows, and peanuts over pudding mixture.  Drizzle with chocolate syrup.  Cover with aluminum foil and freeze 6 hours or overnight.  Cut into squares.<!><!><!>none
4722<!><!><!>PINK DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix all together with cottage cheese and jello. Add Cool Whip. Mix well. Let stand overnight in refrigerator.<!><!><!>none
4723<!><!><!>LEMON CHEESECAKE DESSERT<!><!><!>In a bowl combine the cracker crumbs, pecans and sugar, add butter, mix well (set aside 1/2 cup).  Press the remaining crumb mixture into greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish.  Bake at 325 degrees for 8 minutes.  Meanwhile, in a small bowl beat the cream cheese until smooth.  Add the milk, eggs and lemon juice, beat until smooth.  Spoon over crust.  Sprinkle with the reserved crumb mixture.  Bake for 30 minutes or until center is almost set.  Cool on a wire rack.  Store in refrigerator.  16 to 20 servings.<!><!><!>none
4724<!><!><!>CHERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Place cherry pie filling mix in a buttered 9 x 12 pan.  Mix cake mix, coconut and chopped nuts and spread evenly over cherries. Drizzle butter over dry cake mix.  Bake in 350° oven for 45 minutes or until nicely browned.<!><!><!>none
4725<!><!><!>CREAM PUFF DESSERT<!><!><!>Bring to boil water and butter until butter melts.  All at once, add flour and salt.  Stir until dough comes away from sides of pan.  Let cool 5 minutes.  Beat eggs in one at a time.  Spread in 1 inch deep cookie sheet type pan.  Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes.  Pierce with fork all over.  Let cool before putting topping on.  For topping, make pudding according to package directions, then beat in cream cheese.  Spread over crust.  Top with cool whip.  Put on topping of choice if desired (chocolate or caramel syrup, etc.).<!><!><!>none
4726<!><!><!>PUMPKIN PIE DESSERT<!><!><!>Combine first 6 ingredients. Place in 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with dry cake mix. Pour melted butter on top. Top with nuts. Bake 1 hour at 350°.<!><!><!>none
4727<!><!><!>ICE CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix first four ingredients.  Press half of the mixture into a 9 x 13 greased pan.  Spoon 1/2 gal. softened ice cream onto mixture in pan.  Press second half of mixture on top of ice cream. Freeze until ready to serve or until ice cream is frozen.<!><!><!>none
4728<!><!><!>ICE CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Variation:  Add 1/3 c. caramel on top of the first layer of ice cream.<!><!><!>none
4729<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Stir together first 4 ingredients in a large casserole dish. Save 1/2 cup of this mixture to sprinkle over the top later.  Set aside.  Put the rest in the oven and bake 15 to 20 minutes at 350°.  Stir often and smooth out to form a crust on the bottom of dish.  Mix egg whites, lemon juice, sugar and strawberries.  Beat until fluffy.  Set aside while you beat the whipping cream.  Add 3 tablespoons sugar, one tablespoon at a time and a pinch of salt. Combine fluffy mix and whipping cream mix.  Pour over crust, then sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup you saved from the bottom of the casserole.  Freeze.  This is cut into squares to serve.  It is best to let it sit about 10 minutes before serving.<!><!><!>none
4730<!><!><!>CHOCOLATE ECLAIR DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix instant pudding and milk. Beat 3 minutes. Fold in Cool Whip; stir well. Line 9 x 13 inch pan with graham crackers; cover with pudding mixture. Continue layering graham crackers and pudding mixture. Cover top of dessert with a layer of graham crackers. Add melted chocolate frosting to top.<!><!><!>none
4731<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY GRAHAM DESSERT<!><!><!>In small bowl, combine cracker crumbs and butter; set aside 1 Tbsp. for topping.  Press remaining crumb mixture into 8 inch square pan.  Bake at 325° for 10 to 14 minutes, until golden brown.  Cool.<!><!><!>none
4732<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY GRAHAM DESSERT<!><!><!>In bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water; stir in strawberries and lemon juice.  Refrigerate until partially set, about 1 1/2 hours.<!><!><!>none
4733<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY GRAHAM DESSERT<!><!><!>In small mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla and salt until smooth.  Fold in whipped cream.  Spread half over cooled crust.  Pour gelatin mixture over filling. Refrigerate until firm.  Top with remaining cream mixture. Sprinkle with reserved crumb mixture.  Refrigerate overnight. Garnish with fresh strawberries, if desired.  9 servings.<!><!><!>none
4734<!><!><!>BANANA SPLIT DESSERT<!><!><!>Melt 2/3 cup margarine.  Stir in graham cracker crumbs and press in 9 x 13 baking dish.  Beat remaining margarine with eggs, powdered sugar and vanilla.  Spread over crumb mixture.  Slice bananas; dip in pineapple juice and arrange on egg mixture.  Place pineapple on top of bananas and top with Cool Whip.  Drizzle with chocolate syrup; sprinkle chopped nuts and maraschino cherries over top.  Chill for 8 hours.<!><!><!>none
4735<!><!><!>TWINKIE DESSERT<!><!><!>Layer the twinkies in a 9 inch square pan. (They just fit so do not eat any.) Peel and slice bananas, arrange slices on top of twinkies. Prepare vanilla pudding, spread over bananas. Spread whipped topping over bananas and pudding. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.<!><!><!>none
4736<!><!><!>LEMON DESSERT<!><!><!>Beat 3 egg yolks.  Add rind of 1 lemon and the juice of 2 lemons.  Add can of condensed milk and stir until thick.  Crush 1/2 box of wafers and put on bottom of 8 x 8-inch pan.  Pour mixture over crumbs, then spread the whipped cream over mixture.  Add the remaining crushed wafers and refrigerate for several hours before serving.<!><!><!>none
4737<!><!><!>ICE CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients, except ice cream.  Press 1/2 of mixture into bottom of 9 x 13 pan.  Spread with ice cream.  Sprinkle remaining mixture over the ice cream.  Freeze for 4 to 6 hours. Serves 12.<!><!><!>none
4738<!><!><!>4 LAYER BUTTERSCOTCH DESSERT<!><!><!>Melt margarine and add brown sugar, flour and pecans. Press ingredients into 9 x 13 glass baking dish. Bake at 325° for 20 minutes. Let cool.<!><!><!>none
4739<!><!><!>4 LAYER BUTTERSCOTCH DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix with mixer the milk and pudding.<!><!><!>none
4740<!><!><!>4 LAYER BUTTERSCOTCH DESSERT<!><!><!>Mix Cool Whip, cream cheese and powdered sugar in a separate bowl. Spread this mixture over the baked portion, then pour pudding over second layer.<!><!><!>none
4741<!><!><!>4 LAYER BUTTERSCOTCH DESSERT<!><!><!>Fourth Layer: Spread remaining Cool Whip on top and garnish with pecans.<!><!><!>none
4742<!><!><!>PEANUT BUTTER DESSERT<!><!><!>In a bowl, combine the crushed cookies, sugar and butter; press into ungreased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish, bottom only. Bake at 350° for 6 to 8 minutes or until golden brown. Cool.<!><!><!>none
4743<!><!><!>PEANUT BUTTER DESSERT<!><!><!>In a mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese and confectioners sugar; fold in 1 cup whipped topping.  Spread over cooled crust. In another mixing bowl, beat milk and pudding mix on low speed for 2 minutes or until thickened.  Spread over cream cheese layer.  Top with remaining whipped topping; sprinkle with cookie pieces. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.<!><!><!>none
4744<!><!><!>LEMON DELIGHT DESSERT<!><!><!>Break cake into bite-sized pieces. Mix lemon juice with sweetened condensed milk and stir until well mixed. Whip cream; put the 2 together. Put 1/2 of the cake in a 9 x 13 pan, then half the mixture. Top with the other 1/2 of the cake pieces and the rest of the mixture. Sprinkle top with coconut. Refrigerate overnight.<!><!><!>none
4745<!><!><!>CHERRY OR BERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>In large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs. Beat until light. Add almond extract. Stir in flour and baking powder. Mix until smooth. 4746<!><!><!>CHERRY OR BERRY DESSERT<!><!><!>Other berry pie filling may be substituted.<!><!><!>none
4747<!><!><!>SNAPPY PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>Combine gingersnap crumbs and butter.  Press into an ungreased 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan.  Bake at 325° for 10 minutes.  Cool.<!><!><!>none
4748<!><!><!>SNAPPY PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>Filling:<!><!><!>none
4749<!><!><!>SNAPPY PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>In a mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese, powdered sugar and milk until fluffy. Spread over the crust.<!><!><!>none
4750<!><!><!>SNAPPY PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>Topping:<!><!><!>none
4751<!><!><!>SNAPPY PUMPKIN DESSERT<!><!><!>Beat milk and pudding mix for 1 minute.  Add pumpkin and pie spice; beat until well blended.  Fold in whipped topping.  Spread over the cream cheese layer.  Refrigerate for at least 3 hours. Cut into squares; garnish with whipped topping if desired.  Yield: 12-15 servings.<!><!><!>none
4752<!><!><!>CHOCOLATE CLAIR DESSERT<!><!><!>Combine pudding mix and 3 cups milk in large bowl. Prepare pudding using package directions. Add whipped topping, beating with electric mixer set at medium speed until blended. Arrange a layer of graham crackers in bottom of a 13 x 9-inch dish. Spread half of pudding mixture. Add a second layer of graham crackers. Spread remaining pudding mixture. Top with another layer of graham crackers. Combine butter and chocolate in small saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring frequently, until chocolate melts. Stir in remaining milk. Place confectioners sugar in medium bowl. Add chocolate. Beat at medium speed until icing is a spreadable consistency. Spread over layers. Chill, covered, for 8 hours. Cut into squares and serve.<!><!><!>none
4753<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY PRETZEL DESSERT<!><!><!>Combine pretzels, margarine, and sugar.  Spray a 9 x 13 baking dish with non-stick spray and press pretzel mixture into the bottom.  Bake at 400° for 18-20 minutes.  Cool.<!><!><!>none
4754<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY PRETZEL DESSERT<!><!><!>In a small bowl, beat cream cheese, and remaining 1 c. of sugar until smooth.  Fold in cool whip and spread over cooled crust. Refrigerate.  Drain pineapple, reserving juice; set pineapple aside.  Add water to juice to make 1 c. Put in small saucepan and bring to boil.  Pour into large bowl and stir in jell-O.  Drain berries, reserving juice.  Add water to juice to make 1 1/2 c. and stir this into jell-O mixture.  Refrigerate until partially set. Stir in all fruits and spoon over cream cheese layer.  Cover and chill 3-4 hours.  Makes 18 servings.<!><!><!>none
4755<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Trim 3/4-inch from ends of ladyfingers; place ends on bottom of 9-inch spring-form pan. Stand remaining ladyfingers around side of pan with cut sides facing in. Reserve 2 strawberries for garnish; mash remaining strawberries.<!><!><!>none
4756<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY CREAM DESSERT<!><!><!>Stir boiling water into gelatin in large bowl at least 2 minutes until completely dissolved. Add ice cubes; stir until melted. Add whipped topping and mashed strawberries; stir gently with wire whisk until well blended. Refrigerate 10 minutes or until mixture is very thick and will mound. Spoon into pan. Refrigerate 3 hours or until firm. Remove side of pan. Garnish with reserved strawberries. Makes 12 servings.<!><!><!>none
4757<!><!><!>PINEAPPLE DESSERT<!><!><!>Arrange drained pineapple in baking dish.  Mix sugar and flour together and sprinkle over pineapple.  Then, sprinkle cheddar cheese over this. 4758<!><!><!>SUMMER SURPRISE DESSERT<!><!><!>In shallow 9 x 12-inch glass dish, combine all fruit and mix well.  Sprinkle brown sugar over fruit.  Top with sour cream. Cover with plastic wrap; refrigerate 3 to 4 hours or overnight. The sour cream will seep through the brown sugar to the fruit.  To serve, gently stir the fruit; spoon into sherbet glasses.<!><!><!>none
4759<!><!><!>SUMMER SURPRISE DESSERT<!><!><!>Tip: Any combination of fruits may be used - fresh plums, kiwi, raspberries, pitted Bing cherries, etc. However, fresh peaches, fresh grapes and fresh blueberries are a necessity. Frozen or canned fruits are not recommended.<!><!><!>none

4801<!><!><!>CRISP BAKED FISH FILETS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 500°. Wash and dry filets and cut into serving pieces. Dip in oil and coat with cornflake crumbs. 4802<!><!><!>TUNA FISH SALAD PLATE<!><!><!>Drain off all water from tuna.  Separate and mash tuna with a fork.  Mix all ingredients. Add tuna salad (a nice size serving) in middle of lettuce.  Arrange sliced fresh orange, pear halves, tomato wedges, sliced avocado and few ripe olives to garnish.  Serve with crisp crackers.<!><!><!>none
4803<!><!><!>GRILLED FISH AND SHRIMP<!><!><!>Melt butter; add lemon juice and garlic and simmer 1 minute. Season fish and shrimp lightly with Greek seasoning.  Place fish and shrimp in a large sheet of heavy foil with top loosely opened. Baste heavily with lemon butter and garlic sauce.  Add chopped tomato, onion and green pepper.  Place on an outdoor grill and cook about 5 minutes.  This may be baked in oven with foil closed.<!><!><!>none
4804<!><!><!>GRILLED FISH AND SHRIMP<!><!><!>Scallops may be substituted for shrimp.<!><!><!>none
4805<!><!><!>FISH STOCK<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients in a soup kettle, cover and slowly bring to boil skimming as needed. Lower heat and simmer 1 hour. Strain, cool and refrigerate. Stock has a 4-day shelf life, so it's best to freeze unless using immediately.<!><!><!>none
4806<!><!><!>FISH STOCK<!><!><!>Note: See Soup Stock Basics for storage information.<!><!><!>none
4807<!><!><!>HERBED FISH AND VEGETABLES<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 450 degrees or grill to medium-high.  Spray foil with nonstick cooking spray.  Center one fish fillet on each sheet of foil.  Top with green onions; place frozen vegetables around fish.  Sprinkle fish with thyme, marjoram, salt and pepper. Top with margarine.  Bring up foil sides.  Double fold top and ends to seal packet, leaving room for heat circulation inside. Repeat to make two jackets. Bake 18-20 minutes on a cookie sheet in oven or grill 10-12 minutes in covered grill.  Drizzle with lemon juice.  Makes 2 servings.<!><!><!>none
4808<!><!><!>MEDITERRANEAN FISH FILLET CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Place uncooked Gorton's Fillets in the bottom of an ungreased baking dish.  Mix all ingredients except cheese and spoon evenly over fillets.  Cover & cook in the oven at 375 for 25 minutes. Top with cheese.  Makes 6 servings.<!><!><!>none
4809<!><!><!>FISH KABOBS<!><!><!>In a shallow pan, arrange the fish cubes in one layer.  Combine the chili sauce, Worcestershire, hot pepper sauce and salt.  Pour over fish and let stand for 1 to 2 hours.  Drain the fish, reserving the marinade.  Cut each piece of bacon into fourths.  On each of 8 skewers, string a fish cube, a piece of bacon, then a square of pepper.  Repeat, ending with a fish cube.  Grill 4 to 5 inches from heat for 10 to 12 minutes, basting a few times with reserved marinade.<!><!><!>none
4810<!><!><!>CAJUN RUBBED FISH NUGGETS<!><!><!>Brush BBQ grill with oil.  Turn to medium high.  Place Cajun Rub and 1 pound of fish nuggets in a paper bag.  Shake until pieces are well coated.  Thread onto pre-soaked skewers.  Cook on hot grill for 3 - 5 minutes each side.  Serve with lemon wedges, as an appetizer for 4 or as a main dish for 2.<!><!><!>none
4811<!><!><!>BOUILLON POACHED FISH<!><!><!>In large skillet, or electric skillet, dissolve bouillon with water over medium heat.  Add vegetables, cover and simmer 10 minutes.  Add fish; cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes.  4 servings.  Only 1 1/2 Weight Watcher Points per 4 oz. serving.<!><!><!>none
4812<!><!><!>BROILED FISH FILLETS<!><!><!>Arrange fish fillets, skin side up, on broiler pan.  Brush both sides of fish with margarine. 4813<!><!><!>FISH AND CHIPS<!><!><!>Cut fillets into pieces, about 3 x 1 1/2-inches.  Place on paper towels to dry.  Beat egg yolks until thick and light. Blend in beer, milk, flour and seasonings.  Mix until smooth. Beat egg whites stiff but not dry; fold in.  Pat fillets dry.  Dip into batter, a few pieces at a time; lift out and drain slightly with fork or slotted spoon.  Fry in deep fat heated to 375° for 2 to 3 minutes until golden brown and puffed.  Drain on absorbent paper.  Serve with French fried potatoes.<!><!><!>none
4814<!><!><!>HONEY FRIED FISH<!><!><!>In a bowl, beat Egg and Honey.  In another bowl combine the next 5 ingredients.  Dip Fillets into Egg and Honey mixture then coat with Cracker mixture.  In a large skillet, heat Oil.  Fry Fillets over medium heat for 3 - 4 minutes or until Fillet flakes easily with fork.  Drizzle with Honey and Lemon if desired. Yields:  4 servings.<!><!><!>none
4815<!><!><!>TOM'S HERB-BAKED FISH (OR CHICKEN) AND RICE<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°.  In an 8 x 12 dish, combine bouillon, rice and seasonings.  Bake, covered, for 10 minutes.  Top with broccoli, 1/2 can onions and Parmesan cheese.  Place fillets in dish; sprinkle with paprika.  Bake, covered, for 20 to 25 minutes. If using chicken, bake for about 40 to 45 minutes.  Stir rice. Top with Cheddar cheese and rest of onion.  Bake, uncovered, 3 minutes.  Serves 3 to 4.<!><!><!>none
