6150<!><!><!>WHITE CHOCOLATE PARTY MIX<!><!><!>Combine first 5 ingredients; set aside.  Heat chips and oil on Medium-high for 2 minutes in microwave.  Stir once, then microwave on High for 10 seconds and stir.  Pour over cereal; mix and stir until smooth.  Spread on three waxed paper lined baking sheets.  Cool.  Break apart.  Store in airtight container.<!><!><!>none
6151<!><!><!>PARTY PIN WHEELS<!><!><!>Mix first 3 ingredients.  Spread on tortillas.  Sprinkle fixings on top.  Roll up jelly roll style, wrap tightly.  Chill 2 hours or over night.  Cut off ends, slice accordingly, 3/4 inch slices.<!><!><!>none
6152<!><!><!>PARTY PUNCH<!><!><!>In a large punch bowl, combine first 4 ingredients. Add sliced lemons and limes for added color and flavor. Just before serving, slowly drop the sherbet in by large spoonfuls. Serves approximately 25 people.<!><!><!>none
6153<!><!><!>PARTY SHRIMP<!><!><!>Melt the butter in a pan, but do not let it brown.  Mix in the garlic salt.  Add the shrimp and cook, stirring, over medium heat for about 8 minutes, until the shrimp begin to turn pink.  Do not overcook.  Add the Worcestershire sauce.  Stir to mix.  Turn off the heat; cover and let sit for 4 to 5 minutes.  Sprinkle on the parsley.  Pierce each shrimp with a toothpick or place the shrimp in a serving dish with toothpicks alongside so guests can help themselves.  Serve warm or cold.  Serves 8.<!><!><!>none
6154<!><!><!>PARTY BEANS<!><!><!>Brown the ground chuck. Spoon off the fat. Add onions and celery to meat and cook until tender. Stir in the soup, paste and catsup. Simmer for 15 minutes. Drain the green, lima and wax beans and combine with meat mixture. Do not drain the other beans, just add. Stir in brown sugar and mustard. Bake in a preheated 325° oven for 1 hour or cook in crock-pot on low all day.<!><!><!>none
6155<!><!><!>PARTY SAUSAGE CHEESE BALLS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°.  Mix all ingredients well and form into 1-inch balls. Bake 15 minutes on ungreased cookie sheet until golden brown.  Makes about 6 dozen balls.<!><!><!>none
6156<!><!><!>PARTY MIX<!><!><!>Combine first 6 ingredients in large roasting pan.  Combine oil, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce and garlic salt.  Pour over first 6 ingredients and toss to coat.  Bake at 250 degrees for 1 1/2 hours, stirring frequently.<!><!><!>none
6157<!><!><!>PARTY PECANS (OR WALNUTS)<!><!><!>Beat egg white until frothy with 1 tablespoon water.  Melt butter in pot.  Add sugar, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg.  Put nuts into egg white and coat well, then put them into sugar mixture. Cover well.  Place in pan with butter and bake at 250° until done.<!><!><!>none
6158<!><!><!>NUTS & BOLTS PARTY MIX<!><!><!>Mix oil, Worcestershire sauce, garlic salt and seasoned salt. Pour over cereal and mix with wooden spoon.  Bake at 250 degrees for 2 hours, turning mix every 15 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6159<!><!><!>PARTY POTATO SKINS<!><!><!>Cut potatoes in half lengthwise.  Scoop out pulp, leaving 1/8 inch thick shells.  (Save pulp for another use.)   Brush with melted butter; broil 6 inches from heat until crisp.  Place cut side up on ungreased baking sheet.  Sprinkle with garlic salt and cheese.  Broil 30 seconds or until cheese melts.  Top with bacon and chives.  Yield: 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
6160<!><!><!>CHEX PARTY MIX<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 250°. Heat butter or margarine in a shallow baking pan in oven until melted. Remove from oven and stir in seasoned salt and Worcestershire sauce. Add Chex, nuts and pretzels. Mix until all pieces are coated. Bake in oven 1 hour. Stir every 15 minutes. Spread on absorbent paper to cool. Makes 9 cups.<!><!><!>none

Pour white chocolate over cereal mixture.  Toss to coat evenly.  Spread mixture on waxed paper to dry.  Break into small chunks.  Store tightly covered.<!><!><!>none

6165<!><!><!>PARTY POPCORN<!><!><!>In large bowl, place popcorn.  In 1-quart saucepan, melt butter over low heat (2 to 3 minutes).  Follow directions for desired variation.  Serve immediately.<!><!><!>none
6166<!><!><!>PARTY POPCORN<!><!><!>Variations:<!><!><!>none
6167<!><!><!>PARTY POPCORN<!><!><!>Tex-Mex Popcorn:  Stir 1/4 teaspoon hot pepper sauce into melted butter.  Drizzle over popcorn; toss to evenly coat.  In small bowl, combine 1 teaspoon chili powder and 1/4 teaspoon garlic salt.  Sprinkle over popcorn; toss to evenly coat.<!><!><!>none
6168<!><!><!>PARTY POPCORN<!><!><!>Savory Popcorn:  Stir 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce into melted butter.  Drizzle over popcorn; toss to evenly coat.  In small bowl, combine 1 teaspoon paprika, 1/2 teaspoon seasoned salt, 1/4 teaspoon basil leaves, 1/4 teaspoon marjoram leaves, 1/4 teaspoon thyme leaves and 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder.  Sprinkle over popcorn; toss to evenly coat.<!><!><!>none
6169<!><!><!>PARTY POPCORN<!><!><!>Parmesan Italian Popcorn:  Drizzle melted butter over popcorn; toss to evenly coat.  In small bowl, combine 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese, 1 teaspoon basil leaves, 1/2 teaspoon oregano leaves and 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder.  Sprinkle over popcorn; toss to evenly coat.<!><!><!>none
6170<!><!><!>PARTY POPCORN<!><!><!>Praline Pecan Popcorn:  Increase butter to 1/2 cup.  Stir 1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon into melted butter.  Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until mixture comes to full boil (3 to 5 minutes).  Boil, stirring constantly, 7 minutes.  Remove from heat; stir in 2/3 cup chopped pecans.  Slowly pour over popcorn; stir to evenly coat.  Cool 10 minutes; break apart.<!><!><!>none
6171<!><!><!>PARTY BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>In a large resealable plastic bag, combine flour, salt and pepper; add beef cubes and shake to coat. In a skillet over medium heat, brown beef in oil. Place beef and drippings in a greased, shallow 2 1/2-quart baking dish.<!><!><!>none
6172<!><!><!>PARTY BEEF CASSEROLE<!><!><!>To skillet, add water, broth, garlic, onion, thyme and rosemary; bring to a boil. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Stir in mushrooms. Pour over meat; mix well. Cover and bake at 350° for 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 hours or until beef is tender. Sprinkle peas over meat. Spread potatoes evenly over top. Brush with butter. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake 15 to 20 minutes more. Yield: 6 to 8 servings.<!><!><!>none

6174<!><!><!>PARTY SALMON BALL<!><!><!>Drain salmon thoroughly. Flake carefully. Combine with softened cream cheese. Add next 5 ingredients; mix thoroughly. Cover bowl. 6204<!><!><!>SWEET POTATO PARTY LOG<!><!><!>Combine first 5 ingredients and cook over medium heat until very thick (about 10 minutes), stirring frequently. Gradually knead in sugar until dough is smooth, but still slightly sticky. Assemble cookie press; fill with mint mixture, following directions. Press through cookie press in desired shape onto cool cookie sheet. Allow mints to firm up 20 to 30 minutes before attempting to arrange on plate for serving.<!><!><!>none

6216<!><!><!>PAINTBRUSH PARTY COOKIES<!><!><!>How to Make the Egg Yolk Paint:  Over a bowl, poke a small hole in the bottom of an egg with paring knife.  Let egg white drain out.  Get as much as you can.  Don't take out the yolk.  Put egg yolk in another mixing bowl.  Add 1/4 tsp water.  Mix with fork. Pour egg yolk into paper cups.  Add a different food coloring to each cup.<!><!><!>none

6236<!><!><!>ZESTY PARTY CRUNCH<!><!><!>Heat oven to 325°. In 13 x 9-inch baking pan, heat margarine in oven until melted. Remove pan from oven. Stir in cheese and seasoning. 6237<!><!><!>THE ORIGINAL CHEX<!><!><!>Heat oven to 250°. Melt butter in large roasting pan in oven. Stir in seasonings. Gradually stir in remaining ingredients until evenly coated. Bake 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes. Spread on paper towels to cool. Store in airtight container. Makes 12 cups snack.<!><!><!>none
6238<!><!><!>THE ORIGINAL CHEX<!><!><!>Microwave Directions: Melt butter in large microwavable bowl, uncovered, on High. Stir in seasonings. Gradually stir in remaining ingredients until evenly coated. Microwave, uncovered, on High 5 to 6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes. Spread on paper towels to cool. Store in airtight container.<!><!><!>none
6239<!><!><!>THE ORIGINAL CHEX<!><!><!>Important: Because microwaves cook differently, time is approximate.<!><!><!>none
6240<!><!><!>THE ORIGINAL CHEX<!><!><!>Reduced-Fat Recipe: Use 3 tablespoons of margarine instead of the 6 tablespoons butter, omit nuts and use fat-free bagel chips.<!><!><!>none

6258<!><!><!>PARTY MIX<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients in a large pan (a dish pan is good for this). 6272<!><!><!>CRANBERRY-APPLE-ORANGE SALAD<!><!><!>In food processor or blender, grind cranberries, apple and orange.  Mix with sugar and set aside.  Prepare gelatin according to package directions, using 1/4 cup less of cold water.  Chill until it begins to thicken.  Add cranberry mixture and nuts.  Mix well.  Pour into a mold, if desired, or leave in a bowl and stir before serving.  Chill until set.  Can even be made a day ahead. Keeps well in refrigerator for a few days.<!><!><!>none

6275<!><!><!>GRAPEFRUIT, PINEAPPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve Jell-O in cup of hot water; add pineapple and grapefruit juices.  Mix pineapple and grapefruit sections and add. Place in grapefruit hulls and congeal.  (I usually divide my fruit around in the 8 halves and pour in gelatin mixture.)  When ready to serve, cut cross the halves, making 16 servings.<!><!><!>none
6276<!><!><!>GRAPEFRUIT, PINEAPPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Dressing:  Cook 2 egg yolks, pineapple juice and sugar until thick.  Let cool and fold into whipping cream.  Serve with salad.<!><!><!>none
6277<!><!><!>JANE'S LIME-PEAR JELLO SALAD<!><!><!>Heat  1 cup pear juice.  Add Jell-O and dissolve.  Mash pears and  combine with cream cheese.  Add Jell-O.  Let stand in refrigerator  until  almost set.  Add 2 cups Cool Whip and stir together.  Chill 4 hours.<!><!><!>none
6278<!><!><!>PLUM OR APRICOT DUMPLINGS<!><!><!>Bake potatoes.  Peel while hot and puree.  Make dough with potatoes, butter, flour, sugar and eggs.  Pit the fruit and stew in wine with cloves over low heat, just until boiling.   Remove fruit carefully from wine and cool.  Make dough into two rolls and cut into one-inch slices.  Place one piece of fruit on one piece of dough, covering fruit completely.  Cook in simmering, salted water over medium flame.  Be careful not to boil, about 10 minutes. Carefully remove.  Brown bread crumbs in a little butter and mix with cinnamon; sprinkle over dumplings.  Can also be served with vanilla sauce.<!><!><!>none
6279<!><!><!>LIME-RASPBERRY PIE<!><!><!>Reserve a few raspberries for garnish.  In a medium bowl, combine milk and juice.  Fold in topping and raspberries.  Spoon into pie crust.  Cover and chill 3 hours.  Garnish.  Makes 10 servings.  This is very rich, but good!<!><!><!>none

6284<!><!><!>CRANBERRY APPLE PEAR RELISH<!><!><!>Pare, halve, core and chop apples and pears.  Put in a medium saucepan.  Add washed cranberries, sugar, water and horseradish. Bring to boiling. 6286<!><!><!>RAW CRANBERRY/ORANGE/APPLE RELISH<!><!><!>Wash cranberries and remove any stems.  Wash and seed oranges (do not peel) and cut into chunks suitable for grinder.  Wash and core apples and cut into chunks (do not peel).  Grind the fruits together; mix well and add sugar.  Like stew, it improves with age and will keep well in refrigerator for about a week.  Freezes indefinitely and good with meat or fowl.<!><!><!>none
6287<!><!><!>LIME PEAR SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve Jell-O in 2 cups boiling water.  Add pear juice and water to 2 cups.  Let Jell-O partially set.  Meanwhile, let cream cheese soften.  In blender or electric mixer, blend cheese and cream.  Add partially set Jell-O, blending well.  Fold in cut up pears and chopped nuts.  Pour into a large flat dish.  Chill overnight.  Cut into squares to serve.<!><!><!>none

6291<!><!><!>APRICOT-LIME SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve lime gelatin in hot water. Soak 1 tablespoon gelatin in cold water and add to hot mixture; cool. Add ginger ale.  Pour into 9-inch ring mold. Serve with dressing.<!><!><!>none

6298<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY KIWI SMOOTHIES<!><!><!>Peel kiwi, cut in quarters and freeze for 20 minutes or until frozen. Add all ingredients to blender. Blender will be full. Pour into glasses. Serve immediately.<!><!><!>none

6319<!><!><!>BLUEBERRY OR BLACKBERRY COBBLER<!><!><!>Mix berries, sugar, flour, salt and lemon juice. Pour into greased 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Dot with butter. 6320<!><!><!>PEAR OR CHERRY/PINEAPPLE COBBLER<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°.  Dissolve the first 5 ingredients in a large pan of boiling water (2 cups).  Add pears and 1 more cup of water.  Bring mixture to a low boil until pears are soft and tender.  Stir as needed.  Add rest of water, if needed.  When pears are soft and tender, turn heat to low.  Check occasionally while preparing the dough.  For best results the pears should be much like lumpy applesauce.  Just before putting fruit into dough lined baking pan, bring fruit to rolling boil.<!><!><!>none
6321<!><!><!>PEAR OR CHERRY/PINEAPPLE COBBLER<!><!><!>Fruit Preparation (Cherry/Pineapple):<!><!><!>none
6322<!><!><!>PEAR OR CHERRY/PINEAPPLE COBBLER<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°.  Put all ingredients in a large pan. Bring to a boil. Simmer fruit mixture until dough is ready.  Check occasionally while preparing dough.  Just before putting fruit into dough lined baking pan, bring fruit to rolling boil.<!><!><!>none
6323<!><!><!>PEAR OR CHERRY/PINEAPPLE COBBLER<!><!><!>Dough Preparation:<!><!><!>none
6324<!><!><!>PEAR OR CHERRY/PINEAPPLE COBBLER<!><!><!>Put first 4 ingredients in a sifter (do not sift yet).  Put honey in a medium mixing bowl. Blend the butter into honey with a fork. Stir in eggs with a fork.  You might want to check the fruit mixture. Sift 1/3 of the flour mixture in medium mixing bowl. Stir in thoroughly. Sift in the second 1/3 and stir in thoroughly. Sift in the last 1/3 and stir in thoroughly. Dough will be very moist.<!><!><!>none
6325<!><!><!>PEAR OR CHERRY/PINEAPPLE COBBLER<!><!><!>Making The Cobbler:  Prepare the 9 x 9-inch deep dish baking pan or a very deep 5 or 6-inch cake pan.  Lightly grease. Sprinkle in a light covering of flour, making sure the bottom and sides have flour on them.  Line the pan with thin layer of dough (bottom and sides). Sprinkle 1 to 2 tablespoons of sugar in the bottom of the pan.  Pour 2 to 3 tablespoons of cream on bottom of pan.  Put pan on  a cookie sheet (to keep oven clean).  Pour in boiling fruit mixture. Cover mixture with thin layer of dough. Sprinkle 1 to 2 tablespoons of sugar over top layer of dough.  Pour 2 to 3 tablespoons of cream over top layer of dough.  Pour 1/8 to 1/4 cup of water over top layer.  Make 4 to 6 breathing holes. Cook for 40 minutes (or until golden brown) at 350°.  Serve in desired quantities with cream or ice cream.  Makes 9 servings.<!><!><!>none
6326<!><!><!>PEAR OR CHERRY/PINEAPPLE COBBLER<!><!><!>This was entered in the State Fair of Texas. It is more of a guide.  I never do it exactly the same each time. The more I practice with it, the better it gets.<!><!><!>none
6327<!><!><!>PEAR OR CHERRY/PINEAPPLE COBBLER<!><!><!>The recipe is an adaptation of ideas from my wife (Helen Todd), my mother (Martha Todd), my mother-in-law (Ermine Heckman) and my Grandma Todd and was created by me.<!><!><!>none
6328<!><!><!>PEAR, RASPBERRY AND RHUBARB CRISP<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°.  In a large bowl, stir raspberries, rhubarb, pears, honey, flour and cinnamon.  Pour into greased 13 x 9-inch baking dish.<!><!><!>none
6329<!><!><!>PEAR, RASPBERRY AND RHUBARB CRISP<!><!><!>To mix topping:  In medium bowl, stir together oats, flour, brown sugar, cinnamon and salt.  Combine margarine and jelly; heat or microwave until melted.  Stir into flour mixture until crumbly. Sprinkle over fruit.  Bake for 40 to 50 minutes, until fruit is done.<!><!><!>none
6330<!><!><!>GLAZED ORANGES WITH KIWI<!><!><!>Cut thin slivers of peel from one orange with a vegetable parer or sharp knife, being careful not to cut into white membrane.  Cover peel with boiling water; let stand 5 minutes. Drain.<!><!><!>none
6331<!><!><!>GLAZED ORANGES WITH KIWI<!><!><!>Mix sugar and cornstarch in a 2-cup measure; stir in water and orange peel.  Microwave, uncovered, on High (100%), stirring every minute with a fork, until thickened, 2 to 3 minutes.  Let cool 5 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6332<!><!><!>GLAZED ORANGES WITH KIWI<!><!><!>Pare oranges, cutting deep enough to remove all white membrane.  Cut into slices.  Pour syrup over slices; cover and refrigerate about 1 hour.  Just before serving, fold in kiwi fruit.<!><!><!>none
6333<!><!><!>ORANGE ROUGHY FISH WITH KIWI FRUIT<!><!><!>Place fish in glass dish which has been sprayed with Pam. Sprinkle with salt, garlic, pepper and oregano to taste.  Add kiwi slices.  Slowly squeeze and dribble lime over fish.  Add nuts. Dribble margarine over all.  Cover with tin foil to keep from drying out fish.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes until flaky.<!><!><!>none
6334<!><!><!>LIME PEAR SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve the gelatin in the boiling water.  Drain the pears and reserve the juice.  Heat the juice to a boil and add the cream cheese to dissolve.  Set aside to cool.  Mash the pears with a fork.  Cool the gelatin until it begins to gel, then beat for a few minutes.  Add the pear juice and cream cheese mixture.  Add the crushed pears and beat again for a few minutes.  Fold in the whipped topping.  Refrigerate in an oblong glass baking dish.  Top with coconut or red cherries, if desired.<!><!><!>none
6335<!><!><!>CRANBERRY, PEARS AND APPLES<!><!><!>Boil sugar and water for 3 minutes; add cranberries and boil for 2 more minutes.  Add apples and pears to mixture and boil another 8 minutes.  Delicious!  Put in a pretty bowl.<!><!><!>none
6336<!><!><!>LIME AND PEAR SALAD<!><!><!>Let jello and hot water firm up a little (not completely). Blend softened cream cheese with jello.  Add 1 small and 1 large can of pears.  Cut the halves in about 3 pieces.  Refrigerate until firm.<!><!><!>none
6337<!><!><!>EASY COBBLER - PEACH, CHERRY, APPLE<!><!><!>Melt butter and pour in the bottom of a 9 x 11-inch baking pan.  Make batter of 1 cup sugar, flour, powder powder, salt and milk.  Mix and pour batter over melted butter.  Spoon in fruit with juice.  Sprinkle 1/2 cup sugar over the batter.  Do not stir. Bake 45 minutes to 1 hour at 350°.<!><!><!>none
6338<!><!><!>MICROWAVE PINEAPPLE KIWI FRUIT JAM<!><!><!>In 2-quart microwave-safe bowl, combine kiwi fruit, sugar, lime juice and pineapple.  Microwave on High for 11 1/2 to 16 minutes or until mixture comes to full rolling boil, stirring every 2 minutes. Stir in liquid pectin.  Microwave on High for 2 to 3 minutes or until mixture comes to full rolling boil; continue to boil for 1 minute.  Skim foam, stir in food color.  Spoon into 5 clean, hot 8-ounce jars; screw lids on firmly.  Cool several hours.  Store in refrigerator up to 3 weeks or in freezer up to 3 months.  Makes 4 1/2 cups.<!><!><!>none
6339<!><!><!>CHERRY FIG BARS<!><!><!>Combine first 7 ingredients in a bowl; stir well.  Add eggs; stir until dry ingredients are moistened (batter will be slightly thick).  Spread into a 9-inch square baking pan coated well with cooking spray.  Bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean.  Cool in pan for 10 minutes; cut into bars about 2 inches across.  Bake about 12 to 15 minutes or until browned.  (The cookies won't be crisp unless they are browned.)  Yields 44 cookies.  Calories:  144 for 2 cookies. Food exchange:  1 bread and 1 1/2 fat.<!><!><!>none
6340<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY KIWI PIZZA<!><!><!>Mix flour, pecan chips and butter and put in pizza pan.  Cook on 350° for 10 to 15 minutes.  Mix together cream cheese, powdered sugar and Cool Whip (save about 1 cup Cool Whip) until smooth and put on top of cooled cake.  Add sliced strawberries to cover pizza.  Cover with strawberry glaze.  Decorate with kiwi.  Dot top of pizza with leftover Cool Whip.<!><!><!>none
6341<!><!><!>BLACKBERRY OR RASPBERRY JAM<!><!><!>Crush berries one layer at a time.  Measure fruit packed solidly in cup; if slightly short add water.  Put into 6 to 8-quart pan.  Measure sugar and set aside.<!><!><!>none
6342<!><!><!>BLACKBERRY OR RASPBERRY JAM<!><!><!>Stir Sure-Jell into fruit (pan must not be more than 1/3 full to allow a full boil).  Bring to a full boil over high, stirring constantly.  At once, stir in sugar.  Stir and bring to a full rolling boil (a boil that cannot be stirred down).  Then boil hard 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Skim off foam with large metal spoon.  Immediately ladle into jars.  Wipe rims of jars with damp cloth.  After cooled, cover with wax.  Use 1/2 teaspoon butter and 1/4 cup sugar with Sure-Jell to produce less foam on top.<!><!><!>none
6343<!><!><!>RASPBERRY-PEAR PIE<!><!><!>In a mixing bowl, combine sugar, flour, orange peel and cinnamon. Add pears and raspberries; toss to coat. Set aside.<!><!><!>none
6344<!><!><!>RASPBERRY-PEAR PIE<!><!><!>For pie shell, prepare double-crust pastry. Roll out half of pastry to a 12-inch circle and line a 9-inch pie plate. Fill pastry-lined pie plate with pear mixture. Dot filling with margarine or butter. Trim bottom pastry to 1/2-inch beyond the pie plate. Roll out remaining pastry to 12-inch circle.  Cut into 1/2-inch wide strips. Weave strips on top of filling to make a lattice. Trim strips even with edge of bottom pastry.  Fold under pastry and flute edge. Cover edge of pie with foil. Bake in a 375° oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 25 to 30 minutes more or until crust is golden. Spoon Glazed Nut Topping over warm pie.  Cool on wire rack. Serve with sweetened whipped cream.<!><!><!>none
6345<!><!><!>RASPBERRY-PEAR PIE<!><!><!>Glazed Nut Topping:<!><!><!>none
6346<!><!><!>RASPBERRY-PEAR PIE<!><!><!>In a small saucepan, combine margarine or butter and walnuts. Cook and stir over medium heat until walnuts are lightly browned. Stir in brown sugar. Heat and stir 1 minute.  Carefully stir in milk.<!><!><!>none
6347<!><!><!>LIME PEAR JELLO SALAD<!><!><!>Drain pears and heat juice.  Mash pears.  Add Jell-O to heated juice.  Dissolve thoroughly.  Add mashed pears to Jell-O mixture. Chill until slightly set.  Whip cream cheese and mayonnaise.  Add to Jell-O mixture.  Whip the whipping cream.  Fold into Jell-O mixture.  Put in mold.  Refrigerate until set.<!><!><!>none
6348<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY FIG JAM<!><!><!>Mash figs and bring to boil.  Cook for 10 minutes then add strawberry jello and sugar.  Cook for 10 minutes, then pour in jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6349<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY FIG JAM<!><!><!>Cover figs with jello and sugar.  Let stand 45 minutes.  Cook slowly 5 minutes.  Raise heat, but don't bring to a boil.  Cook 15 minutes or until thickens.  Put in hot jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6350<!><!><!>FIG (STRAWBERRY) PRESERVES<!><!><!>Use potato masher to mash fruit to a fine pulp.  Add sugar and jello.  Cook over low heat until mixture comes to a boil.  Let boil 15 to 20 minutes and put into jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6351<!><!><!>APRICOT-LIME SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve gelatin in hot water.  Stir in cold water and ginger ale.  Pour into 9-inch ring mold.  Chill until partially set. Fill centers of apricot halves with cream cheese balls, rolled in nuts.<!><!><!>none
6352<!><!><!>APRICOT-LIME SALAD<!><!><!>Place, cheese side down, on top of partially set gelatin, alternating with maraschino cherries.  Chill until firm.  Unmold. Can be served with favorite dressing.  Makes 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
6353<!><!><!>FIG-LEMON CONSERVE<!><!><!>Mix figs and sugar in a heavy saucepan.  Cook on low for 15 minutes.  Add gelatin; mix well.  Seal in hot jars.<!><!><!>none
6354<!><!><!>FRESH RASPBERRY, STRAWBERRY OR PEACH PIE<!><!><!>Bake and cool pie crust.  Boil sugar and 1 1/4 cups water until the sugar is dissolved.  Mix cornstarch with 3 tablespoons water and add to sugar mixture.  Cook until thick.  I add a little crushed fruit to give it color.  Cool mixture a little, then carefully stir in fruit.  Pour into pie shell and refrigerate until ready to serve.  Superb!<!><!><!>none
6355<!><!><!>PRESERVED PLUMS OR PLUM SAUCE<!><!><!>Boil plums 15 minutes. Drain off juice. Add all other ingredients and boil 30 minutes.  Pour into Mason jars while still very hot so jars will seal.<!><!><!>none
6356<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY AND KIWI SALAD<!><!><!>Arrange kiwi slices in overlapping circles in a shallow dish. Place 1/2 of strawberries, cut side out, around edge of dish to form a border.  Arrange remaining strawberries in a flower-petal pattern in center of plate.  Combine lime juice and fructose and pour over fruit, cover and chill until served.  Makes 4 servings; 74 calories and 0 fat.<!><!><!>none
6357<!><!><!>ORANGE-FIG DROPS<!><!><!>Cream butter, cheese  and  sugar  until light.  Beat in marmalade.  Stir together  dry  ingredients  and  1/4 teaspoon salt;  stir into creamed  mixture.  Fold  in  figs.  Drop by 1 1/2 tablespoonfuls on an ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° until browned, 12 to  15  minutes.  Cool.  Frost  with  Orange Frosting. Makes 2 dozen.<!><!><!>none
6358<!><!><!>ORANGE-FIG DROPS<!><!><!>Orange Frosting:<!><!><!>none
6359<!><!><!>ORANGE-FIG DROPS<!><!><!>Blend ingredients; beat well.<!><!><!>none
6360<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY, RASPBERRY OR PINEAPPLE SQUARES<!><!><!>Mix flour, brown sugar, Grape-Nuts and margarine.  Spread on cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes, stirring often into crumbs.  Drain some of juice from fruit.  Combine egg whites, sugar and lemon juice with fruit in large mixing bowl and beat on high speed until soft peaks (maybe 10 minutes).  Fold in large Cool Whip.  Spread 1/2 crumbs in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Cover with filling and then rest of crumbs.  Cover with foil and freeze.  Can be made several days in advance.<!><!><!>none
6361<!><!><!>PEAR LIME JELLO<!><!><!>Drain pears, saving the juice. Add water to pear juice to make 1 cup.  Bring to a boil. Add lime Jell-O and mix for 2 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6362<!><!><!>PEAR LIME JELLO<!><!><!>With mixer, add 2 tablespoons of whipped topping to cream cheese and mix well.  Slowly add lime Jell-O to cream cheese, using mixer.  Add the rest of the whipped topping to lime mixture, using mixer.  Mash pears and fold into lime mixture.  Pour into a bowl and chill.<!><!><!>none
6363<!><!><!>APRICOT OR LIME JELLO SALAD MOLD<!><!><!>Mix dry jello with cream cheese.  Add 1 1/2 cups boiling water and stir until all lumps are gone.  Add pineapple and stir.  Mold and refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
6364<!><!><!>BANANA-STRAWBERRY-ORANGE POPS<!><!><!>You will also need 4 or 5 small paper cups and 4 or 5 popsicle sticks.<!><!><!>none
6365<!><!><!>BANANA-STRAWBERRY-ORANGE POPS<!><!><!>First, wash your hands.  Have an adult help you crush the banana and strawberries in a blender; add the orange juice and mix again for about 20 seconds.  Pour the juices into the cups; put a stick in it and put in the freezer overnight.  Pull the paper cup off and enjoy a yummy frozen fruit treat.<!><!><!>none
6366<!><!><!>CRANBERRY-ORANGE-APRICOT BREAD<!><!><!>Heat oven to 350°.  Grease and flour bottom only of 9 x 5-inch loaf pan.  Combine first six ingredients, mixing well; set aside. Beat eggs and oil with wire whisk to blend thoroughly.  Mix in orange juice, water and orange peel.  Add dry ingredients, mixing just until moistened.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes.   Cool 15 minutes.  Remove from pan and cool completely.<!><!><!>none
6367<!><!><!>BANANA/PINEAPPLE/ORANGE PUNCH<!><!><!>You will need a 5 to 6-quart freezer container.<!><!><!>none
6368<!><!><!>BANANA/PINEAPPLE/ORANGE PUNCH<!><!><!>Combine sugar and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil slowly.  Stir constantly until sugar dissolves.  Pour sugar and water mixture into a 5 to 6-quart freezer container.  Add frozen juices, bananas and lemon juice, stirring thoroughly.  Freeze until firm.  Remove mixture from freezer several hours before serving to partially thaw.  Pour into a punch bowl and stir in ginger ale, Orange Crush (optional) and orange and lemon slices.  Makes 2 1/2 gallons.<!><!><!>none
6369<!><!><!>LEMON-LIME JELLO, CHEESE AND PINEAPPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Mix lemon and lime Jell-O with 1 1/2 cups boiling water until dissolved.  Add 2 more cups cold water.  Allow to cool until it starts to set.  Add the softened cream cheese, mixed with 1/4 cup of water and the Ricotta cheese, mixed with 1/4 cup of water. Stir vigorously or use a mixer.  Then stir in the crushed pineapple.  Allow to set in the refrigerator.<!><!><!>none
6370<!><!><!>CRANBERRY FIG BARS<!><!><!>In saucepan, combine cranberries, figs and honey.  Cook, covered, over low heat for 15 minutes or until cranberries pop. Stir often.  Stir in vanilla.<!><!><!>none
6371<!><!><!>CRANBERRY FIG BARS<!><!><!>In large mixing bowl, stir together flour, oatmeal, brown sugar, soda, cinnamon and salt.  Blend in butter.  Put half of oat mixture on bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 8 minutes.  Remove and spread fruit filling over baked layer. Sprinkle remaining oat mixture over top and pat gently.  Bake 20 minutes longer, until golden.  Cool.<!><!><!>none
6372<!><!><!>CRANBERRY FIG BARS<!><!><!>Lemon Glaze:<!><!><!>none
6373<!><!><!>CRANBERRY FIG BARS<!><!><!>Combine sifted powdered sugar with lemon juice, adding juice until of spreading consistency.  Drizzle over top and cut into bars.  Makes 36.<!><!><!>none
6374<!><!><!>GRAPEFRUIT PINEAPPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Cream together cream cheese and sugar.  Dissolve gelatin in 1/4 cup water.  Add boiling water.  Stir until dissolved.  Add to mixture.  Combine well.  Add crushed pineapple, grapefruit sections and juice and walnuts or pecans.  Chill until firm.<!><!><!>none
6375<!><!><!>GRAPEFRUIT PINEAPPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Note:  It might be good if your pineapple is real tart to sprinkle about 1/4 cup sugar and let set before adding to other ingredients.<!><!><!>none
6376<!><!><!>PEAR LIME SALAD<!><!><!>Mix pear juice and jello.  Mix milk with cream cheese.  Let jello cool, then mix pears - when like egg whites.  Mix in whipping cream.<!><!><!>none
6377<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY FIG JAM<!><!><!>Combine mashed figs, sugar and jello and mix thoroughly.  Let stand 30 minutes.  Slowly bring to a boil and boil slowly for 10 to 15 minutes.  Pour into jars and process in water bath for 10 minutes.  Can be mixed and stored in refrigerator overnight.<!><!><!>none
6378<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY FIG JAM<!><!><!>Note:  Raspberry or cherry jello can be used.<!><!><!>none
6379<!><!><!>KIWI LIME COOLER<!><!><!>Puree all ingredients, except strawberries, in blender until thick and frothy.  Pour into glasses and top with sliced strawberries.  Serves 2.<!><!><!>none
6380<!><!><!>TANGERINE CRANBERRY RELISH<!><!><!>Squeeze the juice of 2 tangerines to measure 1/2 cup.  Peel remaining 3 tangerines, separate segments.  Cut each segment in half, removing seeds.  In a 3-quart saucepan bring cranberries, sugar and tangerine juice to a boil over high heat, stirring frequently.  Reduce heat to low.  Simmer, uncovered, until all cranberries pop.  Spoon cranberry mixture into bowl and stir in tangerine segments.   Cover and refrigerate at least 3 hours. Makes 4 cups.<!><!><!>none
6381<!><!><!>PEAR LIME MOLD SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve gelatin in pear syrup and bring to boil.  Chill until slightly thickened.  Mash pears; whip with mixer.  Beat in cream cheese until smooth and add to slightly thickened gelatin.  Fold in whipped cream.  You may want to reserve some for topping.  Chill until set.<!><!><!>none
6382<!><!><!>CRANBERRY ORANGE WITH CHERRY GELATIN<!><!><!>Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.  Stir in Indian Trail cranberry orange sauce and pineapple.  Pour into mold.<!><!><!>none
6383<!><!><!>FIG PRESERVES WITH STRAWBERRIES<!><!><!>Cook 3 to 5 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6384<!><!><!>LIME PEAR SALAD<!><!><!>Heat 1 cup pear juice to boiling.  Add jello and sugar and dissolve.  Add cream cheese and mix well.  Add one cup mashed pears.  Let stand until slightly thick, but not firm.  Use beater through jello to whip it up.  Add whipped cream.  Mix chopped cherries and nuts if desired.  This can be molded or set in plain bowl.<!><!><!>none
6385<!><!><!>LIME PEAR SALAD<!><!><!>Note:  Pear juice is the only liquid used to dissolve jello.<!><!><!>none
6386<!><!><!>BLACKBERRY APRICOT<!><!><!>Combine  fruit.  Mix  dry  ingredients,  add  to fruit. Pour into  unbaked  9-inch  pie  shell.  Top with second crust after dotting with butter.  Bake for one hour at 400°.<!><!><!>none
6387<!><!><!>BLACKBERRY APRICOT<!><!><!>Hint:  May substitute peaches for apricots.<!><!><!>none
6388<!><!><!>LEMON, BANANA, PINEAPPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Mix lemon Jello and boiling water.  Add marshmallows to mixture and stir until melted.  Add drained pineapple and sliced bananas to lemon mixture.  Let set in refrigerator in 9 x 13 glass dish.  Put pineapple juice, sugar, flour, margarine and eggs in saucepan. Cook until bubbly and thickened.  Let cool.  Add Cool Whip.  Fold into cooked mixture.  Spoon and spread on top of lemon mixture and refrigerate until well set (several hours).<!><!><!>none
6389<!><!><!>CANDY ORANGE/GRAPEFRUIT PEEL<!><!><!>*I have used just orange or just grapefruit.  Four to 5 grapefruits can be used.<!><!><!>none
6390<!><!><!>CANDY ORANGE/GRAPEFRUIT PEEL<!><!><!>I  cut	my  grapefruit in half, and when eaten, I clean the membrane out of rind; if the white is thick, I scrape some of this.  Cut	in strips about 1/2-inch thick; place in large saucepan  with  water to cover.  Heat to boiling;  reduce heat and simmer  15  minutes.  Drain;  repeat with fresh water and drain 2  more times.  After the third cooking, return rind to pan.  Add 2 cups of the sugar, corn syrup, ginger, salt and 1 cup  of the water.  Cook slowly for 40 minutes, stirring often from  bottom of pan, or until most of syrup is absorbed.  Have the	gelatin softened in the remaining 1/2 cup water.  Stir it until dissolved,	then cool.  Lift out strips, one at a time; roll  in remaining 1/2 cup sugar sprinkled on a sheet of waxed paper.  Coat generously.  Place in a single layer on a cookie sheet  to  dry slightly.  If stored in a tightly covered container, peel will keep for weeks.<!><!><!>none
6391<!><!><!>Fig Strawberry Jam<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients and bring to a boil for 3 minutes.  Place in jars.  Seal and let set one or two days before freezing.<!><!><!>none
6392<!><!><!>PEARS WITH SPICY LIME, CHILE AND PEANUT CHUTNEY<!><!><!>Cut each pear lengthwise into quarters.  Using a melon baller, create a well in the center of each quarter.  In a small bowl, prepare chutney by mixing together the next seven ingredients. Spoon chutney into hollowed out section of pear quarters.  Add a sprig of mint for garnish.  Place on serving tray.<!><!><!>none
6393<!><!><!>PEAR LIME GELATIN<!><!><!>Drain pears, reserving juice; set pears aside.  Measure the juice; add water if needed to equal 1 1/2 cups.  Pour into a saucepan; bring to a boil.  Add gelatin; stir until dissolved. Gradually add cream cheese, whisking until smooth.  Cover and refrigerate until cool.  Mash reserved pears; fold into gelatin mixture.  Fold in whipped topping.  Pour into a 6-cup serving bowl. Refrigerate until set.  Yield:  6 servings.<!><!><!>none
6394<!><!><!>PEAR LIME GELATIN<!><!><!>Note:  One can prepare this salad with sugar-free gelatin successfully.<!><!><!>none
6395<!><!><!>PLUM OR PEACH CUSTARD DESSERT<!><!><!>Cream the margarine and sugar.  Sift flour, salt, cinnamon and baking powder.  Blend into creamed mixture until crumbly.  Measure out about 1/3 of mixture and press remaining mixture evenly into bottom and about 1 inch up sides of ungreased 9-inch pie pan. Arrange plums or peaches in shell.  Sprinkle with saved mixture. Bake at 400° for 15 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6396<!><!><!>PLUM OR PEACH CUSTARD DESSERT<!><!><!>Beat egg slightly.  Stir in cream (do not whip cream).  Pour over and bake 30 minutes longer or until custard is set.<!><!><!>none
6397<!><!><!>PEAR AND LIME JELLO SALAD<!><!><!>Soften cream cheese.  Put pears and cream cheese in blender; liquefy.  Bring juice to a boil.  Dissolve Jell-O and cool.  Pour into cream cheese mixture, then fold into Cool Whip.<!><!><!>none
6398<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY  JELLO FIGS<!><!><!>Mix the first 3 ingredients together and let set 1 hour or more. Cook slowly and boil 20 minutes. Add the Sure-Jell and cook 2 minutes longer.  Put in sterile jars and seal.  Tastes and looks like strawberry preserves.<!><!><!>none
6399<!><!><!>MANGO LIME MOUSSE WITH RASPBERRY SAUCE<!><!><!>Sprinkle gelatin over lime juice in a small saucepan and allow to stand for 10 minutes.  Peel mangoes and cut fruit off seed.  In a bowl, mash mangoes together with cream until smooth.  Over low heat, melt gelatin in lime juice.  Add to mango mixture.  Stir and place in bowl in refrigerator.  (You can freeze.)  On day you are going to serve, place thawed package of raspberries in blender with 1/2 cup of sugar and 1/4 cup of Chambord.  Blend, then put mixture through sieve to eliminate seed.  Pour over mousse when ready to serve.<!><!><!>none
6400<!><!><!>CHERRY, STRAWBERRY OR BLUEBERRY CHEESE CAKE<!><!><!>Melt butter in an oblong pan.  Mix flour and nuts together; add butter and press into pan.  Bake at 350° until light brown. Cool.<!><!><!>none
6401<!><!><!>CHERRY, STRAWBERRY OR BLUEBERRY CHEESE CAKE<!><!><!>Whip first 3 ingredients; pour over cool crust.  Spread filling on top and store in refrigerator.<!><!><!>none
6402<!><!><!>FIG-STRAWBERRY PRESERVES<!><!><!>Cook mashed figs and sugar 20 or 25 minutes.  When ready, add 2 small boxes jello, cook until dissolved.  Pour into jars; seal.<!><!><!>none
6403<!><!><!>BLACKBERRY RASPBERRY JELLY<!><!><!>Pour juice in pan.  Add Sure-Jell.  Stir over high heat until juice boils.  Add sugar and Jell-O.  Bring to a hard rolling boil and boil for 2 minutes.  Pour into jars.  Cool before serving.<!><!><!>none
6404<!><!><!>FIG-STRAWBERRIES<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients well; let set for 30 minutes.  Simmer for 5 minutes, cooking slowly.   Pour into jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6405<!><!><!>CRANBERRY TANGERINE SMOOTHIE<!><!><!>Mix altogether in a blender. Serve.<!><!><!>none
6406<!><!><!>CRANBERRY-TANGERINE CONSERVE<!><!><!>Remove peel from tangerines; scrape off excess white membrane. Cut and peel into very thin strips.  Reserve 3/4 cup strips.<!><!><!>none
6407<!><!><!>CRANBERRY-TANGERINE CONSERVE<!><!><!>In 6-quart kettle, combine peels and water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6408<!><!><!>CRANBERRY-TANGERINE CONSERVE<!><!><!>Meanwhile, chop the fruit from the tangerines (you need 1 1/3 cups of fruit).  Add juices from the fruit and the cranberries. Put all three into the hot peel mixture.  Return it to boiling; boil hard for 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Add walnuts.  Remove from heat and skim foam.<!><!><!>none
6409<!><!><!>CRANBERRY-TANGERINE CONSERVE<!><!><!>Ladle into hot, clean half-pint jars, leaving 1/4-inch headroom.  Wipe rims; adjust lids.  Process in boiling water bath for 15 minutes.  Yields 8 1/2 pints.<!><!><!>none
6410<!><!><!>CRANBERRY-TANGERINE CONSERVE<!><!><!>Makes a lovely gift from the kitchen.<!><!><!>none
6411<!><!><!>TOPPING FOR APPLE, BLUEBERRY OR CHERRY PIE<!><!><!>Mix all together and use as needed.<!><!><!>none
6412<!><!><!>PEACH, STRAWBERRY OR BLACKBERRY COBBLER<!><!><!>Melt butter in a 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan.  Combine flour, 1 cup sugar and milk.  Spoon evenly over margarine.  Do not stir. Combine fruit with remaining cup of sugar (may need more sugar if fruit is tart).  Bring to a boil.  Ladle over butter.  Do not stir.  Bake at 375° for 30 to 45 minutes or until brown.<!><!><!>none
6413<!><!><!>CRANBERRY TANGERINE SMOOTHIE<!><!><!>Put all ingredients, except garnish, in a blender.  Blend for a few seconds on high speed or until ingredients are thoroughly combined.  Pour into a large glass and garnish with strawberry.<!><!><!>none
6414<!><!><!>PEACH OR FIG FRUIT PRESERVES<!><!><!>To keep celery crisp, stand it in a jar of cold salted water and refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
6415<!><!><!>PEACH OR FIG FRUIT PRESERVES<!><!><!>Let raw potatoes stand in cold water for 30 minutes before frying for crispier French fries.<!><!><!>none
6416<!><!><!>PEACH OR FIG FRUIT PRESERVES<!><!><!>For a juicier hamburger, add 1/2 cup cold water per pound of meat before grilling.<!><!><!>none
6417<!><!><!>BLUEBERRY/APPLE/PEACH CRISP<!><!><!>Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and egg with a fork until crumbly for topping.  This will look too dry. Fear not.<!><!><!>none
6418<!><!><!>BLUEBERRY/APPLE/PEACH CRISP<!><!><!>Fruit goes into a 2-quart casserole.  Sprinkle brown sugar over the fruit. Add topping. Dribble melted butter over top. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar.  Bake at 375° for about 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6419<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY, CRANBERRY, PINEAPPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Drain the pineapple well.  Put the juice with water to make 3 cups.  Boil and pour over the jello and mix.  Add cranberry sauce; mix.  Add pineapple and box of strawberries.  Stir now and then until everything is thawed and mixed.  Let set.<!><!><!>none
6420<!><!><!>LIME AND PEAR SALAD<!><!><!>Mix  cream  cheese  with hot jello mixture; add ginger. When partially  congealed,  add  small  can of drained sliced pears. Fruit  juice  may  be  substituted  for  cold water in jello.<!><!><!>none
6421<!><!><!>GRAPEFRUIT AND PINEAPPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Drain  fruit  and  reserve liquid.  Dissolve jello in 1 cup boiling water.  Add 1 cup grapefruit and pineapple juice. Stir well.  Add fruit and  refrigerate  in  5  x 8-inch pan or glass dish until jello  sets.  Serve  on	lettuce  leaf  with favorite dressing.  Makes 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
6422<!><!><!>GRAPEFRUIT AND PINEAPPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Variation:  Add  12  ounce  carton  cottage  cheese  to mixture before it sets.<!><!><!>none
6423<!><!><!>MANDARIN ORANGE OR ORANGE PINEAPPLE CAKE<!><!><!>Mix cake mix, eggs, Crisco and orange slices and bake in 3 (9-inch) round layer cake pans at 350° for approximately 20 to 30 minutes.  Mix Cool Whip, crushed pineapple and juice and package of pudding together and spread between cooled layers, on top and sides.  Keep cake in refrigerator.<!><!><!>none
6424<!><!><!>PEACH, APPLE OR APRICOT COBBLER<!><!><!>Melt butter in large baking dish.  Mix sifted dry ingredients with milk.  Pour the batter carefully over the butter.  Pour fruit over top of batter.  Sprinkle with 1/2 cup sugar.  Bake at 400° for 45 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6425<!><!><!>FIG - STRAWBERRY PRESERVES<!><!><!>Wash figs and cut off any dark spots.  Mash and mix other ingredients together.  Cook 3 or 4 minutes at a hard boil.  Put in jars and cover with wax.  When cooled, store in refrigerator.<!><!><!>none
6426<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY KIWI TART<!><!><!>You can use any fresh fruit, not frozen.<!><!><!>none
6427<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY KIWI TART<!><!><!>Mix baking mix and sugar.  Cut in margarine until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal.  Press mixture in bottom of a lightly sprayed with Pam spring-form pan (9 x 3-inch) or shape into 9-inch round on cookie sheet.  Bake until light brown, 9 to 12 minutes.  I bake for 8 minutes in my oven.  Cool 30 minutes.  Remove side of pan.  Do not take out of pan.  Heat 1/4 cup jam to boiling. Immediately pour and spread over crust.  Arrange fruit on top. Heat other 1/4 cup of jam to boiling.  Brush or spoon over fruit. Refrigerate at least 1 hour but no longer than 8 hours.  Cut into wedges.  Serve with whipped cream, if desired.  Serves 6.<!><!><!>none
6428<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY KIWI TART<!><!><!>Bake at 400°.<!><!><!>none
6429<!><!><!>CRANBERRY, ORANGE AND APRICOT BREAD<!><!><!>Heat oven to 350°.  Grease and flour bottom only of 9 x 5-inch loaf pan.  Combine first six ingredients, mixing well; set aside. Beat eggs and oil with fork or wire whisk to blend thoroughly; mix in orange juice, water and orange peel.  Add to dry ingredients, mixing just until moistened.   Stir in remaining ingredients. Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.  Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan.  Cool completely.  Makes 16 servings.<!><!><!>none
6430<!><!><!>JUSTIN'S CHERRY, PINEAPPLE, BANANA PIE<!><!><!>Drain cherries and pineapple, reserving juices.  Add enough water to the reserved juices to equal 2 cups.  Combine juices with cherries, pineapple, salt, sugar, flour and coloring in saucepan. Cook until thick, stirring constantly.  Cool.  Fold in bananas and pecans.  Pour into pie shells.  Garnish with whipped cream.<!><!><!>none
6431<!><!><!>LIME-APRICOT SALAD<!><!><!>In a saucepan, bring pineapple to a boil. Add remaining ingredients. Congeal and serve.<!><!><!>none
6432<!><!><!>FIG STRAWBERRY PRESERVES<!><!><!>Cook mashed figs and sugar for 10 to 15 minutes.  Add gelatin and boil until it dissolves.  Pour into hot sterilized pint jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6433<!><!><!>WHITE CHOCOLATE MOUSSE WITH KIWI AND STRAWBERRY SLICES<!><!><!>Combine sugar and water in small, heavy saucepan.  Bring to boil, stirring just until dissolved.  Boil gently until it reaches 225° on candy thermometer.  Remove from heat.  Set aside while beating egg whites.  Beat egg whites until soft peaks form.  With mixer at low speed, add sugar syrup in slow, steady stream.  Beat 30 seconds, or until fluffy.  Melt chocolate at 50% power in microwave.  Add to mixture and continue beating.  Set aside.  Whip the cream until stiff.  Fold into chocolate mixture.  Pour into serving dishes.  Chill.  Before serving, decorate top with sliced kiwi and strawberries.  Sprinkle with nuts, if desired.<!><!><!>none
6434<!><!><!>PEACH PLUM FRUIT PIE<!><!><!>Heat oven to 425°.  Prepare pie crust.<!><!><!>none
6435<!><!><!>PEACH PLUM FRUIT PIE<!><!><!>In large bowl, combine  peaches,  plums, 3/4 cup sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon and nutmeg;  mix lightly.  Spoon into pie crust lined pan.  Dot  with margarine.  Top with second crust. Cut four  4  inch slashes in center of crust forming a crisscross design.  Peel  back  center points and press lightly in crust  to hold and form eight petals.  Brush crust with milk; sprinkle  with sugar.  Bake  at  425° for 50 to 60 minutes or until  golden brown.  Serve with vanilla ice cream or garnish as desired.  Makes 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
6436<!><!><!>LEMON-LIME PINEAPPLE MOLD<!><!><!>Dissolve gelatin in water.  Mix cream cheese into hot gelatin mixture.  (Use a blender if desired.)  Refrigerate until slightly congealed.  Beat heavy cream with pineapple until smooth.  It will not be stiff.  Stir cream mixture into gelatin mixture, mixing well.  Pour immediately into a lightly oiled mold.  Refrigerate until firm.<!><!><!>none
6437<!><!><!>LIME JELLO WITH APRICOTS SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve jello in boiling water.  Add 7-Up and cold water. Stuff apricots with cream cheese and pecans.  Place in jello mold and pour jello over stuffed apricots.  Place in refrigerator and let set.<!><!><!>none
6438<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY-KIWI-TEA-SPRITE PUNCH<!><!><!>Put tea in bags in Sprite bottle.  Return lid and set some place out of the way for 2 days.  Do not shake Sprite.<!><!><!>none
6439<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY-KIWI-TEA-SPRITE PUNCH<!><!><!>When ready to use, open carefully because it foams and pour carefully over chipped ice.<!><!><!>none
6440<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY-KIWI-TEA-SPRITE PUNCH<!><!><!>One 3 liter Sprite makes nice punch bowl.<!><!><!>none
6441<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY FIG JAM<!><!><!>Combine and cook 7 minutes after it comes to a rolling boil. Pour into sterilized jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6442<!><!><!>RASPBERRY OR BLACKBERRY LIQUEUR<!><!><!>Mix all the ingredients in a 1-gallon, wide mouthed jar. Store in a cool, dark place.  Stir or shake every few days for about 3 weeks.  Strain through several layers of cheesecloth, reserving the liquid, but discarding the pulp and seeds. Refrigerated, the liqueur will keep indefinitely.  Makes 5 cups.<!><!><!>none
6443<!><!><!>FIG STRAWBERRY PRESERVE<!><!><!>Thoroughly mix	figs,  Jell-O  and  sugar  in saucepan. Bring to boil  and  boil 3 minutes, stirring constantly.	Pour quickly into glasses or jars.  Cover with paraffin.<!><!><!>none
6444<!><!><!>FIG-STRAWBERRY JAM<!><!><!>Put figs, sugar and jello in pot.  Bring to a boil.  Stir until it boils.  Then simmer 20 minutes or more.  Stir once in a while, as it boils.  Pour into jars and seal with wax.<!><!><!>none
6445<!><!><!>LIME PEAR CONGEALED SALAD<!><!><!>Heat juice from pears and dissolve jello in the juice.  Add this to the cream cheese and blend until smooth.  Let it begin to gel and then add lemon juice, chopped pears and Cool Whip. Congeal.<!><!><!>none
6446<!><!><!>KIWI RASPBERRY FINALE<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 400°.  In a large bowl, beat egg whites and salt until mixture holds soft peaks.  Stir together sugar and cornstarch.  Beat egg whites, gradually adding sugar mixture until mixture holds stiff peaks.  Beat in vinegar and vanilla.<!><!><!>none
6447<!><!><!>KIWI RASPBERRY FINALE<!><!><!>Lightly moisten a greased baking sheet.  Pile egg white mixture onto damp baking sheet, shape into a 7-inch circle.  Place in oven preheated to 350°, immediately reduce oven temperature to 250°, bake until meringue is lightly browned and dry to the touch (about 1 1/2 hours).  Let cool, lift off baking sheet with a large spatula and transfer to a serving plate.<!><!><!>none
6448<!><!><!>KIWI RASPBERRY FINALE<!><!><!>To serve, beat cream until stiff and swirl over meringue. Garnish with drained mandarins and sliced kiwi fruit.  Pass Raspberry Sauce to spoon over individual servings.  Serves 6.<!><!><!>none
6449<!><!><!>KIWI RASPBERRY FINALE<!><!><!>Raspberry Sauce:<!><!><!>none
6450<!><!><!>KIWI RASPBERRY FINALE<!><!><!>In a saucepan, add all ingredients and cook over medium heat, stirring until sauce boils and thickens.  Cool, cover and refrigerate overnight.<!><!><!>none
6451<!><!><!>LIME PEAR DELIGHT<!><!><!>Dissolve lime jello in hot pear juice.  Add sieved pears (put through a sieve) to the softened cream cheese; blend until smooth.<!><!><!>none
6452<!><!><!>GRAPEFRUIT AND ORANGE COCKTAIL SALAD<!><!><!>Halve grapefruit and remove segments.  Save shells.  Cut orange into segments and combine with grapefruit segments.  Add sugar and rum.  Place mixture into clean grapefruit shells. Garnish with chopped mint and refrigerate until serving.<!><!><!>none
6453<!><!><!>RASPBERRY FIG PRESERVES<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients in pan.  Bring to a boil and boil for 7 minutes.  Put into sterilized jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6454<!><!><!>RASPBERRY FIG PRESERVES<!><!><!>You can use strawberry jello for strawberry fig preserves.<!><!><!>none
6455<!><!><!>PEAR-BANANA-LIME MOLD<!><!><!>Pour milk into freezer tray.  Freeze until edges are icy. Drain pers, reserving syrup.  Add water to make 1 cup; bring to boil.  Dissolve gelatin in boiling liquid.  Chill until  partially set.  Gradually add milk to gelatin, whipping until double.  Dice pears.  Slice bananas; sprinkle with lemon juice.  Fold fruits into gelatin.  Pour the mixture into a 6 1/2-cup ring mold.  Chill mixture until firm.  Unmold on lettuce.  Serves 8.<!><!><!>none
6456<!><!><!>LIME JELLO MOLD WITH PEARS<!><!><!>Drain pears, reserving 1/2 cup.  Dice pears and set aside. Dissolve gelatin and salt in boiling water; add cold water, pear syrup and lemon juice.  Measure 1 1/4 cups into an 8 x 4-inch loaf pan (I use metal mold sprayed with Pam).   Chill until set, but not firm.  Gelatin should be sticky to the touch.<!><!><!>none
6457<!><!><!>LIME JELLO MOLD WITH PEARS<!><!><!>Meanwhile, soften cream cheese.  Beat in gelatin.  Fold in pears.  Spoon over set gelatin.  Chill overnight or until firm.<!><!><!>none
6458<!><!><!>PEAR HONEY OR PEAR BUTTER<!><!><!>Combine all ingredients and cook in heavy pan, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes.  Put through a food mill.<!><!><!>none
6459<!><!><!>PEAR HONEY OR PEAR BUTTER<!><!><!>Fill hot jars with hot pear butter.  Run a thin blade around inside of jar to remove air bubbles.  Process for 10 minutes in a hot water bath.<!><!><!>none
6460<!><!><!>PEAR HONEY OR PEAR BUTTER<!><!><!>Note:  Orange may be substituted for lemon to make orange pear honey.<!><!><!>none
6461<!><!><!>HAZELNUT, PEAR AND APRICOT PIE<!><!><!>Prepare a pastry for a single 9-inch pie.  Place the hazelnuts in a 8 or 9-inch wide pan.  Bake in a 350° oven until nuts are lightly browned under the skins (15 to 20 minutes).  Pour into a towel, rub lightly with towel to remove as much of the brown skins as possible.  Lift the nuts from the towel; discard the skins.<!><!><!>none
6462<!><!><!>HAZELNUT, PEAR AND APRICOT PIE<!><!><!>In a food processor or blender, whirl the nuts with sugar and flour until finely ground.  Add butter, eggs and vanilla and whirl until thoroughly blended.<!><!><!>none
6463<!><!><!>HAZELNUT, PEAR AND APRICOT PIE<!><!><!>Fit the pastry over the bottom of a plain or fluted tart pan with a removeable bottom; fold any excess pastry down to make flush with the pan rim.  Pour the nut mixture into the pastry and spread it smooth.<!><!><!>none
6464<!><!><!>HAZELNUT, PEAR AND APRICOT PIE<!><!><!>Core the pear and cut into 1/4-inch wedges.  Sprinkle with lemon juice.  Arrange the pear slices, overlapping, on nut filling. Bake in a 350° oven until filling is richly browned, about 40 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6465<!><!><!>HAZELNUT, PEAR AND APRICOT PIE<!><!><!>In a 3 to 4 cup pan over low heat, stir the apricot jam until warm (or microwave-safe bowl on full power in a microwave oven; stir every 10 seconds).  Spoon the jam onto the warm pie, then gently spread to pastry.  Serve warm or at room temperature.  If making ahead, cover airtight and chill up to 1 day.  Serves 8 to 10.<!><!><!>none
6466<!><!><!>HAZELNUT, PEAR AND APRICOT PIE<!><!><!>Per serving: 300 calories (57% from fat); 4.2g protein, 19g fat (5.2g saturated); 30g carbohydrate; 172 mg sodium; 55mg cholesterol.<!><!><!>none

6469<!><!><!>BANANA-KIWI FOOL<!><!><!>Put first five ingredients in pot over medium heat; stir to thicken and boil 1 minute.  Put in glass dish, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate. 6470<!><!><!>APRICOT-FILLED PEAR CAKE<!><!><!>Drain pears.  Save 1/2 cup juice.  Blend pears in blender until smooth.  In large bowl, combine cake mix, pureed pears, 1/2 cup pear juice and eggs at slow speed until smooth and moistened. Beat 2 minutes on high.  Pour batter in a lightly greased and floured 13 x 9-inch pan.  Grease a piece of wax paper and fit in bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes. Cool in pan 10 minutes, remove from pan and cool completely. Slice cake in half, spread apricot jam over cut half.  Replace top cake layer.  Spread with topping.  Chill well.<!><!><!>none
6471<!><!><!>CRANBERRY-APPLE-PEAR SAUCE<!><!><!>Heat all ingredients except liqueur in large pan to boiling, stirring frequently, to prevent burning.  Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, stirring frequently until mixture thickens, about 45 minutes.  Take off heat; stir in Cointreau.  Refrigerate, covered, at least 4 hours.  Better overnight or longer.  Serve chilled with turkey.<!><!><!>none

6483<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY FIG JAM<!><!><!>Combine figs, sugar and jello.  Cook until thick and transparent (about 35 to 40 minutes).  Makes 4 pints.  Wash jars in hot, soapy water.  Rinse well. 6489<!><!><!>LEMON, PINEAPPLE, MANDARIN ORANGE MOLD<!><!><!>Mix lemon jello and crushed pineapple and the juice in a cooking pot.  Mix thoroughly and cook on medium heat until it bubbles. Fold in Cool Whip very well, so it reaches evenly around the edges.   Turn into 10 to 12 cup mold or use a Bundt pan.  Refrigerate overnight before unmolding.<!><!><!>none
6490<!><!><!>APRICOT-RASPBERRY TORTE<!><!><!>Combine cake mix, nectar and egg whites.  Beat 2 minutes at high speed.  Pour into 2 (8-inch) pans, sprayed with Pam. 6501<!><!><!>PEACH PLUM PIE<!><!><!>Combine tapioca, sugar, peaches, plums and lemon juice.  Let stand 15 minutes.  Roll half of pastry and line 9-inch pie pan. Use rest for top crust or lattice top.  Dot with butter, then put topping on.  Bake at 425° for 55 minutes or until done.<!><!><!>none
6502<!><!><!>BLACKBERRY OR RASPBERRY JAM CAKE<!><!><!>Cream together 2/3 cup of butter and 1 1/2 cup sugar. Separate 3 egg yolks, reserving the whites.  Slightly beat the yolks and mix with 1 cup of jam; whip into creamed mixture.  Sift together flour, baking powder, soda, salt, ground cloves and cinnamon.  Add dry ingredients alternately with 1 cup sour milk. Beat the 3 egg whites and fold into the batter.  Add vanilla. Bake in 3 lined layer cake pans in 350° oven for 25 minutes or until done.  Test with a toothpick.  Cool and frost with cream cheese frosting or a vanilla frosting.<!><!><!>none
6503<!><!><!>BLACKBERRY OR RASPBERRY JAM CAKE<!><!><!>From a collection of recipes belonging to my mother, Florence Redman.  She frequently made this cake.<!><!><!>none
6504<!><!><!>ORANGE-GRAPEFRUIT SALAD<!><!><!>Combine first 5 ingredients in a jar.  Cover tightly and shake vigorously.  Set aside.  Just before serving, combine salad greens and remaining ingredients.  Drizzle with dressing and toss gently.<!><!><!>none
6505<!><!><!>APPLE, PEACH OR PEAR CRISP<!><!><!>Mix fruit with enough sugar to sweeten slightly.  Place in 2-quart baking dish.  In a pan, melt margarine.  Remove from heat. Add flour, oatmeal, sugar and cinnamon.  Stir until crumbly. Sprinkle over fruit.  Top with nuts.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes at 350°.  Serve with ice cream or cheese if desired.<!><!><!>none

6516<!><!><!>PEACH OR BLACKBERRY COBBLER<!><!><!>Mix fruit  with  3/4  cup sugar.  Put margarine in deep baking dish and  melt  in	a 350° oven.  Stir up batter of 3/4 cup sugar, flour,  baking  powder,  salt and milk.  Pour over melted margarine.	Do  not  stir.	Pour fruit on top.  Bake at 350° for one  hour  or  until  crust is golden brown.  Batter rises to top during baking.<!><!><!>none

6524<!><!><!>PEACH-BLACKBERRY COBBLER<!><!><!>Mix berries with peaches.  Put into pan.  Mix flour and sugar. Sprinkle evenly over fruit.  May add a dash of cinnamon or nutmeg. 6525<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY-KIWI SALAD WITH BASIL<!><!><!>Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl.  Add kiwi fruit and strawberries.  Toss well.  Cover and chill for 1 hour.  Stir in basil just before serving.  Yields 4 servings.<!><!><!>none
6526<!><!><!>APRICOT PEAR TART<!><!><!>Mix graham cracker crumbs, sugar and butter in a small bowl. Press crumb mixture onto bottom of 9-inch spring-form pan. Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water, measure 3/4 cup Jell-O; set aside.  Chill remaining Jell-O until slightly thickened.  Fold in whipped topping and ginger.  Spoon over crust.  Chill measured gelatin until slightly thickened.  Slice pears lengthwise, cutting almost through stem ends.  Arrange on whipped topping mixture, fanning each pear slightly.  Place mint leaf and cinnamon stick at stem of each.  Carefully spoon remaining Jell-O over pears. Chill 3 hours.  Run hot knife around edges of pan before removing.<!><!><!>none
6527<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY FIG JAM<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients.  Bring to boil; cover.  Cook on medium-high for 5 to 10 minutes, stirring constantly.  Spoon into jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6528<!><!><!>LEMON, PEARS AND PINEAPPLE CONGEALED SALAD<!><!><!>Combine 3/4 cup of the pear juice and 1/4 cup of water.  Bring to a boil.  Add Jell-O and stir well. Cool to touch.  Blend buttermilk with Cool Whip.  Add mayonnaise (or sour cream) and blend well.  Fold in the fruit and grated cheese.  Add cooled Jell-O and blend well.  Congeal in 3-quart Pyrex dish. Cut into 18 pieces.<!><!><!>none
6529<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY KIWI MOCK MARGARITA<!><!><!>PLACE water, orange juice, lime juice and drink mix in blender container; cover. Blend until drink mix is dissolved.  ADD ice; cover. Blend on high speed until smooth.<!><!><!>none
6530<!><!><!>GRAPEFRUIT ORANGE MOLD<!><!><!>Dissolve gelatin and salt in boiling water.  Add water to gelatin mixture.  Chill until very thick.  Fold in grapefruit and orange sections.  Pour into six individual molds.  Chill until firm.  Yield:  6 servings.  Carbohydrate 5 g, protein 0 g, fat 0 g, calories 20.  One serving = 1/2 fruit exchange.<!><!><!>none

6549<!><!><!>PEAR 'N RASPBERRY SHORTCAKE<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 425°.  Grease an 8-inch round cake pan. Combine flour, 1/4 cup sugar, baking powder and salt in a medium bowl.  Cut in 1/2 cup butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Stir in milk, egg and vanilla until well blended.  Spread mixture in pan; bake for 15 minutes.  Cool.  In saucepan over medium heat, combine raspberries, cornstarch and liqueur.  Cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.  Cool slightly; strain to remove seeds.  Melt remaining butter and sugar over medium heat.  Add pears; cook 3 to 5 minutes.  Arrange pear slices over top of cake; drizzle with half of the raspberry sauce.  Garnish with fresh raspberries; serve with remaining sauce on side.  This is too wonderful!!!  Makes 6 to 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
6550<!><!><!>PEAR-LIME GELATIN SALAD<!><!><!>Drain pears, reserving juice.  Set pears aside.  Measure the juice; add water if needed to equal 1 1/2 cups.  Pour into saucepan and bring to a boil.  Add gelatin; stir until dissolved. Gradually add cream cheese, whisking until smooth.  Cover and refrigerate until cool.  Mash reserved pears; fold into gelatin mixture.  Fold in whipped topping.  Pour into a 6-cup serving bowl.  Refrigerate until set.  Yield: 6 servings.<!><!><!>none

6554<!><!><!>KIWI ORANGE ROUGHY<!><!><!>Combine  salt,  garlic  powder,  pepper   and  oregano; sprinkle  over  fillets.  Place fillets in a 12 x 8  x  2-inch baking dish coated with vegetable oil.  Drizzle  fillets  with melted  butter and lime juice.  This can be prepared  to  this point  up  to  12  hours  ahead and kept in  the  refrigerator covered with plastic wrap.  Cover with foil and bake  at  350° for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested  with a fork. Transfer  fillets to a serving platter;  garnish  with Macadamia nuts and kiwi fruit slices.  Serves 4.<!><!><!>none
6555<!><!><!>GERMAN APPLE CAKE (OR PLUM OR PEACH)<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease an 8 x 8-inch square baking dish. Combine the butter, 1 cup sugar and eggs in bowl and beat thoroughly. Add flour, baking powder and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Spread evenly in baking dish. Combine 1/2 cup sugar with the cinnamon.  Add to the apples, coating well. Arrange slices on top of batter in overlapping rows, pressing lightly in batter. Bake 1 hour.  Cool and cut into squares.<!><!><!>none
6556<!><!><!>FRUIT PIE FILLING FOR STRAWBERRIES, BLUEBERRIES OR RASPBERRIES<!><!><!>Cook oleo and flour until smooth. Add water, vanilla and sugar. Cook until thickened; add berries. Pour into pie crust.<!><!><!>none
6557<!><!><!>CRANBERRY TANGERINE RELISH<!><!><!>Bring orange juice and water to a boil.  Add sugar, stirring until dissolved.  Add zest and cut up orange flesh.  Add cranberries to boiling mix.  Bring to a boil again and listen for popping.  When they are considerably softer, approx 3-5 minutes, remove from heat.  In a bowl large enough to hold everything, put the dried cherries.  With a strainer and the back of a soup ladle or wooden spoon, strain the liquid over the cherries and force the berries through the strainer with the ladle.  Occasionally scrape the underside of the strainer to allow more flow.  Keep forcing the berries through until almost completely strained.  Discard the remaining husks.  Refrigerate overnight.  The mixture will jell considerably as it cools.<!><!><!>none
6558<!><!><!>PEACH-PLUM JAM<!><!><!>Peel and pit peaches; chop very fine.  Pit plums; chop very fine.  Mix fruits; measure 4 1/2 cups into large saucepan.  Place saucepan of fruit over high heat.  Add pectin.  Stir until mixture comes to a hard boil.  At once, stir in sugar.  Bring to a full, rolling boil and boil hard 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Skim and stir for 5 minutes.  Ladle quickly into hot scalded glasses.  Seal at once.  Makes ten 6-ounce glasses.<!><!><!>none
6559<!><!><!>PEAR AND LIME JELLO<!><!><!>Make Jell-O using  juice  of  pears  and  lemon, adding water to make up	second	cup.  Save  2  tablespoons  juice to soften cheese.  When Jell-O is softly set, beat in cheese and pears and let set.<!><!><!>none
6560<!><!><!>FIG STRAWBERRY JAM<!><!><!>Pour sugar over figs.  Let set for 20 minutes.  Add jello and cook for 12 more minutes.  Pour into hot jars and seal.   Makes 4 1/2 pints.<!><!><!>none
6561<!><!><!>LEMON KIWI FRUIT PIE<!><!><!>In a  large  bowl  combine  sweetened  condensed  milk, lemonade concentrate  and food coloring (optional);  mix well. Fold in whipped  topping.  Pour  into  prepared  pastry shell. Chill 4 hours or until set.  Garnish with kiwi fruit.<!><!><!>none
6562<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY KIWI JAM<!><!><!>Rinse and pat dry strawberries.  Place in medium bowl; crush with a potato masher.  Combine strawberries, kiwi, lemon juice, ginger and pectin in a large saucepot.  Bring to a rolling boil, stirring frequently.  Add sugar; return to a rolling boil, stirring constantly.  Boil hard for 1 minute if using Sure-Jell pectin or 4 minutes if using MCP pectin.  Remove from heat; skim foam, if necessary, or place 1 teaspoon of butter to cut foaming down.  Pour into hot jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace.  Adjust caps.  Process 10 minutes in simmering water bath.  Makes 6 half-pint jars.<!><!><!>none

6585<!><!><!>FIG PRESERVES WITH LEMON<!><!><!>Wash figs and remove stems; do not peel.  Place in saucepan; add water.  Sprinkle sugar on top and bring to a simmer. 6594<!><!><!>PEAR RASPBERRY JAM<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients together except pectin.   Chop or mash fruit to get 4 cups puree.  Bring to rolling boil.  Add pectin and boil hard for 1 minute more.  Skim foam.<!><!><!>none
6595<!><!><!>PEAR RASPBERRY JAM<!><!><!>Put in hot sterilized jars, leaving 1/4-inch headroom.  Wipe rims, cover and process 15 minutes in the boiling water bath method, which is to immerse jars, with lids secure but not tight, into already boiling water for 15 minutes.  Jars must be covered by the water.  Remove and let cool slowly.  Listen for the pop.<!><!><!>none
6596<!><!><!>PEAR RASPBERRY JAM<!><!><!>Yields 6 to 7 1/2 pints.<!><!><!>none
6597<!><!><!>RASPBERRY OR APRICOT DREAMS<!><!><!>Sift flour, baking powder and salt.  Add butter, egg and milk. Beat until smooth.  Roll or pat into 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan.  Spread thin layer of jam.  Spread sugar, coconut and egg mixture over jam.  Bake at 325° for 25 to 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6598<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY KIWI TRIFLE<!><!><!>Prepare pudding according to package using 1 3/4 cups skim milk.  Let thicken.  Add yogurt and stir.  In a glass bowl, layer 1/3 of cake, 1/3 of pudding and 1/3 of fruit.  Repeat two more times.  Refrigerate.<!><!><!>none
6599<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY KIWI TRIFLE<!><!><!>This can be made using 2 cups prepared lemon pie filling in place of vanilla pudding.<!><!><!>none
6600<!><!><!>APRICOT FIG LOAF<!><!><!>Sift first 4 ingredients together.  Add next 3 ingredients and mix well.  Combine remaining ingredients in bowl.  Add dry ingredients, stirring just enough to moisten.  Pour into 3 small greased and floured loaf pans.  Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes. Remove from oven and cool in pans, 15 minutes.  Remove from pans and continue cooling.<!><!><!>none
6601<!><!><!>APRICOT FIG LOAF<!><!><!>Glaze:<!><!><!>none
6602<!><!><!>APRICOT FIG LOAF<!><!><!>Combine and glaze.<!><!><!>none
6603<!><!><!>LIME PEAR JELLO SALAD<!><!><!>Drain pears; add enough water to juice to make 2 cups.  Bring to boil and add jello and cream cheese.  Chill until partially set and whip.  Add whipped cream and pears.  Mix well and set.<!><!><!>none
6604<!><!><!>PEAR-LIME JELLO MOLD<!><!><!>Prepare Jell-O according to package directions.  Beat cream cheese with milk.  Slowly add to Jell-O and beat until fluffy. Chill until partially set.  Add fruit and pour into mold.  Serves 6.<!><!><!>none
6605<!><!><!>LIME PEAR SALAD<!><!><!>Set cream cheese out to soften.  Drain pears and mash.  Add enough water to pear juice to make 2 cups.  Bring liquid to a boil.<!><!><!>none
6606<!><!><!>LIME PEAR SALAD<!><!><!>In large bowl empty Jell-O.  Add hot liquid, mix well and set aside to gel a little.  Whip Dream Whip according to directions. Add cream cheese, mashed pears and Dream Whip to Jell-O and whip altogether.  Makes a large 9 x 13-inch pan.  When set, cut in squares.  You can sprinkle chopped nuts on squares and a cherry if desired.<!><!><!>none
6607<!><!><!>PEAR LIME MOLD<!><!><!>Add enough water to syrup to measure 1 cup.  Bring to a boil. Stir into gelatin until dissolved.  Chill until slightly thickened.  Mash pears, beat in cream cheese until smooth.  Add to gelatin.  Mix well.  Fold in 1 1/2 cups whipped cream.  Chill until set.<!><!><!>none
6608<!><!><!>PINEAPPLE GRAPEFRUIT SWIRLS<!><!><!>In a metal tray, stir together 1 cup of the grapefruit juice and the sugar until the sugar is dissolved; fit the tray with the divider and freeze the mixture until it is frozen solid.  In another metal ice tray fitted with the divider, pour 1 cup of the pineapple juice and freeze it until it is frozen solid.  (The fruit mixtures may be prepared up to this point 1 day in advance.) In a blender, blend the frozen grapefruit juice mixture with 1 1/2 ounces of tequila and the remaining 1/4 cup grapefruit juice, scraping down the sides occasionally, until the mixture is smooth but still frozen and divide the mixture between 2 stemmed glasses. In the cleaned blender, blend the frozen pineapple juice with the remaining 1 1/2 ounces tequila and the remaining 1/4 cup pineapple juice, scraping down the sides occasionally, until the mixture is smooth but still frozen.  Pour over grapefruit mixture.  Makes 2 drinks.<!><!><!>none
6609<!><!><!>KIWI FRUIT BLUEBERRY SALAD<!><!><!>Place lettuce on 4 individual plates.  Arrange kiwi fruit on lettuce and top evenly with blueberries.  Combine mayonnaise and next 3 ingredients.  Stir well.  Drizzle over salads and top with strawberries.  Serve immediately.<!><!><!>none
6610<!><!><!>CRANBERRY APPLE ORANGE SALAD<!><!><!>Empty cranberries into large mixing bowl.  Chop remaining ingredients coarsely in food processor or blender.  Add to berries and marinate overnight or several days.<!><!><!>none
6611<!><!><!>FIG-STRAWBERRY PRESERVES<!><!><!>Mash figs thoroughly.  Mix jello, sugar and figs.  Stir until the sugar dissolves.  Heat.  Boil for 3 minutes, stirring constantly.  Place in hot sterilized jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6612<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY AND FIG JELLY<!><!><!>Put all ingredients into a pan and bring to boil. Cook for 4 minutes. Put in small canning jars. Great gift to give at the holidays. Good on toast, biscuits or with cream cheese.<!><!><!>none
6613<!><!><!>FIG STRAWBERRY JAM<!><!><!>Cover figs with water.  Cook until tender.  Drain and mash. Add sugar and jello.  Stir and boil 3 minutes.  Pour into sterilized jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6614<!><!><!>CRANBERRY-ORANGE AND APRICOT BREAD<!><!><!>Heat oven to 350°. Grease and flour bottoms only of 9 x 5 loaf pan. Combine first 6 ingredients, mixing well; set aside. Beat eggs and oil with whisk to blend thoroughly. Mix in orange juice, water and orange peel. Add to dry ingredients, mixing until just moistened. Stir in remaining ingredients. Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely. Yield: 16 servings.<!><!><!>none
6615<!><!><!>LEMON-LIME PINEAPPLE PUNCH<!><!><!>In large pitcher, mix Kool-Aid, sugar and water. Refrigerate all ingredients. When ready to serve, place Kool-Aid mixture in punch bowl. Slowly add ginger ale and well shaken pineapple juice. Stir gently. Serve.<!><!><!>none
6616<!><!><!>PINEAPPLE GRAPEFRUIT SALAD<!><!><!>Soak gelatin in lemon juice.  Place drained pineapple juice on heat and bring to a boil.  Pour over lemon gelatin and plain gelatin.  Cool.  Add pineapple chunks, grapefruit sections and salt.  Pour into pans or molds and let set in refrigerator several hours.  Yields 12 to 18 servings.<!><!><!>none
6617<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY AND FIG JAM<!><!><!>Mash figs fine; measure 3 cups.  Add sugar and Jell-O.  Stir good.  Put on stove and bring to a boil.   Boil 10 minutes.  Do not put any water in it.  Put in sterilized jars and seal.<!><!><!>none
6618<!><!><!>GRAPEFRUIT APPLE SALAD<!><!><!>Drain  pineapple,  reserving  1/4  cup juice.  Dissolve gelatin  in  1  cup  boiling water in large bowl.  Add 3/4 cup water  and reserved pineapple juice.  Chill until thick.  Fold grapefruit,  apple  and  green  peppers  into gelatin mixture. Pour in lightly oiled 4 cup mold.  Cover and chill until firm. Unmold  onto  lettuce  leaves  and garnish with mayonnaise, if desired.  Yield:  6 to 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
6619<!><!><!>FROTHY LIME-PEAR JELLO MOLD<!><!><!>Dissolve lime jello in boiling water.  Add cold water and orange juice.  Arrange pears in lightly oiled ring mold or rectangular Pyrex dish; cover with lime gelatin.  Chill until almost set.<!><!><!>none
6620<!><!><!>FROTHY LIME-PEAR JELLO MOLD<!><!><!>Dissolve lemon jello in boiling water; add cold water and lemon juice.  Gradually add to softened cream cheese, mixing until well blended.  Pour over lime layer.  Chill until firm.  Unmold. Enjoy!<!><!><!>none
6621<!><!><!>GRAPEFRUIT BANANA ENERGIZER<!><!><!>Peel grapefruit; remove seeds and cut in chunks.  Peel banana and slice.  Place grapefruit and banana with fructose in blender. Blend until smooth.<!><!><!>none
6622<!><!><!>KIWI LIME PIE<!><!><!>In a saucepan, combine sugar, flour and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Stir in milk.  Stir over medium heat until bubbly.  Reduce heat; cook and stir 2 minutes more.  Remove from heat.  Stir 1 cup of hot mixture into eggs.  Return to saucepan; cook and stir until thickened.  Cook and stir 2 minutes more.  Do not boil.  Remove from heat.  Stir in margarine, lime peel and juice.  Fold in yogurt.  Tint with food coloring.  Cover surface with plastic wrap; cool.<!><!><!>none
6623<!><!><!>KIWI LIME PIE<!><!><!>Brush the pastry shell with some jelly.  Place about 1 cup of custard in shell.  Cover with 8-inch pastry.  Brush with jelly. Spread with 1 1/4 cups of custard.  Top with 8 3/4-inch pastry. Top with remaining jelly and custard.  Cover; chill pie overnight.<!><!><!>none
6624<!><!><!>KIWI LIME PIE<!><!><!>To serve pie, garnish with whipped cream, kiwi fruit slices and lime slices.  Makes 8 servings.<!><!><!>none

6627<!><!><!>CRANBERRY-FIG MUFFINS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 400°.  Adjust oven rack to above oven center. In a small saucepan, heat water to a rolling boil.   Stir in oat bran and remove from heat.  Continue stirring until smooth and free of lumps.  Set aside to cool for 5 minutes.  Stir milk and oil into oat mixture.  Beat egg whites with sugar just until foamy.  Stir in oat mixture.  Combine flour with baking powder and salt.  Stir into egg white mixture with figs and cranberries. Spoon batter into 12 (2 3/4-inch) muffin tins lined with paper baking cups.  Bake 20 minutes or until lightly brown.  Cool 10 minutes before serving.  Makes 12 muffins.<!><!><!>none
6628<!><!><!>PEACH-PLUM COBBLER<!><!><!>Mix sugar and cornstarch in saucepan; gradually stir in boiling water.  Boil for 1 minute, then add fruit, stirring constantly.  To mixture, add cinnamon, nutmeg, 1 tablespoon of sugar and almond.  In a bowl, sift together the flour, sugar-nutmeg mix, baking powder and salt.  Cut in shortening until pea size particles are formed.  Beat milk and egg and add to dough mixture; stir and blend well.  Pour into greased baking dish. Now, add fruit mixture to baking dish.  Drop spoonfuls of dough atop fruit.  Place in 400° oven and bake for 30 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6629<!><!><!>PEACH-PLUM COBBLER<!><!><!>If fruit is very juicy, pour off some and use as a sauce.<!><!><!>none

6634<!><!><!>CHERRY (OR CRANBERRY) APRICOT MUFFINS<!><!><!>In large bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt.  In medium bowl, place egg, milk, sugars, oil and orange peel.  Beat well 1 minute.  Add to flour mixture and beat about 15 seconds to combine.  Do not overmix.<!><!><!>none

6651<!><!><!>PEPPERONI HEART SHAPED PIZZA<!><!><!>Heat oven to 425°.  Mix baking mix and water until soft dough forms; beat vigorously for 20 strokes.  Pat dough with hands floured with baking mix into 12-inch heart shape on lightly greased cookie sheet, carefully forming a 1/2-inch rim.  Sprinkle evenly with Parmesan cheese.  Stir oregano and garlic powder into tomato sauce; spoon over Parmesan cheese.  Carefully spread to cover; sprinkle with remaining ingredients.  Bake until crust is golden brown, about 20 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6652<!><!><!>PIZZA CUPS<!><!><!>Melt margarine. Add mushrooms, peppers and onions to skillet. Stir until veggies are tender. Add tomato paste, water and oregano; blend. Cover for 5 minutes. Bake at 375° for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with remaining cheese.<!><!><!>none
