6697<!><!><!>PIZZA POTATOES CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Bake uncovered at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6698<!><!><!>PIZZA GRILLED CHEESE<!><!><!>Butter one side of each slice of bread. Place one slice in a skillet, butter side down. Top with cheese, pepperoni, sauce and second slice of bread, butter side up. Cook over medium heat until golden brown, turning once.<!><!><!>none
6699<!><!><!>PIZZA-BURGERS<!><!><!>Brown meat and drain. Add pizza sauce. Patty out burgers and grill. When done, top with Mozzarella cheese and melt. Serve on hamburger with toppings of choice.<!><!><!>none
6700<!><!><!>PIZZA POCKETS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°. Unroll crescent rolls. do not separate into triangles. Take each rectangle piece of dough and roll slightly between 2 pieces of waxed paper. Put a teaspoon or two of pizza sauce in middle of rectangle. Top with pepperoni and cheese. Fold edges over and seal along cracks. Bake for 15 minutes. One tube makes 4 pizza pockets.<!><!><!>none
6701<!><!><!>VEGETABLE PIZZA<!><!><!>Mix cream  cheese,  mayonnaise  and Ranch dressing; let stand several hours or overnight.  Pinch together the crescent rolls on a pizza pan.  Bake at 375° for 10 to 13 minutes.  Let cool; spread cream cheese mixture on top.<!><!><!>none
6702<!><!><!>VEGETABLE PIZZA<!><!><!>Garnish with raw vegetables, olives, peppers, broccoli, etc. At Christmas use red bell pepper and broccoli.<!><!><!>none
6703<!><!><!>CHINESE VEGETABLE PIZZA<!><!><!>Wash all veggies.  Cut squash, zucchini, and peppers into thin slices.  Quarter garlic.  Cut onion into thin stringy slices.  Mix all veggies well, add 5 Tbsp. soy sauce, garlic and black pepper, mix again.  Place veggies in lightly sprayed grilling basket.  Cook on BBQ grill for 15 minutes or until veggies get tender.  Heat oven to 375F.  Place bread on baking sheet, place veggies on top of bread in equal amounts.  Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and dust with parmesan cheese.  Bake for 10-12 minutes or until cheese has melted.  Can be served with Jalapeno Soy Dip.<!><!><!>none
6704<!><!><!>PIZZA BREAD<!><!><!>Put frozen loaves in refrigerator overnight.  Cut each loaf in half and roll out.  Brown sausage and drain.  Chop green onions, olives and pepperoni.  On each 1/2 loaf rolled out, layer sausage, onions, olives, pepperoni and cheese.  Sprinkle a few drops of Tabasco, if desired.  Roll up and seal edges.  Bake at 350° for about 35 minutes or until brown.  At this point, you may eat it or freeze it.  If frozen, remove from freezer (do not thaw) and bake at 350° for about 25 minutes or until hot all the way through. Makes 6 loaves.<!><!><!>none
6705<!><!><!>BREAKFAST PIZZA<!><!><!>Place rolls in pizza pan to form shape of pizza pan. Brown sausage and crumble sausage over crust. Beat eggs, salt and pepper. Pour over sausage. Put cheese over this. Bake at 350° until crust is brown and eggs are done.<!><!><!>none
6706<!><!><!>HOMEMADE PIZZA CRUST<!><!><!>Mix all the ingredient and make a dough.  Cover and let stand for 15 min.  Preheat the oven on 300°.  Grease pizza pan with cooking spray.  Roll out the dough to make the crust.  Bake for about 10 mins or until it's light brown.  Flip it and let it bake the uncooked side.   When done spread pizza sauce and your fav. toppings and bake for 10 min.  And Enjoy!!!!!!!!<!><!><!>none
6707<!><!><!>CHOCOLATE PIZZA<!><!><!>Melt chocolate chips with 14 ounces of almond bark in large saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallows, cereal and peanuts. Pour onto greased 12-inch pizza pan. Top with cherries. Sprinkle with coconut. Melt remaining 2 ounces almond bark with oil over low heat, stirring until smooth. Drizzle over coconut. Chill until firm, then store at room temperature.<!><!><!>none

6718<!><!><!>PIZZA CUPS<!><!><!>Brown  hamburger  and onions.  Drain.  Stir  in  tomato paste, onion and seasonings.  Cook over low  heat  for  5 minutes, stirring frequently.  Place biscuits in a greased muffin tin, pressing to cover bottom and sides.  Spoon  about 1/4 cup meat mixture into biscuit-lined cups and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 400° for 12 minutes or until  golden brown.  Yields 12 cups.<!><!><!>none

6739<!><!><!>FRUIT PIZZA<!><!><!>In  a  small  bowl, beat together cream cheese, 1/2 cup sugar, vanilla  and lemon juice  until  creamy.  Spread  over crust. 6740<!><!><!>FRUIT PIZZA<!><!><!>Spread sugar cookie roll on pizza pan and bake 8 to 10 minutes. Cool completely.  Mix cream cheese, 1 cup sugar and nuts.  Spread on cookie. 6741<!><!><!>CHOCOLATE PIZZA<!><!><!>Microwave chocolate chips and 14 ounces bark on High for 2 minutes, then stir and microwave for 1 to 2 more minutes until smooth when stirred. Stir in marshmallows, Rice Krispies and peanuts. Pour into greased 12-inch pizza pan. Top with M&M's. Sprinkle with coconut. Microwave remaining bark and oil in 1-cup measure for 1 minute. Stir continuously until smooth. Drizzle over coconut. Refrigerate until firm.<!><!><!>none

Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until it sets. Serve immediately.<!><!><!>none

6754<!><!><!>HOT PIZZA DIP<!><!><!>Microwave pepperoni for 30 seconds.  Drain and blot on paper towels.  In a small bowl, mix together cream cheese, oregano, parsley and basil.  Spread mixture in the bottom of a 9 inch pie plate.  Sprinkle 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese and 1/2 cup of parmesan cheese on top of the cream cheese mixture.  Spread the pizza sauce over all.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese.  Top with green pepper, pepperoni and olive slices.  Cover and microwave for 5 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6755<!><!><!>HOT PIZZA DIP<!><!><!>Serve hot.<!><!><!>none
6756<!><!><!>MEXICAN PIZZAS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 425°.  Place 2 baking sheets with corn tortillas overlapping (coat both sides of tortillas with cooking spray) in oven. Bake 7 minutes; flip tortillas over. Rotate pans. Bake until lightly brown, 7 minutes. In large nonstick skillet, brown round sirloin, breaking up clumps.  Stir in green and red peppers. Add taco seasoning. Cook 4 minutes. Spread tortillas with refried beans or you could use bean dip.  Top each with heaping 1/4 cup meat and 2 tablespoons cheese.  Bake 2 minutes to melt cheese.<!><!><!>none

6779<!><!><!>CANDY SHOP PIZZA<!><!><!>Immediately sprinkle 1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips morsels over crust; drop peanut butter by spoonfuls onto morsels. 6780<!><!><!>BERRY PATCH BROWNIE PIZZA<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°. Prepare brownie mix according to package directions. Stir in almonds. Spread batter onto bottom of greased 14-inch pizza pan. Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until set. Cool completely.<!><!><!>none
6781<!><!><!>BERRY PATCH BROWNIE PIZZA<!><!><!>In a large bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar and vanilla; mix until smooth. Fold in whipped topping. Chop enough strawberries to measure 1/2 cup. Gently stir into cream cheese mixture. Spread strawberry mixture evenly onto brownies. Slice remaining strawberries. Arrange on brownie. Top with raspberries and blueberries. Sprinkle with peel. Garnish with powdered sugar and strawberry fan, if desired. Yield: 16 servings.<!><!><!>none
6782<!><!><!>GERMAN PIZZA<!><!><!>In a 12-inch stove-top skillet or electric skillet over medium heat, brown hamburger with  onion,  green  peppers, 1/2 teaspoon salt  and  pepper.  Melt  butter.  Spread  potatoes, (which have been peeled and finely  shredded)  over butter and sprinkle with remaining salt.  Top with meat mixture.  Combine eggs and milk; pour over all.  Cook,  covered,  until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes.  Top with cheese; cover and heat until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.  Cut  into  wedges or squares to serve.<!><!><!>none
6783<!><!><!>APPLE PIZZA<!><!><!>Spread sugar cookie dough on bottom of a 13-inch pizza pan or 9 x 13-inch cake pan.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool.  Mix with a beater cream cheese, brown sugar and caramel ice cream topping; beat until smooth.  Spread on COLD crust.  Put apples, sliced thin in lemon juice and drain really well.  Arrange over caramel; sprinkle with mixed nuts or peanuts or a cinnamon/sugar mixture.  Refrigerate for awhile, then cut.<!><!><!>none
6784<!><!><!>BUBBLE PIZZA<!><!><!>Heat oven to 400°.  Brown beef in a large skillet over medium heat until no longer pink. While meat cooks, open tube of biscuits and cut each biscuit into sixths.  Spray a 10 inch deep dish pie plate or 9 inch square baking pan.  When beef is done, drain well and return to pan.  Stir in pizza sauce, seasonings, and other optional items if desired.  Spoon sauce evenly over the top and bake for 12-15 minutes, until biscuits are cooked through and cheese is melted.  Remove from oven and allow to set 5 minutes before serving.  Makes 4-6 servings.<!><!><!>none
6785<!><!><!>PIZZA APPETIZERS<!><!><!>Brown beef and sausage; drain fat and stir in cubed cheese. Add remaining ingredients, except bread; spread on bread.  Put in single layer on cookie sheets and freeze.  Microwave when you are ready to eat.<!><!><!>none
6786<!><!><!>PEPPERONI PIZZA SPREAD<!><!><!>In a large bowl, combine all ingredients, except crackers. Transfer to an 11 x 7 x 2-inch baking dish.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until edges are bubbly and lightly browned.  Serve with crackers, breadsticks and/or French bread. Yield: 6 cups.<!><!><!>none
6787<!><!><!>UPSIDE-DOWN PIZZA<!><!><!>In a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until the meat is no longer pink; drain.  Add spaghetti sauce. Cover and simmer until heated through.  Pour into a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.  Sprinkle with cheese.<!><!><!>none
6788<!><!><!>UPSIDE-DOWN PIZZA<!><!><!>In a blender, combine the milk, eggs, oil, flour and salt; cover and process until smooth.  Pour over cheese.  Bake, uncovered, at 400° for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Yield: 12 servings.<!><!><!>none
6789<!><!><!>EASY MEXICAN PIZZAS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°.  Place 5 tortillas on greased baking sheets.  Sprinkle each with 1/4 cup cheese.  Place remaining tortillas on top of cheese.  Heat vegetable oil in large skillet over medium heat.  Add chicken, onions and green peppers.  Cook 4 to 5 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.  Add 2 tablespoons taco seasoning mix and 1 tablespoon water; mix well. Remove from heat.  Combine refried beans, remaining seasoning mix and 1 tablespoon of water in small bowl.  Heat in microwave until warm.  Spread about 1/4 cup bean mixture on each tortilla.  Layer with a drizzle of taco sauce, chicken mixture, remaining cheese and toppings.  Bake for 5 to 8 minutes or until cheese is melted.<!><!><!>none
6790<!><!><!>PIZZA ROLL<!><!><!>Brown sausage with a little onion and green pepper.  Mix hot roll mix according to package directions.  Cover and let rise in warm place while you slice pepperoni and grate cheese.  Roll out dough on floured surface about as large as a cookie sheet.  Spread sausage. Cut pepperoni and cheese almost to the ends.  Roll up like a jelly roll.  Secure ends and place seam side down on cookie sheet.  Bake at 375° for 20-25  minutes.<!><!><!>none
6791<!><!><!>KIM'S VEGGIE PIZZA<!><!><!>Spread dough on cookie sheet, pinching edges together.  Bake 8 minutes until lightly browned.  Cool.<!><!><!>none
6792<!><!><!>KIM'S VEGGIE PIZZA<!><!><!>Mix cream cheese, dressing mix and mayonnaise.  Spread on cooled crust.  Top with finely chopped vegetables.  Refrigerate. Cut into small squares to serve as an appetizer or party fare.<!><!><!>none
6793<!><!><!>SHRIMP, SPINACH AND BASIL PIZZA BIANCA<!><!><!>Place crust on sprayed cookie sheet.  Combine cornstarch, milk and garlic in a small pan.  Whisk, bringing to a boil.  Cook 1 minute; add salt and pepper.  Spread on crust.  Heat a nonstick skillet coated with Pam over medium heat.  Sauté shrimp three minutes.  Add mushrooms.  Sauté 2 minutes.  Stir in spinach and cook until spinach wilts.  Drain.  Spoon mixture over sauce. Sprinkle with oregano and basil.  Top with cheeses.  Bake at 425° for 8 minutes or until cheese melts.<!><!><!>none
6794<!><!><!>HOT PIZZA DIP<!><!><!>Combine cream cheese and Italian seasonings; spread into 8-inch pie pan. In a small bowl, combine Mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle 1/2 on top of the cream cheese. Spread pizza sauce over the cheese mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Top with bell pepper and green onion. Bake at 350° for 15 to 18 minutes. Serve with French bread or vegetable dippers.<!><!><!>none

Spread sauce and toppings. Bake at 400° for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Add cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer.<!><!><!>none

6823<!><!><!>SAUSAGE AND EGG BREAKFAST PIZZA<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°.  Brown sausage in skillet until no longer pink.  Separate rolls into eight triangles. 6824<!><!><!>PIZZA CARBONARA<!><!><!>Unroll pizza crust. Press onto a greased 12-inch pizza pan. Build up edges slightly. Prick dough thoroughly with a fork. Bake at 425° for 7 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned.<!><!><!>none

Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Reduce heat. Stir in Parmesan cheese. Spread over hot crust. Sprinkle with bacon, Monterey Jack cheese and green onions. 6875<!><!><!>POTATO PIZZA<!><!><!>Brown hamburger. Add onion, salt, and pepper, set aside. Mix potatoes, cheese soup, and milk in a baking dish. Top with hamburger mixture. Mix tomato sauce and oregano and put on top of hamburger mixture. Bake, covered at 350° for 1 hour. Remove cover and top with cheeses and return to oven to melt cheeses.<!><!><!>none
6876<!><!><!>PEPPERONI PIZZA BITES<!><!><!>Combine mozzarella cheese, pepperoni and pizza sauce in bowl. Set aside.  Flatten biscuits to 3-inch circles.  Place about 1 rounded tablespoon filling in the center of each biscuit.  Bring edges together and pinch closed with fork.  Brush with milk. Sprinkle Parmesan over biscuits.   Bake in oven at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.  Serve warm.  Makes 20.<!><!><!>none
6877<!><!><!>BRUNCH PIZZA SQUARES<!><!><!>Unroll crescent roll dough into a greased pan (13 x 9 x 2 in.). Press dough 1/2 in up the sides.  Sprinkle with meat.  In a bowl, mix the other ingredients and pour over meat.  Bake, uncovered at 400°F for 15 min. or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted.  About 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
6878<!><!><!>CHERRY PIZZA CAKE<!><!><!>Butter 13 x 9 inch cake pan and pour pie filling in bottom. Sift cake mix over filling. Melt butter and pour over mix and sprinkle with nuts. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6879<!><!><!>UPSIDE DOWN PIZZA<!><!><!>Brown beef with dry onion in 2 Tbsp oil.  When nicely browned, drain of excess oil.  Put meat in skillet, add spaghetti mix and tomato sauce and simmer for about 3 to 4 minutes.  Put meat on the bottom of 13x9 inch glass baking dish.  Spread on top of meat sour cream and mozzarella cheese.  Top with can of crescent rolls or biscuit dough.  Lay the rolls crosswise on the pan mixture, brush rolls with melted butter and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Bake at 375°F for about 3 minutes.  Let cool for 10 minutes and cut into squares.<!><!><!>none

6888<!><!><!>PIZZA CASSEROLE II<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°. Crumble sausage into a medium skillet; cook over medium heat until browned, stirring occasionally. Remove sausage and drain on paper towels. In a large lightly greased casserole dish, layer 1/2 of the noodles, 1/2 of the sausage and 1/2 of the remaining ingredients. Repeat with second layer of noodles, sausage and remaining ingredients. Reserve several pepperoni slices to garnish top. Bake 35 to 40 minutes. Serve immediately. Serves 6 to 8.<!><!><!>none
6889<!><!><!>TACO PIZZA DIP<!><!><!>Mix sour cream, cream cheese and taco seasoning together; spread on a foil-lined pizza pan. Add toppings. Serve as nacho dip. Keep refrigerated.<!><!><!>none
6890<!><!><!>CHICAGO STYLE PIZZA<!><!><!>Brown meat and onion; drain. Dissolve yeast in water. Add sugar and allow to set for at least 5 minutes. Place flour and salt in mixer. Add yeast and water to flour; knead with dough hook. Add oil and knead until smooth and elastic. Place in oiled bowl (lightly oiled with olive oil). Cover with damp towel and place in warm place until doubled in bulk (approximately 30 minutes).<!><!><!>none
6891<!><!><!>CHICAGO STYLE PIZZA<!><!><!>Punch down.  Brush 14-inch round x 2-inch deep pan with olive oil.  Sprinkle pan with corn meal.  Press dough on sides and bottom, making 2-inch rim (for thinner crust pizza, use larger round pan).  Let rise 20 minutes.  Place Mozzarella cheese on dough.  Add cooked meat onto cheese.  Add well drained tomatoes; sprinkle salt and fennel mixture on tomatoes, then sprinkle oregano and basil on tomatoes.  Add peppers and mushrooms, then sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Add pepperoni last.<!><!><!>none

6905<!><!><!>MINI APPETIZER PIZZAS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°. In a large skillet, brown ground beef and sausage. Mix onion into sausage and beef mixture and sauté it until tender. When meat is browned and onion tender, drain the grease out of the skillet. Stir processed cheese into meat and onion mixture. Continue cooking until the cheese melts. Arrange slices of bread on a cookie sheet. Place a heaping spoonful of the meat, cheese and onion mixture onto each slice of bread. Bake 12 to 15 minutes. Serve warm. Makes approximately 20 servings.<!><!><!>none

6916<!><!><!>STRAWBERRY PIZZA<!><!><!>Glaze: Crush 1 cup fresh strawberries. Add 1 cup water and cook for 2 minutes, strain. Spoon the glaze on top and refrigerate until set.<!><!><!>none

6922<!><!><!>SAUSAGE AND EGG BREAKFAST PIZZA<!><!><!>Heat oven to 375°.  Separate crescent rolls into eight triangles.  Place in an ungreased 12-inch pizza pan with points toward the center.  Press crescent rolls together to form a crust and seal perforations.  Sprinkle cooked sausage evenly over crust. Top with potatoes and diced bell peppers.  Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.  Combine beaten eggs, milk, salt and pepper.  Pour over crust.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Bake the pizza for 25 to 30 minutes or until crust is browned and eggs are set.  Makes 1 pizza. 6932<!><!><!>VEGGIE APPETIZER PIZZA<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 400°.  Press crescent rolls onto pan; form edges.  Bake for 9-10 minutes (don't let it brown).  Let cool. Press down lightly and chill for at least 1 hour.  Cut into pieces.  (Don't make this too much in advance as crust becomes soggy if allowed to sit for very long.)<!><!><!>none
6933<!><!><!>UPSIDE DOWN PIZZA<!><!><!>Brown ground beef and onions, drain. Add spaghetti sauce mix and tomato sauce. Simmer gently to let flavors combine. Spread meat mixture in 9 X 13 pan. 6934<!><!><!>EASY ITALIAN CRUST PIZZA<!><!><!>Heat oven to 425°.  Lightly grease 12-inch pizza pan; Sprinkle with flour.  In a large skillet lightly brown ground beef; drain. In a small bowl, combine 1 c flour, italian seasoning, salt, pepper, milk and eggs; blend until smooth.  Pour batter into greased pan, tilting pan so batter covers bottom.  Spoon beef over batter, top with onions and mushrooms.  Bake at 425° for 25-30 min. on the lowest oven rack.  In a small bowl, combine tomato sauce and oregano; spoon over pizza.  Sprinkle with cheese; bake an additional 10-15 min.<!><!><!>none

6937<!><!><!>GRILLED PIZZA WITH RED PEPPERS AND CHEESE<!><!><!>Lightly drizzle one side of the dough with some of the olive oil and carefully place the dough, oil side down, on the grill. 6941<!><!><!>PIZZA ROLL<!><!><!>Roll out bread dough, use flour underneath.  Brush with butter/oregano mixture.  Sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese and meat. Add mushrooms. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes, or until it bursts open and cheese oozes out.  Cut into slices and dip in pizza sauce.<!><!><!>none
6942<!><!><!>VEGGIE PIZZA<!><!><!>Unroll crescent rolls and line bottom of 15 x 9 x 1 inch pan. Cook at 350° for 7 to 8 minutes or until golden brown. 6945<!><!><!>VEGETABLE PIZZA<!><!><!>Press crescent biscuits into and halfway up the sides of 15 1/2 x 10 1/2-inch jelly roll pan. Bake at room temperature given on biscuit can. Let cool. Blend Hidden Valley Ranch salad dressing mix until smooth, then spread on cooled crust. Put finely chopped vegetables, meat and cheese on top. You can use broccoli, cauliflower, fresh mushrooms, green onion, radishes, pepperoni, cooked sausage, ham and shredded cheese. Just use your imagination. Chill before serving.<!><!><!>none

6951<!><!><!>PIZZA LOAF<!><!><!>Let bread dough rise.  Prepare filling:  Cook meat with onions, mushrooms, salt and pepper in large skillet.  Drain.  Stir in tomato sauce, paprika, oregano and garlic salt.  Bring to a boil, lower heat, cover and simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cool. punch down dough.  Press out onto a 15 x 12 greased cookie sheet.  Spoon meat filling down center third of dough.  Sprinkle cheeses on filling.  Make diagonal cuts in dough, 1 1/2 inches apart down each side, to within 1/2 inch of filling.  Criss cross srtips over filling, pressing down and sealing with a drop of water.  Brush top of loaf with melted butter.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until golden brown.  Cut in thick slices to serve. Serves 6.<!><!><!>none

Bake at 375° for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool.  Invert onto serving plate; carefully remove foil.  Invert to right side.<!><!><!>none

6960<!><!><!>POCKET PIZZA<!><!><!>Layer remaining ingredients on half of the circle in order listed; fold dough over filling. Turn edge of the lower dough over edge of the top dough; pinch edge to seal. Prick top with a fork. Bake until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6961<!><!><!>POCKET PIZZA<!><!><!>Pizza Dough:<!><!><!>none
6962<!><!><!>POCKET PIZZA<!><!><!>Beat the flour, milk, oil, baking powder and salt in a bowl until the dough leaves side. Turn onto a lightly floured surface; gather into a ball. Knead 10 times. Cover with a bowl; let stand 15 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6963<!><!><!>PIZZA SWIRLS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 450°. Generously coat a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray. Roll out dough to a 10-inch square on a floured surface. Spread pasta sauce over dough. Reserve 2 tablespoons Mozzarella; sprinkle remaining Mozzarella over sauce. Top with pepperoni. Roll dough jelly roll style to enclose filling. Cut roll crosswise into 10 slices. Place slices, cut side down, on prepared baking sheet. Brush tops with oil. Sprinkle with Parmesan and reserved Mozzarella. Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter and serve immediately.<!><!><!>none

6966<!><!><!>PASTA PIZZA<!><!><!>Cook macaroni according to package directions.  Drain. Combine eggs and milk and stir into cooked macaroni.  Stir in cheddar cheese, onion, salt and pepper.  Mix well.  Spread mixture evenly over a buttered 14 inch pizza pan.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6967<!><!><!>PASTA PIZZA<!><!><!>Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook ground beef until browned. Drain off fat.  Stir in spaghetti sauce.  Spoon meat mixture over baked macaroni crust.  Arrange tomato slices and pepper rings on pizza.  Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.  Bake for additional 15 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.<!><!><!>none
6968<!><!><!>PASTA PIZZA<!><!><!>Makes 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
6969<!><!><!>POUR PIZZA<!><!><!>Preheat  oven  to  400°.  Brown  hamburger  and  onion. Season with salt and pepper.  Set aside.  Combine flour, salt, pepper, oregano, eggs and milk, making  a soft batter.  Grease a 9 x 13-inch pan.  Sprinkle with  cornmeal.  Pour  batter  in pan. Sprinkle  meat over batter.  Bake  15  to  20  minutes. Spread pizza sauce and cheese over meat.  Bake  15  more  minutes. Yields 1 (9 x 13-inch) pan.<!><!><!>none
6970<!><!><!>BARBECUE CHICKEN PIZZA<!><!><!>Combine chicken and barbecue sauce.  Place pizza crust on a baking sheet.  Spread chicken mixture over pizza crust.  Top with remaining ingredients.  Bake at 450° for 15 minutes or until cheese melts.<!><!><!>none
6971<!><!><!>HOT PIZZA DIP<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°.  Combine cream cheese and Italian seasoning; mix well.  Spread in bottom of 9-inch round cake pan. Combine cheeses.  Sprinkle half of cheese mixture over cream cheese.  Spread pizza sauce over cheese.  Top with remaining cheese, peppers and onions.<!><!><!>none
6972<!><!><!>HOT PIZZA DIP<!><!><!>Bake 15 to 18 minutes or until cheese is melted and mixture is bubbling around the edges.  Serve hot with bread or chips.<!><!><!>none
6973<!><!><!>MINI PIZZAS<!><!><!>Take tortilla shell and spread spaghetti sauce until covered. Add cheese. Top with optional ingredients. Bake at 350° until cheese bubbles.<!><!><!>none
6974<!><!><!>FRUIT PIZZA<!><!><!>Slice cookie dough and place on pizza pan that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Pat dough over top of pizza pan making sure no openings are left. Bake according to package directions, but only until light tan in color. Set aside to cool.<!><!><!>none
6975<!><!><!>FRUIT PIZZA<!><!><!>In medium mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar and dry Dream Whip. Beat until all ingredients are combined and mixture is smooth. Spread over top of cookie crust. Add sliced fruits of your choice, in layers, over top of crust.<!><!><!>none
6976<!><!><!>FRUIT PIZZA<!><!><!>In small saucepan over medium heat, melt a small amount of apple, peach or any other light colored jelly. Drizzle over layers of fruit. Cut pizza into slices. Garnish with whipped topping, if desired.<!><!><!>none
6977<!><!><!>FRUIT PIZZA<!><!><!>Recipe Note: Suggested fruits to be added to pizza in layers are strawberries, blueberries, kiwi, bananas, apples, fresh pears or fresh peaches or any fruit you desire. If using any fruits that turn brown, dip them in apple juice before adding to pizza.<!><!><!>none
6978<!><!><!>GARDEN VEGGIE PIZZA SQUARES<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 375°.  Roll out crescent rolls onto a large non-stick baking sheet.  Stretch and flatten to form a single rectangular shape on the baking sheet.  Bake 11-13 minutes in the oven, or until golden brown.  Allow to cool.  Place cream cheese in a medium bowl.  Mix cream cheese with 1/2 of the ranch dressing mix.  Adjust the amount of dressing mix to taste.  Spread the mixture over the cooled crust.  Arrange carrots, red bell peppers, broccoli and green onions on top.  Chill in the refrigerator approximately 1 hour.  Cut into bite-sized squares to serve.<!><!><!>none
6979<!><!><!>CHICKEN PESTO PITA PIZZAS<!><!><!>Heat oven to 450 degrees.  Place 2 oven racks in bottom half of oven.  Remove fajitas from packaging and place in a microwave safe dish.  Heat on HIGH power until pieces begin to thaw; stir and rearrange fajitas in dish as necessary.  Pull apart to separate; tear or cut chicken into bite-sized pieces.  Meanwhile, line 2 large baking sheets with foil.  Lay 3 pita shells on each baking sheet.  Combine mayonnaise with pesto; spread evenly over tops of pita bread, about 2 tablespoons on each.  Place chicken, artichoke hearts, and mushrooms over pesto layer.  Cut pepper into thin strips; lay strips over tops of pizzas and sprinkle evenly with cheese, 1/3 cup over each pizza.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes, or until cheese melts and begins to brown.  Let stand 2 to 3 minutes, cut into slices and serve.<!><!><!>none
6980<!><!><!>PIZZA SWIRLS<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 450°.  Generously coat a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray.  Roll out dough to a 10-inch square on a floured surface.  Spread pasta sauce over dough.  Reserve 2 tablespoons Mozzarella; sprinkle remaining Mozzarella over sauce. Top with pepperoni.  Roll jelly-roll style to enclose filling. Cut roll crosswise into 10 slices.  Place slices cut side down on prepared baking sheet.  Brush with oil.  Sprinkle with Parmesan and reserved Mozzarella.  Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.  Transfer to a serving platter and serve immediately.<!><!><!>none

6983<!><!><!>VEGETABLE PIZZA<!><!><!>Top with grated cheese. Cut with pizza cutter. Sour cream can be substituted for cream cheese.<!><!><!>none
6984<!><!><!>FRUIT PIZZA<!><!><!>Cut cookie dough into 1/8 inch slices and line pizza pan. Bake at 375° for 12 minutes or until brown. Let cool. Then mix together cream cheese, Splenda and vanilla. When ready to serve, top with fresh strawberries, bananas, pineapple, blueberries, etc. (your choice). Make sure to dip bananas in lemon juice to keep them from browning.  About 140 calories and 5 grams of fat.<!><!><!>none
6985<!><!><!>SPAGHETTI-PIZZA CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Cook spaghetti; drain and place in a lightly greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Combine milk and eggs; stir well. Pour over spaghetti. Cook ground beef, onion and green pepper in a large skillet. Stir until beef crumbles; drain well. Stir in spaghetti sauce and spoon over spaghetti. Layer mushrooms and pepperoni on top. Bake at 350° for 20 to 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheeses; bake 10 minutes more or until cheeses are melted.<!><!><!>none
6986<!><!><!>DEEP-DISH PIZZA CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Cook hamburger and onion. Drain grease. Add water and tomato paste. Simmer 10 minutes. Spread biscuits in dish that is greased to make crust. Pour mixture over biscuits and add cheese. Cook at 350° for 20 minutes.<!><!><!>none
6987<!><!><!>DEEP-DISH PIZZA CASSEROLE<!><!><!>You can add anything to mixture you'd normally put on pizza.<!><!><!>none
6988<!><!><!>FRIDAY NIGHT PIZZA<!><!><!>Place 1 cup of milk in microwave for 3 minutes. Add ice water. Put in freezer to cool. Mix flour, sugar, salt and yeast. (You can use your bread maker, a Kitchen Aid mixer or just a wooden spoon and your hands to mix the dough.) Once the milk/water mixture is cool enough, add gradually to the dough. Knead very thoroughly. Let rise in a warm place for 1 hour. Grease a cookie sheet or a pizza pan. Roll out the dough on a floured surface. Form a pizza crust with your hands by tossing it while stretching the dough. Stretch to fit your pizza pan or a large cookie sheet. Make sauce after you've formed your crust on your pan.<!><!><!>none
6989<!><!><!>FRIDAY NIGHT PIZZA<!><!><!>Sauce:<!><!><!>none
6990<!><!><!>FRIDAY NIGHT PIZZA<!><!><!>Mix well. You can melt butter and garlic and spread evenly on your crust. Or you can spread olive oil on your crust mixed with basil or garlic or whatever sounds good to you or you can just leave the crust dry if you're watching calories! Spread pizza sauce evenly onto pizza.<!><!><!>none
6991<!><!><!>FRIDAY NIGHT PIZZA<!><!><!>Toppings are up to you. I use Mozzarella, onions, tomatoes, peppers, ham, olives or whatever I have on hand. I've even tried fresh spinach and it was yummy! Pepperoni is always a plus! The possibilities are endless!<!><!><!>none

6996<!><!><!>PIZZA DELIGHTS<!><!><!>In a 10-inch skillet, cook sausage over medium heat; drain off fat. Stir in pizza sauce, ketchup and garlic powder. Set aside. Press biscuits into 20 well-greased muffin cups. Spoon 1 to 2 tablespoons of the meat and sauce into each biscuit. Top with Mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 350° for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Yield: 20 muffin size pizzas.<!><!><!>none

Spread in layers over the cream cheese mixture. Top with cheese. Refrigerate until chilled. Set out of the refrigerator 1 hour before serving.<!><!><!>none

Fold dough over and around cheese; press dough edges to seal.  Top crust with pizza sauce, pepperoni and cheese.  Bake at 425° for 15 min. or until crust is golden brown and cheese melts.<!><!><!>none

7015<!><!><!>HOT PIZZA DIP<!><!><!>Combine cream cheese and Italian seasoning.  Spread into the bottom of an 8 inch baking dish.  Sprinkle 1/2 cup mozzarella and 1/2 cup parmesan evenly on top of the cream cheese mixture.  Pour pizza sauce uniformly over the cheeses.  Sprinkle remaining cheeses evenly over pizza sauce.  Top with chopped onion.  Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees.  Serve with bread sticks.<!><!><!>none
7016<!><!><!>PIZZA MEATLOAF<!><!><!>Combine meat, cracker crumbs, 3/4 c. pizza sauce, onion, bell pepper, Parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, eggs and seasonings. Mix lightly.  Press meat mixture into an 8-inch square baking pan. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  Pour off drippings.  Spread remaining pizza sauce over meat.  Bake 10 minutes longer. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.  Return to oven until cheese begins to melt.  Garnish with green pepper rings.  Serves 8.<!><!><!>none

7030<!><!><!>PIZZA ROLL-UPS<!><!><!>In a skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain.  Remove from the heat.  Add tomato sauce, Mozzarella cheese and oregano.  Mix well.  Separate crescent dough into eight rectangles, pinching seams together.  Place about 3 tablespoons of meat mixture along one long side of each rectangle.  Roll up, jelly roll style, starting with a long side.  Cut each roll into three pieces.  Place, seam side down, 2-inches apart on greased baking sheets.  Bake at 375° for 15 minutes or until golden brown.  Yield: 2 dozen.<!><!><!>none
7031<!><!><!>PIZZA HOT DISH<!><!><!>Brown the hamburger with the onion. Add the garlic salt, salt and pepper. Drain. Add sauces and oregano. In kettle, cook noodles according to package directions; drain. Then mix in soup. Layer in casserole 1/2 the noodles, 1/2 the meat, remaining noodles and rest of the meat. Cover and bake at 350° for 45 minutes. Remove cover; sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese and bake until cheese melts.<!><!><!>none
7032<!><!><!>SALAD PIZZA<!><!><!>Mix 1  cup water with butter in saucepan and bring to a boil. Add  flour, all at once, and stir rapidly until mixture forms a ball.  Remove from heat and cool.  Beat in eggs, 1 at a  time, beating  well after each one.  Spread  in  ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.  Cool.<!><!><!>none

7037<!><!><!>FIFTH SUNDAY BREAKFAST PIZZA<!><!><!>Divide flaky biscuits into 2 layers each.  Begin in the middle of a large pizza pan.  Place biscuit layers close together to fill pan. Pat gaps together.  Set aside.  In mixing bowl, beat eggs with softened cream cheese.  Spoon egg mixture over biscuit crust.  Sprinkle cheese over entire pizza.  Top with crumbled bacon.  Bake at 400° for 10 to 15 minutes, until edge is lightly browned and center is set.  Cut into wedges or squares.  Serves 8 as main dish, 12 as appetizer.<!><!><!>none
7038<!><!><!>EASY PIZZA BROWNIES<!><!><!>Heat oven to 350°.  Grease 12-inch pizza pan or 13 x 9-inch baking pan.  If using a disposable pizza pan, place on cookie sheet to bake.  Use only a spoon to beat melted butter, sugar, vanilla and eggs in large bowl.  Stir in dry ingredients until well blended.  Spread into pan.  Bake 20 to 22 minutes or until top springs back when touched lightly.  Serve plain or sprinkle hot brownie with chocolate or white chips, peanut butter chips, coconut or toffee bits.<!><!><!>none
7039<!><!><!>GREEK PIZZA<!><!><!>In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saut for 5 minutes. Add spinach and saut until all excess moisture has evaporated. Add basil, oregano, lemon juice and pepper. Mix well. Cool. Place length of fillo across width of buttered 15 x 10 x 1-inch baking dish. Use 10 sheets of fillo dough, brushing every two with melted butter or margarine. Overlap each set of fillo sheets at the center. At the edges of the baking dish, roll fillo onto itself to form "pizza crust." Brush top layer with melted butter or olive oil. Spread spinach mixture on prepared fillo sheets. Top spinach with 1/2 of the Mozzarella. Dredge tomatoes in bread crumbs and arrange on top of Mozzarella. Top with remaining Mozzarella and Feta cheese. Bake in preheated oven at 400° for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown.<!><!><!>none
7040<!><!><!>PIZZA DIP<!><!><!>Mix the cream cheese, sour cream, oregano and crushed red pepper.  Spread in bottom of pan.  Cover with pizza sauce. Sprinkle onion, green pepper and pepperoni on top.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Top with Mozzarella and return to oven.  Remove when cheese has melted.  Serve hot with crackers, bread sticks or garlic bread.<!><!><!>none

7044<!><!><!>PIZZA MACARONI BAKE<!><!><!>Set the cheese packet from dinner mix aside. In a saucepan, bring water to boil. Add macaroni; cook for 8-10 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook the beef, onion and green pepper over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Drain macaroni; stir in the contents of cheese packet. Transfer to a greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Top with beef mixture, pizza sauce and pepperoni and mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until heated through.<!><!><!>none

7057<!><!><!>ANNIE'S PIZZA BITES<!><!><!>On a 9 by 13-inch cookie sheet, roll out 1 can pizza dough to edges of cookie sheet.  Spread pizza sauce evenly over crust leaving 1/2-inch space around the edges of the crust.  Sprinkle pepperoni and cheese evenly over sauce.  Roll out remaining can of dough into a 9 by 13-inch rectangle.  Carefully place this on top. With a pizza cutter, score into 16 rectangles.  Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.  Serve warm.<!><!><!>none
7058<!><!><!>PIZZA CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Cook macaroni until tender; drain liquid off. Brown ground beef; season with salt, pepper and onions. Drain fat. Mix all other ingredients together, except cheese. Pour into 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese to edge. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Serve with salad and bread sticks for a complete meal.<!><!><!>none
7059<!><!><!>HOT PIZZA DIP<!><!><!>In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and Italian seasoning. Spread in an ungreased 9-inch microwave-safe pie plate. Combine Mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses. Sprinkle half over cream cheese. Top with the pizza sauce, remaining cheese mixture, green pepper and onion. Microwave on High for 3 to 4 minutes, uncovered, or until the cheese is almost melted. (Rotate a half turn several times.) Let stand for 1 to 2 minutes. Yields about 3 cups. Serve with tortilla chips or breadsticks.<!><!><!>none
7060<!><!><!>LITTLE PIZZAS<!><!><!>Use heavy-duty large pan. Crumble Italian sausage, after taking casing off sausage, into a skillet. Add bulk sausage. Stir and cook on medium heat until well mixed. Then add all the other ingredients. Turn heat down to low. Cook until all the cheese is melted and all the ingredients are well done.  When done, use a tablespoon to cover slices of bread. Place on a cookie sheet and freeze. When frozen, place in freezer bags. Take out of the freezer when ready to bake.<!><!><!>none
7061<!><!><!>LITTLE PIZZAS<!><!><!>To bake, preheat oven to 400°. Place bread slices on lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake 6 to 8 minutes, until well heated.<!><!><!>none
7062<!><!><!>HALLOWEEN COOKIE PIZZA<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°. Lightly grease a 12 inch pizza pan. In a large mixer bowl, beat sugar and margarine until creamy. Add egg, water and vanilla. Beat well. In a separate bowl, stir together flour, soda and salt. Add to sugar mixture, beating on low until blended. Stir in peanut butter chips. Spread batter in prepared pan to within 1/2 inch of edge. Bake 11 to 13 minutes or until set. Remove from oven. Sprinkle marshmallows, chocolate chips and nuts over top. Return to oven. Bake 5 to 7 minutes or until marshmallows are lightly browned. Cool completely.<!><!><!>none

7067<!><!><!>BREAKFAST PIZZA<!><!><!>Spread rolls on cookie sheet and bake for 5 minutes.  Brown sausage and sprinkle on top.  Sprinkle cheese on top of sausage. Mix 6 eggs and milk.  Pour slowly on top.  Bake at 325° for about 30 minutes or until done.<!><!><!>none
7068<!><!><!>MINIATURE PIZZA<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients together with a small amount of mayonnaise to make a spread. Spread on party rye or pumpernickel. Cook in 300° oven for approximately 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve warm.<!><!><!>none
7069<!><!><!>CHEDDAR APPLE PIZZA<!><!><!>Roll pastry to fit a greased 12-inch pizza pan. Flute edges. Bake at 400° for 10 minutes. Arrange apples in single layer. Sprinkle with cheese. Combine the brown sugar, walnuts, cinnamon and nutmeg. Sprinkle over cheese. Cut butter into small pieces and dot top of pizza. Bake for 20 minutes or until apples are tender. Cut into wedges. Serve warm. Yield: 12 servings.<!><!><!>none
7070<!><!><!>TAFFY APPLE PIZZA<!><!><!>On a well greased 15-inch pizza pan, press out cookie dough into a 14-inch circle.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Combine cream cheese, peanut butter, and sugar.  Spread this mixture evenly over cooled cookie.  Arrange apple slices over this mixture.  Uniformly sprinkle on chopped peanuts and drizzle with caramel topping.  Slice and serve with vanilla ice cream or cool whip.<!><!><!>none
7071<!><!><!>UNCLE  THANKSGIVING DRESSING<!><!><!>Fry onion, celery, peppers and olives in a liberal amount of shortening--Mom uses butter--until celery is rather soft.  Season with salt and pepper.  Crumble bread and pour drippings from the bird on bread.  Mom uses chicken bouillon cubes.  Add mixture and mix.  Moisten well and season to taste.  Place in oven in greased baking dish 'till browned.  350 degrees about 45 minutes to an hour.<!><!><!>none

7075<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING DINNER<!><!><!>Depending on how far you have to drive (pack clothes for an overnight trip) get up early on Thanksgiving Day and go to your mother's house.<!><!><!>none
7076<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING DINNER<!><!><!>If traveling a long distance use plenty of second and third ingredients.  Upon arriving at your destination, prepare your nostrils for some luscious mouth-watering smells. Help your mother prepare a wonderful dinner (or stay out of the way).  Sit down at the table, say grace, and enjoy, enjoy, enjoy.  To help make the dinner more enjoyable (especially to your mother) wash the dishes.<!><!><!>none
7077<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Stew chicken (slightly salted) until done.   Remove meat from bones and set aside after cutting into medium size pieces.    Melt margarine and add onion and sage.   Stir into dressing.   In a large, greased casserole, begin with a layer of dressing crumbs. Add a layer of chicken, then a can of mushroom soup diluted with 3/4 can of reserved chicken broth.  Again, a layer of crumbs and chicken, then cream of chicken soup diluted with 3/4 can of reserved chicken broth.    Top with crumbs and bake at 350° until done.<!><!><!>none
7078<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING PIE<!><!><!>Crust:  Take one measure of thankfulness and thoroughly sift out all lumps of sin and selfishness with a Calvary sieve.*  Add one heaping measure of patience and moisten with the water of God's Word until dough is pliable enough to stretch without tearing.  Fit into heart-shaped container and bake at highest heat until very firm.  Then fill with the following:<!><!><!>none
7079<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING PIE<!><!><!>Filling:  Combine seven measure of God's mercy with one heartful of God's love.  Blend in one full individual realization of unqualified grace, and stir well.  Then fold in the following ingredients, one at a time, alternating each addition with a generous measure of praise.<!><!><!>none
7080<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING PIE<!><!><!>After all ingredients are combined, pour into prepared crust. Allow to settle and smooth out; top with a meringue of pure joy. Reheat until piping hot** and serve to the Lord.<!><!><!>none
7081<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING PIE<!><!><!>*If in doubt as to ingredients, equipment or procedures, consult the Master Cookbook at once.<!><!><!>none
7082<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING PIE<!><!><!>**This recipe will be unpalatable if served lukewarm!  All ingredients must be imported from God's Kingdom -- do not substitute.  The mixture will be sweet, and no additional sweeteners are necessary!<!><!><!>none

7095<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING PUDDING<!><!><!>Heat grape juice to boiling point; add gelatin and stir.  Add egg yolks which have been creamed with sugar. 7104<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Stew the chicken until done (do not saute).  Remove meat from bones; set aside.  Reserve the broth.  Melt the margarine; stir into the dressing. 7113<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING DAY SALAD<!><!><!>Before Thanksgiving dinner, unmold the salad on a large platter.  (To help unmold the salad, run a knife around the edge of the mold.   Dip the mold into warm water for a few seconds, being careful not to get water on the salad.  Place serving platter over the top and turn over, holding both together.) Surround with lettuce leaves.  Refrigerate and prepare the topping.<!><!><!>none

7122<!><!><!>SOUTHERN CORNBREAD THANKSGIVING STUFFING<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°.  In a large bowl, combine crumbled cornbread, dried white bread slices and saltines; mix together and set aside. Pour mixture into a greased pan and bake until dressing is done, about 45 minutes.  Serve with turkey as a side dish.<!><!><!>none

7139<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING TURKEY GRAVY<!><!><!>Combine first 6 listed ingredients and bring to boil.  Reduce heat and cover, then simmer 1 hour.  Cool a little, then strain, keeping liquid, neck and giblets.  Discard vegies.  (At this point you may freeze liquid and neck separately for up to 1 week.)  Cut butter into flour and make four balls; put into freezer.  Thaw liquid and neck day of dinner; add in salt, pepper and herbs to taste.  Adding neck, giblets and drippings to liquid, bring to boil, then reduce to medium heat.  Remove flour and butter balls from freezer.  Place one at a time, in center of wire whisk.  Stir whisk with ball into the liquid until dissolved.  Repeat with each ball until desired thickness is achieved.  Bring to low boil for 3 minutes to remove any flour taste.<!><!><!>none
7140<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY RELISH CUPS<!><!><!>Wash  cranberries.  Select  large  thin skinned oranges and lemon.  Wash  and  cut  in	pieces,  then put through food chopper,  skins  and all together with cranberries.  Add sugar and mix  well.	Chill.	Let  stand  at	least  24 hours before serving.  Serve in orange cups.<!><!><!>none
7141<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY RELISH CUPS<!><!><!>To  make orange cups, cut small oranges in half.  Scoop out pulp and flute edges of shells with scissors.<!><!><!>none
7142<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve gelatin in boiling water and allow to cool.   Mix rest of ingredients.  Stir into cooled gelatin.   Put in mold and chill.<!><!><!>none
7143<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING JELLIED SALAD<!><!><!>Drain pineapple; keep juice.  Dissolve jello in hot water. Add cold water, pineapple juice and salt.  Chill until partially set.  Stir sugar into ground fruits; fold into jello.  Add pineapple, oranges, celery and walnuts.  Pour into ring mold. Chill until firm.  Yields 8 to 10 servings.<!><!><!>none

7148<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING TOMORROW<!><!><!>Heat oven to 350°.  Combine all ingredients, adding turkey broth or water if mixture is too dry (I use turkey gravy if any left).  Place in lightly greased  1-quart casserole dish.  Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until hot and lightly brown on top. Garnish with cranberry jelly or sauce if desired.<!><!><!>none
7149<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING DAY WILD RICE STUFFING<!><!><!>Saute, in 1/2 cup of butter, then onions, mushrooms and celery; salt lightly.  In large bowl, combine bread, pecans and seasonings. Add sauteed vegetables.  Saute wild rice in remaining 1/2 cup butter and chicken broth; simmer 5 minutes.  Add rice to bread mixture.  Combine thoroughly.  Makes 12 cups.  Will stuff a 12 to 14 pound turkey, or cook separately for 40 minutes in a covered dish.<!><!><!>none
7150<!><!><!>DIABETIC THANKSGIVING CHEESECAKE<!><!><!>Dissolve jello in 1 cup warm water.  Set aside to cool.  Stir together 6 packages Equal with graham cracker crumbs.  Add melted margarine.  Press 2 cups of the mixture firmly in 9 x 13-inch pan. Reserve rest of crumbs for top.<!><!><!>none
7151<!><!><!>DIABETIC THANKSGIVING CHEESECAKE<!><!><!>Cream 16 packages Equal with cream cheese.  Mix with jello. Stir in Cool Whip.  Spread mixture on top of crust.   Sprinkle with remaining crumbs.  Chill 3 to 4 hours.  Also freezes well. Makes 36 squares (37 calories per square).<!><!><!>none

7155<!><!><!>KRIEGER THANKSGIVING SQUASH<!><!><!>Saute onions in butter; add eggs.  Combine all ingredients, except crackers.  Pour into buttered 9 x 13-inch pan and top with crushed Ritz crackers.  Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes.<!><!><!>none
7156<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING POTATOES<!><!><!>Place the diced potatoes in a large saucepan and add water to cover.  Heat to boiling.  Reduce heat and simmer over medium heat until tender.  Drain.  Place the potatoes in a mixer bowl.  Cut the butter and cream cheese into small pieces and add to the potatoes. Beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.  Beat in the sour cream.  Season with nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste.  Serve immediately or reheat in a buttered casserole at 300° for 20 minutes, if you want to prepare them in advance.  Yields 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
7157<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING DRESSING<!><!><!>Mix bread, celery, margarine, spices and chicken livers.  Add water and mix.  Beat eggs and dry milk.  Add to bread mixture. Bake at 350° for 1 hour.  Stir after 15 minutes.  Continue baking.<!><!><!>none
7158<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING DRESSING<!><!><!>Why I like (or memories of) my grandma or grandpa's recipe: It's good!  She makes it every year for Thanksgiving.<!><!><!>none
7159<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING PUNCH<!><!><!>Chill ingredients. Mix in Punch bowl adding 7-up last.  Add a few drops of red food coloring, orange slices & lemon Slices.<!><!><!>none
7160<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING SALAD<!><!><!>Mix the Jell-O and water; dissolve.  Cream the cream cheese. Add pineapple with juice.  Add remaining ingredients and mix with Jell-O.  Chill until congealed.<!><!><!>none
7161<!><!><!>NO FAIL THANKSGIVING TURKEY<!><!><!>Defrost turkey in refrigerator.  Remove neck and giblets.  Wash turkey in cool water.  Pat dry.  Melt margarine in large pan. Saute chopped liver until no longer pink.  Add onion, celery and parsley and saute until soft.  Add bread cubes and mix.  Add beaten eggs or egg substitute.  Mix well.  Generously sprinkle turkey cavities with salt.  Spoon in stuffing, but do not pack. Brush outside of turkey with melted margarine.  Place in roaster on rack.  Cover with foil tent.  Refer to turkey packaging for proper cooking times.<!><!><!>none
7162<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CHICKEN CASSEROLE<!><!><!>Stew chicken until done (do not salt).  Remove meat from bones.  Reserve broth.  Melt margarine and stir in dressing and onions (celery and sage).  In a greased 9 x 13 casserole dish, begin with a layer of dressing crumbs.  Add a layer of chicken, then a layer of mushroom soup, diluted with 1 can of reserved chicken broth.  Again, a layer of crumbs and chicken, then a can of cream of chicken soup diluted with 1 can of reserved chicken broth.  Top with crumbs and margarine.  Bake at 350° for 35 minutes or until top is brown.  Serves 10 - 12.<!><!><!>none
7163<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING APPLESAUCE CAKE<!><!><!>Cream shortening and sugar.  Add eggs and applesauce.  Sift together flour, soda, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg and salt and stir into shortening mixture.  Add nuts, raisins and cut up candy. Pour into greased tube pan and bake at 325° for approximately 1 1/2 hours.<!><!><!>none

7169<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING RELISH<!><!><!>Wash berries and apples; core, but do not peel apples.  Peel all but one orange.  Put all of this through grinder.  Add can of crushed pineapple and 2 cups sugar; stir and blend well.<!><!><!>none

7171<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING EVE SPAGHETTI SAUCE<!><!><!>Brown ground beef, saving 1 to 2 tablespoons of drippings. Saute onions and garlic in drippings.  Add crushed tomatoes.  Add sauce.  Add paste to onions and garlic.  Add sugar and spices. Stir together well.  Add ground beef; stir well.  Let simmer for at least 3 hours.  Serve over hot pasta.<!><!><!>none
7172<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING KUCHEN<!><!><!>Sift dry ingredients together into a mixing bowl.  Add eggs, oil, pumpkin and remainder of ingredients; mix thoroughly. Lightly oil and flour a tube pan so batter will not stick.  Add batter.  Bake in a 350° oven for about 1 hour and 10 minutes. Drizzle with orange frosting after cake is baked and cooled.  I prefer cake plain or with powdered sugar.<!><!><!>none
7173<!><!><!>ARIZONA BITTINGER'S THANKSGIVING FRUIT CAKE WITH LOLA SCHOPPERT'S<!><!><!>Cream sugar and shortening well.  Add beaten eggs, then the molasses; mix well.  Add soda to buttermilk and beat until foamy, then add to other ingredients.  Measure the flour and add the spices to it and sift together 2 to 3 times.  Have the nut meats, raisins, currants and candied fruits in separate containers and take a couple of tablespoons of the flour and mix through each thoroughly.  Start adding a handful of each to the first mixture along with the flour until all is in, then mix well.<!><!><!>none
7174<!><!><!>ARIZONA BITTINGER'S THANKSGIVING FRUIT CAKE WITH LOLA SCHOPPERT'S<!><!><!>Grease funnel pan and cut heavy brown paper to line the bottom and sides (such as a large grocery sack).  Fill the pan 3/4 full and bake at 250° (slow oven) for 2 1/2 hours or until tested done. After I put the batter in the pan, I decorate the top with thin slices of the candied pineapple and halves of candied cherries and halves of English walnuts.  I get two cakes out of this batch.<!><!><!>none

7184<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CAKE<!><!><!>Cream butter until light.  Add sugar slowly, beating well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each, then add wafer crumbs alternating with milk.  Add vanilla extract.  Add coconut, then mix fruit, nuts and raisins into bowl with 1/4 cup flour.  Cover well and shake, dusting well with flour, then mix with batter. Pour in well-greased and papered tube pan.  Cook 1 1/2 hours at 325°, then let cool.<!><!><!>none
7185<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING PEACHES<!><!><!>O, the comfort, the inexpressible comfort of feeling safe with a person.  Having neither to weigh thoughts, nor measure words, but pouring them right out, just as they are!!  Chaff and grain together.  Certain that a faithful hand will take and sift them. Keep what is worth keeping and with the breath of kindness, blow the rest away.  Amen.<!><!><!>none
7186<!><!><!>"AFTER THANKSGIVING" TURKEY CORN SOUP<!><!><!>In 4-quart saucepan over medium heat, heat the corn, broth, turkey, potatoes and thyme to boiling. 7187<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING RICE<!><!><!>Boil rice; set aside in colander.  Use a large skillet to cook sausage thoroughly.  Saute celery, onions and pepper in sausage fat.  When vegetables are lightly browned, add the rice.  Stir well for about 3 minutes.  Remove from heat; put into a large mixing bowl.  Combine with egg and seasonings.  Mix well.  Put into greased casserole dishes for serving or freezing.  Reheat in oven until rice is hot.   Yield:  12 to 14 servings.<!><!><!>none
7188<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING ROLLS<!><!><!>Dissolve salt, yeast, water and 2 tablespoons sugar.  Melt butter and add to yeast mixture. Beat eggs and add to mixture. Add 3/4 cup sugar and flour; mix well.  Let rise to double. Roll 1/4-inch and cut out. Put in pan and brush with melted butter. Let rise to double again. Bake at 400° until brown.<!><!><!>none
7189<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING ROLLS<!><!><!>These rolls have become a Thanksgiving tradition in our family. But they are great anytime!<!><!><!>none
7190<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MOUNTAIN GROUSE<!><!><!>Defrost breasts overnight in large roasting pan with cold water and Tender Quick.  Rinse birds off and pan out thoroughly in morning.  Combine soy sauce and Five Spice into bowl until a granulated consistency occurs.  Rub mixture deeply into breasts. Strip bacon to cover bottom of roasting pans and add breasts. Cover and refrigerate until ready to cook.<!><!><!>none
7191<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MOUNTAIN GROUSE<!><!><!>When ready, add 1/2 can chicken broth and toothpick remaining bacon on top of breasts.  Bake at 325° for 1 hour, then uncover and brown for 20 minutes.  Use leftover broth for a hearty bacon gravy.<!><!><!>none
7192<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING APPLE-CHERRY PIE<!><!><!>Mix flour and salt well.  Cut in shortening and butter until coarse crumbs.  Add water and vinegar, mixing with fork.  Form in ball.  Roll out. 7193<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING APPLE-CHERRY PIE<!><!><!>Note:  Very easy to handle and roll out; needs no chilling.<!><!><!>none
7194<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY RELISH MOLD<!><!><!>Cut orange into small sections; remove seeds.  Process orange, cranberries and sugar in food processor until fruit is coarsely chopped.  Prepare gelatin using package directions.  Chill until partially set.  Add chopped fruit; mix well.  Pour into large mold.  Chill until set.  Unmold onto serving plate.  Garnish with orange slices and parsley.  Chill until serving time.  Yield: 8 servings.<!><!><!>none

7197<!><!><!>AFTER THANKSGIVING DINNER<!><!><!>Place  butter  in a large glass mixing bowl.  Microwave at High  1  to  2 minutes or until melted.  Add cornbread and bread crumbs.  Stir  to  coat.  Add  other  ingredients  and combine thoroughly.  Spread  mixture  into a buttered 2-quart casserole. Cover  with  waxed paper.  Microwave at High 10 to 12  minutes. Let  stand,  covered,  2 minutes before serving. Yields 4 to 8 servings.<!><!><!>none
7198<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING DINNER<!><!><!>Depending on how far you drive (pack clothes for an overnight trip).  Get up early on Thanksgiving day and go to your mother's house.  If traveling a long distance, use plenty of ingredients 2 and 3. Upon arriving at your destination, prepare your nostrils for some luscious, moth-watering smells.  Help your mother prepare a wonderful dinner (or stay out of the way).  Sit down at the table, say grace and enjoy.  To help make the dinner more enjoyable (especially to your mother) wash the dishes.<!><!><!>none

7211<!><!><!>LYNN'S FOOLPROOF STUFFING FOR THANKSGIVING TURKEY<!><!><!>In a large skillet, crumble sausage.  Cook and stir until sausage is brown.  Drain off all but 1/4 cup drippings.  Add butter, celery, onion and carrot.  Cook, stirring occasionally until onion is tender.  In a very large bowl, combine bread cubes, apple, sage, thyme, rosemary, parsley and sausage mixture.  Toss lightly.  Add enough broth to moisten.  Salt and pepper to taste. Use to stuff 1 (10 to 12 pound) turkey.<!><!><!>none
7212<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING BEANS<!><!><!>Mix beans, bacon, chestnuts and soup.  Place in casserole. Cover with onion rings.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.<!><!><!>none
7213<!><!><!>DAY AFTER THANKSGIVING CASSEROLE<!><!><!>In a 2-quart casserole, combine uncooked rice and packet of seasoning with remaining ingredients except nuts.  Mix well. 7214<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING PUMPKIN CRUNCH<!><!><!>Line 9 x 13-inch pan with wax paper.  Mix first 5 ingredients and pour in pan.  Shake dry cake mix and nuts over this. Dribble melted butter on top. 7215<!><!><!>TZIMMES DELUXE (GREAT FOR THANKSGIVING)<!><!><!>Put yams, carrots, prunes and water in saucepan.  Bring to a boil; cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until tender.  Add apple and honey and cook 25 minutes longer.  Preheat oven to 300°.  Turn mixture into a heatproof serving dish and bake uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes.  Yields 4 servings.<!><!><!>none
7216<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING PICKLES<!><!><!>Pack whole cucumbers in 1/2 gallon jar. Mix vinegar, salt, spices and alum together.  Pour over cucumbers. Finish filling jar with cold water.  Put Saran Wrap on jar; seal tight and set aside. In fall when you want to eat, take out of jar and dry off.  Slice pickles about 1 1/2-inches thick.  Pour about 1 1/2 pounds sugar over them; seal and shake jar to dissolve sugar.  Leave in refrigerator as you use them.  The longer they set, the crispier they get.<!><!><!>none

7231<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING TURKEYS<!><!><!>Open all the cookies and spread icing on each side.  On one side of the cookie, press the candy corn, fat end toward the edges to form tail feathers.  On the other cookie side, press the malted milk ball into the icing to form the turkey's body, then press the red hot in front of the malted milk ball to form its "beard." Using icing as "glue," attach the "tail" half to the "body" half. Happy Thanksgiving!<!><!><!>none

7234<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve jello and let it start to set up.  Add pineapple, cranberry and nuts.<!><!><!>none
7235<!><!><!>GRANDMA COLE'S THANKSGIVING JELLO<!><!><!>Mix jello, using juice from pineapple as part of water called for.  Mix in fruit at this time, also.  Let set.  When set, fork jello apart.  Mix cottage cheese and Cool Whip in.<!><!><!>none
7236<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CAKE<!><!><!>Heat oven to 350°. Grease and flour 3 round 8 1/2 inch cake pans. Mix cake flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon and salt; set aside. Beat cookies, chopped pecans and butter in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed, scraping bowl occasionally, until crumbly. Divide among pans; press evenly on bottoms of pans. Beat sugar, oil, eggs and pumpkin in same bowl on medium speed 1 minute, scraping bowl constantly. Gradually beat flour mixture into pumpkin mixture on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. Pour over pecan mixture in pans; spread evenly. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans to wire rack. Cool completely. Prepare Buttery Cream Cheese Frosting. Fill each layer with 1/3 cup of the frosting, placing layers with pecan side down. Frost sides and top of cake with remaining frosting. Spread caramel topping over edges of cake, allowing some to drizzle down the sides. Arrange pecan halves and candies on top of cake. Store covered in refrigerator.<!><!><!>none
7237<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CAKE<!><!><!>Buttery Cream Cheese Frosting:<!><!><!>none
7238<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CAKE<!><!><!>Beat butter and cream cheese with electric mixer on low speed, scraping bowl frequently, until smooth. Beat in powdered sugar and vanilla on low speed until smooth and spreadable.<!><!><!>none
7239<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING SALAD<!><!><!>Stir gently to mix.  Mound on a bed of lettuce.<!><!><!>none
7240<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING SALAD<!><!><!>Serves 4.<!><!><!>none
7241<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING POT PIE<!><!><!>Soak cranberries in sherry.  Set aside.  Boil water; add carrots and cook until tender, about 2 minutes.  Add leeks and cook about 1 1/2 minutes.  Drain.  Cook mushrooms in 1 tablespoon oil about 5 minutes.  Mix together turkey, drained cranberries (reserve sherry) and all vegetables.  Add tarragon, parsley and orange zest. Heat broth and sherry.  Melt butter over medium low heat; add flour and cook, stirring, until it browns lightly, about 3 minutes. Slowly whisk in hot broth and whisk over medium-high heat until thickened, about 5 minutes.  Season with salt and pepper.  Fold white sauce into vegetables and meat and remove to a round 2 to 3-quart casserole dish.<!><!><!>none
7242<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING POT PIE<!><!><!>On a lightly floured surface, roll thawed puff pastry into a circle about 2 inches larger than casserole.  Place pastry over top of casserole and crimp edges.  With knife, make 3 slits in top.  Brush top of crust with egg wash.  Bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes.<!><!><!>none
7243<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING WALDORF SALAD<!><!><!>Place first four ingredients in salad bowl.  Combine remaining ingredients, mix well.  Pour over fruit.  Toss lightly.  Serve in lettuce lined salad bowls.  Makes 4 servings.<!><!><!>none
7244<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CANDLELIGHT PUNCH<!><!><!>Chill the apricot nectar and Sprite. Just before serving time, combine the apricot nectar and concentrated orange juice in the punch bowl. Slowly pour in chilled Sprite. Add peaches and float generous spoonfuls of ice cream on top of the punch. Serves 35.<!><!><!>none
7245<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING POTATOES<!><!><!>Cook potatoes until tender.  Drain.  Place potatoes in bowl. Cut butter and cream cheese into small pieces and add to potatoes. Beat with mixer until light and fluffy.  Beat in sour cream. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.  Serve immediately or reheat in a buttered casserole at 300° for 20 minutes if prepared in advance.  Makes 8 portions.<!><!><!>none
7246<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING TREATS<!><!><!>Heat oven to 325°.  Mix together coconut, sugar, flour and salt.  Stir in egg whites and almond extract; mix well.  Stir in nuts; mix well.  Drop from teaspoon onto lightly greased baking sheets.  Bake 20 minutes or until edge of cookies are golden brown.  Remove from baking sheet immediately.  Let cool and serve. Makes about 30 cookies.  So pretty and so easy!<!><!><!>none
7247<!><!><!>FAKE THANKSGIVING TURKEY<!><!><!>Mix all ingredients well and pour into greased bread pan and sprinkle top lightly with Kellogg's poultry seasoning.<!><!><!>none

7249<!><!><!>FAKE THANKSGIVING TURKEY<!><!><!>Gravy:<!><!><!>none
7250<!><!><!>FAKE THANKSGIVING TURKEY<!><!><!>Saute onion in margarine or butter; add water and veg chicken style soup base.  Make runny mixture of flour and water and add slowly while stirring over heat to thicken.<!><!><!>none
7251<!><!><!>CHILDREN'S THANKSGIVING TURKEY<!><!><!>You will also need round toothpicks.<!><!><!>none
7252<!><!><!>CHILDREN'S THANKSGIVING TURKEY<!><!><!>Clean apple; place a drop of vegetable oil on it to polish and make shiny.  Place 2 toothpicks 1-inch apart on the narrower side of the apple.  Place 1 toothpick on the back of the apple to balance the apple, allowing it to stand alone on toothpick "legs." Thread raisins onto 12 to 16 toothpicks, filling the toothpicks except for the a small tip to pierce the apple.  Arrange the raisin toothpicks in 2 rows fanned out and stuck into the back side of the apple to form the "turkey's feathers."  Place 1 toothpick deep into the front of the apple to give him a "neck."  Stick a large olive on his "neck," and gently pull the pimento out to give him a "gobbler."<!><!><!>none
7253<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING DINNER MEATBALLS<!><!><!>Mix ingredients together and let set awhile, even overnight is okay.  Shape into approximately 16 balls.  Place meatballs in serving dish and cover with sauce.  Bake, covered, for 45 minutes at 350°.<!><!><!>none

7258<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING SQUASH<!><!><!>Cook squash and drain well.  Slice onion, grate carrot, add butter and cook in microwave oven for 3 minutes. Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.<!><!><!>none

7262<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING SALAD<!><!><!>Grind cranberries.  Cut orange and apples in very small pieces (I prefer to grind the apples).  Add sugar to fruit and let stand while Jell-O cools.  Just before it starts to set, mix in fruit and turn into mold or bowl.<!><!><!>none
7263<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve  jello  in  one  cup  hot  water and pineapple juice. Melt  cranberry  sauce  in  saucepan on low heat until smooth and  mushy.  Mix  with all other ingredients and chill until thickened  and then add diced apple.  Spoon into 8-inch square dish,  sprayed with Pam or salad oil for easy removal. Chill until  firm.  Cut  in squares and serve on lettuce with mayonnaise or Cool Whip.  Serves 8.<!><!><!>none
7264<!><!><!>AUNT HARRIET'S THANKSGIVING DATE PUDDING<!><!><!>Pour the one cup of boiling water over half of the dates and add the soda.  Let this mixture stand while you mix the next batch of ingredients.  Sift (mix) flour, sugar and baking powder.  Mix into the date, soda and water mixture and add beaten egg, butter and 1/2 cup of nuts.  Blend well and spread mixture in a greased 10 x 15 x 1-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Spread over the top a sauce made by mixing the remaining 1/2 pound dates, 1/2 cup nuts and the 2/3 cup of boiling water.  The sauce should be mixed while the cake is baking.  The topping will remain moist and keep the cake moist.  Serve slices with whipped cream.<!><!><!>none
7265<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING CRANBERRY DELIGHT<!><!><!>Combine pineapple juice and water in a 2-quart saucepan.  Heat to boiling.  Remove from heat.  Add gelatin and stir until dissolved.  Stir in cranberry sauce, lemon juice, peel and nutmeg. Chill until mixture thickens slightly.  Add sour cream; stir until thoroughly combined.  Fold in pineapple and pecans.  Pour into 8-cup mold.  Chill until firm.  Unmold onto serving plate. Garnish with strawberries.<!><!><!>none
7266<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING SQUASH<!><!><!>Simmer squash, onion, salt and pepper until tender and drain well.  Mix well oleo, dry stuffing mix, sour cream, carrots, green pepper and mushrooms.  Add squash and mix together very well. Place in casserole dish and top with stuffing mix.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes (45 minutes at 325° if Corning Ware is used).<!><!><!>none
7267<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MINCEMEAT CAKE<!><!><!>Cream butter in a large mixing bowl; gradually add sugar, beating well.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating mixture well after each addition.<!><!><!>none
7268<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MINCEMEAT CAKE<!><!><!>Dissolve soda in buttermilk, stirring well.  Add flour to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk mixture, beginning and ending with flour.  Mix well after each addition.  Stir in crumbled mincemeat.<!><!><!>none
7269<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MINCEMEAT CAKE<!><!><!>Spoon batter into 2 greased and floured 8-inch round cake pans.  Bake at 300° for 45 to 50 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.  Cool in pans 10 minutes. Remove layers from pans and let cool completely.<!><!><!>none
7270<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MINCEMEAT CAKE<!><!><!>Spread Caramel Cream Frosting between layers and on top and sides of cake.  Yields one 2-layer cake.<!><!><!>none
7271<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MINCEMEAT CAKE<!><!><!>Caramel Cream Frosting:<!><!><!>none
7272<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MINCEMEAT CAKE<!><!><!>Place 2 tablespoons of sugar in a saucepan; cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved and becomes golden brown in color. Set aside.<!><!><!>none
7273<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MINCEMEAT CAKE<!><!><!>Combine remaining 1 cup of sugar, butter and cream in a medium saucepan; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a boil.  Stir in caramelized sugar.  Return to a boil; cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat; beat until spreading consistency.  Yields enough frosting for one 2-layer cake.<!><!><!>none
7274<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MORNING BREAD<!><!><!>Dissolve the yeast in the warm water. Cream the butter in a very large bowl and beat in the granulated sugar  until it is no longer grainy. Add whole eggs and egg yolks, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Sprinkle in the salt and lemon rind. Add 4 cups of the flour.  Mix, then stir in the dissolved yeast.  Mix in 2 more cups of flour and as much of the last cup as you need to make a dough. Turn out on a floured board and knead for 7 to 8 minutes until smooth and elastic.  Add a little more flour if dough seems sticky.  Put dough in a buttered bowl, butter the top and cover.  Let the dough rise until doubled, about 1 1/2 hours.<!><!><!>none
7275<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING MORNING BREAD<!><!><!>Punch down and pat into flattened round.  Mix cranberries, hazelnuts, raisins and brown sugar.  Scatter mix on dough and knead into dough until evenly distributed.  Cut dough into 3 pieces and shape each piece into a round.  Put rounds in well buttered 1 pound coffee cans or shortening cans.  Cover and let rise until it reaches top of can and is rounded at top.  Bake in a preheated 350° oven for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until the loaves test done. Remove them from cans and put them on a rack.  Brush the tops with melted butter.  These are also good iced or glazed.<!><!><!>none
7276<!><!><!>THANKSGIVING SALAD<!><!><!>Dissolve Jello and sugar in the hot water.  Add juice and cool.  Grind cranberries, oranges with the skin and apples, cored, with the skin.  Add to above mixture  Add nut meats.  Place in mold and cool until set.<!><!><!>none
7277<!><!><!>SOUR CREAM COFFEE CAKE<!><!><!>Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan. Mix first 5 ingredients together in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed.  Combine salt, flour, baking powder, and baking soda, and add gradually to butter mixture.  Stir in sour cream. Alternately layer mixture #1 and mixture #2 in tube pan, starting with mixture #1.  Bake for 45 minutes.<!><!><!>none

7281<!><!><!>RAVE REVIEWS COCONUT CAKE<!><!><!>Blend cake mix, pudding mix, water, eggs and oil in a large mixing bowl.  Beat at medium speed for 4 minutes.  Stir in coconut and pecans.  Pour into 3 greased and floured 9-inch layer pans. Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.  Cool in pans for 15 minutes.  Remove and cool on rack.  Fill and top with Coconut-Cream Cheese Frosting.<!><!><!>none
7282<!><!><!>RAVE REVIEWS COCONUT CAKE<!><!><!>Coconut-Cream Cheese Frosting:<!><!><!>none
7283<!><!><!>RAVE REVIEWS COCONUT CAKE<!><!><!>Melt butter in skillet.  Add coconut.  Stir constantly over low heat until golden brown.  Spread coconut on absorbent paper to cool.  Cream 2 tablespoons of butter with cream cheese.  Add milk; beat in sugar gradually.  Blend in vanilla; stir in 1 3/4 cups of the coconut.  Spread on tops of cake layers.  Stack and sprinkle with remaining coconut.<!><!><!>none
7284<!><!><!>RAISIN NUT SPICE CAKE<!><!><!>Cream shortening, sugars and eggs.  Sift dry ingredients, then add alternately the buttermilk and dry ingredients to the shortening mixture.  Beat about 2 minutes.  Fold in nuts and raisins.  Pour into prepared 9-inch cake pans (greased and floured).  Bake 30 to 35 minutes in a 350° oven.  Cool and frost with White Butter Icing.<!><!><!>none
7285<!><!><!>RAISIN NUT SPICE CAKE<!><!><!>White Butter Icing:<!><!><!>none
7286<!><!><!>RAISIN NUT SPICE CAKE<!><!><!>Melt  shortening  in  saucepan.  Remove from heat;  add flour and  salt.  Stir  in slowly the milk.  Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.  Boil 1 minute.  Remove from heat.  Stir in confectioners sugar and vanilla.  Beat until right consistency to spread.<!><!><!>none
7287<!><!><!>SCRIPTURE CAKE<!><!><!>Cream butter with sugar.  Beat in egg yolks, one at a time. Sift dry ingredients together.  Blend into creamed mixture alternately with milk.  Beat egg whites until stiff and fold in. Fold in chopped almonds, figs and raisins.  Turn into greased and floured 10-inch tube pan.  Bake in 325° oven 1 hour and 10 minutes or until cake is golden brown and cake tester comes out clean. Cool 10 to 15 minutes in pan.  Remove from pan and cool on rack. Drizzle Burnt Sugar Syrup over cake and decorate with whole almonds.<!><!><!>none
7288<!><!><!>SCRIPTURE CAKE<!><!><!>Burnt Sugar Syrup:<!><!><!>none
7289<!><!><!>SCRIPTURE CAKE<!><!><!>Melt sugar in iron skillet over low heat.  Continue cooking until syrup is light amber.  Add water; cook until syrup is smooth. Remove from heat; add butter and stir until melted.<!><!><!>none

7293<!><!><!>LEMON POUND CAKE<!><!><!>Cream Crisco, butter and sugar in a medium bowl.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating mixture after each.  Add sour cream to mixture.  In another bowl, combine flour and baking powder.  Add to mixture, small portions at a time, alternately with milk.  Mix completely and well.  Add lemon and vanilla extracts.  Bake at 325° for 1 hour and 30 minutes.  Check with toothpick after cake has baked 1 hour and 15 minutes.  Let cool, then glaze cake.  Use Baker's Joy for tube pan.<!><!><!>none

7314<!><!><!>MARYANN'S BANANA CAKE<!><!><!>In medium size bowl mix flour and baking soda.  In another bowl beat butter and sugar together until creamy.  Beat in eggs and mix well.  In a small bowl or glass combine milk and vinegar. Beat into the egg and sugar mixture.  Mix well.  Add bananas and mix well.  On low speed add dry ingredients.  Mix until well blended.  Bake in a greased 9 x 13 inch pan at 350° for 1/2 hour or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.<!><!><!>none

7325<!><!><!>EASTER BASKET CAKE<!><!><!>Handle:  Fold the aluminum foil (16 x 8-inches) half lengthwise and continue folding in half lengthwise 3 more times.  The final size is 16 x 1/2-inch.
